Hi fellow admins,

I think there's one **killer feature **in Workplace groups that's probably somewhat underused. I just realized today that, as we have an internal Support Group, kinda like "all problems tech and digital" and IT news+announcements, it's so good to add a media integration, namely the **Workplace Status feed**. 

Now I'll never have to look it up (*pull*), but all announcements are posted as they are published elsewhere (*push*). Brilliant, easy & less work answering questions like *"is it just me or our Workplace service?"*

The same goes for other Group Publishing Bots, i.e. **bots that post updates into your Groups** on Workplace. You can take any custom RSS feed on internet and you can also configure your own with Incoming Webhooks. 

We have three groups focused on design inspiration, data & analytics insights and other cool and creative stuff. For these we picked one top feed per group to contribute with posts outside the box and keep things lively and inspirational.

**IMPORTANT**: The reason I missed the Workplace Status was that it's hidden under Bloomberg, you have to click the tiny hyperlink to expand the list!

Link: Dev guide on Group Publishing Posts

https://developers.facebook.com/docs/workplace/group-publishing-bots/

Edit: hashtags removed as they linked wrong

Hi there, 

I was wondering if an "hide post" feature was in the pipeline ? It would be useful for us for the notes. When we have notes, we always publishing a short post + note for the people who wants to know more. So with the current solution, we have always 3 posts, 2 notes (different languages) + another post with link to the notes above in the timeline of everybody. As we're publishing notes in more than one language, it's not super user-friendly.

Hello! We're just starting out on our 'proper' Workplace journey and I wondered if anyone created a policy for employees which outlined what can/can't be posted, etc? Our data protection team are getting twitchy!

Is there a way to share a **'weekly snapshot of the week that was'** on Workplace? Like a way to gather all important or top posts of the week? I know we could do it manually but I thought I would see if there was a quicker way to do this. I've looked through the resources and can't find anything. 

**Reasoning behind this**

We've had some feedback from people who are not based at a desk all day and they are struggling keep up with reading posts. These people have suggested a weekly summary of key posts would be useful so they can read that one post and then be directed to important content. 

These people have managed their notifications but they do not want to scroll in the newsfeed to stay up to date especially if they are only able to going on Workplace a couple of time a week they have to scroll through a lot of content. 

Note - we have 'marked posts as important' but this is not useful if there is a week where we have multiple important posts or if the post expires before they make it on to Workplace. 

Any advice would be appreciated please :)

**Go Live/Producer Help**

We love the ability to go live with multiple hosts and want to start assigning someone to "produce" the event (read questions, monitor streaming health, announce/launch poll questions, etc.). We want them to be behind the scenes, but even when they disable their camera and mic, they are still visible (image below). Am I missing a setting somewhere or is this the functionality? It would be great if I could truly be invisible.

Kristina Martin-Terry, Nick Sandercock - FYSA

Hello! I see Workplace introduced Black Lives Matter profile frames (nice add!). Will you be introducing other frames in the future? We are hoping for one to coincide with PRIDE month in June. Our employees are looking for an easier "Facebook-like" way to add/update frames to their profile pics (pre-set by Workplace or custom designs by us), which doesn't seem to exist in Workplace. TIA for any insight. 

Kristina Martin-Terry, Nick Sandercock - FYSA.
How do you start out when you're on your own with around 50 interested VIP parties?

Hello, everyone :)
Does someone know if there is something about photos in the privacy policy of Workplace premium? Are users agreeing to the admins are  processing their data (photos to be exact) by signing in?

Is there a way for an admin to prioritise a group for all of its members or is this only a selection an individual can make themselves?  This is to help with ensuring that content posted within this group is seen by all versus in highlights which is why we believe some are missing the content.  I'm aware that marking a group 'Official' would provide similar behaviours in terms of notifying the members of all posts etc but I am yet not clear on whether this group should be classed as such.

I have a colleague wondering if they can hide posts from their profile. My understanding is that it's an automatic feature that your profile would aggregate all of your posts (though others can only see posts made in groups where they're also members). Is that correct? And is there a way to choose which posts display on your profile? Thank you!!

# üåüüéâ New Workplace Releases - April 2021
```
**Admins - here's your digest for this month to keep you up-to-speed on what's new in the world of Workplace. `We are excited to share that we‚Äôve made highly anticipated updates to some of the most popular Workplace features!`**
```
> **Any feedback on these updates let us know! **üìÆüì©

**FEATURE RELEASE SUMMARY:**
* Notes - `complete refresh!`
* Dual Stream share for multi live - `Live video now allows for sharing both a screen and video stream`
* KL Updates
   * APIs
   * Reorder categories
   * Mobile Site
* Video Right Management Update
## üìù** CREATE COLLABORATIVE COMMUNICATIONS DIRECTLY FROM WORKPLACE WITH THE NEW NOTES**
* Create and share detailed documents directly within Workplace ‚Äì including monthly newsletters, meeting notes or project status reports.
* The new Notes allows you to collaborate with everyone in your company with co-editing and to embed videos, images and tables.

*Go to the Help Center to [read more about the new Notes](https://workplace.com/help/work/1125597027868637).*
## ‚ú®üñ•** MORE FLEXIBLE SCREEN SHARING WHEN PRESENTING WITH OTHERS**
* Share your screen and camera feed at the same time when you‚Äôre broadcasting with other hosts.
* By showing the host alongside the content being shared, viewers can now easily track who‚Äôs presenting for increased engagement during the live broadcast.
## ‚öôÔ∏èüìö** SURFACE EXISTING CONTENT IN KNOWLEDGE LIBRARY WITH NEW API'S**
* We are adding new functionality to our Knowledge Library APIs. You can now surface content from other platforms (such as an existing intranet) in Knowledge Library.
* This allows you to easily migrate content to Knowledge Library and ensures that your employees can engage with existing resources right from Workplace.
* Knowledge Library APIs will now also allow you to set the right permissions for your content, manage the homepage quick links and understand how resources are received with the ability to read user reactions, comments and impressions.

*Check out [the developer site](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/workplace/reference/graph-api/category) for more details on how to build with Knowledge Library API.*
## üîß** **üóÇ** EASILY REORDER SUBCATEGORIES IN KNOWLEDGE LIBRARY**
* Admins can now easily reorder subcategories within a category to better organize their content in Knowledge Library.

*Learn how in the [Workplace Help Center](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/248135470306950).*
## ‚úîÔ∏èüèÉ‚Äç‚ôÄ** ACCESS KNOWLEDGE LIBRARY ON THE GO**
* Knowledge Library is now available from the Workplace mobile site giving you a mobile optimized experience even if you don‚Äôt have the Workplace app.
* We want to make it easy for anyone to stay informed even if they don‚Äôt have the space on their mobile device for another app.
## ‚ñ∂Ô∏èüé•** MORE FLEXIBLE VIDEO RIGHTS MANAGEMENT**

Last year we announced a feature to protect your internal videos, such as All Hands, live recordings of meetings, and product launch announcements on Workplace by restricting downloads...
* Now, we‚Äôre updating the feature to give admins the ability to determine a set of people who are able to download videos while continuing to restrict others from downloading and distributing videos outside of Workplace.
* This ensures certain employees who need to download video content for their role are able to do so.

*You can learn more about Video Rights Management and how to enable it for your community by visiting our [Help Center.](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/522077105048941)*

This community thrives and relies upon the valuable help, support and learnings you provide each other!

Does anyone know if we can add photo frame options that users can select to add to their Workplace profile pictures just like Facebook does for profile pictures?

Hi all, 

Was the function"create doc" deleted ? I cannot find it anymore... Any idea if something will (or does) replace this ? 

Tnx!

I've posted this before and it's still a very confusing issue. I'm unable to use certain aliases for my groups. I.e. I have a "Board Games" group and I'd like to use /boardgames, but when trying to set this I get an error stating that it is already assigned. When I navigate to MYCOMPANY.workplace.com/groups/boardgames I'm directed to the main Facebook website, to a group that has the boardgames alias.

Divya Kukar, why are aliases for groups from the main facebook site checked when trying to set a workplace alias and why do workplace groups redirect to the main facebook site? This is very strange behaviour...
Hi all, still a bit new to Workplace here. I would like to know if it is possible to add individuals from one group into another group, so they do not have to request to join.

We've been adding users to Workplace by their personal email addresses, which has been working fine, but my org has decided to begin using Google Workspace (G Suite) and give everyone their own email usernames.

As our existing users have emails like gmail/yahoo/hotmail, and we obviously cannot verify these domains as our own, we find ourselves unable to link their existing Workplace account to their new Google provided identity. We also cannot change the emails on the existing accounts for the same reason.

Is there any way around this? I've tried editing emails via API but that doesn't work either. Perhaps we create new accounts for everyone with the Google creds and there is a way to merge this with their old one? 

Thanks.

message:
We have found something in notes that cause a bit of an issue. Creating the note keeps it private except for who you share it with but if you go to schedule the note as a post, it changes the viewability to all in the group of where you shared prior to the post schedule time. 

We like to schedule our notes in our all employee group and have it go live at a specific time, with the current set up, we cannot do that now because once we schedule it, it goes live for anyone in the group if they click the files link.

Is anyone else experiencing problems inviting all group members to an event created within the open group?

When I try to "select all" members, I am getting an error message that FB is looking into the isssue.

# ‚ñ∂Ô∏è **[Live Video Interactive Demos](https://training.wplearn.com/sl/7caf31d0) **‚óÄÔ∏è
## [ü§î](https://training.wplearn.com/sl/7caf31d0)  Why use an interactive demo?
* To get a full walkthrough of setting up your Live video without actually going live to your organization. 
* The interactive demo will help you get familiar with the Live Producer experience so you‚Äôre best prepared for your next broadcast. 
* It also includes some tips and best practices for effective virtual presentations to help you along the way.
## üßê  Yeah, But What *Exactly* is an Interactive Demo?
* It's a *simulation* of the Live Producer experience.
* You‚Äôll be *prompted to click* through various elements of Live Producer in order to set up a live broadcast.
* Sprinkled into each demo you will find *tips highlighting best practices*, what happens *behind the scenes*, and what the *audience* will see.
## üëÄ  Cool! How Many Demos are There?

To make it easier for customers to jump to what they need quickly, we've broken up the different parts of the broadcasting process into these ***9 short demos***:
1. Launching Live Producer
1. Starting a Live Broadcast as the Only Presenter
1. Starting a Live Broadcast with Multiple Presenters
1. Scheduling a Live Broadcast with Multiple Presenters
1. Starting a Scheduled Broadcast
1. Answering Questions During a Live Broadcast
1. Trimming the Video After Ending a Live Broadcast
1. Viewing Analytics After Ending a Live Broadcast
1. Using Polls During a Live Broadcast (under 'Engaging Your Audience')
# **[Explore the Demos Here!](https://training.wplearn.com/sl/7caf31d0)**

# Video Conference

Does anyone else find their teams turning to Teams or Zoom when they have a number of people on a video call? I'm finding it erodes the confidence in Workplace in general, something I'd love to resolve as I champion Workplace in our organisation. Common complaints include:
1. Share screen function better on Zoom/ Teams

2. 'We can get more people on a Teams call  more easily'

3. 'I have problems with sound on Workplace.'

4. 'I have to call someone back and fourth several times in order to get everyone to pick up.' (I have also found even when I answer a call it often cuts me off.

I'm keen to understand if anyone else has found solutions or has tips on the above as it feels like a dagger to the heart every time I get a Zoom calendar invite üòÇ

## Measuring success of Workplace posts

Can anyone share with me how they are measuring the success of Workplace posts please. Measuring by the number of 'seen by' doesn't feel like a particularly good measure of success as there is no-way of knowing if people have read the whole post and engaged in it. # üÜï üéâ **What's New in Workplace? **March 2021 enhancements
1. *Improved video analytics*
1. *What‚Äôs New notifications*
1. *Captions in Japanese*

**üìä IMPROVED VIDEO ANALYTICS FOR ADMINS & CREATORS**
* Better understand how people are consuming video on Workplace. System Admins now have the ability to access video insights as well as creators, and we‚Äôre also making the metrics more clear and consistent.
* You can now get a more accurate view of who is watching your video at any given time. This is another step towards actionable insights that maximize the reach and engagement of video content on Workplace.

Go to the Help Center to read more about [Video Analytics](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/917132895358158).

üõé** NOTIFICATIONS FOR UPCOMING LAUNCHES IN WHAT‚ÄôS NEW**
* Last year we introduced the What‚Äôs New section in our Admin Panel to make it easier for admins to find what new features are coming to Workplace.
* What‚Äôs New Notifications will take this a step further, sending administrators in-Workplace notifications when new features are added in What‚Äôs New.
* These notifications will only be shared with admins and you can opt out at any time. If admins wish to share new features with their community, they can continue to use the share function in What‚Äôs New.

üí¨** JAPANESE VIDEO CAPTIONS NOW SUPPORTED**
* We are adding Japanese to the list of supported languages in Automatic Video Captioning.
* Video captions allow you to maximize the value of videos by making them more accessible, inclusive and easy to consume.
* Automatic captions allow you to get your message out faster. Plus, regardless of the language you choose, you also have the ability to download and edit captions before publishing to ensure your message is captured correctly.

Go to the [Help Center](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/1505051832842006) to learn more about video captions.

# Tomorrow (March 5th) is Employee Appreciation Day!!
## **[FREE TRIAL OFFER](https://thebotplatform.com/recognition-free-trial-on-workplace/): SUPERCHARGE STAFF RECOGNITION USING THE BOT PLATFORM**

Every year on the first Friday in March, companies and organizations take it upon themselves to celebrate **Employee Appreciation Day** ‚Äì and for good reason. 77% of employees say they ‚Äúdon‚Äôt feel strongly valued for the work that they do‚Äù and 36% say a lack of recognition is ‚Äúthe number one reason they‚Äôre considering switching jobs.‚Äù

Employee recognition is a critical part of the employee experience, but in 2021 it‚Äôs more important than ever as staff are stressed and separated from their colleagues.

# üí°Workplace [#FeatureSpotlight](https://fb.workplace.com/hashtag/featurespotlights?__eep__=6&__gid__=2551666451815103): üîê **Single Sign On**
> ‚¨áÔ∏è** **‚ñ∂Ô∏è** **Admins, for a quick summary of this feature, watch the video below üëá. You can** [download here the 'single sign for' video](https://facebook.widen.net/view/video/6uo3vfkuoq/Feature-Explainer---Single-Sign-On_CE?t.download=true&x.share=true&x.portal_shortcode_generated=oprcvt0x&x.app=portals&ref=AVt4JGSd4uAGacg92GcVf62V0SxiNhFT8-6ndxjUxmz73NvoH-xWuQdks3pMRZ5O07nGiIyOxMz4cBoRLGqj7tVLvDSXUCo1OEWJwnePFMEn5CplM_bTzd8bCCj-V4A24XHVPdU1RSxj6pWMHF3sb93cmjhFGm3p_dhIjbWwrq0NiyDtLXXHc8W68Q5KBtkGTC072hUO6t2KnHK-ID1j_lDzzXftgpXj4kHuwWyU1z_TVYcX5poyw81S_j-iE0jrCfw)[ ](https://facebook.widen.net/view/video/ldod17wup5/Feature-Explainer---People-Sets_CE?t.download=true&x.share=true&x.portal_shortcode_generated=oprcvt0x&x.app=portals)**included in this post to share with your own Workplace community.

**WHAT IS SINGLE SIGN-ON?**

Single Sign-On is an authentication method that allows users to securely sign in to multiple applications using just one set of credentials.

**WHY USE SINGLE SIGN-ON?**

With Single Sign-On, your organization can achieve:
* üîí Better security and governance (no credentials are stored outside of your company‚Äôs controlled systems or transmitted over the network).
* üôå An improved experience for your employees who no longer need to remember a variety of usernames and passwords
* ‚¨áÔ∏è Lower IT costs due to reduced login issues

**TOP TIPS FOR ENABLING SINGLE SIGN-ON**
1. To enable Single Sign-On, you'll first need to verify your corporate domain in the Admin Panel.
1. You'll need to be signed in as a System Administrator, and you'll need to have a corresponding account in your Identity Provider with the same email as the one you use for Workplace.
1. Workplace is directly supported by several identity providers, including Azure AD, G Suite, Okta, OneLogin, Ping Identity which offer direct connectors to make setup easier. Get step-by-step setup instructions in the [Workplace Technical Resources](https://www.workplace.com/resources/tech/authentication/sso).

üìπ For more feature videos you can view & download, visit the NEW **[Learning Videos page on the Customer Resource Center](https://www.workplace.com/resources/videos/features)**.

# Workplace Search Feature Enhancement Suggestion... 

We have been using Workplace for almost 3 years, which means we have a LOT of content in our platform. Due to our retention policy, we are unable to delete any information on our platform. 

**The problem? The "Search Workplace" feature is defaulted to "top posts" instead of most recent. **This is starting to confuse many people on what is the most relative content. 
* Colleagues are not tech savvy enough to have to switch the toggle to most recent.
* Search Workplace is used to find content quickly, but needs to be the most recent content.
* Too much content to search through, it was recommended to "turn off comments" on old posts but colleagues still refer to old content as they don't see the comments are turned off as they are not trying to comment on it, but view the information.

**Possible solution? Can we make the "Search Workplace" feature default to "most recent" in order to keep the most up-to-date information at the top.**
> We put all of our benefit information in Workplace each year, we have 3 years worth of content but 2 years of that is outdated. We recently have been having colleagues search for this information and interact with old content, leaving the end user frustrated and pushes them away from Workplace.

You can** [download here the 'Draft For' video](https://facebook.widen.net/view/video/jbxw8w0ruk/Feature-Explainer---Draft-for_CE?t.download=true&x.share=true&x.portal_shortcode_generated=oprcvt0x&x.app=portals&ref=AVvYOSp05njPk2Cyv_85OL6cIIPbwFjXSNUs-Pb_n-IZJqD2SHqMxx3dGUh9aKJljAWp4zITojbUOH-q0uEkcezXaeoRJ6MS3HCuSqe2esp4JnvjPc0y7coOPaie8G5wgByaqLcFQRwkbRLvrCK2ezRYi9IaMiLWlsUIuXjEBhYgcNAUDCxNB-4gARAnZdUwoxU3GitV2aJQ-Debp5S9BGw0lRbZF4kDyU_MvvKEZo3wOA)[ ](https://l.workplace.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Ffacebook.widen.net%2Fview%2Fvideo%2Fldod17wup5%2FFeature-Explainer---People-Sets_CE%3Ft.download%3Dtrue%26x.share%3Dtrue%26x.portal_shortcode_generated%3Doprcvt0x%26x.app%3Dportals&h=AT2DQ_gFJ3aIMFcAHZa-Mux9jrg8pdqjuGaZyNPFsHul-yNGidrTV3i7rqd-NqRVg2RGLTNfCfhH0U6Z2u3MYIXC-FytV705RS8fnp2fu56UMIT7GjurRIEZX6kszUptT3PFrPNEYHyeQ_BtiuBj&__tn__=-U-UK-R&c%5B0%5D=AT0DyC7GqgRpVq7ARbEkxGQG0LCbBHhLcx6KqpIATVARFltZZz7k_iTaeSBQ4sT97-Fp2RHIQ1b3qAvGp3kGiPbHultXL7xMaqbwACxixhLyW905LDp0kPOxQkRWTqaleK5aJ7C31JsXLsQ1KZR-AU1rlHZKVmNhGt5MS9hlkemdFmbOz6eiSfS4vKZnDlxd8Bu0dNjXlPgIQlLAyP-sPXWGxJyAFg)**included in this post to share with your own Workplace community.

**WHAT IS DRAFT FOR?**

Draft for allows individuals with permission to draft posts on behalf of executives. Executives can then review, make changes and publish the post themselves.

**WHY USE DRAFT FOR?**

Draft for allows communication teams to produce rich communications on behalf of executives, setting the tone for engagement and building company culture - even during the busiest times.

**TIPS FOR USING DRAFT FOR:**
* üÜó An admin has to grant you permission to draft posts for someone else. This needs to be done per person you need to draft posts for.
* ‚úÖ Consider creating a custom admin role for Executive Admins and give them ‚ÄúManage 'Draft For' Permissioning‚Äù access so they can grant members from various teams access to draft posts for executives.
* ‚è∞ Try to give executives a good amount of time to review and approve of your post. Be clear when communications are time-sensitive.

## üìù  **[WORKPLACE RULES](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/2508804946079684)**
1. üìë Admins have told us that they spend a lot of time trying to keep their Workplace safe and respectful. An important part of this effort is establishing organizational rules and guidelines. Rules set the tone for a company and help employees understand how to engage on Workplace.
1. üëÄ Admins tell us rules are most effective when they are easily seen. In the past, admins wrote their rules and guidelines in various places within their Workplace.

**Now, admins can create and effectively communicate a code of conduct for their company within their Workplace.**

## Ô∏èüñ§ [DARK MODE NOW AVAILABLE ON WORKPLACE](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/382575319378072)

**We‚Äôve added Dark Mode on the Workplace iOS and Android apps. This accessibility feature allows you to change your device‚Äôs background from white to black, helping to reduce eye strain and glare in low light situations.**

*The Workplace app will follow the system‚Äôs dark mode setting on your device, but you can also override it by clicking on the Help and Settings page in the app.*

Visit the Help Center to[ learn more about dark mode](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/382575319378072).
## üé® **[NEW WORKPLACE WEB EXPERIENCE FULLY ROLLED OUT](https://www.workplace.com/resources/news-updates/improved-workplace-faq)**

We announced a few month ago that we have redesigned the Workplace website to be faster with a more streamlined design, and added extra features like dark mode and full-width mode. 

Go to the Customer Resource Center to [learn more about the changes. ](https://www.workplace.com/resources/news-updates/improved-workplace-faq)

*You can control your company‚Äôs access to the new experience by going to What‚Äôs New in your Admin Panel and clicking ‚ÄúManage Early Access‚Äù*

# üí°Workplace [#FeatureSpotlight](https://fb.workplace.com/hashtag/featurespotlights?__eep__=6&__gid__=2551666451815103): üìå‚ùóÔ∏è**Mark as Important**
> ‚¨áÔ∏è** **‚ñ∂Ô∏è** **Admins, you can** [download here the 'Mark as Important' explainer video](https://facebook.widen.net/view/video/c7ok4rsis0/Feature-Explainer---Mark-as-Important_CE?t.download=true&x.share=true&x.portal_shortcode_generated=oprcvt0x&x.app=portals&ref=AVtFt2MnmPaN5jdmvaxJiTK1CptlOn8-vb411X4KGD58k8YnF9_tLK4f73ODClmTPXV0t2_8cvm-2fomX6ghID8NYGzj2l4t6-rxVMNxoSLFcPa2Hj1tlLqXrUEVRRInsJGQUkQL_to2kUDPRJA8zNMMj8f-jnYOwgVsfxmq7xy2gQ9HmlZCXwwDOjX5HwbSgjWpm2VyuVAkU6RYBHRLa1h0wf7WJsd03vjpj9CkkTiNoVBtDR2SdJgS5MVAE2ue1To)[ ](https://facebook.widen.net/view/video/ldod17wup5/Feature-Explainer---People-Sets_CE?t.download=true&x.share=true&x.portal_shortcode_generated=oprcvt0x&x.app=portals)**included in this post to share with your own Workplace community.

**WHAT IS **MARK AS IMPORTANT**?**

Mark as Important allows you to pin important posts to the top of the News Feed for all group members for a set period of time. Group members will be asked to acknowledge that they read the post.

**WHY USE **MARK AS IMPORTANT**?**

Mark as Important ensures that your most important announcements are seen by relevant employees and no one misses out on critical information.

**TOP TIPS **FOR USING MARK AS IMPORTANT**:**
* üë•‚ùìConsider what group you are posting in. If your post is only relevant to a small segment of group members, see if there is a smaller group that might be better suited for the announcement
* ‚úñÔ∏èüîù Don't mark too many posts as important. This is a tool to be used for critical announcements, marking too many posts as important might dilute the significance of other, more significant updates.
* üëâ‚öôÔ∏è Go to Important Posts in the Admin Panel to track how many people saw your posts and how many marked it as read. You can also export the data to report on how your communications are performing.
* üõéüëã Use the 'Nofify' button to maximise awareness of important messages! Admins can select as an audience for further notifications 'People who haven't seen your post' or 'People who haven't clicked the button on your post.' Additionally, you can send an email notification to your chosen audience. Note this option will not appear immediately after the initial post was done.

The Mark as Important video belowüëá is a good overview.

# üí°Workplace [#FeatureSpotlight](https://fb.workplace.com/hashtag/featurespotlights?__eep__=6&__gid__=2551666451815103): üë• **People Sets **
> **‚¨áÔ∏è ‚ñ∂Ô∏è **Admins, you can** [download the People Sets explainer video ](https://facebook.widen.net/view/video/ldod17wup5/Feature-Explainer---People-Sets_CE?t.download=true&x.share=true&x.portal_shortcode_generated=oprcvt0x&x.app=portals)**included in this post to share with your Workplace community and help others learn. 

Here are some summary points related to this Workplace feature:
## ‚ùì**WHAT ARE PEOPLE SETS?**

People Sets help you group your employees into subsets based on specific criteria like location, department and job title.
## üéØ **WHY USE PEOPLE SETS?**

People Sets allow you to **assign employees to groups automatically** based on their profile information. That way, when a new employee joins your Workplace, they're automatically added to groups that are relevant to their location and role.

People Sets can also be used to **send surveys out to specific segments of your organization**, so you can tailor your survey to your audience without having to add recipients one by one.
## ‚öôÔ∏è **TIPS FOR USING PEOPLE SETS**
1. Make sure employee profile fields are filled out. You can do that by connecting Workplace to your Cloud Identity Provider, or uploading a spreadsheet with relevant profile information filled out.
1. **Profile criteria** = location, job title, department
*When you add multiple criteria, employees will have to meet all of the criteria you set to be automatically added to your People Set.
**Value for a criteria** (for example, for location) = San Francisco, London, Dubai
*When you add multiple values for one criteria, anyone who meets at least one of the values will be added to the People Set.
1. Recommended People Sets:
   * One for each office location to automatically add employees to regional groups.
   * One for each department to automatically add employees to their department group.
   * One for people managers to add them to a manager group.

For a quick summary of People Sets and how to create one, watch the video below üëá

 üìπ üóÇAnd for even more feature videos to download and share with your Workplace community, visit the new **[Feature Videos page on the Customer Resource Center](https://www.workplace.com/resources/videos/features)**.

# Workplace Rules 

## Announcing workplace rules!

Now it's even easier for you to create and communicate rules for your Workplace. 

Admins can create and share a set of organisation rules with their coworkers. Sharing rules for using Workplace can help to keep Workplaces safe and encourage respectful communication.
## 

Admins have told us that they spend a lot of time trying to keep their Workplace safe and respectful. An important part of this effort is establishing organisation rules and guidelines. Rules set the tone for the organisation and help employees understand how to engage on Workplace. Admins tell us rules are most effective when they are easily seen by users. In the past, admins wrote their rules and guidelines in various places within their Workplace. Now, admins can create and effectively communicate a code of conduct for their organisation within their Workplace.

## How does it work?

Admins can create a set of Workplace Rules. Admins can choose to show a link to their rules when users report content.

Users can see the completed rules in the bottom-left of the Workplace website, under Quick Help -> Workplace Rules.

## **WHEN IS IT LAUNCHING?**

It is now launched to 100% of Workplaces using the new Workplace website experience. 

For more information and FAQs, go to the [Help Center](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/2508804946079684).

# üôå Hootsuite Amplify Improvements

‚öôÔ∏è ***What are we announcing?***

Hootsuite has improved their Amplify product which integrates with Workplace. 

Watch this üìπ video which explains more about the integration.

Here are the high level updates:
* Admins can send Amplify posts to Workplace through the ‚ÄúSend to Workplace‚Äù flow while creating content in Amplify's new Composer flow make sending content to Workplace easier than ever
* Within Workplace, the ‚ÄúShare content to my Social Networks‚Äù link now opens a new External Share flow (a new tab for users to get setup and select their networks to share to) with the following benefits:
   * If new, the flow onboards and authenticates first time users securely as Amplify license, enabling full use of Amplify feature set
   * The new share flow shows previews, allows users to schedule and use the full gambit of Amplify share features
   * Admins are able to track the value delivered by Workplace-origin shares as part of their Amplify package.
* None of this comes at an extra charge, it is all included as long as a customer has both solutions (Workplace and Amplify)

story: Jared Trout created a poll in Workplace Admins Community.

message:
## Storage limits

The Knowledge Library is going to be an important feature for WP. One hopes that over time it will be the repository for lots of information/data.

But the current billing arrangements for WP do not support its use. Each user for a WP instance gets up to 1tb of free storage (subject to T&Cs). The thing that worries me is that this is allocated strictly on a per user basis rather than to the WP instance.

So if particular users frequently upload materials because of their role (such as a PM, Group sponsor, Comms Mngr and so on) they might easily exceed their allocated limit. This is especially true of the Knowledge Library where  WP insists that only certain, nominated users can upload materials.

I raised this with WP asking that some form of aggregation be applied. Their response is that their will be no change.

Personally I think that this is short-sighted and that if this is to be the case, then the publicity for WP and the Knowledge Library should be changed to make this clear.  

I think that fellow admins should know, hence this post.

**Topics Feedback!**

Does anyone else really hate that hashtags are now converted to topics automatically? 

Firstly, I don't understand the benefit of this.  The old way of adding topics was more considered, whereas now, any hashtag a user writes inadvertently creates a topic. Having them as two separate features made far more since to me. 

Secondly, we now have 3.5 years of hashtags listed in the topics sections, meaning it's total chaos and not helpful to anyone!

Communicators understand the benefits of hashtags and topics, so will use them in a consistent way, with care.  But the majority of our users do not, they just use hashtags for fun. Therefore, we'd prefer it if their hashtags are not converted to topics automatically! 

We really want to use topics to help organise and group important posts, but this will be really had to do if anyone can create a topic!

**Safety Center is the evolution of Safety Check on Workplace.**

We added new features and redesigned the experience to bring you more flexibility when managing your communications before, during, and after safety incidents.

* üìàüìä **Response Insights**: See key metrics such as read and response rate in a clear dashboard. Understand your incident response success in a glance.

**Safety Center has begun to roll out and will be available to all customers by February.**

## Topic Tags

I don't know if people are aware of some changes that seem to have been made in respect of topic tags and the posting tool. 

First, a hash icon now appears in the bottom right hand corner of the post tool which - on hover - says 'Insert Topic'. 

If you click on the icon, and if you have no topics already 'stored', you can click on a button labelled '# Try Topics'. If you do that, then you see that a hash is inserted into the body of the post. If you type immediately after the hash then the hash and text turns blue and you have a hashtag.

If you do already have topics 'stored' - pinned or previously used - then you will see these and can select the appropriate one.

You can click on the topic hashtag and will see results just for the Group you have posted to. But you can also select a 'see all' option and you will then see results globally. (Which means that they are like any other hashtag.) This is different. Previously topics could only be searched for within a Group but now they can be searched for globally. 

Also, now up to 30 topics can be added to a post (previously 5) and you can have unlimited topics in a group (previously 150), including multi-company groups. But you can still only pre-populate up to 5 tags.

For what I am doing, these are good and welcome changes. But I had to go asking about them which irritates me somewhat.

# üå† 5 future of work predictions for 2021 & beyond!

We recently posted an [article](https://l.workplace.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Ftech.fb.com%2F5-factors-that-will-change-how-we-work-in-2021-and-beyond%2F&h=AT1El2gmmFllfhhbetLUZSXVcsN3nHRjSuwVqdV_MWBzon7TgFcDD8knR0U4rjVQSdXk0GbuUYNdBcvJ3DdnZ-RZr_TEXE9WBknw0jigSqlFM66nsKuoFxVZtYmEi4AW_Pnq86xFOHN6vZUR8Op4&__tn__=-UK-R&c[0]=AT2Z-Mt8PGXPgHMRl91IoB4ny1td1OJNERvI5trtu74oOs2qAvViWzO1-5hhFX1FD_9Qmx6uUwKp2R6jRLmRp6gNDrBdeDVyzam3KUYfXDHCZkURCKEF-CynjUZc3V4omtmEvV1MjtwGR21fS0_zqbjeQ0HXNnpBjAvRCCzil59uNfecXS8B7pNGE94S4XL_KtxUqY15gezJMqamIQ) on Facebook's Tech@ blog outlining our predictions for the future of work.

This topic was also mentioned in a [Yahoo! News](https://l.workplace.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fau.finance.yahoo.com%2Fnews%2Ffacebooks-five-future-of-work-predictions-in-2021-000115923.html&h=AT10meJQQXDyF6Idh4K6nbvwwb_zyZ2Err1JB532iN8IBZmKPYXQO_-HBW3ssqMEOVwFatJi8HHhfiLfEM-lBTz9JIXD-gsOfrIn-Hdv2zB6N-1VFIz01EDRBm7lkGXbwrCulbno65GSkdAbOgFl&__tn__=-UK-R&c[0]=AT2Z-Mt8PGXPgHMRl91IoB4ny1td1OJNERvI5trtu74oOs2qAvViWzO1-5hhFX1FD_9Qmx6uUwKp2R6jRLmRp6gNDrBdeDVyzam3KUYfXDHCZkURCKEF-CynjUZc3V4omtmEvV1MjtwGR21fS0_zqbjeQ0HXNnpBjAvRCCzil59uNfecXS8B7pNGE94S4XL_KtxUqY15gezJMqamIQ) article, which links to Workplace's [What's New](https://www.workplace.com/resources/news-updates/november-2020) page that explains the new Shift Cover feature.

From employee wellbeing to automation tech, the predictions cover trends that we are seeing across Workplace and Facebook's enterprise products. Here's a top line summary!
1. **Frontline workers will be at the centre of decision-making, with ‚Äúcareer frontliners‚Äù being the norm**
1. **Health and wellbeing will be the new corporate KPI**
1. **Augmented reality (AR) and virtual reality (VR) will be widely adopted for training, collaboration, and improved customer contact**
1. **Location will cease to matter as we see a narrowing of the digital divide**
1. **Companies will increasingly automate mundane tasks and focus on giving employees more satisfying work**

Hopefully this is a useful read as you look to develop your own outlook and plans for 2021.

# **Workplace Essential is going away on February 10, 2021**

As an admin of your Workplace, you should have received an email on December 10 informing you that Workplace Essential is going away on February 10, 2021, and offering you a free 180-day trial of Workplace Advanced to support you in this transition.
 
We built Workplace in 2016 to give the world a place to work together. Since then, we‚Äôve connected thousands of work communities and millions of people with this aim in mind. We‚Äôve seen increases in [productivity](https://www.workplace.com/blog/productivity/) and [engagement](https://www.workplace.com/blog/employee-engagement/) as well as employee sentiment and retention. 

In order to focus on improving the features that will deliver a high-quality product experience to all customers, we have decided to remove our free plan, Workplace Essential. **This change will come into effect on February 10, 2021.**
 
**FREE 180-DAY WORKPLACE ADVANCED TRIAL**
To start your free 180-day Workplace Advanced trial, follow the steps in the [Admin Panel](https://work.workplace.com/work/company_selector/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwork.workplace.com%2Fwork%2Fadmin%2Fpayment_information) before February 10, 2021. By upgrading to our Workplace Advanced plan, you will have access to key features such as [Insights](https://www.workplace.com/blog/employee-engagement-and-workplace-insights), [single sign-on (SSO)](https://www.workplace.com/resources/tech/authentication/sso) and [live chat support](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/1758078247807059). *Please note this free trial offering is only available to current Essentials members of this group (as of Dec 11th). *

In the last few months we‚Äôve also released a number of new features to address the challenges of working remotely, like [Knowledge Library](https://en-gb.workplace.com/resources/ways-to-work/employee-comms/knowledge) and [Live Producer](https://en-gb.workplace.com/features/live-video), helping people discover information, work together and [communicate](https://www.workplace.com/blog/business-communication/) authentically.
** 
WHAT HAPPENS IF ESSENTIAL CUSTOMERS DON‚ÄôT UPGRADE BY FEBRUARY 10, 2021**
Unless Essential customers upgrade to Workplace Advanced, they will lose access to their Workplace on February 10, 2021, and it will be subsequently deleted as per the [Workplace Terms](https://www.workplace.com/legal/FB_Work_EnterpriseAgreement).
 
If Essential customers decide to leave Workplace, system admins can find information on how to download their Workplace data in our [Help Center article](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/499690577151523?helpref=typeahead_suggestions&sr=3&query=download+data).
 
**ARE WORKPLACE FOR GOOD CUSTOMERS AFFECTED?**
Eligible Workplace for Good customers will not be affected and will be able to continue using Workplace Advanced for free. 
 
We recently got in touch with some Workplace for Good customers to ask them to verify their eligibility for Workplace for Good in order to continue to use Workplace Advanced for free. These customers have until February 10, 2021 to verify their eligibility by adding a TechSoup token in the Admin Panel under the Payments Tab. 
 
**WHAT‚ÄôS NEXT FOR WORKPLACE**
Looking ahead, we're going to double our efforts to bring you the best work and collaboration tools. We're also going to be focusing on how we can help organizations like yours build your company culture. Hello,

I have a small issue with **"Draft for" feature**. When I draft for some of our managers, I usually send them **a link to the draft via email **so they can easily find and approve it whenever they have the time for it. It works fine if they follow the link from a desktop, but it doesn't if they do it via their mobile, because **there is no "Post now" button** *(see screenshots 1 & 2 below)*. They can approve it via mobile if they enter the app directly, find the notification they have received and approve it from there, because they have "Post now" button there* (see screenshot 3)*.

I wrote to the support, but the answer I got is that this is expected behavior and they will consider weather it makes sense to develop this particular feature. This is really strange to me - "Post now" is actually the only feature missing when following the link via mobile. The user can edit the post, but cannot post it afterwards. 

**Is it really expected behavior and if yes, is it possible to develop this feature anytime soon? **

It would save lots of time and explanations here.

# üåü **Giving a huge thanks to all our Workplace Admins! **üåü
## üíñ SPREAD THE JOY OF GRATITUDE....

Many colleagues, partners and friends are celebrating Thanksgiving in the United States today. We want to take this opportunity to thank all our Admins for their tireless efforts this year.

From the Workplace team, a massive heartfelt thank you for all that you do! You have helped build important communities on Workplace, ensuring vital information is surfaced to colleagues in a timely manner via Workplace implementation and infrastructure management. 

In spite of all the uncertainty the Covid-19 pandemic has bought, your work has fostered connection and important communication for colleagues all around the world in spite of the lack of in-person presence. That's quite a feat.

**Since the important message from Thanksgiving is to embrace gratitude, spend a little time spreading gratitude by sending a *virtual* (very 2020!) message of thanks to those that have assisted you this year. Pause to give recognition to those special people that have got you through this tough year, giving you light even on the darkest days.**

**And be grateful also for your own efforts to carry on with optimism and resilience in the face of challenges.**

üéâ**‚õì ANNOUNCING SERVICENOW PARTNERSHIP AND NEW INTEGRATIONS WITH WORKPLACE! ‚õì **üéâ

Workplace and ServiceNow have a shared mission:
* to connect ALL workers ‚Äì from the frontlines to the back office to HQ
* to transform the employee experience for the better!
* to make work easier and better for everyone

That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre excited to announce our newest partnership!

‚öôÔ∏è**[ServiceNow explained](http://www.servicenow.com/)**‚öôÔ∏è

ServiceNow is a leading cloud‚Äëbased platform with comprehensive Employee Workflow products that help manage workflows across multiple functions and systems, from IT, HR, Workplace Services, Legal and Procurement.

**CHALLENGES**

As we continue navigating the COVID-19 global crisis, many organizations & business leaders need to respond to such challenges:
* Not everyone can work from home. How can we leverage technology to close the gap with the frontline and digitally connect ALL employees?
* Companies often have multiple digital tools and systems. How can disparate systems be optimally connected to improve employee experience?

‚öôÔ∏è **TOOLS TO CONNECT** ‚öôÔ∏è

As a response to such challenges, we‚Äôve been collaborating with our partner @ServiceNow to create new and improved tools to connect employees, wherever they work.
* **Talking to frontline employees*** (tool: **Employee Campaigns**)
*
   * By integrating *ServiceNow¬Æ Employee Campaigns* capabilities with Workplace from Facebook, HR and communications teams now have a way to easily communicate with employees, in the frontlines or the back office.
   * Pushes targeted communications to all employees, or specific groups in Workplace.
* **Supporting frontline employees with smart conversational experiences*** (tool: **ServiceNow Virtual Agent integration**)
*
   * *ServiceNow‚Äôs Virtual Agent* is an enterprise chatbot that uses the full context of the Now Platform¬Æ to deliver intelligent, personalized, and meaningful conversations that help people get things done.
   * Provides round-the-clock automated support within Workplace Chat. People can start a conversation, find answers and get immediate assistance wherever they are.
* **Helping frontline employees stay productive ***(tool: **Workplace from Facebook Spoke**)
*
   * ServiceNow helps companies design and build unique workflows to get work done effectively. ServiceNow has developed the *Workplace from Facebook* Spoke to make it easier to integrate Workplace into these workflows.
   * Performs actions like creating Workplace Groups and publishing Workplace posts as part of workflows that span different systems and address employee needs.

**Check out the [Workplace blog](https://www.workplace.com/blog/servicenow-and-workplace) for the full story!**

# üí° Your Workplace Best Practice Recommendations üöÄ

We've been using Workplace for a little while now for staying connected while we've all been working from home. But now, we're also keen to start using it as our intranet too.

What would be your number one best practice suggestion for making sure this a success?

# Pinned posts

Hi there, does anyone know how pinned posts work in terms of tracking the number of 'seen by' please?  I have a pinned post in a group of almost 20K people but the pinned post is only showing 800 'seen by'. Can anyone tell me if that's because it only counts the actual clicks on the post? I'm not sure.

## Has anyone had problems with email invitations being received by the people you want in Workplace? 

We recently implemented Workplace for our sustainable tourism project.  We are trying to bring independent contractors to the platform but they are not receiving the invitation email, not even inside their spam folder. 

We have to use the "Remind" option on the Admin Panel>People but we are still receiving emails telling us that they cannot see the invitation email.

Thanks! üôÉ

One of the Winners of the international award - Intercomm 2020
Dear colleagues, want to share some good news with you. On October 27 Beeline Kazakhstan took 3rd place in the Intercomm 2020 International Award in Moscow (Russia). Our communication project "Happiness with delivery" (about 70% of activities were implemented in the Workplace) was recognized as one of the best in the "Team Energy" category. 
This is a great achievement for Beeline KZ Intcomm team because in general more than 100 projects from many countries were submitted for the Award dedicated to internal corporate communications. 
This is our second year at the Intercomm Awards and we have already been awarded twice. Last year we took 2nd place with the project "Workplace-digital communications center".

Hi there!

We are currently looking for ways to move from Workplace AD sync app, which syncs on premise Active Directory users to Workplace. We have to choose between sync with Google Workspace and Azure AD. We would prefer to use Google, as we have SSO set with Google. With on premise AD we have mix of OUs and groups sync - OUs for company employees in different locations, and groups for individual external users - like contractors, vendors, etc.

As I see now, Google sync doesn't seems to cover such requirements as it can only sync either based on groups or based on OUs. Also Workplace   cannot read nested Google groups which we massively use.

Azure AD sync will cover our needs most probably, but before going into that direction, I wonder if anyone had similar setup, which approach did you choose and how you've set synchronization of users?

Thanks in advance.

# Status Update #5: New Workplace website and iOS Chat app

Hi everyone, this is our 5th update on the improvements to the [new Workplace website and iOS Chat app](https://www.workplace.com/resources/news-updates/improved-workplace-faq/). The [Help Centre](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/952689815156265/customer-updates?helpref=hc_fnav&rdrhc) articles are up to date with the latest fixes and what‚Äôs coming up next.

Last week** we started rolling out the new Workplace iOS Chat app to all customers**. We expect everyone to be upgraded over the next week or two. You‚Äôve been upgraded to the new app if you‚Äôre on version 289 or above (check this in your phone settings) and you can turn on Dark Mode (via your phone's display settings). 
## **STATUS UPDATE: 9th November 2020**

We have updated the Help Centre articles with more details on the latest improvements and features:
* [New Website features and timelines](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/2465795716899395)
* [New Chat iOS features and timelines](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/578311909777824?helpref=uf_permalink)

**Website improvements: **We‚Äôre still focused on bringing back support for Voice Clips in web chat,  Multilingual Posts and Topics. Work on these features is still ongoing.

**iOS Chat app improvements: **All temporarily missing features are back.  We will continue to monitor feedback so please keep providing feedback via the app.
## **WHERE CAN I GIVE FEEDBACK?**

**Chat iOS app: **submit feedback via the app. Click on your profile picture to access the app settings and then select  ‚ÄòSend feedback‚Äô under Help & Support. 

**New Workplace website:** submit feedback via the website. Click on ‚ÄúGive feedback‚Äù in the left hand navigation above your profile photo.

Our product teams actively monitor and triage reported problems, but do not respond to individual issues.
## **
TIMELINES**
* **New iOS chat app: **We're continuing to roll out to customers this week and next.
* **New Website:** You can opt-in to the Early Access experience via[ What‚Äôs New](https://work.workplace.com/work/admin/whats_new/). [Instructions are available in the Help Centre](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/2465795716899395). Everyone will be upgraded to the new experience on December 9th.

# üèÖüèÜ** 2020 Workplace Customer Awards - final call for entries & your FAQs answered **‚ÅâÔ∏è  
## ADMINS, IT'S THE LAST STRETCH FOR SUBMISSIONS WITH THE **DEADLINE FOR ENTRIES THIS WEDNESDAY!**

**[SUBMIT YOUR ENTRY HERE!](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdn5zUQYYgWC670f8bYSudQzFt72C_Sf-8CqOwONTzyg56vWA/viewform)** üì©
## your FAQs **ABOUT THE AWARDS **ANSWERED  üëá

‚è∞ **By what time on 11th November do entries need to be in by?**

It shouldn't take more than 45 mins to get your entry collated and sent in. The hard deadline for entry submission is 11:59pm BST on Wednesday, 11th November 2020.

üßæ **Can I attach Workplace screenshots to my entry?**

In order for these to be visible to judges you need to upload screenshots as images into Google Drive or as WeTransfer links and share those links in the entry form. You can also email them to **[abasmajian@fb.com](mailto:abasmajian@fb.com)**

‚úçÔ∏è **Can I submit my entry in my local language or does it have to be in English?**

Yes. You CAN enter in your native language and your entries will then get translated into English so our judges can review them all.

üìë **Can I translate the form for entry into another language?**

Yes. If you want to translate the [entry form](https://forms.gle/yaPivHAyYy46Seom7) you need to right click in the form. Select** ***translate to English *and* *then click on 3 dots** **(options) and choose the language you would like it to be translated to.

üó£ **Will Workplace publish winning entries or any entries publicly?**

We won‚Äôt publish the winning entry forms /submissions. That information is only for the judges' eyes. What we will do is announce **THE NAMES **of the winners but we won't be posting customer entries in any MCGs. 

What we will do is work with clients (winners and non-winners) to see if we can work on a way to share their story throughout 2021 so other customers can be inspired by their stories.

‚úçÔ∏èü§ì **Where can I get tips on entering?**
## [Here in the entry pack](https://assets.brandfolder.com/6j79vjvbwk2bh7qq2f2p8w34/v/34833326/original/Workplace%20Client%20Success%20Customer%20Awards%20Entry%20Pack.pdf)

 üì© **Where do I submit my entry?**
## [In this form](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdn5zUQYYgWC670f8bYSudQzFt72C_Sf-8CqOwONTzyg56vWA/viewform)

üìÆüì• **Can I enter multiple entries?**

Yes. You can enter multiple entries for various categories but you need to submit a new form for each category you want to enter.

üôãüèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è **Who can I contact if I have more questions?**

Reach out to Awards Lead, **Anahid Basmajian** on **[abasmajian@fb.com](mailto:abasmajian@fb.com) **or on WP Chat who will answer any questions you may have.

‚åõÔ∏èü•≥ **When will winners be announced?**

16th December 2020

# üéâ **What's new in Workplace? November Product Update **üéâ 

Here's our monthly round-up of all the latest Workplace product announcements!
> We are releasing a new tool for frontline workers called Shift Cover! This new feature makes it simple to change shifts and keep managers in the loop. 
> We are rolling out a new option to subscribe to Knowledge Library categories which will be available to everyone by the end of November.
# üë•ü§© **Shift cover made easy**

Frontline workers use Workplace to stay connected to the business and their coworkers. One common reason to reach out is shift changes. We‚Äôve made it easy to request cover for a shift using a new post type called Shift Cover. 

Shift Cover posts provide a clear template and the ability to nominate anyone in a group as shift supervisor to approve or decline cover offers. You‚Äôll be able to see all available shifts within a group in the new Shifts tab. 
 
Take a look at this üìπ **[tutorial video](https://brandfolder.com/s/54jz3vpvxmt5bt7whnvbwf68) **üìπ or visit our **[Help Center](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/2777083382538829)** to learn more about getting started with shift cover on Workplace. *Please note you must be on the new web experience to access shift cover.*
# üõé‚ÑπÔ∏èüìö**Get real-time updates on Knowledge Library**

We‚Äôve added the option to subscribe to any Knowledge Library categories or subcategories to receive regular updates on edits, comments and reactions. Now when editors make a change they can decide if an update is important enough to send notifications. The ability to subscribe to notifications will be available to everyone by the end of November.
 
Knowledge Library resources to check out!
* **[Animated Video](https://cdn.brandfolder.io/B7C054OK/as/q98jd8-53v3t4-6slbpj/Knowledge_Library_animated_demo_video.mp4)**
* **[Guide for admins](https://cdn.brandfolder.io/B7C054OK/as/q94smc-9fbg68-ev1h02/Knowledge_Library_Admin_2-pager.pdf)**
* **[Customer Resource Center](https://www.workplace.com/workplace/resources/ways-to-work/employee-comms/knowledge)**

‚úèÔ∏èüìì **Workplace LIVE Customer Education Classes - w/c Nov 9**

Check out the classes scheduled for this coming week üëá

**REGISTER FOR ALL CLASSES** **[HERE](https://training.wplearn.com/student/all_events)**

7:00 am Pacific / 3:00 pm GMT (60 mins)

Biggest and best releases from Workplace over the last 3 months AND Q&A with Workplace experts.

# Status Update #4: New Workplace website and iOS Chat app

Hi everyone, this is our fourth update on the improvements to the [new Workplace website and iOS Chat app](https://www.workplace.com/resources/news-updates/improved-workplace-faq/). The [Help Centre](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/952689815156265/customer-updates?helpref=hc_fnav&rdrhc) is up to date with the latest fixes and what‚Äôs coming up next.

This is a final reminder that on** November 4th we will start rolling out the new Workplace iOS Chat app to all customers**. After November 4th, you will no longer be able to switch back the old Chat iOS app.

**We strongly encourage you as Admins to try the new app before November 4th by opting in to Early Access **as you start preparing for the roll-out**. **On desktop, go to[ What‚Äôs New in the Admin Panel](https://my.workplace.com/work/admin/whats_new). From the Workplace Chat iOS post select Manage Early Access. You can choose to either opt in the system admins of your Workplace or your entire Workplace.

The new app is faster, takes up less space on your phone, and has Dark Mode. To help improve the app‚Äôs performance, we have also removed some very low usage features which are listed in the[ Help Centre](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/578311909777824).
## **STATUS UPDATE: 26th October 2020**

**iOS Chat app improvements: All temporarily missing features are back **and the following improvements will be available in the latest versions of the app:
* Call reliability improvements (version 287)
* Photo annotations (version 287)
* Do not disturb (version 287)
* Highlighting mentions if you‚Äôre mentioned in a conversation (version 287)
* Set status (version 288)

**iOS Chat app coming up next:** We‚Äôre tackling some remaining improvements to saved messages and bluetooth audio before the launch. We will continue to monitor feedback and make improvements after the launch on Nov 4th.

**Website improvements: **We‚Äôve shipped several small bug fixes, but have primarily been focused on bringing back support for Voice Clips in web chat,  Multilingual Posts and Topics. Work on these features is still ongoing and they will be supported by December. 

## **WHERE CAN I TRACK STATUS OF THE NEW WEBSITE AND CHAT IOS APP?**

We have updated the Help Centre articles with more details on the latest improvements and features:
* [New Website features and timelines](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/2465795716899395)
* [New Chat iOS features and timelines](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/578311909777824?helpref=uf_permalink)
## **WHERE CAN I GIVE FEEDBACK?**

**As we approach November 4th, we‚Äôre** **particularly interested in feedback about the Chat iOS app**. Please submit feedback via the app. Click on your profile picture to access the app settings and then select  ‚ÄòSend feedback‚Äô under Help & Support. Our product teams actively monitor and triage reported problems, but do not respond to individual issues.
## **REMINDER OF THE TIMELINES**
* **New Chat iOS app: On November 4th we will start rolling out the new Workplace iOS Chat app to all customers**. Opt-in to Early Access via [What‚Äôs New in the Admin Panel](https://my.workplace.com/work/admin/whats_new) to try the new app before it launches. 
* **New Website:** You can opt-in to Early Access or choose when your Workplace gets upgraded to the new website experience via[ ](https://work.workplace.com/work/admin/whats_new/)What's New. [Instructions are available in the Help Centre](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/2465795716899395). Everyone will be upgraded to the new experience on December 9th.

**Anyone Experiencing These in the New Experience? HELP.**
* **Insufficient Permission in regular post** this happens randomly to users that try to add a link, video or file (no pattern on why it is some)
   * Support ticket comes back with clear history/cache or go into incognito mode - this worked a few times but now it is not working for most users. I am unable to tell 8500 colleagues to do this every time they try and post something with a link due to varying levels of tech skills
* **Insufficient Permission in DRAFT post (image attached)** when it comes creating content for others, we cannot attached a photo, video or hyperlink
   * Support ticket comes back with clear history/cache or go into incognito mode - same thing as above
   * This feature isn't much at all anymore, we have to tell the poster how to attach a file or video themselves now, which defeats the purpose of drafting
* **Upload Closed Captioning to a drafted post **isn't available :(
* After successfully drafting a post in Classic Mode, **the Poster will post and hyperlinks will appear as a preview once they post **(even though we removed them when drafting)
* **Saved text in post compositor,** when not saving a draft when coming back to the group? This is confusing the end user that they cannot post (some do not know how to delete the information)
* **Copy/Paste issues in draft composer**, along with issues with spell check. The copy/paste will either shut out of the post or move the copy/paste to the bottom of the text
* **Emojis not copying over from another post**
   * We create content posts for approvals in workgroups, once we get approval, we will copy and paste over into the live group. Which will require us to re-find all the emojis from the test post. 
* **Workversary's not showing**: when many of them are showcased in a notification, the user clicks and it doesn't show the list 
   * Managers use this feature to know who they need to recognition in the department groups

## Is there a way I can submit 1 ticket for all of these items? 

I find myself spending much time and energy sending Support Tickets in. Is there an easier way to capture or submit the new user experience issues? The clock is ticking for the switch over and most of our users that are experiencing these issues above are going back to classic. Which is opposite of helping them learn the new platform. :(

All of our other software allows for managed updates, am I missing something with Workplace?

# ‚öôÔ∏èüìù **[Workplace top tips for boosting productivity](https://www.workplace.com/resources/ways-to-work/work-smarter/staying-organized) **üìù‚öôÔ∏è

Here are 4 helpful tips to help you stay productive & work smarter while using Workplace. 
## 1. MANAGE YOUR NOTIFICATIONS üõéüîï

Modify your settings so you only get notified about the important stuff. Here are a few ways you can do that:
* Prioritize your most important groups so notifications from them appear at the top of your inbox.
* Go to your Groups page to modify notifications from individual groups or in bulk.
* Go to your notification settings to modify how you get notified and what you get notified about.
## 2. SET CHAT MESSAGE REMINDERS üïêüí¨

Set reminders for time-sensitive chat messages so nothing falls through the cracks.
## 3. SAVE POSTS AND MESSAGES ‚ÑπÔ∏èüì∞

Save important posts and chat messages to your Saved folder to create a collection of useful content.
## 4. FIND FILES IN THE FILES TAB ‚ùìüóÇ

Use the Files tab to find any file ever shared in your group. For chat conversations, check out the Shared tab.

üéØ For more productivity tips be sure to check out the **[full guide for working smarter on Workplace](https://www.workplace.com/resources/ways-to-work/work-smarter/staying-organized)!**

# Status Update #3: New Workplace website and iOS Chat app

Hi everyone, this is our third update on the improvements to the new Workplace website and iOS Chat app. We have updated the [Help Centre](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/952689815156265/customer-updates?helpref=hc_fnav&rdrhc) again to keep you informed of the progress we‚Äôve made and what‚Äôs coming up next. 
 
A **reminder that on November 4th, the new Chat iOS app will become the default for all customers** and it will no longer be possible for Admins to switch back to the old experience via What‚Äôs New. We encourage you to try the new Chat iOS app during the remaining Early Access period if you haven‚Äôt already (you can opt-in via What‚Äôs New). Please let us know in the comments below how you‚Äôre finding it and how it compares to the old experience. 
 
## STATUS UPDATE: 12th October 2020
Full details of what features are available and what‚Äôs in progress are in the [Help Centre](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/952689815156265/customer-updates?helpref=hc_fnav&rdrhc).

**iOS Chat app improvements:** You‚Äôll see improvements to message search and missing avatars after you‚Äôve read a message. We‚Äôve introduced hidden chat and permanently hidden chat in settings, polls are back and now you can edit group chat descriptions and images. 

**iOS Chat app coming up next:** We are now working on fixing set status and photo cropping while we continue to work on bug fixes customers have reported as well as video and audio call reliability. 
 
**Website improvements:** In the last two weeks we‚Äôve added support for PDF file annotations as well as video/audio composition in Web Chat. We‚Äôve also made improvements to Japanese/Korean text inputs in the post composer and Chat Bot Carousels. 

**Website coming up next:** We‚Äôre still working on adding support for Voice Clips in web chat,  Multilingual Posts and Topics. 

## WHERE CAN I TRACK STATUS OF THE NEW WEBSITE AND CHAT IOS APP?
We have updated the Help Centre articles with more details on the latest improvements and features: 
- [New Website features and timelines](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/2465795716899395)
- [New Chat iOS features and timelines](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/578311909777824?helpref=uf_permalink)
 
## WHERE CAN I GIVE FEEDBACK?
As we approach November 4th, **we‚Äôre particularly interested in feedback about the Chat iOS app**. Please comment below or submit a ticket with our support team to give us feedback. 
 
## REMINDER OF THE TIMELINES
**New Chat iOS app:** You can use the new chat iOS app or switch back to the old app via What‚Äôs New. [Instructions are available in the Help Centre](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/578311909777824?helpref=uf_permalink). Everyone will be upgraded to the new experience on November 4th. 
 
**New Website:** You can use the Early Access experience and choose when your Workplace gets upgraded to the new website experience via What‚Äôs New. [Instructions are available in the Help Centre](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/2465795716899395). Everyone will be upgraded to the new experience on December 9th.

# No printing #printing

I've been in the Knowledge Management world for several decades, but am new to Workplace. I am shocked to find that there is no built in print facility, especially for the Knowledge Library. Am I the only one that thinks that this is a real problem?

Here is what I said to the Help Centre in reply to their normal questions: 

Gosh - it is amazing that Workplace is trying to establish itself as a serious player in this marketplace, but doesn't offer any print facility. How hard can this be - not very. It needs some basic coding to ensure that pages are presented to the browser's print engine properly formatted. I see this as a deal breaker for some organisations.

*What would you use the option to print pages in the Knowledge Library?* Many Front Line workers would welcome the chance to print off pages so that they have them available if they have no access to the internet or phone. Many Admins would like to print off pages so that they have a back-up if (as does happen) the pages are mislaid/lots by Workplace.

*What are the problems/issues that would be solved by having it?* Being able to print!

*How do you solve these problems today, if at all?* I currently either do a screen scrape of select the text and copy/paste.

*What's important about your request? How would your work change if you had it? *Very important. I have no ability at present to either create backup copies, or to create copies of previous pages that have some change on them. Front line workers are unbale to create physical copies to go into a physical work folder (for example). There is no chance of having a record trail.

Hi, I would like to know if there is a way to **archive or delete surveys **once no longer needed anymore, e.g. we have 77 completed and clogging up the view - is this on a roadmap as an option in the future please?

A few colleagues noticed that with the recent Workplace update, we can no longer see the last names of users within a Workplace Chat group. Workplace is a vital tool for departments across our organization and many staff members share first names, so it's important for us to see last names in a chat thread to easily distinguish who's who.

**Is anyone else being challenged by this recent update and is there a fix? **Many of our staff use Dark Mode and switching the display back to Classic isn't a long term solution. We've played around with Nicknames as well, but this isn't an ideal fix.

# üéâ**What's new in Workplace? October 2020**

Here's our monthly round-up of all the latest Workplace product announcements! Watch Sabrina's video for a summary and demo of these updates! üìπüëá
# üé® Redesigned Workplace Experiences

We are continuing to [launch the new Workplace website experience and Workplace Chat iOS app](https://fb.workplace.com/groups/WorkplaceVIPs/permalink/2082118701920729/). The aim is to improve performance and the overall user experience, while ensuring they are as reliable and feature rich as the current experiences.
## ‚ÅâÔ∏è‚úÖ **WHAT ARE THE CHANGES?**
* **[Dark Mode](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/382575319378072) **(website and Chat iOS app):
   * *Why?* Reduces screen glare and is easier on the eyes, especially for use in low light conditions.
* **Full Width Mode** (website only):
   * *Why? *Allows people to minimize white space when using Workplace on a large monitor.
* **Better Post Creation** (website only):
   * *Why? *Collapsing the ‚ÄúAdd to Your Post‚Äù section improves focus. We also wanted to introduce easier text formatting options.
* **Faster Navigation** (website and Chat iOS app):
   * *Why? *By using cutting edge infrastructure components developed at Facebook, both the Workplace website and Chat iOS app are now significantly faster, making it easier to find work essential things, and to connect and collaborate with your colleagues.
* **Accessibility Functionality** (website only):
   * *Why? *To make the Workplace website more accessible for customers with accessibility needs. We also plan to introduce improved focus management, easier keyboard navigation and support for screen readers.

To learn more about updated functionalities, visit our [Customer Resource Center](https://www.workplace.com/resources/news-updates/improved-workplace-faq).

Workplace admins can also find more details around availability in the [What‚Äôs New](https://work.workplace.com/work/admin/whats_new/) section of the Admin Panel.
## NEW PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT

These new launches have been popular asks!
# üìçüí° Create Customized Experiences with Frontline Areas

Areas is a way for admins to group frontline workers based on criteria like geography, department etc. To further empower managers to manage their teams access to Workplace we‚Äôve extended Areas capabilities! **Customized Areas**: Each Area can now be customized with its own settings including the ability to enable custom pop-up notices based on area.

E.g. an Area with all UK based employees might see a pop-up relevant to their region while employees in the Brazil could see something else.

Learn more about **[[Custom Settings for Areas]](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/737247566707182).**
# üìö Knowledge Library Enhancements

üîê **New invite flow:** editors and viewers can now be added to edit an individual Knowledge library category. Editors no longer need to be given full access to edit all of Knowledge Library.
üì©üõé **Option to subscribe to Knowledge Library categories:** sign up to specific KL categories you deem important, to receive regular, relevant updates. Plus editors can decide if an update is important enough to send notifications.
 
**Knowledge Library resources**

‚ñ∂Ô∏è [Animated video](https://cdn.brandfolder.io/B7C054OK/as/q98jd8-53v3t4-6slbpj/Knowledge_Library_animated_demo_video.mp4)

üìí [Guide for admins](https://cdn.brandfolder.io/B7C054OK/as/q94smc-9fbg68-ev1h02/Knowledge_Library_Admin_2-pager.pdf)

üìñ [Customer Resource Center](https://www.workplace.com/workplace/resources/ways-to-work/employee-comms/knowledge)

‚ùì[Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/252991161966313)

üöÄ **Full Rollout of Workplace Login, Zoom and BlueJeans on Portal Touch Devices! **

Following up on [our previous announcement around the extension of video conferencing apps on Portal](https://fb.workplace.com/groups/WorkplaceVIPs/permalink/2039274812871785/), we're excited to share that Workplace Login, Zoom and BlueJeans apps release is officially in progress, and estimated to reach 100% roll-out by early next week.

To use Workplace-only login, you can go to Settings>Account to add your Workplace account, and from there you can remove your existing Facebook/WhatsApp account on device.

# Activation, active retained rates - what have you done to improve these scores? 

Hi everyone, 

We are coming up to our six month Workplace anniversary, and are starting to think about our longer term plans and strategy...

Our activation rate is currently at 91% , our monthly active rate is 95% and our retained rate is 57% - so our biggest priority is to work on getting colleagues to log on and use Workplace on a more regular basis. 

It would be really helpful if you're able to share your rates in the comments and what you have done to increase them. 

Thanks in advance - Lauren and Dani Chivers from Saga :-)

# Status Update #2: New Workplace website and iOS Chat app 

Hi everyone, this is our second update on the status of the [new Workplace website and iOS Chat app](https://www.workplace.com/resources/news-updates/improved-workplace-faq/). Your feedback has been invaluable in helping us ensure the new website and iOS Chat app meet your expectations before we move everyone to the new experiences. **We have updated the Help Centre again to keep you informed of the progress we‚Äôve made** and where we‚Äôre continuing to make improvements. 
 
Please keep giving us feedback. This is a great opportunity to work together to make Workplace even more user friendly, reliable and accessible to everyone.   
 
## STATUS UPDATE: 28th September 2020
*Full details of what features are available and what‚Äôs in progress are in the [Help Centre](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/952689815156265/customer-updates?helpref=hc_fnav&rdrhc).*
 
**Website improvements:**
- **Closed caption management and in-line editing** (including translations) are now available in the new experience. 
- We‚Äôve also made significant improvements to writing posts, reintroducing **Sharepoint and OneDrive** integrations so you can easily share files, as well as making the text formatting options more visible.  
- We‚Äôve made some smaller improvements to display schedules in Events and you can now upload files in the Files tab in a group. 

**Website coming up next:** We‚Äôre now focused on adding support for: Voice Clip & Camera options in chat as well as Multilingual Posts. Additionally we‚Äôre working to improving our existing support for: Topics and Japanese/Korean text input in Composer.

**iOS Chat app improvements:** Video and audio call reliability has been our top priority. We have fixed issues with video calls disconnecting and made improvements to audio quality.  Photo editing from photos uploaded from your camera will also be available in the next app release. 

**iOS Chat app coming up next:** We will continue to work on video and audio call reliability. 

## WHERE CAN I TRACK STATUS OF THE NEW WEBSITE AND CHAT IOS APP?
Detailed overviews of the current status of the new website and chat iOS app are available in the [Help Centre](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/952689815156265/customer-updates?helpref=hc_fnav&rdrhc). We have updated these overviews with the latest improvements and feature availability: 
- [New Website features and timelines](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/2465795716899395/why-is-the-workplace-website-being-updated)
- [New Chat iOS features and timelines](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/578311909777824/why-is-the-workplace-chat-ios-app-being-redesigned?helpref=uf_permalink)
 
## WHERE CAN I GIVE FEEDBACK?
We‚Äôre continuing to keep track of all your feedback, so keep it coming! Please check the Help Centre for the latest information on what we‚Äôre working on. If you have any new feedback, please post in this Admins MCG group or submit a ticket with our support team. 
 
## REMINDER OF THE TIMELINES
**New Website:** You can use the Early Access experience today or choose when your Workplace gets upgraded to the new website experience via What‚Äôs New. [Instructions are available in the Help Centre](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/2465795716899395/why-is-the-workplace-website-being-updated). **Everyone will be upgraded to the new experience on December 9th.** 
 
**New Chat iOS app:** You can use the new chat iOS app now or switch back to the old app via What‚Äôs New. [Instructions are available in the Help Centre](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/578311909777824/why-is-the-workplace-chat-ios-app-being-redesigned?helpref=uf_permalink). **Everyone will be upgraded to the new experience on November 4th.**

Hi everyone,

Our current situation is the following:
