# Status Update: New Workplace website and iOS Chat app

Hi everyone, this is an update on how we‚Äôre addressing your feedback on the Early Access versions of the new Workplace website and iOS Chat app. We‚Äôre continuing to keep track of all your feedback and will update the Help Centre every two weeks on Monday to keep you informed of the progress we‚Äôre making, any known issues, and the timelines for feature availability in the new experiences.
 
We hope this information will help you understand what to expect from the current Early Access experiences as well as help you decide when to switch over to the new experiences, if you haven‚Äôt already.  
 
## LATEST STATUS UPDATE
Full details of what features are available and what‚Äôs in progress are in the [Customer Updates section of the Help Centre](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/952689815156265/?helpref=hc_fnav).
 
**[Website improvements:](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/2465795716899395)** We‚Äôve made improvements to writing posts, sharing files, Groups and Chat. 

**Website coming up next:** We‚Äôre now focused on improvements to Topics, Closed Captioning, File integrations with SharePoint/OneDrive and support for Multilingual posts. 
 
**[iOS Chat app improvements:](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/578311909777824?helpref=uf_permalink)** We‚Äôve made improvements to editing photos uploaded from your photo library, message search and editing group descriptions. 

**iOS Chat app coming up next:** We‚Äôre working hard to improve Video Calling reliability to resolve known Audio issues.
## WHERE CAN I TRACK THE STATUS OF THE NEW WEBSITE AND CHAT IOS APP?
Detailed overviews of the current status of the new website and chat iOS app are available in the Help Centre. Going forward, we will update these overviews every two weeks on Monday: 
- [New Website experience - features and timelines](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/2465795716899395)
- [New Chat iOS app - features and timelines](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/578311909777824?helpref=uf_permalink)
 
A higher level overview of the improved Workplace website and iOS Chat app, which you can share with your organisation is available in [Customer Resource Centre](https://www.workplace.com/resources/news-updates/improved-workplace-faq/).  

## WHERE CAN I GIVE FEEDBACK?
Please check the Help Centre for the latest information on what we‚Äôre working on. If you have any new feedback, please post in this MCG group or submit a ticket with our support team. 
 
## REMINDER OF THE TIMELINES
**New Website:** We have extended the early access period for the new website until **December 9th 12:00 UTC**. You can use the Early Access experience until December 9th and choose when your Workplace gets upgraded to the new website experience via What‚Äôs New. 
 
**New Chat iOS app:** We have postponed the launch of the new chat iOS app until **November 4th**. You can continue to use the new Workplace Chat iOS app or opt-out via What's New until November 4th.

# üôå **[5 Tips for Building an Inclusive Workplace Community](https://www.workplace.com/resources/toolkits/inclusion) **
## Here are a handful of tips from our playbook on *"Building an Inclusive Workplace"* we want to share with Workplace admins! 
## Get even more by [downloading the playbook in the Customer Resource Center](https://www.workplace.com/resources/toolkits/inclusion).
## 1. üë• SET UP SOCIAL RESOURCE GROUPS 

Social resource groups (a.k.a. employee resource groups) offer a safe space for important conversations. Create open groups like "Black at [Company Name]", "Muslim at [Company Name]", "Differently Abled at [Company Name]" etc and set posting permissions so anyone can post.
## 2.  üìöüí° OFFER LEARNING AND KNOWLEDGE SHARING OPPORTUNITIES FOR PEOPLE MANAGERS

Use a closed or secret people managers group to foster conversations about how leaders can create inclusive team environments.
## 3. üîÄ SHARE RESOURCES IN YOUR KNOWLEDGE LIBRARY 

Create a new "Wellness and Inclusion" category in your Knowledge Library. This could include links to a Company D&I mission, strategy & groups, Workplace accessibility features & as well as mental health and wellness resources.
## 4. üíå CELEBRATE DIVERSITY WITH INTERNAL CAMPAIGNS 

The **[Be the Ally campaign kit](https://www.workplace.com/resources/toolkits/ally)** consists of a series of GIFs you can use to help define D&I-related terminology. Share a GIF in your company-wide discussion group and include links in the post to relevant resources!
## 5. üìàüìã BE TRANSPARENT ABOUT D&I STRATEGY AND PROGRESS 

Send Surveys out to the entire organization every 6 months to measure the success of your D&I strategy. Create a post in your all-company announcement group, sharing data points and insights on what worked well the last 6 months and what didn‚Äôt. Then, outline an action plan for how you plan to improve.
## WANT TO USE THE GIFS from THIS POST AS PART OF AN INTERNAL CAMPAIGN IN YOUR OWN WORKPLACE?

[DOWNLOAD THE BE THE ALLY CAMPAIGN KIT HERE](https://www.workplace.com/resources/toolkits/ally/)!

# An update on the new Workplace website and Workplace Chat on iOS

Hi everyone, since launching Early Access to the new Workplace website and Workplace Chat iOS app we have received a lot of valuable feedback. We‚Äôve been actively listening to your feedback and we‚Äôre now acting on that to create the best possible experience on Workplace. We hope the details below clarify the Early Access timelines and next steps for ensuring that the new website and chat iOS app deliver a high-quality experience with all the features you expect.  

## WHAT ARE THE UPDATED TIMELINES?

**New Website:** We are extending the early access period for the new website until **December 9th 12:00 UTC** You can continue using the Early Access experience or delay when your Workplace gets upgraded to the new website experience until December 9th via [What‚Äôs New](https://work.workplace.com/work/admin/whats_new/). More detailed instructions are available in the [Customer Resource Centre](https://fb.me/improved-workplace-faq). 

**New Chat iOS app**: We are postponing the launch of the new chat iOS app until November 4th. You can continue to use the new Workplace Chat iOS app or opt-out via [What's New](https://work.workplace.com/work/admin/whats_new/) until **November 4th.** More detailed instructions are available in the [Customer Resource Centre](https://www.workplace.com/resources/news-updates/improved-workplace-faq/). 
 
## WHAT‚ÄôS THE CURRENT FEATURE STATUS OF THE NEW WEBSITE AND CHAT IOS APP?
 
Detailed overviews of the current status of the new website and chat iOS app are now available in the [Help Centre](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/952689815156265/customer-updates?helpref=hc_fnav&rdrhc) as well as the [Customer Resource Centre](https://www.workplace.com/resources/news-updates/improved-workplace-faq/). We will keep these overviews updated with the latest information on what features are available. 

[Overview of new Website features and timelines](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/2465795716899395) 
[Overview of new Chat iOS features and timelines](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/578311909777824?helpref=uf_permalink) 

## SHOULD I CONTINUE USING THE NEW WEBSITE AND CHAT IOS APP?
To ensure you can continue to have the best possible experience on Workplace while we action the feedback we‚Äôve received, you can temporarily switch back or postpone enabling early access to the new Workplace website and/or the new iOS chat app. 

We will continue to keep this group updated as we action your feedback.

# ‚úÖ **5 Custom Badges Admins can Create in Workplace**
# üéñ Badges are a great way to show **[recognition](https://www.workplace.com/resources/ways-to-work/culture/recognition)** of employee roles and achievements right on their Workplace profile. 
# Here are a few idea for custom badges you can create and award today:
1. ü§© **Top Workplace Contributor ** 
Identify top Workplace contributors in the Content tab of your Insights and award them with a Badge.
1. üíü **Social Resource Group Admin
**Does your organization have social resource groups like "Women at [Company Name]"? Create a Custom Badge in Workplace to identify and recognize social resource group admins.
1. üèÖ **Champion Learner 
**Awarded to people who have completed 5+ optional internal trainings
1. üìß **Department Contact 
**Awarded to people who volunteer to be the point of contact for their department
1. üîØ **Mentor**  
Awarded to people who take part in your organization's mentorship program

Badges are managed by admins in the Admin Panel. ** **

**[Visit the Customer Resource Center to learn more about Workplace recognition features](https://www.workplace.com/resources/ways-to-work/culture/recognition).**

## COMING TO PORTAL:** **BLUEJEANS, WEBEX, GOTOMEETING, AND ZOOM IN SEPTEMBER

In addition to Facebook‚Äôs collaboration tool Workplace, we‚Äôre now partnering with [BlueJeans](https://www.bluejeans.com/), [GoToMeeting](https://www.gotomeeting.com/), [Webex](https://www.webex.com/) and [Zoom](https://zoom.us/). # üñ• **Workplace on Portal - what's new?**

üåÖ **BACKGROUNDS:**
* Workplace on Portal is available on all Portal devices, which now includes Portal TV, and we‚Äôre adding backgrounds for your video calls to eliminate distractions in your workspace!
* The new Backgrounds feature provide a set of dynamic backgrounds that change lighting and effects based on local Portal device time, providing more privacy and fun factors for Workplace calls on Portal. The existing Background Blur feature will now be one of the effects under Backgrounds.
* During, or when connecting to a Workplace call on Portal, users can tap Backgrounds on screen, and select one of the effects that replaces their background during a video call.

üîì **WORKPLACE-ONLY LOGIN:**
* We‚Äôre also adding a way for you to use Portal as a dedicated work device for calling co-workers and participating in meetings.
* In addition to Facebook and WhatsApp, users will have the option to use Workplace accounts to login to their Portal devices.
* Users can use Workplace accounts only, or along with their Facebook/Whatsapp accounts.

üí¨ **Announcing Google DialogFlow integration with Workplace**
We are excited to announce that Google has built its first-ever 3rd party app on Workplace called Dialogflow.

üó£ Dialogflow is an end-to-end, build-once deploy-everywhere development suite for creating conversational interfaces for websites, mobile applications, popular messaging platforms, and IoT devices.

ü§ñ You can use it to build chatbot interfaces that enable natural and rich interactions between your users and your business.

üñä **Send Sign and Succeed with DocuSign eSignature for Workplace **

We partnered with DocuSign to build a new integration that will notify users when they've received an envelope and send them a link to easily view or sign right within Workplace from Facebook.

With this integration customer organizations can:
üîë Seamlessly access DocuSign- Enter DocuSign eSignature app with a single click from Workplace Chat to send, track, and manage electronic agreements.
üí® Do business faster - Receive notifications when there‚Äôs an agreement you need to sign or get status of agreements that you sent for signature.
üèõ Stay compliant - Signed documents, along with a legally binding audit trail of the transaction, are automatically archived in DocuSign.
‚ûï More details and how to add the DocuSign integration to your WP instance are available **[here](https://www.workplace.com/integration/?app_id=535265687132788)**

# ‚öôÔ∏è **August Toolkits: Managing Change with Workplace**

üì£ This month we're releasing two new toolkits to help you manage change and uncertainty.

üë• **[ENGAGING EMPLOYEES IN TIMES OF CHANGE](https://www.workplace.com/resources/toolkits/change/)**

This playbook is a comprehensive guide for managing your change communications with Workplace. It will help you:
* Understand your audience üéØ
* Develop your messaging üí¨
* Optimize and amplify your communications üó£
* Empower people managersüë§üéñ
* Measure success and iterate based on your findings üìà

You'll learn how features like People Sets, Groups, Knowledge Library, Mark as Important and more can play a central role in your change communication strategy.

üëâ [Download the employee change management playbook here](https://www.workplace.com/resources/toolkits/change/) üëà

ü§© **[POSITIVE CHANGE CAMPAIGN KIT](https://www.workplace.com/resources/toolkits/positive-change/)**

# üë•‚öôÔ∏è **5 Simple Steps to Get Your Frontline Connected to Workplace **

**[Read the full guide on the Customer Resource Center](https://www.workplace.com/resources/ways-to-work/frontline/areas/)**
## 1. CREATE AN AREA  üë£

Create an Area for a region, storefront or department and add all relevant employees to it.
## 2. ASSIGN AN AREA COORDINATOR üó£

Make your frontline managers Area Coordinators so they can help their direct reports access Workplace.
## 3.  SHARE ACCESS CODES WITH FRONTLINE EMPLOYEESüîì

Area Coordinators can retrieve access codes and share them with employees via text message, email or WhatsApp.
## 4. RE-SEND EMAIL INVITATIONS üì®

Area Coordinators can re-send email invitations to encourage employees to activate their profiles.
## 5. MAKE PROFILE CREATION REQUESTS üì£

When a new employee joins their team, Area Coordinators can send profile creation requests to System Admins to get them added to Workplace faster.

Couple of issues I find using WorkChat, not sure if others face the same.
1- In group chat, if doing voice recording, sometimes the iOS app keeps the recording bar displayed continuously, even if I have finished recording and removed the finger, it remains there any doesn't end. I can cancel it only but there is no other way to actually send what is recorded already. Hence, have to resend in smaller chunks.
2- in workchat on macbook app, if voice recording (for any message) is finished, and I sent it, it keeps loading in the message screens, but never sends actually. I have to use my iPhone workchat app to send voices. This happens in Facebook messenger as well many times.
3- A serious problem I believe, if I doing voice recording in workchat iOS app, and suddenly my phone rings, I lose everything I recorded already unlike WhatsApp where the recording remains in draft mode giving me option to either send it or delete it which is great!
4- This is a feature request actually, like in WhatsApp, you can hear the voice recording from the middle or anywhere by moving the bar, we don't have this option in workchat, it would be great as sometimes we have to repeat the specific part of the voice and we cannot do it unless we hear from the beginning. and it wastes so much time when the voices are 2 minutes long.
I heavily use the voice notes instead of text...
Hope to have some updates on these issues soon...

# Introducing the improved Workplace website and Workplace Chat on iOS!

We are redesigning the Workplace website and Workplace Chat iOS app to provide you with a more modern and powerful experience for work! With this update, we focus on improving performance and usability, and overall upgrading the user experience. 

## When is the update coming?

- **Website:** The open access period for the improved Workplace website will start on **August 12th.** We‚Äôre planning to move every Workplace community to the improved website by the end of September. 
- **Chat iOS app:** The new Workplace Chat iOS app has been made available to some customers since June 10th. However, we are opening the access to every Workplace starting today, **July 22nd,** and we‚Äôre planning to move every Workplace to the new Chat iOS app by the end of August. 

## What enhancements are coming?

- **Website:** The improved Workplace website supports Dark Mode and Full Width Mode, and is overall significantly faster when loading and navigating between pages. We redesigned several components of the website based on your feedback. Some of these changes may be visible to you and some may not, but they significantly improve the usability of Workplace. Examples include the Full Width Mode to accommodate larger monitors, as well as a more modern post creation experience, with easier text formatting options. We are also making the website more accessible by those with accessibility needs by providing improved focus management, easier keyboard navigation and screen reader support.  
- **Chat iOS app:** The new Workplace Chat iOS app is now faster overall! Starting the app and loading a message takes significantly less time. The app is easier to use and takes up only a fraction of the space on your phone compared to the current app. We‚Äôre also introducing new functionalities such as Dark Mode.

## How do I move to the new website and Chat iOS app?

- **Website:** Starting **August 12th,** system admins will be able to move their Workplace to the new website via the Workplace website post in the Upcoming Features section of the What‚Äôs New page in the Admin Panel. Admins will be able to pick the start and end date of their early access period. When the period ends, your Workplace will only see the improved website. 
- **Chat iOS app:** Starting today, **July 22nd,** system admins will be able to move their Workplace to the new Chat iOS app via the Workplace Chat iOS post in the Upcoming Features section of the What‚Äôs New page in the Admin Panel. 

## Where can I find out more?
For more information, please visit the dedicated [Customer Resource Center page](https://www.workplace.com/resources/news-updates/improved-workplace-faq) or contact your Workplace team.

Hello Workplace Community. Here at Farmers Insurance, we've been on the Workplace journey for about four years, and its been an invaluable tool in reshaping how we communicate. Due to some necessary technology upgrades, we're in the early stages of planning a re-working of our intranet portal, and therefore have an opportunity to reexamine the role our portal plays alongside Workplace and some other communications tools we use. Ultimately, I believe our role is to create a cohesive digital experience for our employees with a well balanced suite of communications tools that complement each other, as opposed to a handful of independent tools. 

As part of that exploration, I'd welcome the opportunity to discuss with some others how they have positioned their intranet portal alongside Workplace, what works, what doesn't, what types of integrations you've been able to achieve , etc. 

If anyone would be willing to meet and share their experiences, please either comment below or PM me via Chat. Thanks- hope to hear from a few of you!

# Questions re functionality in Knowledge Library:
* Currently you can edit the order of subcategories, but cannot reorder sub-subcategories. As we build out the Knowledge Library, this will be a critical function so we are not forced to keep the subcategory order as the order of added. 
* We would like to be able to create tables to make some of the content more clean rather than having everything in list form when a table is more appropriate. 
* Once you create a category and choose the icon and the colour, it appears this cannot be changed - as we add more areas, we may need to edit these. Can this feature be added?
* Is there a way to link to content further down the page from links at the top of the page? We have a few very long pages in an effort to avoid having sub-sub-sub categories, but we are aware that people will not continue to scroll if they cannot find their content quickly and easily. 
* Is there any way to add or link to a calendar from a page? Some of the content pages we are pulling from on our current Intranet have events calendars for specific areas. Single events won't work because people need to view in month format. Ideally the calendar would sit in page, but we could link out somewhere if necessary.

# üôå Coming Soon | Simplified Access to Workplace & Videos on Knowledge Library üôå 

Next week, we are making two frequently requested additions to Workplace. We are launching **Frontline Areas** to make it easier for those working on the frontlines to access their Workplace accounts. We are also adding the ability to upload or embed **videos into Knowledge Library**.

To find out whether a specific feature has been enabled for your Workplace, please check [What‚Äôs New](https://work.workplace.com/work/admin/whats_new/) within the Admin Panel.

‚ú®**Simplify access to Workplace with Frontline Areas**

Make accessing Workplace easier for people who work away from a desk by creating areas. Once you create an area, you can add people based on criteria that makes sense for your company like location, cost center or department. From here, you can designate an area coordinator responsible for managing access to Workplace for everyone in their area including helping people activate their account, log out of a session and more. Read more about how to make [Workplace access easy for frontline](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/ways-to-work/frontline/areas) in our Customer Resource Center.

üìπ **Add videos to your Knowledge Library**

Knowledge Library provides a central place to create and share static content on Workplace. To keep this official content interesting and engaging, you can now add videos to categories on Knowledge Library. You can choose to upload a video from your device or embed a video by adding a link to Workplace, YouTube, Vimeo and more.

‚ÑπÔ∏è **More info**

Check out the [Help Center](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/) to learn more about [creating content on Knowledge Library](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/572419446963367), how to [create an area](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/545523702791799) and how an area coordinator can [share access](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/966600717092382) with select people. And be sure to check [What‚Äôs New](https://work.workplace.com/work/admin/whats_new/) for details on the new features above!

story: Hash Manickum is answering questions in Workplace Admins Community.

message: Hi All! Is it possible to enable "don't disturb" for all users trough API respecting their working hours? We already use this resource in Active Directory, but I don't know if it's possible to do the same in Workplace.

We have a company-wide group where folks post updates/information relevant to everyone within our organization. This is a default group so all employees are members. I'm finding, however, that the group can feel noisy for some users because of the number of posts there vs. the number of posts in their smaller team groups. I've shared instructions for changing notification settings but am frequently asked if it's possible to change that group's overall settings to turn off the many notifications. To my knowledge, this is not an option and notifications can only be changed by individuals. Anyone have any luck finding a way around this?
Hi! Are there any plans to release filter options or the "voter information center" here on Workplace?
Feature request: is there a way to have a tasks list and assign tasks to people?

Hi All,

Just wanted to share a short video on some of the integrations we have done for employee experience. I have blocked out some of the sensitive info by blurring it out.

We are aiming to make Workplace the only app our frontline employees will ever need by bringing what we can into workplace.

More to come such as : Leave booking, log a ticket with IT or HR/Payroll. Exciting times ahead!

How do I get my workplace to use the platform? 
Since it was introduced, a handful have been using it but most others have reverted back to the familiar old email.

Have you implemented any weekly/monthly/quarterly employee recognition mechanism on Workplace? 

If yes, is it manual or have you implemented any of the available integrations. Do share more info on which one, how has the experience been and Pros/Cons.

Does anyone have any good ways to manage projects via Workplace? So far we're using ad-hoc Google Docs to hack it but it's just not elegant. I know Workplace isn't Monday.com / Basecamp / etc but hoping some of you have found good ways to collaborate on projects with your peers within the platform. Any thoughts appreciated. Thanks!
Does anyone know if you can sync your Slack status with your Workplace status?

Request: it would be nice to organize groups in folders.  Currently I create secret groups for each project we have (painting company) and add the crew members to the group for that project.  I pin this group to short cuts.

Once the project is completed I then remove each member from the group (which is a tedious process since you have to do each person individually - no way to select several at once to update) and then archive the group once it is complete.

It would be great to have folders to organize since we have new groups starting for each project.

Any suggestions on how others file closed and/or open jobs would be helpful.

# Q1: Scheduling shares?

Is there a way to schedule shared posts from groups? I can do it via the app, but not on desktop (unless I'm missing something!)
# Q2: Countdown clocks?

Has anyone found/used a live countdown clock on Workplace (ie it actually counts in real time and ends after the event has finished)?

**Feature request!**

We use the link function a lot, so would love to be able to track the click-through rates.

We often signpost to content elsewhere, and when it's content on Workplace it would be great if we could somehow distinguish if a user saw the original post or landed on it after clicking on a link. 

I don't believe either is currently possible, but if someone does know a way to track this, please let me know! 

Also, if this is something which may be considered, could these metrics be available to the post author rather than those with insights/admin access?

Do you guys have any tips/tricks for this situation:

We have 60+ secret groups that we use for our company and like to keep them private so everyone can stick to their own department/division's team announcements. 

Since I'm the admin and constantly posting in those secret groups, my profile page shows each post I make. Is there a way to avoid having to go to each post and select "hide" on my profile page? It gets old after a while lol

Hello All,
I know Facebook has a mentorship add on to groups, is that something that Workplace will be adding anytime soon?

**Update: Solved.**

May i know what's everyone's workaround solution to overcome the limitation of not able to have chat in multi-company group? When will chat be available in multi-company group?

**Update:** 

Thank you! Sorted out! 

Previously, there was no option to have group chat within multi-company group. I have just realized today, that it's now available. Haven't been following up on their updates. Usually i will look at, "What's new" to keep track of changes. Cheers!

# **üîê Increasing secure access for the modern workforce üîê**

**Webinar **hosted by** Workplace, Microsoft & Yubico**

Thursday, June 18, 2020, 09:00 (AM) PST, 17:00 (PM) BST
# **[Register Here](https://l.workplace.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fevent.on24.com%2Fwcc%2Fr%2F2400283%2FB213412AB8B6B66E51EC58AA478D280E&h=AT32bg7NujXCG0ZYDhza96hgnVcFlrnMqfbJJiP78LrQv_eqM1CNZBcp1z1TthmL6Zm7_BVpMCCWARAMiFFIAqOZZV4Q2l89Tmt4qb4sdlxPDtph8ytzMRZDyNwWdKvzzYxFM-5gs0DYYAtFI1UYLieHlwPOGT9hZYdx7g)**

As global workforces continue to be dispersed, giving safe and easy access to work applications is crucial for business continuity. There has been an explosion in the numbers of apps, devices, and users who are now operating off the corporate network, as well as complex and fluctuating worker profiles (e.g. increased Frontline workers, fluctuating employee statuses such as temporary leave, sick leave, furlough etc.).

Workplace has partnered with Microsoft and Yubico to help our customers ensure that employees are being securely provisioned, de-provisioned, managed and authenticated into company systems.

üíª **What will the webinar cover?**
* See a demo of how Workplace, Microsoft Azure AD, and Yubico work together for advanced secure employee provisioning, authentication and access management
   * Through[ Azure Active Directory](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/active-directory/?&ef_id=CjwKCAjw2uf2BRBpEiwA31VZj0cf1AfmibODVW6e86kDAKSpVt9t_WdKgp31gL8idklS6fa-YjquZhoCOLkQAvD_BwE%3AG%3As&OCID=AID2000128_SEM_CjwKCAjw2uf2BRBpEiwA31VZj0cf1AfmibODVW6e86kDAKSpVt9t_WdKgp31gL8idklS6fa-YjquZhoCOLkQAvD_BwE%3AG%3As&gclid=CjwKCAjw2uf2BRBpEiwA31VZj0cf1AfmibODVW6e86kDAKSpVt9t_WdKgp31gL8idklS6fa-YjquZhoCOLkQAvD_BwE), Workplace admins can be confident that the employees accessing their work applications are who they say they are.
   * With[ Yubico](https://l.workplace.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.yubico.com%2F&h=AT0Xjv9lEjmFK7ND6jkEBMKJz4O-DeEX23Kw7oK4zADRHfUlLmERwl-EHKs01VprAKgyI8QCn7exhpUXRxEQmbBDgEA9v0c0L1VY9vvti8h8W5aDM1dg57g2ureI3xeIUh8I-yHYUgl6ji8W_-JIAD6q4yH4U41x4IcA7A), customers can leverage the advanced authentication security of YubiKeys to mitigate external threats to account compromise and move towards a more secure, passwordless future.
* Hear how we are jointly working to define industry standards for identity security such as FIDO
> *Webinar registrants will gain first access to Workplace, Microsoft, and Yubico's joint 'how-to' set-up guide for advanced identity security methods.*

# **Coming Soon | Improving Profile Controls**

In order to ensure people and organizations feel safe using Workplace, we are continuing to invest in easy-to-use and transparent tools to manage people‚Äôs profiles on Workplace.

We are adding the ability for people to **report a profile** if they find it suspicious. We are also adding the option to **switch to another Workplace **for people who have more than one account.

These updates have started rolling out and will be made generally available by the end of July. To find out whether a specific feature has been enabled for your Workplace, please check [What‚Äôs New](https://work.workplace.com/work/admin/whats_new/) within the Admin Panel.

**REPORT A PROFILE**

We are introducing a new reporting option that allows people to report Workplace profiles they find suspicious. Upon receiving a profile report, a System Admin will have the option to either deactivate or allow the user profile. We are also introducing a new report type called ‚ÄúPretending to be someone else‚Äù, which will be added to the existing content reporting flow, and can be used to report posts, comments, chats or profiles. 

**SWITCH TO ANOTHER WORKPLACE**

You can now easily switch from one Workplace profile to the other, if you are logged into multiple accounts on the same browser. Just click on your profile picture, select ‚ÄúSwitch Workplace‚Äù and pick the account you‚Äôre looking for.

**MORE INFO**

Check out the Help Center to learn more about [reporting content](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/351883618534615), [managing reported content](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/980242522134735) and [switching profiles](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/901053133659334). Visit [What‚Äôs New](https://work.workplace.com/work/admin/whats_new/) for more details on these releases.

# **Coming Soon | New Features on Portal & More!**

At Workplace we have been working tirelessly over the last few months to improve the experience of working remotely. We‚Äôre excited to announce today that we will add several new features to help you work on Portal, **Watch** **Workplace Live on Portal, as well as Background Blur and Desk View for Workplace calls on Portal. **In addition, we are also introducing some enhancements to **Do Not Disturb **to help you protect your personal time** **and the ability to** save searches in Security Logs. **
 
These new features will begin launching next week and be available to all customers by late June. To find out whether a specific feature has been enabled for your Workplace, please check [What‚Äôs New](https://work.workplace.com/work/admin/whats_new/) within the Admin Panel.
 
**WATCH WORKPLACE LIVE ON PORTAL**
Workplace Live app on Portal adds a new way of broadcasting and consuming live videos. Workplace users can already go live via Portal, now you can also watch live videos from your organization on Portal using the same app. Turn Workplace Live app on Portal into your organization‚Äôs live video channel, discovering both both in-session and previous live videos in one place and catch up with important company information.
 
**BACKGROUND BLUR AND DESK VIEW ON PORTAL**
When using Workplace on Portal, use Background Blur and Desk View to help you make the right impression with your co-workers, clients, stakeholders and others. During Workplace calls on Portal, Background Blur intelligently blur your environment while keeping the view of yourself clear and focused. Desk View enables Smart Camera to optimise the camera view for sitting or standing close to a workstation, while enabling Smart Sound to minimise noises such as keyboard typing. 
 
**DO NOT DISTURB IMPROVEMENTS**
Set aside time to focus or disconnect from work with Do Not Disturb. Now when you set Do Not Disturb, we make it easier to step away by pausing notifications, sounds and message and post pop-ups. If someone sends you a message on chat during this time, they will now receive an automatic message letting them know your notifications are off and when you will return. You can turn on or schedule Do Not Disturb by clicking on your profile picture or status in the bottom left corner. 
 
**SAVED SEARCHES IN SECURITY LOG**
Managing the security events of a Workplace community can be a demanding job. To help admins better navigate the Security Log, we are launching Saved Searches so admins can save their most frequently used search queries and filter combinations, making it easier to understand and manage the security events in the instance. 
 
**MORE INFO**
Check out the [Help Center](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/) and [What‚Äôs New](https://work.workplace.com/work/admin/whats_new/) for details on all the new features above!

message:
**If any of you use Trading Post, what have you found to be the most effective way for posting items?**

We love the idea of using Trading Post... but we aren't sure how we want to set it up. We're trying to decide if we should let staff post to it directly or have an admin post each item to ensure it has adequate info and to cut down on the notifications coming from that group by turning off commenting and asking that interested parties reach out to the person via chat (we're afraid if someone comments on the post that everyone will get bombarded with each notification). I guess we're a little skiddish about the notifications because some of our staff see Workplace as an annoyance (staff that've been with us a long time, who don't like change) and so we don't want to reinforce that feeling by causing notification overload.

Thank you in advance üòä

# **Have you ever hosted a Workplace Live session with someone who has no vision?**

Hi everyone,

We are looking at running a Workplace Live session with our CEO who happens to be blind. He uses a screen reader on a day to day basis, but we haven't tried this in the live environment yet. 

I was wondering if anyone else had run a similar event and how they over came the challenges? 

We are currently weighing up the use of a screen reader (and that potentially being distracting) or having someone in his household read incoming questions out. 

Any ideas or advice would be so appreciated :)

Many thanks

# ‚ú®**[June Employee Engagement Kits!](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/engagement-campaigns/june)**‚ú®

This month, we‚Äôve put together 3 employee engagement campaign kits you can use to communicate with and engage with your employees.

Celebrate Pride month with LGBTQ history quizzes, recognize people who have gone above and beyond with Work Hero Awards and get ready to return to the office with the Back to Business Kit.

**[Read the Customer Resource Center guide and download the kits here](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/engagement-campaigns/june)**

With most pride events canceled this year, we think it's more important than ever to use your internal communication channels to celebrate and honor LGBTQ people and history.

The Pride History Quizzes are gamified gifs you can share with your organization each week to engage and educate your employees.

The Pride History Quizzes Kit comes with:
* 8 question gifs to be shared at the beginning of each week
* 8 answer gifs to be shared at the end of each week.

# Coming Soon | Richer posting experiences 

Posts are at the very heart of the Workplace experience. They‚Äôre how our users share information, update colleagues, showcase work, commemorate landmarks. We are continuing to invest in our post experience to help our users both communicate and discover relevant information more effectively. 

To help teams stay on track and feel connected, we have built two new post types. **Action Items posts **are designed to promote visibility and accountability within teams - needs that we know are all the more critical when colleagues are apart. 

**Achievement posts** are designed to help teams create community, boost morale and promote the team‚Äôs hard work. These are key team needs during times of uncertainty and separation. Achievement posts are an easy-to-use way to commemorate team landmarks with a prominent illustrated animation or your own custom image or video. 

Along with **strengthening content creation** with these post options, we‚Äôre going to be enhancing how users can **signpost and discover content** on relevant subject areas - both in their teams and across their organisation. More to come on how we‚Äôre planning to enhance the content sharing and discovery experience in the coming month!

Achievement Post and Action Items Post will be available to all customers on desktop, visible on mobile, by mid June. To get you started, Help Center articles will be published on both over the coming week. To find out whether a specific feature has been enabled for your Workplace, please check [What‚Äôs New](https://work.workplace.com/work/admin/whats_new/) within the Admin Panel.

**ACTION ITEMS POST**

Add Action Items to your post to effectively communicate follow-ups from meetings or jobs to be done to member of your team. A poster can tag colleagues on specific items and keep track of when an action item has been completed.  

*Available on desktop for all users by mid-June! Visible on mobile by mid-June, with creation on mobile coming in July.*

**ACHIEVEMENT POST **

Create a special achievement post with an illustrated animation or your own custom image or video. Achievement posts can be used to highlight a team‚Äôs hard work, and everyone who contributed to the effort. 

*Available on desktop for all users by mid-June! Visible on mobile by mid-June, with creation on mobile coming later this month.*

Updates on our enhancements to content sharing and discovering coming soon!

# Reinventing Video on Workplace

With the shift to remote work, video has become a vital way for companies to strengthen their community and get work done. Workplace is doubling down on video collaboration to address this need, and today we are announcing Workplace Rooms, which will become available in June and will allow you to connect with up to 50 people even if they don‚Äôt have a Workplace account. We‚Äôre also making some exciting updates to Workplace Live, introducing new features to enhance broadcast quality, accessibility and interactivity.

Whether you‚Äôre connecting with colleagues through Workplace Rooms or delivering more authentic company communication with Live broadcasts, Workplace has the video tools to bring your teams together.

## TO BRING YOUR TEAMS CLOSER TOGETHER WITH VIDEO WE‚ÄôVE BUILT:

- **Workplace Rooms (coming in June and July):** A new way for coworkers and teams to stay connected, hangout and get things done when they cannot be together in person. Rooms is an easy way to host both planned and spontaneous video calls from your desktop, mobile or the Workplace app on Portal. Anyone can join, even if they don‚Äôt have an account or the App installed. [Learn how to Get Connected with Workplace Rooms](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/ways-to-work/work-smarter/rooms)

- **Workplace Live Video Improvements  (coming in May and June):** These include Live Producer (coming in June), a new way to go live on Workplace from your desktop with better production value, control and interactivity; automatic live captioning in 6 languages (available in May); automatic caption translations and editing (available in May); and Live Q&A (coming in June). [Learn more about Going Live in Workplace](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/ways-to-work/work-smarter/live)

- **Workplace updates on Portal (coming in June):** Including Workplace on Portal TV, Workplace Rooms on Portal and Workplace Live on Portal (now available) - including the ability to use Portal to go live on Workplace and watch Workplace live videos.

**[Check out our blog to learn more](https://www.workplace.com/workplace/blog/workplace-rooms-for-remote-working/) or [download our admin guide](https://brandfolder.com/s/qap0ld-d80w8o-e5wsh4).** We will continue to focus on video over the coming months, and will keep this group updated on our progress!

# Coming Soon | Showing support while many of us are apart

Helping people be apart together during these unprecedented times has been a top priority for us at Workplace. We are introducing the Facebook **Care Reaction** as well as a set of new work-from-home themed **Profile Frames** to help you connect with your coworkers. 

Both updates will begin launching next week and will be made generally available by June 15th. To find out whether a specific feature has been enabled for your Workplace, please check [What‚Äôs New](https://work.workplace.com/work/admin/whats_new/) within the Admin Panel.

**CARE REACTION**

The new Facebook Care Reaction - an emoji hugging a heart - is coming to Workplace to help colleagues show care and support when responding to a post, message, photo or video.

**PROFILE FRAMES**

Showcase your support by overlaying on your existing profile picture an ‚ÄúApart Together‚Äù frame, or signal the balance you need to strike with a ‚ÄúWork from Home Parent‚Äù frame. Each has been created to help coworkers better understand each other during this difficult time. Profile frames will be available in 13 languages. If you would prefer to not launch the profile frames to your Workplace you can disable them by contacting Workplace Support.

**MORE INFO**

Check out the Help Center article on [Profile Frames](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/674664453294610?locale=en_US&draft=674664453294610) and [What‚Äôs New](https://work.workplace.com/work/admin/whats_new/) for more details on these releases.

# Coming Soon | Useful additions to your admin toolkit

In order to ensure your Workplace community runs smoothly, we are continuing to build the best possible admin experience that minimizes overhead and maximizes utility.

We have improved our reported content tools allowing admins to temporarily **hide reported posts and comments **while they go through review. We are also making it easier to track Workplace issues by **extending the reach of our Workplace Status page** with a new preview in the Admin Panel, a Workplace Groups integration and an RSS feed.  

All of these updates will begin launching next week and will be made generally available in the coming weeks. To find out whether a specific feature has been enabled for your Workplace, please check [What‚Äôs New](https://work.workplace.com/work/admin/whats_new/) within the Admin Panel.

**HIDE REPORTED WORKPLACE POSTS DURING REVIEW**

We are introducing a new enforcement option for admins and content moderators in the Reported Content review panel. This option is called ‚ÄúHide‚Äù. It allows admins to temporarily hide a post or comment in question from everyone besides the author themselves and the admin while the post is being reviewed.** **

**STAY INFORMED ABOUT ISSUES AFFECTING WORKPLACE**

You can now stay informed about issues affecting Workplace without visiting the [Workplace Status](https://www.workplace.com/workplace/status) page. Just open the Contact Support tab in the Admin Panel to see the current status. Or, to receive automatic updates, subscribe to the Workplace Status [RSS feed](https://www.workplace.com/workplace/status/rss) or setup live status updates in any chosen group by adding the ‚ÄúWorkplace Status‚Äù integration. When an issue appears or gets resolved on the Workplace Status page, it will appear in the group and members will get push and email notifications. [Follow these steps](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/129620394473133) to set up the integration on your group.

**MORE INFO**

Check out the Help Center article on [reported content](https://work.workplace.com/help/work/980242522134735) and [What‚Äôs New](https://work.workplace.com/work/admin/whats_new/) for more details on these releases.

**Workplace Meetings and Appointments Function**

If any of you are like us we organise meetings with our Workplace colleagues all the time. 

To organise a meeting we currently have to step out of the Workplace platform and use the Calendly app which is integrated with our Google Calendar. 

The Facebook Pages platform has had an '[Appointments](https://www.facebook.com/business/m/book-appointments)' function for close to a year now and we have been asking the Workplace support team for years to add this important feature to this fantastic platform.

Frankly we were surprised to see that this feature would appear first in the FB Pages platform and not in Workplace where it would serve us all so well. 

Every time our members leave the Workplace platform it is time lost and a distraction ‚Äî furthermore the backwards and forwards in organising meeting times is unproductive time lost. 

Hopefully the Workplace support team will integrate this feature before too long as it a big missing piece in what is otherwise has been a game changing platform for our work at Regrarians. 

Thanks! 

[https://www.facebook.com/business/m/book-appointments](https://www.facebook.com/business/m/book-appointments)

# Coming Soon | Tools to help you work more efficiently

We are more reliant than ever on digital platforms to talk to coworkers and do our work. Workplace gives you the tools to work together, even when you can't be together. And we are innovating everyday to provide the best possible experience.   

To give you an extra edge of productivity, we‚Äôre adding **predictive text suggestions** on posts and comments so you can respond more quickly and save time in your day. And on Chat, you can now **pin a message** to the top of a chat to ensure everybody sees important news even if the conversation carries on. Larger **files up to 75MB can now be sent via chat** as well. We‚Äôve also enhanced **multi-company groups with the option to add a synced chat** with just a click, so communicating outside of your company is easier than ever before.   

We haven‚Äôt forgotten about our Workplace admins! We listened to your feedback and have added the ability to **deliver surveys through links and email** so you can get more responses, more quickly. Plus we‚Äôve made **Video Rights Management available on Safari** browser so you can protect your video content while letting people use their browser of choice.   

All of these updates will begin launching next week and will be made generally available in the coming weeks. To find out whether a specific feature has been enabled for your Workplace, please check [What‚Äôs New](https://work.workplace.com/work/admin/whats_new/) within the Admin Panel.

**MOVE FASTER WITH PREDICTIVE TEXT SUGGESTIONS**

Predictive text suggestions generate recommendations as you type, allowing you to write posts and respond faster on Workplace. Everyone can turn this feature on and off in their Language Settings.

**HIGHLIGHT IMPORTANT CHAT MESSAGES**

Pinned messages let you keep important chat messages top of mind while the conversation continues. You can now select a message to pin to the top of a chat just like you can pin a post to the top of a group.

**SYNC CHAT WITH MULTI-COMPANY GROUPS**

Work often involves connecting with partners, vendors, suppliers or agencies outside of your organization. We‚Äôve made this simpler to do with synced chats on Multi-Company Groups. Now when you create a multi-company group, you will have the option to enable a chat, too. The chat and group will be synced so you can move between posts and chat with ease.

**EXPAND THE REACH OF YOUR SURVEYS**

Surveys help you track the pulse of your organization. We‚Äôve added new ways to share your survey so you can ask questions and collect feedback faster and more easily. You can now send surveys through a link, email notification, or Workplace Chat.

**EXTENDING THE POWER OF VIDEO RIGHTS MANAGEMENT**

Video Right Management (VRM) provides additional control and protection on videos that are uploaded onto your Workplace so only people on supported browsers can watch them. In January, we made this useful tool available on Firefox, Chrome, Edge Chromium and mobile apps. And now VRM is available on Safari.

**MORE INFO**

Check out the [Help Center](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/) and [What‚Äôs New](https://work.workplace.com/work/admin/whats_new/) for details on all the new features above!

# üì¢üåü **Enabling communication in the world of remote work **üì¢üåü Exciting Updates!

With so many of us navigating remote working initiatives for the first time, organizations are encountering a host of new challenges. To help through this unprecedented time and beyond, [we recently shared what Workplace is doing to connect workforces everywhere](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/blog/supporting-employees-in-the-world-of-remote-work/).

We have been listening to feedback from our customers across different industries and regions to understand how we can best support you. We‚Äôre proud to share the progress we‚Äôve made over the last couple months to help you stay connected while apart.
## ***TO MORE EFFECTIVELY COMMUNICATE CRITICAL INFORMATION WE‚ÄôVE BUILT:***

**Knowledge Library **üìö‚ùì Centralize official knowledge and static content including employee handbooks, work from home policies & travel guidance. It‚Äôs available on desktop and mobile so it‚Äôs accessible and discoverable by all employees. To learn more check out our [admin guide](https://l.workplace.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fcdn.brandfolder.io%2FB7C054OK%2Fas%2Fq94smc-9fbg68-ev1h02%2FKnowledge_Library_Admin_2-pager.pdf&h=AT39aGPGj2mTedrKCSirmNGppjYFD1ylRfNeRkvxe2KEpvTiOmFpwpHr1gNyboKGw5yV3I_Zys6erEkRrpoRazC1NnR_rIG2cuMyIQNSLXlREutGhXxPd3viAWKoE45RrHpLyxPzYe0F6DRSsBH9zAtvoVlMLh5-bydMnA), [Customer Resource Center](https://www.workplace.com/workplace/resources/ways-to-work/employee-comms/knowledge) and [video](https://l.workplace.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fcdn.brandfolder.io%2FB7C054OK%2Fas%2Fq98jd8-53v3t4-6slbpj%2FKnowledge_Library_animated_demo_video.mp4&h=AT3wUnQ3Mk1ED_y-JLmLm0BdVjliFutx2I24Va04x-3_GNntqKgU6oQs2u5bwJoIg0AAiHjn0GLMBftnCf0UwnIrocLvxuGvOcyVCrH7dARMtVF3CHejPymEkbqnizPECWtb89VH6n1MZG2gqgLoSodH8ziXWkCmu8k8Bw).

**Draft For **‚úçÔ∏èüó£ Enable the right people to draft posts on behalf of executives. Executives can review, approve and publish to save time and ensure important information gets to employees quickly. Get started with our [two-pager](https://l.workplace.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fbrandfolder.com%2Fs%2Fq7t9vk-5b6lx4-8y2jed&h=AT2AUXw3rKA01OEdsPeb2tJ86hEy_95QBl3fOCAP_q63rEX2PgXS9qg7VVk_0fLe4jVCEJG8xGCUBqZTwtfuBeJNfnPyUoB0uanc1TgTW_LdypPdfDZ1KKAfwJ26bQAc6UlMx4IyQe4aOjFLgUEJccnFLa13HVdXJ5lFiQ) and [video](https://l.workplace.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fbrandfolder.com%2Fs%2Fq7ta4m-cs4wf4-3spf9m&h=AT2DnuVIJ6CLJldWnQN6GTtSqqL7R5BG0_3hR4vx-MJ2I3gcdGpcmny_XuPVSt-M2MV8vEvXuJhB7f7mXZCCQbePmVPBNmFLuWPA35jK8J9T2L6HXga5y1OxngE3F39IPR1WpF5VZlOrhjJfeXtFFaxEhdL4y-ffJsIKIQ).

**Campaigns **üìäüìà (*Coming in May*): Generate rich, campaign-level reporting with just a few clicks. Pull multiple posts together and save them into a campaign, so you can track your audience reach, engagement and sentiment across posts. Use campaigns to improve your COVID-19 response communications.
## *TO HELP ENSURE EMPLOYEE WELLBEING WE‚ÄôRE OFFERING:*

**Safety Alerts**üôÖ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è‚õîÔ∏è (*Coming in June*): Rediscover the power of Safety Check with alerts. Alerts provide safety teams with a more flexible option to send safety updates without requiring a response. Safety Alerts can be widely used for any important notices, not just drills or crises.

**Q&A Posts **‚ùì Create an open conversation between company leaders and employees, using the new Q&A-type post within a group. Group members can add questions, comment and vote on other people‚Äôs questions. Learn more in our [Help Center](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/539610090311471).

**Care Reaction **üíù (*Coming in May*): Respond with the new care reaction to express solidarity and support for colleagues.

**Profile Frames **üî≥ (*Coming in May*): Select from a set of work-from-home-themed frames that can be overlaid on your existing profile picture to help people be apart together.

[Check out our blog](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/blog/supporting-employees-in-the-world-of-remote-work/) to learn more. We will continue to focus on these areas over the coming months while we also invest in enabling better team collaboration and powerful video experiences.

üëáFeedback on these new features welcome! üëá

We're really looking forward to the Knowledge Library, however, we're finding the first iteration really limiting in terms of the editor.  How are you overcoming these limitations:

#1.  We cannot embed animated GIFs or PNGs.  We have a lot of technical documentation, and we have short screen captures as animated GIFs.  Knowledge converts these to JPG's, so we can't use them.

#2.  Can cannot embed videos.  We're a social work organization, and many of our videos have confidential information.  Normally we'd use Vimeo and then limit the domains where the videos can be embedded.  But, we just have to use links within Knowledge and this complicates things.

# Introducing [Employee Engagement Campaigns](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/engagement-campaigns)!

Employee Engagement Campaigns is a new section of the Workplace Customer Resource Center that has all the tools, downloadable materials and inspiration you need to run engaging internal campaigns in Workplace.

You can use these campaigns to educate your employees on how to use Workplace features or to authentically engage with them in fun ways.

The **[Employee Engagement Campaigns](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/engagement-campaigns)** section contains:
* **[Tip Tuesday:](https://brandfolder.com/s/qap9xp-a6fefk-a4vnkx)** help people get more out of Workplace with weekly tips and downloadable attachments.
* **[Remote Working Campaigns:](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/engagement-campaigns/remote)** campaign ideas and inspiration to help your organization be apart but together while working remote.
* **[Wellness Campaigns:](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/engagement-campaigns/wellness)** campaign ideas and a customizable asset kit to help you build community around wellness at work.
* **[Fun Friday Challenges:](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/engagement-campaigns/fun)** downloadable games to help you celebrate the upcoming weekend and get people talking.
* And more!
## [GO TO THE EMPLOYEE ENGAGEMENT CAMPAIGNS](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/engagement-campaigns)

*Give our Show and Tell Fun Friday Challenges a try! Pause the gif below *üëá* and share your responses in the comments. *

# **Coming Soon | New ways to stream updates and measure impact**

People are at the heart of every business. And we believe that humanizing communications is a crucial component of creating a great workplace and turning employees into advocates!
 
That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre excited to announce the upcoming release of **Workplace Live on Portal**, which will enable leaders to easily connect with their people on a personal level‚Äîwithout the hassle of complex hardware and software setups. So they can focus on verbalizing the thinking that goes into their decisions and providing context for written updates, without needing an entourage for (remote) stand-by support.
 
We‚Äôll also be introducing **Campaigns** as an out-of-the-box solution for quantifying impact across multiple posts. In addition to reducing time spent on reporting, this will help communications teams to highlight how their work directly affects employee sentiment!
 
Both of these updates **will be made generally available by the end of May**. To find out whether a specific feature has been enabled for your Workplace, please check [What‚Äôs New](https://work.workplace.com/work/admin/whats_new/) within the Admin Panel.
 
**STREAM LIVE VIDEO TO WORKPLACE WITH PORTAL**
Workplace Live on Portal brings professional live streaming to everyone, with a simple setup and rich out-of-the-box capabilities. Portal minimizes background noise while Smart Camera follows the presenter, so you can focus on your message instead of worrying about your tech. Plus real-time comments and reactions make it easier to engage with viewers during the live broadcast.
 
**MEASURE THE IMPACT OF YOUR CAMPAIGNS**
Generate rich, campaign-level reporting with just a few clicks. Pull multiple posts together and save them into a campaign, so you can track your audience reach, engagement and sentiment across posts.
 
**MORE INFO**
Go to the [Help Center](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/) to learn more about Workplace Live on Portal and Campaigns. Or stop by the [Customer Resource Center](https://www.workplace.com/resources/) to pick up the latest tips for topics like [tracking internal campaigns](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/ways-to-work/employee-comms/campaigns).

# Bring your static and dynamic content together

Knowledge Library is a new home for your key resources. It‚Äôs a single place to create, store and share content on desktop or mobile, so your company knowledge is accessible and discoverable. Knowledge Library is rolling out now and will be available to all Workplace communities by Thursday, April 23rd. 

**How does it work?**

Knowledge Library is found in the Explore Menu right under News Feed. Any admin with permission to manage Knowledge Library will be able to create and edit content from an easy to use editor. System Admins can give anyone Knowledge Library edit permissions through the Admin Panel. Once content is published, Knowledge Library will be visible to all employees who have access.

Everyone in your community will see a personalized Knowledge Library home based on what they have access to. Here admins can also highlight priority information and key links. Knowledge Library sits alongside Groups and Chat and is mobile-friendly too. So any employee, whether they sit behind a desk or work on the frontline, can access your Health & Safety guidelines, benefits information or relevant policies right from Workplace.

**What is happening to Resources?**

Resources provided a single page to store key links on Workplace. With the launch of Knowledge Library, we now offer a much more powerful alternative. For this reason, if you were using Resources, on April 27, 2020 we are moving the page into Knowledge Library under a category called ‚ÄúResources‚Äù. We will be removing the Resources feature from Workplace on May 26, 2020. 

**Where can I find out more? **

For more details, check out our [animated video](https://cdn.brandfolder.io/B7C054OK/as/q98jd8-53v3t4-6slbpj/Knowledge_Library_animated_demo_video.mp4), [guide for admins](https://cdn.brandfolder.io/B7C054OK/as/q94smc-9fbg68-ev1h02/Knowledge_Library_Admin_2-pager.pdf), [Customer Resource Center](https://www.workplace.com/workplace/resources/ways-to-work/employee-comms/knowledge) which includes a  tutorial and this [Self Paced Course on Creating a Two-Way Comms Strategy](https://training.wplearn.com/student/activity/205410-creating-a-two-way-comms-strategy#/page/5e966beac52d0d2066b7d2ac). And if you have questions, please consult the [Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/252991161966313) or reach out to Support.

# **HOW TO GET WHAT YOU NEED FROM THE  WORKPLACE SUPPORT TEAM**

Whether you've been on Workplace for years or are a new customer, I want to ensure that you and your teams know how to get what you need from the Workplace Support team. üõ†üì¢üëÇ.

**Attached you'll see an easy How-To guide** for using Support**.**

I'm Abigail and I lead the global customer support team for Workplace üëã. My team exists to help customers with any issues using Workplace and to answer questions about how to use the product. We have a 24/7 support model covering all regions, so you can get hold of us whenever you need to üåê‚úÖ.

I‚Äôve noticed some really great questions posted in this group where Workplace Support could help in a valuable way. ‚ùì‚ùì

***WHO CAN USE SUPPORT?***

**Admins of the Enterprise & Advanced plans of Workplace can use Direct Support **to contact experts from our customer support team. If you have questions about using Workplace or run into technical issues, please let us know by [**opening a case via the Direct Support tool](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/275313006293716) **within the admin panel.

***WHEN TO CONTACT SUPPORT?***

We want to hear from you üëÇüôè. We're here to help.

We have a global team who work across time zones and in multiple languages.

Once a Direct Support case is opened, our support teams will leverage their product expertise to answer your questions, resolve technical issues as quickly as possible, and help you get the most from Workplace based on your particular needs.

***THE BENEFITS OF DIRECT SUPPORT***

There are a number of [benefits to using Direct Support](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/2009881572565297):
* Admins get visibility to all support requests created by other admins in the company. üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
* Direct support is in-product, meaning admins don't need to go outside of Workplace to get assistance. üéØüìå
* Admins have the ability to see the status of the tickets they've submitted and keep track of progress. üë©‚Äçüè´üìàüìâ
* All questions, issues and feedback that come via the support team are analysed and fed back to the Workplace product teams as a key input for future development and roadmap planning. üìäüó∫üß≠

***HOW TO CONTACT SUPPORT üì¢üîîüõ†***

You'll see the** easy How-To Guide** for contacting Support attached. In addition, [HERE](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/275313006293716) you can find more info about how to open a case (ticket) with us.

Any questions please let us know.  We look forward to hearing from you.

message:
# **Coming Soon | More reasons to bring all your communications to Workplace**

Finding the right information at the right time is easy and effortless when all of your communications are in one place. And Workplace is the tool of choice, whether your organization is focused on creating alignment, boosting morale or upskilling its people.
 
To help you bring everything together on Workplace, we‚Äôre making **important posts** even more effective for business-critical announcements, introducing a new **Q&A**-type post for leadership connections and adding reporting capabilities to **Learning** so you can track completion as well as comprehension. These updates will also make it easier for your people to stay informed, engaged and up-to-date on trainings‚Äîplus improvements to the **Do Not Disturb **setting** **will cut down on disruptions.
 
And last but not least, the new **Imports/Exports tab** of the People page within the Admin Panel will simplify the ongoing management of your Workplace while streamlining the setup process for new customers. 
 
All of these updates will be made generally available in the coming weeks. To find out whether a specific feature has been enabled for your Workplace, please check [What‚Äôs New](https://work.workplace.com/work/admin/whats_new/) within the Admin Panel.
 
**POWERING UP IMPORTANT POSTS**
Boost the reach and conversion of your business-critical communications with the improvements to important posts. Your content will be shown more prominently and you can retarget people by notifying them again, as well as choose the action text that appears in the button so viewers know what‚Äôs expected of them.
 
**ADDRESS EMPLOYEE QUESTIONS VIA WRITTEN Q&A**
Create an open conversation between company leaders and employees, using the new Q&A-type post within a group. Group members can add questions, comment and vote on other people‚Äôs questions. The audience will see answered questions by default, and can sort questions by ‚Äòmost voted‚Äô or view them in chronological order.
 
**TRACK AND ASSESS LEARNING PROGRESS**
Learning units allow you to create collections of content in your groups. Now, with quizzes and insights, you can track if your team has reviewed and understood the information shared in each unit. Learning can be enabled by Group Admins through the group‚Äôs Learning tab. 
 
**FEWER DISRUPTIONS WITH DO NOT DISTURB**
Whether you need focus time during the working day or a better way to disconnect when you‚Äôre off, Do Not Disturb is the answer you seek. The new crescent icon next to your name will inform your colleagues about your status, while the muted chat and notification icons (which become gray instead of red) help you stay focused while you're in focus mode. 
 
**CHECK THE STATUS OF BULK TASKS**
Track the progress of your bulk tasks via the Imports/Exports tab within the People page of the Admin Panel, with real-time information that empowers you to take action on any potential issues. System admins can view all of the bulk-task requests from the past 30 days in one place, with files available for download within a 4-day period.
 
**MORE INFO**
Go to the [Help Center](https://www.workplace.com/help/work) to learn more about Workplace. And check out the following articles for feature-specific instructions: [important posts](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/252991161966313), [Q&A](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/539610090311471), [Learning Setup](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/550972028799141), [Learning Quizzes and Insights](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/522484605366330), [Do Not Disturb](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/2151769891708621), [bulk-data management](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/1858663031075098).  
 
Or stop by the [Customer Resource Center](https://www.workplace.com/resources/) to pick up the latest tips for topics like making the most of [peer-to-peer learning](https://www.workplace.com/workplace/resources/ways-to-work/frontline/peer-learning).

The monthly roundup of new feature releases is live on the Customer Resource Center. This month, we're making remote working during COVID-19 easier and safer. Some highlights of April 2020 include:

[**Free Covid-19 bot by Huminos:](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/news-updates/april-2020) **Workplace is offering a free bot to help customers share important COVID-19 updates and gather information from employees during this critical time.

And visit the [Workplace Customer Resource Center](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources) for user guides, best practices, learning videos and more!

# 5 top tips for maintaining morale 

 üèÜ**Challenges** - Why not set challenges that will not only encourage engagement but also get people completing tasks that can generate positivity. For example, asking people to give a shout out to someone that's helped them tranistion to new ways of working or encouraging people to complete a meditation session.

üéñ**Recognition** -  Encourage managers to make full use of the recognition features available on the platform.

üåü**Leadership comms** - Whether it's regular updates on how the business is adapting to COVID-19 restrictions or sharing messages of positivity, now more than ever,  top down communications are  important for bringing entire organisations together.

üë´üë´**Groups** - Groups can provide welcome respite from isolation and help maintain a community feel during this time. We've seen some groups specific to working from home hacks, top tips for fighting boredom and useful resources for mindfulness.

üìà**Surveys** - Use surveys to take a daily pulse on the senitment of teams, groups or the whole organisation. This could help you identify potential issues with morale, productivity or IT and enable you to act quickly to rectify them.

## What are your top tips? Share with us below!

# **Coming Soon | Knowledge Library and more...**

Equipping your people with the latest information is especially crucial in these times of uncertainty and change. To complement the regular updates that you‚Äôre already communicating, we‚Äôre introducing **Knowledge Library**. This is a new section of Workplace where admins can curate the latest information for important topics like working-from-home and travel policies, with static pages that people can easily re-discover and share.

We‚Äôre also making it easier to get updates out quickly by enabling group admins to populate new groups via **auto membership**. And we will be introducing a **free COVID-19 Bot**, powered by a 3rd party partner, to support multi-channel distribution within Workplace and collect employee inputs via chat.

All three of these updates will be made **generally available by the end of April**. To find out whether a specific feature has been enabled for your Workplace, please check [What‚Äôs New](https://work.workplace.com/work/admin/whats_new/) within the Admin Panel.

**KNOWLEDGE LIBRARY**

Knowledge Library is a hub for employees to find and engage with useful company content, such as the employee handbook, benefits policy and technical documents. It is fully searchable and shareable to help people find what they need more easily. Knowledge Library seamlessly integrates with the rest of Workplace bringing together top-down information with the collective knowledge of your work community. Knowledge Library is available on the web and on mobile apps.

System admins, content moderators and custom-admin roles with the ‚ÄúCreate and edit Knowledge Library Categories‚Äù can create categories and sub-categories of content. These categories and sub-categories can be edited by the creator in drafts before you publish. Once categories and sub-categories are published, they are visible to the selected audience. (Assign access to a resource category based on group membership or profile field information like location, department or job title.) When people are added to categories, they will be informed with a notification.

**AUTO MEMBERSHIP FOR GROUPS**

Auto membership provides group admins with an easy way to add members to their groups, based on people‚Äôs profile fields. Instead of adding people one by one, set up the rules for the profile fields you want auto membership to follow.

Note: Members will not be removed from a group when they no longer meet the Auto Membership rules‚Äô requirements.

**FREE COVID-19 BOT, POWERED BY HUMINOS, A 3RD PARTY BOT PLATFORM**

The COVID-19 Bot, powered by Huminos, helps you share important updates and gather information from employees during this critical time. Raise awareness of COVID-related news through Workplace Chat and groups, send health check surveys and measure understanding with quizzes to limit misinformation.

This bot is free for all Workplace customers and admins can add the bot via the [Integrations Directory](https://www.workplace.com/workplace/integration?app_id=2607489299572488).

**MORE INFO**

Go to the Help Center to learn more about [Knowledge Library](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/252991161966313), [auto membership for groups](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/3071989656166518) and [how to setup third-party integrations on Workplace](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/166279977397367). And stay tuned for additional assets later this month!

# Streamlining the creation and visibility of critical communication

During this period when the creation, publication and visibility of critical communication is more important than ever, our team has been working on solutions that will address each of these needs. 

To this end, we announce the following:

**Draft For** is a new feature which empowers executives and Comms teams to create and publish richer executive communication together. Comms teams are now able to draft and format posts for time-poor executives, who can then swiftly review, approve and publish them. 

**Download our [two-pager](https://brandfolder.com/s/q7t9vk-5b6lx4-8y2jed) and our [animated video](https://brandfolder.com/s/q7ta4m-cs4wf4-3spf9m) for Draft For and get started!!**

**"Post Order"** is a new Group Setting which enables group admins to set the default ordering of posts in a group to be chronological. This flexibility will help to ensure that employees are informed with the most up to date information in important groups.

**Priority Notifications & Prioritized Groups** are designed to help all users surface the information that‚Äôs most relevant to them. We are adding the ability to mark a group as ‚Äúprioritized‚Äù, which means content from this group will appear at the top of News Feed. We‚Äôre also adding a notifications section called ‚Äúpriority‚Äù, which will include notifications for: tags, replies, mentions, Safety Check alerts and posts marked as important by company admins.

Further details on the functionality and availability timelines of each of these new capabilities below.  

The Workplace Team 

--------------------------------------------------------

## Draft For

**How does it work?**

In the Permissions Tab within the Admin Panel, System admins and Content moderators can assign individuals the permission to draft posts for certain executives. Once that permission has been granted, a designated drafter will be able draft and send a fully-formatted post to an executive, ready to be published. This means no additional formatting, copying or pasting will be necessary on the part of the executive (although they can make changes before posting if they so wish). This translates into less time wasted and a lower chance of errors during a time where timely company-wide communication is a high priority. 

**When will Draft For be available? **

We know many Workplace organizations have been asking for this feature, so we will ensure that all customers on the Advanced and Enterprise plans have access to it on desktop by Friday, 27th March. Mobile functionality will be coming in mid-April. 

**Resources** 
Download our [two-pager](https://brandfolder.com/s/q7t9vk-5b6lx4-8y2jed) and our [animated video](https://brandfolder.com/s/q7ta4m-cs4wf4-3spf9m) for Draft For. 

Find Help Centre articles [here](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/185168959434399?helpref=typeahead_suggestions&sr=1&query=draft+author&rdrhc), [here](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/199968437741288?helpref=typeahead_suggestions&sr=1&query=draft&rdrhc) and [here](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/605667650271174?helpref=typeahead_suggestions&sr=1&query=how+do+i+draft+a+po&rdrhc).

## "Post Order"

**How does it work?**

We know that Workplace plays an important role in keeping your employees informed and connected during times of uncertainty. ‚ÄúPost Order‚Äù in Group Settings allows group admins to set the default ordering of posts in a group. Select between ‚ÄúNew activity‚Äù to order them chronologically in the Group‚Äôs feed for everyone in the group. More details in [this post](https://fb.workplace.com/groups/WorkplaceVIPs/permalink/1890503714415563/).

**When will ‚ÄúPost Order‚Äù be available?**

All group admins will have access this new setting by 27th March. 

## Priority Notifications 

**How does it work?**

The priority notifications section will include notifications for: tags, replies, mentions, Safety Check alerts and posts marked as important by company admins. If you‚Äôre a group admin, you‚Äôll also see post approval requests and membership approval requests for your groups. All other notifications will appear in the section called ‚ÄúMore‚Äù. More details in [this post](https://fb.workplace.com/groups/WorkplaceVIPs/permalink/1890417564424178/). 

## Priority Groups

**How does it work?**

Prioritized groups help Workplace users prioritize important information in News Feed. Once a group is prioritized, the user will see content from the group at the top of their News Feed and the group will appear at the top of their groups list. Prioritized groups is built to help individual users prioritize information in their own News Feed. Marking a group as priority only changes this setting for you and not anyone else on Workplace. If an admin marks a post as important, the post will still appear at the top of News Feed. More details in [this post.](https://fb.workplace.com/groups/WorkplaceVIPs/permalink/1890417564424178/)

**When will Priority Notifications & Prioritized Groups be available?**

All users on Workplace will have access to priority notifications and prioritized groups and by 31st March.

# Keep everyone up to date by displaying group content chronologically

We know that Workplace plays an important role in keeping your employees informed and connected during times of uncertainty. We heard from you that it's important to be able to present group information in chronological order to ensure everyone gets the most up to date posts first. 

We‚Äôve added a new ‚ÄúPost Order‚Äù setting in Group Settings. This allows group admins to set the default ordering of posts in a group. Select between ‚ÄúNew activity‚Äù and ‚ÄúRecent posts‚Äù for everyone digesting information in the group. 

_*Every community now has access to this feature.*_

## How does it work 

To change the default sort order of content in a group, go to the ‚ÄúPost Order‚Äù setting in the Group Settings menu. Here, group admins will be able to set the default order of content and posts by selecting between ‚ÄúNew activity‚Äù (posts that have recent comments and replies) or ‚ÄúRecent posts‚Äù (posts that were posted most recently).
