message:
**An update on Prioritized Groups and Priority Notifications**

Hello all, over the past few weeks we‚Äôve continued to make improvements to prioritized groups and priority notifications and we‚Äôre now ready to **roll these features out to everyone on March 31st**. 

Everyone can now prioritize as many groups as they like instead of only 6, so they can prioritize both important project groups and company announcement groups.  

To help everyone stay on top of their workload we've focused priority notifications on important notifications you need to action. Priority notifications will include notifications for: tags, replies, mentions, Safety Check alerts and posts marked as important by company admins. Group admins will also see post approval requests and membership approval requests for their groups. All other notifications will appear in the section called ‚ÄúMore‚Äù, including general activity in priority groups which is already prioritized in News feed. 

Below is an updated overview of what we‚Äôre launching on March 31st. 

 
**Stay on top of important information with prioritized groups and priority notifications**
 
Everyone is using Workplace more than ever to stay on top of company news and collaborate with colleagues. It‚Äôs important they can choose what‚Äôs most important to them and stay in control of their workload, so we‚Äôre introducing two new features to help them - prioritized groups and priority notifications. 
 
**What are prioritized groups? **
To help you stay to up to date with information from specific groups, we‚Äôre adding the ability to mark a group as prioritized. When a group is prioritized, content from the group will appear first in News Feed and the group will appear at the top of your groups list so you can easily find it, helping you stay on top of what you need to know. 
 
For example, if you‚Äôre working on an important project or want to stay on top of company announcements, you can prioritize the group to make sure you don‚Äôt miss an update. 
 
**What are priority notifications? **
To help you stay on top of important notifications you need to action, we‚Äôre adding a notifications section called ‚Äúpriority‚Äù. The priority notifications section will include notifications for: tags, replies, mentions, Safety Check alerts and posts marked as important by company admins. If you‚Äôre a group admin, you‚Äôll also see post approval requests and membership approval requests for your groups. All other notifications will appear in the section called ‚ÄúMore‚Äù. 
 
**When will prioritized groups and priority notifications be available? **
From March 31st all users on Workplace will have access to prioritized groups and priority notifications. 

If anyone wants to switch off priority notifications, there is an option in the notifications tab. 
 
 **Where can I find out more? 
** 
**Here are frequently asked questions:**
 What is a prioritized group?
   * Prioritized groups help Workplace users prioritize important information in News Feed. Once a group is prioritized, the user will see content from the group at the top of their News Feed and the group will appear at the top of their groups list.

**What happens when I prioritize a group?**
 When a group is prioritized, this is what will happen:
      * New content from the prioritized groups will appear at the top of your News Feed.
      * The group will appear at the top of the groups list in a ‚Äúprioritized groups‚Äù section
      * If an admin marks a post as important, the post will still appear at the top of News Feed.

**What are priority notifications?**
   * Priority notifications are a section of notifications, which include: tags, replies, mentions, Safety Check alerts and posts marked as important by company admins. If you‚Äôre a group admin, you‚Äôll also see post approval requests and membership approval requests for your groups. Other notifications will appear in the ‚Äòmore‚Äô section of notifications.

**Can prioritized groups be defined and set by an organisation for their employees?**
   * Workplace admins can use important posts and official groups to share important information with employees. Prioritized groups is a tool for individual users to help them prioritise information that is important to them. Prioritized groups cannot be determined by an organisation for their employees.

**How are prioritized groups different from official groups?**
   * Admins can mark groups as official to help people identify which groups have official company news and announcements. Individual users can prioritized groups to help them easily find information that is important to them.

**If I prioritize a group, does this prioritize the group for other people on Workplace too?**
   * Prioritized groups is built to help individual users prioritize information in their own News Feed. Marking a group as priority only changes this setting for you and not anyone else on Workplace.

**How do I prioritize a group for all group members?**
   * Prioritized groups is a tool for individual users to help them prioritise information that is important to them in their News Feed. Prioritizing a group only changes this setting for you and not anyone else on Workplace. It is not possible to prioritize a group for all group members.

**What does the ‚Äòmore‚Äô section of notifications include?**
   * The ‚Äòmore‚Äô section of notifications includes all notifications read and unread as it was before.

**How do I turn off prioritized groups?**
   * If no groups are prioritized, content from your groups will appear in News feed as it usually does.

**How do I turn off prioritized notifications?**
   * If users want to switch off priority notifications, there is an option in the notifications tab.

**What is the difference between ‚ÄúPrioritized Groups‚Äù and ‚ÄúPinned Groups‚Äù? How do notifications from both these groups differ?**
   * Pinning a group makes it easier to find by bookmarking it. Content from pinned groups is not prioritized in News Feed.

# [The Remote Working Resource Hub is live](https://www.workplace.com/workplace/remote-working-resource-hub)

Today, virtually all of us are adjusting to a new remote working reality - juggling jobs, caregiving and keeping healthy while trying to stay connected with friends, colleagues and loved ones.

In response to this new reality of remote working, we have built a Remote Working Resource Hub to centralize remote working best practices. Here you‚Äôll find articles, guides and e-books to help you stay informed and connected, wherever you‚Äôre currently working.

Thank you for being a part of the Workplace community,

The Workplace Team

# Aware Cares: Free Use of Spotlight
As we face months of uncertainty surrounding the coronavirus, one thing is for sure: we‚Äôre all in this together. We care about the morale and mental health of your unexpectedly isolated employees, and we want to help the best way we know how ‚ù§Ô∏è

**This is why we are offering our insights and analytics product, Aware Spotlight, for free through May.**

*Use Spotlight to:*
- Track COVID-19 conversations in a ‚Äògoogle trends‚Äô type report (with sentiment)
- Understand anxiety levels in your organization over time
- Identify pockets of the organization that might be struggling, so you can provide appropriate support
- Gauge if your crisis communications are resonating with employees
- Track the volume of activity within Workplace over time, down to the group level

Happy to answer any questions you may have ‚ù§Ô∏è If you'd like to participate, simply sign up on this page.

# Unlock the value of Badges with our new API

Badges provide a way to recognize employees for their roles and achievements, directly on their profile pages. Since we released badges in August 2019, we have released custom badges, which provide a more flexible means of reinforcing unique company values. 

Now, with our new read and write APIs, you can further unlock the value of Badges with 3rd party platforms integrations or custom integrations. Now you can export Badges awarded within Workplace to Recognition systems, HR systems or LMS; award Badges which have been recorded in other platforms or pull Badges data via the API to build reports. 

**How do I get started?
**API documentation [here](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/workplace/reference/graph-api/member#badges). A link to this documentation will also feature in a What's New article that will be visible to you in Workplace on Monday!

# [#TechThursday] 3 unsung heroes amongst our Workplace resources

[On Tuesday](https://fb.workplace.com/groups/WorkplaceVIPs/permalink/1875212385944696/) we asked how familiar you were with some of our resources, and it appeared than some of them were more used by this community than others, so we decided to highlight 3 of our unsung heroes so you can get the help you need anytime üôå.
## Direct Support 

Direct Support can be accessed from your Admin Panel and allows admins get visibility on all support requests created by admins in the company, without needing to go outside of Workplace to get assistance.
* Click **Admin Panel** and **Contact Support** will appear to the left.
## [Help Community](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/community/)

The Help Community is a great place where you can find the answer to most of the frequently asked questions about Workplace, and more.
## [Technical Resources](https://www.workplace.com/workplace/resources/tech)

# [**Why Building a Culture of Recognition Matters [SHRM WEBCAST]**](https://l.workplace.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.shrm.org%2Flearningandcareer%2Flearning%2Fwebcasts%2Fpages%2F0320chowdhri.aspx&h=AT3PhrG9yBr3e7tF_eUqRjD4-uFG7PAMW7KzRDRSIZyTm0FkQmrFE1XeDCHYZKDTcOI4G5WoMEa0z5Bf6P-eo8swdHzegQ1xqIBs80Amk9H3-Frj-r-96wTRRF2dVUbT9MTP4qeDFfUPJUJKIMmykA)

According to a recent Gallup State of the Global Workplace report, 85% of the global workforce is currently disengaged in their work. Being unhappy impacts any organization‚Äôs productivity. So how can employee recognition make a difference and what are the new approaches to making people feel valued at work?

Join me on [**Wednesday, March 18th,](https://www.shrm.org/learningandcareer/learning/webcasts/pages/0320chowdhri.aspx) for a webcast **I am hosting in **partnership with SHRM** to discuss how you can:
* Build an **effective recognition program** for everyone in your organization
* **Make appreciation easy** - not just from top-down, but from peer to peer with your frontline employees
* **Coach senior leaders **to recognize and engage with employees directly

If you get it right, employee engagement and company culture becomes stronger than ever before.

[**SECURE YOUR SPOT BY REGISTERING HERE.**](https://www.shrm.org/learningandcareer/learning/webcasts/pages/0320chowdhri.aspx)

# **A feature to share or delegate control to a post **(to make edits)

The biggest caveat of Workplace right now for us is that admins cannot request to edit other employees posts. 

Don‚Äôt get me wrong, I am not asking for a**` <({God Mode })> `** for admins to do whatever they please with users posts and content. I am merely asking for a feature that allows users authors to give up or delegate control of a post to enable a collegue to create posts or make edits already published posts.

Often times, employees post something which need to be revised/edited but they do not know how (e.g. replacing av video to a video post). Or when leaders want us admins to post something in their name. Instead of having to spend 30 minutes to teach them, it would be awesome to just have them press a button and share edit rights to that post with an admin. 

**Is it only us, or is this something others have felt the need for?**

**GUIDE: How businesses can respond to the coronavirus using Workplace**

The recent outbreak of the coronavirus has impacted businesses all over the world. Maintaining open lines of communication with employees is even more important during such periods of uncertainty. 

To help you, we‚Äôve put together [this guide](https://assets.brandfolder.com/q6kn3z-b04v7c-2jn89c/v/11393242/original/How-businesses-can-respond-to-the-coronavirus-using-Workplace.pdf) so you can stay connected to your employees during this challenging time and keep your business moving. In this guide, you‚Äôll also find practical use cases of how other companies are using Workplace which we hope you find helpful.

[https://assets.brandfolder.com/q6kn3z-b04v7c-2jn89c/v/11393242/original/How-businesses-can-respond-to-the-coronavirus-using-Workplace.pdf](https://assets.brandfolder.com/q6kn3z-b04v7c-2jn89c/v/11393242/original/How-businesses-can-respond-to-the-coronavirus-using-Workplace.pdf)

Can you believe it‚Äôs March already? üòÆ We can‚Äôt! As the first quarter continues, we wanted to deep dive on a few other ideas that we shared in our new year‚Äôs campaign, and **recognize  the amazing work we saw from you** around the holidays and at the start of the year!

üåü**Thank you to Lookers, Telefonica, NatWest Group** **(newly renamed parent company for RBS) and our own Facebook** communications team for sharing how you engaged your teams.

Once again, all of the ideas can be found in [this PDF](https://assets.brandfolder.com/q4hape-c39zlk-g5pazo/v/8844325/original/Workplace-New-Start-Campaign-Ideas.pdf), and can be adapted for any fresh start in your organization! **Now let‚Äôs keep the sharing going **in the comments. üëá

**Workplace Best practices, from Workplace Customers, wrt Covid-19**

With the outbreak of Covid-19, everyone is focused on making sure people around the globe stay safe and healthy.  

Our customer success team has compiled a list of key [**Workplace from Facebook](https://www.linkedin.com/company/workplacefromfacebook/) **best practices we‚Äôre learning from our customers, such as** [World Health Organization](https://www.linkedin.com/company/world-health-organization/),** [**SunLife](https://www.linkedin.com/company/sun-life-financial/) **and [**Scoot](https://www.linkedin.com/company/scoot/) **(and from our own internal comms team at [Facebook](https://www.linkedin.com/company/facebook/)), to make sure ALL employees can be informed, safe and productive, **wherever they have to work from**.

We've seen many interesting best practices from these customers, in the last few weeks (creating a group about this topic, using Bot, Live Video or Mark As Important to make sure the information is distributed) and we wanted to aggregate and share all of these in a simple guide. 

Let us know what you think, and don't hesitate to share below YOUR best practices.

# [Coming soon] Increase your video reach with Video Captioning 2.0 

We‚Äôre making a couple of enhancements on the Automatic Video Captioning feature to make accessing and sharing video content easier. In this release, you‚Äôll be able to add generate closed captioning to Live videos directly AFTER streaming has ended. In addition, you can now download transcripts of both uploaded and Live videos in txt. file without times stamps for simpler sharing and editing.
## HOW DOES IT WORK?

**To generate closed captioning for Live videos after streaming: **

After your Live streaming ended, navigate to your Live video post, and click on the three-dots menu on upper right corner. Select ‚ÄúEdit‚Äù. You can then follow the same process of adding captioning to uploaded video by clicking ‚Äúcc‚Äù button.

 

**To download video captions as transcripts:**

Navigate to your post and click on your video to enlarge it. Click on the three-dots menu on upper right corner, and select ‚ÄúDownload Transcript‚Äù.
## WHEN IS IT LAUNCHING?

Both features are scheduled to launch to 100% globally on March 5th, 2020.
## FAQ
* Can I add captioning to Live video during live streaming?
   * At the moment, you'll need to complete Live streaming before adding automatic captioning.
* Which languages does video captioning support?
   * We currently support 13 languages: English, Spanish, Portuguese, French, Arabic, Vietnamese, Italian, German, Turkish, Russian, Thai, Urdu, Malaysian.
* Can I download transcript for Live videos?
   * Yes, after live streaming finishes, you can add captioning and download transcript following the same process as for uploaded videos.
* Can I edit captioning with .txt files?
   * No, you‚Äôll need to download and edit captions in .srt file.
## WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE?For more information, 

For more information, visit Workplace [Help Center](https://www.internmc.facebook.com/help/work/1505051832842006).

# Coronavirus Communication Best Practice 

Hi everyone,

I wanted to share how Facebook is recommending Communication Leaders within the business to handle Coronavirus comms.
## how to handle coronavirus by facebook's comms team
1. **Repetition and frequent updates are necessary: **even if you don't have any updates to share on new guidance or updates, it's important to share that with the employees regularly enough (recommended on a daily basis).  
1. **Follow recommended guidelines** from country's affected and form a committee (with Legal, HR, Internal Comms & Site Leads) to evaluate future actions in case the situation gets worse 
1. **It's important to have one source of truth in a global open group** and then for different leads and line managers to re-share that within the groups. Create a well established cascaded plan so line managers can easily follow directions
## sample comms received this week for managers

*Dear Managers,*

*Myself and the HRBP team are fielding a number of queries from our employees unsure on whether they need to WFH or not so I wanted to share some guidance.*

*If you haven‚Äôt already please review the guidance in LEADERNAME's post (LINK TO POST) and pls work with anyone from your team who traveled to Italy (on business or PTO in the last 14 days) to WFH and self-isolate and/or cancel business travel as needed.*

*I also wanted to let you know that a common theme we are hearing is related to anxiety/stress in offices when people are returning from affected areas and we wanted to provide some guidance. Where employees in the office are concerned/anxious about another employee returning from an affected area, the guidance we are sharing is that there is no requirement for anyone else in the team to WFH, though of course you do have flexibility as people managers to support people who are very concerned. Its important to note that we are also still in flu season so there will generally be a number of people in the office who are unwell, and we don‚Äôt want certain groups feeling ostracized or worse, discriminated against.*

*As per usual with all employees that are unwell, we should be encouraging them to stay at home and to take sick leave/see a doctor where appropriate until they are feeling better. At this stage, we are not mandating anyone to be tested for COVID-19 before returning to the office and its unlikely that we would do this unless a government regulation requires.*

*Here is a general FAQ (LINK TO HR OPEN GROUP) on people being concerned about coming into the office ‚Äì in addition also sharing the EAP (LINK TO EMPLOYEE ASSISTANT PROGRAM) should anyone in your team need support from a stress/anxiety perspective. *

***Q) I am concerned to go into an office as I am worried there may be people who are sick, what do I do?***

***A) **Please note the conservative approach we have taken as a company is above and beyond the World Health Organization guidance. In addition, there are facemasks available in Facebook lobbies, and we encourage you to use one if you are not feeling well. We have also worked with our facilities teams and cleaning staff to increase cleaning at workstations and in common areas. For any other concerns, please speak with your manager or myself.*

*Any queries please let me know*

*Kind regards,
HRBP*

# Tapping into the power of immersive training

With the rise of the use of VR and AR in the workplace, and training being a key üîë application to this new technology, I thought it may be helpful to highlight a recent post from Laura Cahill which shared some insights üë©‚Äçüè´ from a recent **Booz Allen Hamilton** report on immersive training üßê.  The report, that you can download through the link below üëá, is a very meaty piece, but here are some great takeaways:
* Unlike conventional training, it can engage the four learning systems of the brain: experiential, cognitive, behavioural, and emotional through "*combining a rich set of contextual cues that draw learners in, leading to fast initial learning and strong long-term retention.*"
* The opportunities are endless - from workplace safety to skills training. VR and AR's ability to allow you to conduct a simulation of a scenario in a virtual environment enables more advanced and comprehensive training than ever before.
* If you are looking to implement it you must
   * have a clear use case,
   * asses the potential to scale,
   * prioritise benefits
   * and plan for where to go next.

# **Never miss an update with What‚Äôs New**

Innovation is the name of the game at Workplace. To help you stay informed about updates to your Workplace, we‚Äôre introducing a What‚Äôs New page to all customers this quarter‚Äîwith our initial release beginning on February 26.

Within the Admin Panel, you‚Äôll be able to discover new features that are coming soon, track their availability for your Workplace and share relevant updates within your community to drive adoption.

**HOW DOES IT WORK?**

The What‚Äôs New section of the Admin Panel is accessible to all [default admin roles](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/1790034724567049), along with [custom admin roles](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/396188054275905) containing the ‚ÄúSee the What‚Äôs New admin page‚Äù permission.

On the page itself, you‚Äôll see a list of updates that are either Upcoming or Available Now for your Workplace. Easily distribute the information about an update using the Share button. And continue visiting multi-company groups like this one to discuss the latest updates with your peers from other organizations.

**WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE?**

For more information, please consult our [Help Center](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/648647269225981), reach out to Support or contact your Workplace team.

# **Drill into the data with brand new Insights**

Insights is now available to all Workplace customers on the Advanced and Enterprise plans. It‚Äôs a new reporting experience that provides richer ways of tracking, measuring and understanding the impact of Workplace usage.

Drill into the data and explore new ways to connect your organization. You‚Äôll see some familiar stats along with a lot of new information‚Äîlike average % of a post read, sentiment analysis for comments on posts and more. We‚Äôve also introduced filters based on profile fields, so you can benchmark performance across different parts of the organization. And with custom-date ranges, comparing trends over time has never been easier!
## **HOW DOES IT WORK?**

You can find Insights in the Admin Panel. This means only your system admins, content moderators, account managers, analysts, and any custom-admin roles with the ‚ÄòSee activity statistics‚Äô permission can access it.

It contains five tabs: People, Content, Groups, Posts and Connections.
* People > Track how active your population is on Workplace, throughout the launch, onboarding and adoption journey
* Content > Keep an eye on how much content your organization is producing and how many people are actively contributing
* Groups > Stay on top of group creation and activity, across Workplace and in your most active groups
* Posts > Measure the impact of your communications with advanced post-level performance data
* Connections > Identify where collaboration is happening on Workplace, based on the interactions between people.

[Download the demo video](https://l.workplace.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fbrandfolder.com%2Fworkplace%2Fattachments%2Fq5weum-3nwr8w-2h8nlr%3Fdl%3Dtrue%26manifest_digest%3Dq5wf0o-f5moko-910ast%26resource_key%3Dp0ag4k-8smca0-nj7to%26resource_type%3DCollection&h=AT3KjFHy7iigYGFhVggn8XaVqimvBUKkoHYD_ywtzxwIZI946oTw0qgxOuNhpPEzysHZ-btxVDKXKqheE7SOg9aa3FhjhBC5O3YHG6Lcf4fa60qMkgQUKZgjkuG-Etb5nuetdH2X8YOXYFvCb-WERiQOlBBQSyJ550_DqLGTefgeE2qzLbkSKA).
## **WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE?**

For more inspiration, check out our [guide for admins](https://assets.brandfolder.com/q5weum-3nwr8w-9tzqap/v/10392810/original/Workplace%20Insights%20Admin%202%20pager.pdf). And if you have questions, please consult the [Help Center](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/743805009460399), visit the [Help Community](https://workplace.com/help/work/community/) or reach out to Support.

# Welcome to the Workplace Admins Group

The Workplace team is excited to connect you with other Admins on Workplace.

This is your community so while the Workplace team is here to facilitate conversations, we want this to be your place to connect with one another, ask questions, share events, best practices and Workplace success stories.

**This is not a support group** and we will not manage support responses.

# Hello, 

So we created an integration between Workplace and our main software which contains every account in the system. The idea of the integration is that once an account is created in the main system a robot creates account in Workplace. So when an employee leaves it's the same. We deactivate his account in the main system and the robot (integration) deactivates it in Workplace. 

**The integration doesn't delete accounts of former employees because we want to keep their information**. 

The problem is that at some point there are repetitive emails.   

*For example: my name is Dayana Dimitrova, so my email is dayana@econt.com. After a time if I am no longer employee in Econt there will be another Dayana. Our system will create her the same email - dayana@econt.com. But the robot won't be able to create an account in Workplace because mine still exists. *  

So my question is do we happen to have a solution, how can we keep our deactivated accounts and still create new even with dublicated emails? How do you create and deactivate accounts in your communities?

# Hosting Meetings

When you have employees üë´ all around the country  - or the world üåç - holding meetings can be challenging ü§î.

A lot of important information are shared during meetings üìÖ, and being able to keep all these notes üóí together can useful for people üë´ who may not have been able to attend, or to share with the wider organisation üì¢!

With Workplace, you can create a document in your group that you'll use to take notes üñä. You can even add a cover photo and select "Allow group members to edit this document" to invite others to share anything that you might have missed üí™.
## [Read all the other ways to host meeting in Workplace in this CRC article](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/ways-to-work/collaboration/hosting-meetings?ref=AVvOzrqrNv5eqe_Wo73ztqp-JZx43Zt69M47IucaZHrVrFgdPOD7CIbodgPvainF6WQVuNcxTfGqocBWtSOB1tPMat2fTaUwWlmSaP9CIVt602ah818MCrHyMgYMhKFu80zXl01O2oQdivSfC97gdlqNJSO497lB6rqQzzknIENrjfIdmfPA1KIqjr-MKdwGZdINuvopCzGSFlqHF2IPkT66aORpndrhgT1BbWGB0M49GoXd1sGNUIs8StpZFbTXFT0btiIZ5HVe1xwsnNILArjz) üëá.

We grouped these tips under three different category:
* People
* Content
* Posts

# [#TechThursday] Improved PNG Viewing

In H1 of 2019 we received feedback that some types of images posted on Workplace had poor quality, specifically screenshots uploaded as PNGs. 

We have now updated the way we store PNGs so that they render better on Workplace.
## HOW DOES IT WORK?
* Any PNG which is uploaded from desktop www (from composer, comment composer or the Notes editor) are now being stored as PNG.
* In most cases when viewing these images on desktop www they will also be displayed as PNG (with the exception being images in comments where you have to click trough to the full screen viewer).

We hope this improvement will help you get the most of your posts when adding visuals üôå

# Come back to it later with Reminders

> Update April 27: We have decided to roll back this feature in order to minimize disruption in user experience during the COVID-19 period. You can still set a reminder on posts by clicking on the "..." icon to the right of the post you would like to be reminded of. We apologize for the inconvenience and thank you very much for your understanding!

When you‚Äôre in and out of meetings, or traveling on the road, it‚Äôs hard to read or respond to Workplace posts right when you see them. With Reminders, you no longer have to stop what you‚Äôre doing, but instead can remind your future self to come back to it at a convenient time.

It is now easier for you set a Reminder than ever. Reminders has always been available, but it was housed under the section hidden under the three dots to the right of a post. We‚Äôre now moving it to the center of the post interface, replacing the existing ‚ÄúComment‚Äù button. We are also introducing a new Reminders tab in the Notifications section, where you will be able to view and manage all your future reminders.

*We will initiate the rollout of this feature on **February 5**, and all Workplace communities will have access to it by the beginning of March.* 

## HOW DOES IT WORK?

To set a reminder, click on the Reminder button on the post you would like to be reminded of. Then, choose a time you would like the reminder to be triggered - the default options we give you are 9 am the next day, and in an hour, but you can set it for any custom time that is convenient for you.
When a reminder is due, you will receive a Priority notification, so you‚Äôll never miss it.

To view or manage your future reminders, visit the new Notifications tab called ‚ÄúReminders‚Äù.

## üéâCelebrate 2020 on Workplaceüéâ

Happy New Year Workplace Team! I‚Äôm Leah, a CSM on the Workplace Team based out of NYC. As you‚Äôre ringing in the new year, **Workplace can be an amazing tool to galvanize your teams and help them achieve their goals in 2020.**

I sat down with [Andrew Garney](https://fb.workplace.com/profile.php?id=100013971767416&fref=gs&__tn__=%2CdK-R-R&eid=ARBsXSRwOuyZYvNIaan0l85r8-KjRUT9PUiTpaGVbwf8TakpE_IIO03z4O-Q8NzuLAdD5o54WJalGU8s&dti=140547529754847&hc_location=group) to chat about ideas and campaigns we‚Äôve seen customers use to engage their teams and reinvigorate their communities after the holidays. **Now we want to hear what‚Äôs working for you.**
1. Take a look at the [Campaign Ideas PDF](https://assets.brandfolder.com/q4hape-c39zlk-g5pazo/v/8844325/original/Workplace-New-Start-Campaign-Ideas.pdf) and choose your favorite idea.
1. Implement in your organization.
1. Comment below with what you did. Include pictures, videos or screenshots.
1. Watch the üëç and ‚ù§Ô∏è roll in!

**We‚Äôll have some great prizes for the best New Year campaigns. **And stay tuned, we‚Äôll be back next week to share more ideas and highlight successes! Good luck!

# [#TipsTuesday] Prioritized groups and priority notifications are coming üôå

Starting today, we're rolling out two new tools to help everyone on Workplace stay up to date with information that is important to them üí™.

‚ùóÔ∏è***We expect the roll-out to take until the end of February. During the roll-out, some people may get priority notifications before they get prioritized groups.***‚ùó

We‚Äôve heard sometimes people on Workplace feel overwhelmed when News Feed and notifications are a mix of project, announcement and social content. People have told us they would like features to help them track important updates.
## WHAT ARE PRIORITIZED GROUPS?

To help you stay to up to date with information from specific groups, we‚Äôre adding a feature called ‚Äúprioritized groups‚Äù. 

With prioritized groups, you can choose to mark six groups you are a member of as prioritized groups. When a group is prioritized, content from the group will appear first in News Feed and in priority notifications, helping you stay on top of what you need to know.

For example, if you are working on an important project, you could prioritize the group to make sure you don‚Äôt miss an update.
## WHAT ARE PRIORITY NOTIFICATIONS?

To help people stay on top of important notifications, we‚Äôre adding a notifications section called ‚Äúpriority‚Äù. 

The priority notifications section will include notifications for: tags, replies, mentions, posts from prioritized groups, Safety Check alerts and posts marked as important. 

All other notifications will appear in the section called ‚ÄúMore‚Äù.
## [For more information on this launch, check out this post on the Workplace From Facebook Product Announcements MCG](https://fb.workplace.com/groups/WPProductAnnouncements/permalink/865378110548863/) ;).

# [#TechThursday] Run test events in Safety Check

Since Tuesday January 14, we've added the ability to create and run test Safety Check events so safety operators can trial Safety Check functionality without causing alarm. 

This new addition allows safety operators and Safety Check recipients to make a clear distinction between tests, drills and real crisis events.
## How can I do it?

To create a test Safety Check event, go to the Safety Check tab and click "+ Create Crisis Event". 

From here, you will be able to choose if you‚Äôd like to run a test, drill or real crisis event. 
## Visit the [Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/2256383427974038/) to learn more about creating a Safety Check.

# **See people‚Äôs teams and projects with Work Teams **

With collaboration on the rise, teams need a shared space where they can highlight what they‚Äôre working on, who they‚Äôre partnering with, where discussions are happening as well as key resources. 

Work Teams was originally released to some customers in July 2019. Based on customer feedback, we‚Äôve added the following functionality.
* A resources section for handy links.
* The ability to promote members to be Points of Contact.
* The inclusion of work teams in search results.

The new and improved Work Teams will be available to all customers by the end of the month, with our initial release beginning on January 15.

**HOW DOES IT WORK?**
A work team is a static page that includes a description, along with a list of resources, members and associated groups. 

Find and join work teams by searching people‚Äôs profiles or the Directory. Note: Any work team that you‚Äôre a member of will be visible on your Profile page.

**WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE?**
For more information, please consult our [Help Center article](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/324899035109638), reach out to Support or contact your Workplace team.

This year, we've made several improvements to Workplace and next year will see us continue to bring you the innovation your companies are looking for üí™

From all our teams at Workplace: **THANK YOU** for being on this journey with us!

We wish you a fantastic New Year and all the very best for 2020 ü•≥

# [#TipsTuesday] Amplifying company culture üîä

There are many ways to use Workplace to amplify your company's culture, many of those ways are quite unique to your company because they reflect how you promote a feeling of community internally and how you celebrate the individuals who make up the culture.

But did you know there are a few ways that can be used across different types of companies? üòÅ

# 120 AI Predictions For 2020

Here is what Christine had to say on the subject:
> *AI will be integrated seamlessly and gradually into our day-to-day work to make us more efficient and effective in our jobs. Unlike the 'killer robots' people see in the movies, this type of automation will be nearly invisible. As more tasks become automated, leadership needs to prioritise continuous training for employees whose job responsibilities may shift. They‚Äôll also need to emphasise soft skills when hiring‚Äîcommunication, teamwork, empathy‚Äîwhich we know can‚Äôt be replaced by an algorithm*

# Workplace on Portal is now available globally üôå

We're pleased to confirm that Workplace on Portal is now available 100% globally üí™! 

Visit Apps on Portal today to download Workplace and start having Workplace calls on Portal üòâ.
## WHAT FEATURES ARE AVAILABLE?
* **Device Code Login: **Streamlined login process and support all Workplace login types
* **Smart Camera with on/off Toggle: **Smart Camera will default to on, with the ability to toggle it on and off in Workplace VC
* **Receive Screen Sharing: **When connected to someone on their computer, they can share their screen and you can see it on Portal
* **Calling Co-Workers (1:1): **Search for all co-workers in your Workplace instance and initiate 1:1 Calls. We support audio-only and video calls.
* **Receiving Calls w/Ring Settings: **Able to receive 1:1 and group Workplace calls on Portal, with the ability to disable incoming calls for Workplace calls.
* **Workplace PIN: **Create a specific Workplace App PIN to protect usage of the Workplace app from family members who have access to the Portal
## WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE?

Please refer to our [help center article](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/654966795039065) for step-by-step instructions on using Workplace on Portal.

# Log into Workplace using a Security Key 

> *Update: This feature was launched to all Workplace customers on December 23, 2019.* 

We are introducing the option for you to add Security Keys as a back up two-factor authentication (2FAC) method! If you have Two-Factor Authentication enabled for your account and own a security key, you can now use the key to log into Workplace. 

Security Key set up is supported on Chrome, Firefox (from V67), Safari (from V13.3), and Edge (from V18).

**How does it work?**

To set up a security key, make sure you already have 2FAC enabled for your account. Visit the ‚ÄúSettings‚Äù section of your profile, then click on ‚ÄúSecurity and login‚Äù. Then, click the ‚ÄúEdit‚Äù button in the ‚ÄúUse two-factor authentication‚Äù section, and click on the ‚ÄúSet up‚Äù button next to the Security key under the ‚ÄúAdd a back up method‚Äù section of the page. 

**Where can I find out more?**

To learn more about security keys and how to set them up for your account, visit our [Help Center](https://fb.workplace.com/help/work/1206667402811583?helpref=search&sr=5&query=two-factor) for more information.

# Download Workplace security reports from the Admin Panel

We heard from you that it is important to have easy access to Workplace‚Äôs latest security documents. Therefore, we built a feature that allows you to download these reports without having to go to your Workplace Team or Workplace Support!

**How does it work?**
To view and download the latest Workplace security reports, visit the Security Center of the Admin Panel and click on a new tab titled ‚ÄúSecurity Reports‚Äù. Here, you will be able to see and download a list of latest, customer-only security reports, including the SOC 2 Report and the Penetration Test Report. 
 
*The rest of the certificates and reports can be found on the Workplace website [here](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/security).*

**Where can I find out more?**
Visit the Security Center in the Admin Panel to access these reports!

# More powerful pinned posts

For when you just can‚Äôt choose one... you can now pin multiple posts to the top of a group so important stuff stays top of feed and top of mind. The ability to add multiple pinned posts is** available to everyone as of January 21, 2020**.
## How does it work?

As a group admin, you can go to any post in a group, select the post menu and select ‚ÄúPin Post‚Äù. Follow the same steps to unpin a post. If you want to select one pinned post that always shows first, go to the post menu of the pinned post and select ‚ÄúPin to top‚Äù. This feature will be available on the web as well as iOS and Android Workplace apps.
## Where can I find out more?

To learn more about pinned posts, check out our [Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/815081011933314), reach out to Support or contact your Workplace team.

# [Video] Web Summit 2019: Inside Workplace with Julien Codorniou

Last month in Lisbon, our VP Julien Codorniou took to the stage in a Q&A session titled **Web Summit 2019: Inside Workplace**.

Here are also some of the main takeaways:
* JC talked about Workplace‚Äôs origins - a product built for Facebook employees to communicate roughly 9 years ago. It‚Äôs grown into a Software as a Service (SaaS) business, and in 3 years has 3 million paying users.
* Different companies are using Workplace in very different ways: with the new generation of frontline employees we‚Äôre seeing a lot of pictures and live videos, but we‚Äôre also seeing other big corporations using it for full scale enterprise collaboration, such as working on shared documents and integrating Workplace with Office 365.
* Workplace wanted to be the first SaaS company to connect employees that didn‚Äôt even have email. It‚Äôs a category of workers that have been traditionally ignored by others. ‚Äú**We‚Äôre proud to be building software for them, and serving them every day.‚Äù**
* Workplace is part of the wider Facebook ecosystem, including Oculus for Business, and Portal - you start to connect the dots and you can see how these offerings all fit into a wider offering and strategy.
* Every Facebook engineer is contributing to Workplace. **‚ÄúWe want to bring that speed of innovation of consumer tech to the world of B2B and SaaS.‚Äù** Live video is a good example of this - we built it for Facebook and we adapted it for Workplace, same thing for Safety Check and our unrivalled Search capabilities.
## Check out the full interview below üëá

# Manage all your groups in just one location

The redesigned group management page enables you to easily see all your groups, discover new groups and manage group notifications, membership and News Feed settings, all in one location. 
 
With our new ‚ÄúBulk Manage Groups‚Äù functionality you can also filter for and select multiple groups at once. You can then change settings for all selected groups, empowering you to quickly curate you group preferences without needing to navigate into any given group. 

We‚Äôre also making some updates to the look and feel of the Workplace left-hand navigation bar and channel filters. The channels in the left-hand navigation bar will now just be marked by icons. In Workplace Chat and notifications, we are making the filters more prominent to make them easier to use.
 
## How does it work?

**How do I access the group management page?**
To access the groups management page, go to the left-hand ribbon of your screen and, in the Explore tab under News Feed, click ‚ÄúSee More". The first dropdown which appears will be "Groups"; click this and your group management page will come up. 

Alternatively, within your Groups section in the left hand ribbon, click "See All...", which you will see at the bottom of your listed groups, below the option to "Create Group" and "Set Priority Groups". By clicking "See All" you will be taken to the groups management page. 
 
Once on the group management page, your groups will appear as individual tiles that are split into three possible sections: groups you follow, groups of which you are an admin, and any other groups.  
 
**What group settings can I manage? **
 By clicking on the icons on each group tile, you are able to turn off and on notifications for a group, leave a group or to follow or unfollow a group - the action by which you control whether or not you see posts from a group in your Newsfeed.
 
By clicking on the ‚ÄúBulk Manage Groups‚Äù button, you can filter for, search and select multiple groups at once and apply any of the above changes to all of the groups you have selected. 
 
In the Suggested Groups tab, you can also discover groups which might be of interest to you, based on your current activity and groups.

## WHAT'S THE TIMELINE 

The redesign and new functionality will be starting launch Thursday 12th December, and will be with all customers by the end of the week!

# [#TipsTuesday] Attribute Mapping for GSuite
## Workplace Advanced & Enterprise System Admins

This one is not exactly a "tip" per se, but following from the launch of an improved IDP integration setup flow earlier this year, we‚Äôre now rolling out attribute mapping for GSuite üôå.

This means that you can now more easily manage Workplace users with GSuite üí™. 

You can find more information about this feature in the [Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/2037569539804116).

# Understand what‚Äôs in your News Feed & why

‚ÄúWhy am I seeing this post?‚Äù feature enables users to understand why they are seeing each specific post that appears in their News Feed. 

Through brief descriptions of the most significant signals that have been used to determine the ranking of each post, all users will have greater insight into why a post might be relevant - whether it be due to their group memberships, people that they follow, posts that they have reacted to before or post popularity. 

The feature also gives users another place from which they can tailor aspects of their News Feed, such as unfollowing a group, should they want to stop seeing posts from a specific group.

## HOW DOES IT WORK?

In your News Feed, click on the three dots next to a post and you will see ‚ÄúWhy am I seeing this post‚Äù as the first option. 

Click on this and the dialogue box which opens will give a brief description of the signals which have determined why a post has appeared where it has in your News Feed. 

## WHEN WILL IT BE LAUNCHING?

The "Why am I seeing this post" feature will be launching this week and available for all users by the end of the year!

# [November Edition] What's New in Workplace?
## Let's take a look at all the Workplace product announcements and feature releases we did last month üí™

In November we released two much anticipated features: **automatic video captioning** and **customised badges**. But those were not the only features our teams have been working hard on, so [check out our latest article](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/news-updates/november-2019) below to read about the other new features we brought to Workplace üôåüëá

# Protect your copyrighted videos with Video Rights Management

*We completed the rollout of this feature to every Workplace community on Jan 8, 2020.* 

Do you publish internal videos like All Hands, live recording of meetings, and product launch announcements on Workplace? We understand these assets are important to you, so we‚Äôve built a feature to help you protect them. With Video Rights Management, you will be able to prevent copyrighted and confidential videos from unauthorised download & distribution outside of Workplace.  

## HOW DOES IT WORK?

Video Rights Management (VRM) is a feature that encrypts videos published on Workplace and only allows people in your Workplace community who have logged into Workplace on a supported browser to watch them. Today, VRM is supported on Firefox, Chrome and the Workplace mobile app. To enable VRM, visit the Security Center of the Admin Panel, and click on a new tab called ‚ÄúMedia Rights Management‚Äù. Here, you will find the toggles to enable VRM. All videos uploaded while VRM is enabled will be protected via encryption. 

## WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE?

You can learn more about Video Rights Management and how to enable it for your community by visiting our [Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/522077105048941).

# Connect your community to Workplace using multiple SSO providers

Does your organization use multiple Identity Providers (IDP) to manage authentication? In the past, we only supported one Single Sign-On (SSO) provider integration per instance, but now, you can integrate your Workplace community with multiple providers for a better authentication experience. 

This feature has been made available to all the communities in the **Enterprise plan**. 

*If you participated in the beta program for this feature and have already started to use it, you will continue to have access to it, regardless of your pricing plan!* 

## HOW DOES IT WORK?

System admins can now add additional SSO providers to their instance by visiting the Authentication tab of the Security Center. Under the Active SSO Providers section, click on the button ‚ÄúAdd New SSO provider‚Äù. There, just follow the regular configuration steps as if you were setting up your first SSO provider. Once completed, you can assign employees to the SSO they belong to based on their email domain. 

## WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE?

You can learn more about IDPs and how to configure them for your commuinty in our in our [Help Center](https://fb.workplace.com/help/work/1645025008878272?helpref=search&sr=4&query=sso).

In this audiocast, Hogarth Worldwide CTO **David Norton** discusses the role IT executives play in accelerating business innovation, empowering people through technology and modernizing IT infrastructure for the digital future.

# Spread knowledge with Learning

On-board, train and share knowledge faster with Learning! Think about all the things you‚Äôve picked up about your job that someone else might need to learn one day. Today, chances are there is no easy way to capture this information and share it with others. This is about to change, with Learning.

Learning captures your team‚Äôs collective knowledge to make sure information is easily shared and absorbed. Through interactive media like video, photos and posts, you can help people learn faster and smarter. We recommend using short and snappy content (think 3-5 minute videos) to engage employees as they learn.

Our initial release will begin on **December 9th**, with a full release by the end of the year and enhancements coming next year.

## HOW DOES IT WORK?

Group admins will start to see a ‚ÄúLearning‚Äù tab (only visible to them), where they‚Äôll be able to enable and add Learning content. As soon as they create or add content to a module, the Learning tab and modules will become visible to group members. The content will be available through the Learning tab, the group itself and in News Feed.

For now, only group admins can add content to modules: they can choose to create new content through the Learning tab itself or bring in existing content already in the group (only possible through the web version in our first release.)

## WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE?

We will share more examples of how to leverage this functionality, alongside Help Center articles, once we go live. Stay tuned!

In the meantime, you can find the attached video (and 2 other longer versions), to share with your teams [**HERE**](https://brandfolder.com/s/q1y2b8-f4tj6w-f49voi).

# **Delve into the employee experience with Surveys 2.0**

Over the past few months, we‚Äôve made a number of enhancements to Surveys‚Äîranging from [reminders for users](https://fb.workplace.com/groups/WorkplaceVIPs/permalink/1713619118770691/) to the ability for admins to set a [custom-invite message](https://fb.workplace.com/groups/WorkplaceVIPs/permalink/1678379708961299/).

Our next set of updates is focused on improving the admin experience of creating, managing and analyzing surveys.
* **More distribution options.** Admins can now choose between using an  existing People Set and importing a custom list of recipients.
* **Deeper Pulse functionality.** Setup recurring surveys with random  sampling to see how employee responses trend over time.
* **Better reporting.** The results dashboard for completed  surveys now includes better visualizations including response labels.

The initial release will begin on December 3, with Surveys 2.0 coming to all customers before the end of the year.
 
**HOW DOES IT WORK?**
The Surveys section of the Admin Panel is accessible to system admins, content moderators and custom admin roles with the ‚ÄòManage surveys‚Äô permission.
 
To upload a custom list of recipients, click on Manual List in the **Recipients** section of the survey-creation flow. Download the CSV template, input the recipients‚Äô details and then upload.
 
To setup a recurring survey, click on Recurring to Random Samples in the **Duration** section of the survey-creation flow. Choose the period of time during which you‚Äôd like the recurring surveys to run, then define the frequency and response window. Based on your inputs, a summary will be presented with the average sample size, frequency, number of runs and total count of recipients. (Note: In order to send a survey, you need to have an average sample size of 4 people or more; if the Done button is disabled, try adjusting your inputs.)
 
**WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE?**
For more information, please consult our [Help Center](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/362546247797409) and read this article on [Getting the Pulse of Your Organization](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/ways-to-work/culture/surveys?hc_location=ufi).

# [#TipsTuesday] Managing email-less accounts

Workplace is built to give everyone in your organisation a voice, but recognise that not every employee is given a company email address, so we've created access codes.
## What are access codes?

With access codes, employees can activate their account without the need for a company email address.
## [Learn more about email-less accounts with this CRC article](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/tech/account-management/email-less) üëá

# **Dive into actionable data with Insights**

Insights is a new section of the Admin Panel that provides richer ways of tracking, measuring and understanding the impact of Workplace usage. You‚Äôll see a number of familiar stats from the Reporting experience (which is being replaced by Insights) along with a lot of new faces‚Äîlike average % of a post read, sentiment analysis for comments on posts and more.

We‚Äôve also added the ability to drill into the data with advanced filters, meaning you can benchmark performance across different parts of the organization. And it‚Äôs never been easier to compare trends over time, now that you can pick custom-date ranges for your reports.

Stay tuned as ***our initial release will begin on December 4***, with Insights coming to all customers by the end of January 2020.

**HOW DOES IT WORK?**

Insights is located within the Admin Panel. This means that access is limited to system admins, content moderators, account managers, analysts and any custom-admin roles with the ‚ÄòSee activity statistics‚Äô permission.

It contains four tabs: People, Content, Groups and Posts.
* People > Track how active your population is on Workplace, throughout the launch, onboarding and adoption journey.
* Groups > Stay on top of group creation and activity, across Workplace and in your most active groups.
* Content > Keep an eye on how much content your organization is producing and how many people are actively contributing.
* Posts > Measure the impact of your communications with advanced post-level performance data.

Note: The Connections tab is only available to closed-beta participants.

**WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE?**

For more information, please consult the [Help Center](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/743805009460399), reach out to Support or contact your Workplace team.

# Stay on top of important information with prioritized groups and priority notifications

**Information updated on 16th Jan.**

We will soon begin rolling out two new tools to help everyone on Workplace stay up to date with information that is important to them. 
 
We‚Äôve heard sometimes people on Workplace feel overwhelmed when News Feed and notifications are a mix of project, announcement and social content. People have told us they would like features to help them track important updates.
 
So, soon two new features will be added to Workplace - prioritized groups and priority notifications.
## What are prioritized groups? 

To help you stay to up to date with information from specific groups, we‚Äôre adding a feature called ‚Äúprioritized groups‚Äù. With prioritized groups, you can choose to mark six groups you are a member of as prioritized groups. When a group is prioritized, content from the group will appear first in News Feed and in priority notifications, helping you stay on top of what you need to know. 
 
For example, if you are working on an important project, you could prioritize the group to make sure you don‚Äôt miss an update.
## What are priority notifications?

To help people stay on top of important notifications, we‚Äôre adding a notifications section called ‚Äúpriority‚Äù. The priority notifications section will include notifications for: tags, replies, mentions, posts from prioritized groups, Safety Check alerts and posts marked as important. 

All other notifications will appear in the section called ‚ÄúMore‚Äù.
## When will prioritized groups and priority notifications be available?

On 21st January a gradual roll-out to Workplace users will begin. We expect the roll-out to take until the end of February. During the roll-out, some people may get priority notifications before they get prioritized groups. This post and this group will be updated once the features are available to everyone on Workplace. 
 
Both features are now available in test instances and for all Workplace admins. 
 
If users want to switch off priority notifications, there is an option in the notifications tab.
## When will it be available?
* **21st November: **It will be available in test instances
* **25th November**: All Workplace admins in Advanced and Enterprise will get priority notifications and prioritized groups
* **21st January: **A slow roll out will begin to users in Advanced and Enterprise communities. During the slow roll out, some users may have the feature while others may not.
* **Late February: **All Workplace users will have priority notifications and prioritized groups.  
## Where can I find out more? 

Here are frequently asked questions:
* **What is a prioritized group?**
   * Prioritized groups help Workplace users prioritize important information in News Feed and notifications. A Workplace user can mark up to six groups that they are a member of as a prioritized group. Once a group is prioritized, the user will see content from the group at the top of their News Feed and will see notifications from prioritized groups at the top of their priority notifications section.
* **What happens when I prioritize a group?**
   * When a group is prioritized, this is what will happen:
      * New content from the prioritized groups will appear at the top of your News Feed.
      * Notifications from prioritized groups will appear in the priority notifications list.
      * If an admin marks a post as important, the post will still appear at the top of News Feed.
* **What are priority notifications?**
   * Priority notifications are a section of notifications, which include: tags, replies, mentions, posts from prioritized groups, Safety Check alerts and posts marked as important. Other notifications will appear in the ‚Äòmore‚Äô section of notifications.
* **Can prioritized groups be defined and set by an organization for their employees?**
   * Workplace admins can use important posts and official groups to share important information with employees. Prioritized groups is a tool for individual users to help them prioritize information that is important to them. Prioritized groups cannot be determined by an organization for their employees.
* **How are prioritized groups different from official groups?**
   * Admins can mark groups as official to help people identify which groups have official company news and announcements. Individual users can prioritized groups to help them easily find information that is important to them.
* **If I prioritize a group, does this prioritize the group for other people on Workplace too?**
   * Prioritized groups is built to help individual users prioritize information in their own News Feed and notifications. Prioritizing a group only changes this setting for you and not anyone else on Workplace.
* **How do I prioritize a group for all group members?**
   * Prioritized groups is a tool for individual users to help them prioritize information that is important to them in their News Feed and notifications. Prioritizing a group only changes this setting for you and not anyone else on Workplace. It is not possible to prioritize a group for all group members.
* **What does the ‚Äòmore‚Äô section of notifications include?**
   * The ‚Äòmore‚Äô section of notifications includes all notifications read and unread as it was before.
* **How do I turn off prioritized groups?**
   * If no groups are prioritized, only tags, replies, mention, important posts and safety check alerts will appear in the priority notifications section.
* **What is the difference between ‚ÄúPrioritized Groups‚Äù and ‚ÄúPinned Groups‚Äù? How do notifications from both these groups differ**
   * Pinning a group makes it easier to find. Content from pinned groups is not prioritized in News Feed and notifications from pinned groups do not appear in the priority notifications list.

# Group Admins, what is it?

Want a quick refresher on what being a group admin means?
## [Check out this CRC article to find tips and best practices to help you get started](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/getting-started/group-admin-guide) üòâüëá

# [**US, UK, JP & AUS ONLY**] Do you collaborate across offices? Does your company have flexible working policy? We want to hear from you!

At Workplace, we are always looking for ways to help companies become closer and faster üí™. 

We‚Äôve seen companies increasingly collaborate across offices and locations, as well as a strong trend of remote working becoming the new norm. 

We‚Äôve partnered with Ipsos MORI, a leading independent market research company to help us understand how companies are collaborating remotely today. 

Please take 10 mins of your time to take this anonymous [**survey**](https://enter.ipsosinteractive.com/landing/?p=uUUGenXvTaA7qMmak4wyW9pbfN1hPA68TG80TNGGy1IBoXsDr12%2BBSRU%2BLNCW5RsLzx9TVlkBvHoBvk0kqGepDMX4ed%2BFJG4wZzjxJv3nuY%3D&id=partxtest) üîé.
## What questions can I expect from this survey? 

This survey aims to understand the state of flexible working in your company, as well as how you collaborate remotely
## When can I take this survey? 

**Survey is live from now until Nov 20th, 23:59 GMT**
## Is this survey anonymous? 

Yes, this survey is anonymous and independently conducted by Ipsos MORI.
## WHY IS IT ONLY FOR CERTAIN COUNTRIES?

This is the first wave of the research, and we are planning to expand to more countries afterwards, thanks for understanding üôè.

# Making Workplace Easier to Use in Widescreen

Good news for those of you working with widescreens, you can now lock the Workplace interface in place, making it easier to navigate when using a screen greater than 1,920px üôå.
## HOW DOES IT WORK?

In widescreen, the update reduces the amount of white space within the Workplace interface. And it gives maximum size to group cover photos, making it easier to predict what your cover photo will look like on the highest resolution displays.

**We are also introducing a Display Options setting, so users can toggle the new view on and off.**

# Express your unique company values through custom badges

Custom badges provide a way to recognize employees for their company-specific achievements and thereby reinforce unique company values. To streamline the process of awarding badges, we've added the ability to bulk award via file upload‚Äîand it's already possible to create custom admin roles with the 'Manage badges' permission, so others can be empowered to award badges.
 
Alongside custom badges and bulk awarding, we're adding an on/off toggle for admins to manage each badge as well as a user view of all the badges that are being used by their organization.
 
Our initial release will begin on November 25th, with custom badges and other enhancements coming to all customers by the end of the year. 
 

**How do custom badges work?**

Like Badges, custom badges can be managed by system admins, content moderators, account managers and any admin with a custom role containing the ‚ÄòManage badges‚Äô permission. 

**How do I create a custom badge?**

From the Admin Panel, click Badges. You'll see the list of badges that are available within your organization. To create a custom badge, click Create Custom Badge in the top right hand corner. Upload a photo, name and description for the badge and press Save. Once a new custom badge is created, it will appear at the top of your company's list of badges. 
 
Note: custom badges can be deleted or disabled, but not edited. 

**How do I award badges?**

Like manual badges, to award a custom badge, click Award and then type in the names of the individuals to whom you want to award the badge in the dialogue box and then click Close. Or, if you want to do bulk upload to award the custom badge to a large number of employees at once, press Upload File and then insert an .xls or .csv file. Once the names of the employees have been uploaded and are in the Ready category, press Award. 
 
Automatic badges can't be awarded by admins, since it's system generated.

**Where can all of my company's badges be viewed?**

To see all badges available in your company, first click on one of your badges on your profile, or any other employee‚Äôs profile. This will bring up a description of all the badges that you, or the employee‚Äôs whose profile you‚Äôre on, have been awarded. From there, click on Show Other Available. 

As an admin, you can also see all badges in your company by clicking on the Admin Panel at the top left of Workplace and clicking on Badges. 
 
**Where can I find out more?**

For more information, reach out to Support, the Help Center or contact your Workplace team.

For original launch post on Badges, click [here](https://fb.workplace.com/groups/WorkplaceVIPs/permalink/1662675100531760/)

# [#TipsTuesday] CRC Video Library
## Did you know that we have a video library? üìπ

If you have always wanted to share some nice tips or tricks about Workplace with your colleagues, but didn't know where you could find a video to better show how to use the platform, then you're in luck!

All videos are downloadable, so you can easily share them on your own company's Workplace üòâ.
## [Check out our Customer Resource Centre to find our useful video library](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/videos?hc_location=ufi) üëá

# Protect your community by enforcing Two-Factor Authentication

>Update June 8, 2020: This feature has been fully rolled out, so all non-SSO communities should have access to it! 

Two-Factor Authentication (2FAC) has always been available on Workplace as a way to provide extra protection to people‚Äôs accounts, but it was up to the individuals to enable it for themselves. Today, we‚Äôre introducing a new feature where **System Admins are able to enforce Two-Factor Authentication for everyone or selected People Sets in their community**! 

We will begin our initial rollout for this feature on **Monday, November 11** 

## HOW DOES IT WORK?

To enforce 2FAC for people in your community, visit the Security section of the Admin Panel. Under a new tab called ‚ÄúTwo-Factor‚Äù, you can specify the audience you want to enforce 2FAC on, select a date, and view the in-product message shown to them. 
The audience you specified will then see a message asking them to enable 2FAC for their account starting on the specified date. 

## WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE?

You can learn more about 2FAC and how to enforce it for your community by visiting our [Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/2421901164713399).

# [#TechThursday] Smartsheet

## What's that?

With Smartsheet for Workplace, in addition to having the option to receive notifications and requests by email or mobile push, you can also receive them in Workplace Chat.

And while receiving notifications and requests by chat is great, the really exciting part is that you can take action on update and approval requests without leaving Workplace üôå.
## How do I add it?

You can check out more about this integration via the link below üëá

# Automatic Video Captioning
## It's finally here!

We are excited to share with you that Automatic Video Captioning is launching globally today, for all Workplace customers üôå.

Video is a powerful medium of communication that many Workplace users are increasingly taking advantage of, but watching videos can be inconvenient at times, and especially not ideal for coworkers with impaired hearing, or working on the frontline.

Automatic Video Captioning enables anyone to generate captions for videos on Workplace, making videos more accessible and easier to consume anywhere, anytime.
## HOW DOES IT WORK?

Utilising the latest artificial intelligence technology, Automatic Video Captioning generates captions for videos in a few clicks.
* Select the video you want to upload > click [**cc >**]
* Click **Video Auto Captioning**. Workplace will automatically recognise the language being spoken and create captions for you. This can take a few minutes depending on the length of the video.
* Click **Preview Caption** > click [**>**] to play the preview video. When you‚Äôre read click **Done**.

You can also download and edit your captions before publishing, or upload your own captions.
## FAQ
* **What languages does it support?** We currently support 13 languages: English, Spanish, Portuguese, French, Arabic, Vietnamese, Italian, German, Turkish, Russian, Thai, Urdu, Malaysian.
* **Is translation available?** Currently not. Automatic Video Captioning generates captions in the same languages as spoken in the video. You can download the captions, translate and re-upload as a workaround.
* **Do you support captioning for Live videos? **Currently, we only support videos uploaded to Workplace.

For more information, visit Workplace [Help Center](https://www.internmc.facebook.com/help/work/1505051832842006), and our [guide](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/ways-to-work/employee-comms/video) on engaging your organisation with video on Customer Resource Center.

# Set a custom status on Workplace üëè

Whether in a meeting, setting aside some time to focus or catching some sun on holidays, you can now set a custom status on Workplace to let your coworkers know what you‚Äôre up to (and if you‚Äôre in do not disturb mode).
## How does it work?

You can now set a custom status on Workplace paired with an emoji of your choice. On web, click on the smiley face icon in the bottom left hand corner of the screen. On mobile, go to the Workplace Chat app, tap on your profile picture then tap ‚ÄúSet a Status‚Äù. You will then be able to set your emoji, write a status and determine how long you want to keep the status. Plus you can set do not disturb at the same time to block incoming notifications.
## Where can I find out more?

**Status will be available to everyone by Tuesday, October 15th** so we suggest you give it a try. You can learn more about custom status and do not disturb in our [Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/2151769891708621).

By now you must think I'm addicted to polls (and you would probably be right üòÇ), but I would love to know which of the features announced earlier this week during our annual **Flow** event you're most excited to see being made available later this year?
story: Helene Colin created a poll in Workplace Admins Community.

message:
# **We‚Äôre adding two types of reminders to Surveys**

Surveys provide an opportunity for employees to give feedback on important topics. Sometimes the invite doesn‚Äôt land at a convenient time though!

So we‚Äôll be introducing two types of reminders to Surveys, which will help recipients get heard and organizations collect more responses: user initiated and system generated. Our initial release will begin on October 14, with Surveys reminders coming to all customers by the end of the month.

**HOW DOES IT WORK?**

Alongside a survey invite, recipients will now be presented with two actions: Take Survey and Remind Me. Remind Me triggers a user-initiated reminder with the option to get prompted in an hour or tomorrow.

If a recipient has neither completed the survey nor scheduled their own reminder, they will receive a system-generated message 24 hours after the survey invite was originally sent. (Note: This only applies if the survey-response window is still open.)

Both reminder types prompt the following message: ‚ÄúHello again! Do you have time to answer [#] questions about [Survey Title] now?‚Äù

**WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE?**

For more information, please consult our [Help Center](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/362546247797409), reach out to Support or contact your Workplace team. And if you‚Äôre seeking inspiration on how to use Surveys, [check out this article](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/ways-to-work/culture/surveys).

# Product News from Flow by Workplace

Today we hosted our annual global enterprise event, Flow! During the keynote, we announced that we‚Äôve reached more than [**3 million paying monthly users**](https://www.workplace.com/workplace/blog/workplace-has-3m-paying-customers) and shared our biggest upcoming product launches ([**take a look at our booklet and share!**](https://brandfolder.com/s/pz0h3n-evg3tc-8hhylj)) In case you don‚Äôt read through: **Thanks is** **starting to roll out today!**

Our theme this year was ***Why the Future belongs to Connected Companies**. *This is the result of bringing everybody together, empowering them and creating a culture that drives business performance. Here are our key announcements which will allow organizations to be more connected. Sign up for the [**‚ÄúWhat you missed at Flow‚Äù webinar**](https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/rt/737391173675627533) today.

## Connecting the Frontline

The power of Workplace lies in connecting *everyone *across an organization. This includes frontline employees as well as knowledge workers.
* **Access Codes **allows email-less employees to be invited to Workplace through a 16-character code, which they can use to set up their Workplace account *(available now)*
* **Frontline Access** gives administrators the ability to create a dedicated pop up message for frontline workers to confirm that they are logging in during working hours *(available now)*
* **Learning **helps group admins easily curate, organize and share knowledge with group members: from how to make the perfect coffee to improving safety in the factory floor *(available later this year)*
* **Goals **helps teams set and track short term targets. Whether it‚Äôs identifying who** **can make a pizza at lightning speed or who‚Äôs sold the most of the new cosmetic product *(available later this year)*
* **Surveys **give** **leaders a quick pulse check on employees to get fast feedback *(available now)*

**Where can I find out more? **Learn why and how to [connect your frontline employees](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/ways-to-work/frontline/why-workplace-for-frontline) and how to [improve employee on-boarding and on-going learning](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/ways-to-work/frontline/employee-learning). And check out our Help Center for [Frontline Add-on](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/322175708660316), [Access Codes](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/546217199128952) and [Surveys](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/362546247797409).

## **Empowering people with new video tools**

Connection is the first step. People also need to be empowered with information and video is one of Workplace‚Äôs most powerful features.
* **Automatic video captioning** lets you easily add captions to videos uploaded to Workplace, increasing reach and engagement. People can choose how to consume video: watching with audio only or reading the captions *(available later this year)*
* **Enterprise Live **streaming allows large audiences to watch videos on Workplace, maintaining video quality and protecting an organization‚Äôs network *(Contact Sales for availability - Workplace Enterprise only)*
* **Workplace on Portal **gives people the ability to connect with colleagues and truly feel present, combining a consumer grade experience with all the power and security of Workplace *(available later this year)*

**Where can I find out more?** If you‚Äôd like to explore our Peer-to-peer solution for your organization, contact your Workplace team. Workplace on Portal will be available later this year; you can [**register your interest here**](https://go.fb.com/portal-availability.html).

## **Improving culture through belonging and well-being**

The outcome of connecting people and information is a connected culture that unites everybody across the organization. Recognition and belonging are crucial to strengthen culture.
* **Badges **allow organizations to recognize employee achievements through visual displays on Workplace profiles *(available now)*. **Custom badges **make this acknowledgement more personal and distinct *(available later this year)*
* **Thanks **gives employees the opportunity to recognize their peers‚Äô great work publicly on Workplace *(roll out starting today)*

**Where can I find out more? **Learn [how to boost employee engagement with recognition](http://facebook.com/workplace/resources/ways-to-work/frontline/engagement-recognition). Check out our Help Center to learn how to [award](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/478293379655417) or [view a badge](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/2203917923064454) and send [thanks](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/929721510739530).

## **Measuring the impact**

When your company is connected, the next step is to measure that impact.
* **Insights **brings more and new ways to cut Admin reporting data, understand how ‚Äúconnected‚Äù your organization is, identify ‚Äúengaged‚Äù users and collect engagement at the post level *(available later this year)*

...and, that‚Äôs all! Lots of exciting news this year with great developments to come.

**Couldn‚Äôt make it to Flow? **Register to attend our [‚ÄúWhat you missed at Flow‚Äù webinar](https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/rt/737391173675627533) or visit our [YouTube channel](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC4VGW4v0bem7y7X31AmU6Fw) to watch the keynote video. 

If you‚Äôd like to read more about Flow, visit the [Workplace Blog](https://www.workplace.com/workplace/blog/11-new-tools-to-connect-people-at-work) and read our [Announcements Booklet](https://brandfolder.com/s/pz0h3n-evg3tc-8hhylj) to learn more.

# [Sept. 2019] What's New in Workplace?

Catch up with all the newest features we've released over the month of September üôå

From **assigning badges** to your employees, to **searching for exact phrases**, or even **saving messages** and adding **reminders**, we're working hard to make your work easier üí™

And get ready for even more cool announcements this week as our annual **Flow** event is tomorrow!

# [POLL] What's your function?
And to conclude this week beautifully, here is the last part of me being nosy and wanting to know everything about you üòá.
Today, I wish to know what's your function inside your company. You're part of this community because you're the Admin of your company's workplace, but in addition to that, what's your role? ü§ì
Again, I'm only listing a few positions, so feel free to add yours too :D.
