The ‚ÄúWorkplace URL‚Äù setting allows you to move your Workplace community to the new Workplace domain. You‚Äôll be able to find this at the top of this section: Admin Panel > Settings > Company Settings. 

We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience this may cause, and we appreciate your patience. If you have any questions, please feel free to reach out to your Workplace Team or Workplace Support, and we will be very happy to assist you.

# **Flow 2019 - Watch the Keynote Live**

Flow, our annual leadership conference, is taking place in California on Tuesday, October 8. We will reveal *Why the  Future Belongs to Connected Companies *and will share exciting product announcements with you.

If you'd like to tune in for the Keynote,** at** **9am PDT**, please sign up to watch on Facebook Live [**here](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/events/flow-live-stream-registration-2019).**

Looking forward to sharing some exciting news with you!

# Oculus for Business - launching in November

Announced yesterday during the Oculus Connect conference, we are excited to share with you that the new Oculus for Business platform will be launched in November.

Many businesses have been exploring the VR impact on employees' training, and have noticed real improvements on both productivity and safety.

You can find more information on this upcoming launch in our latest blog: [https://www.oculus.com/blog/a-closer-look-at-the-new-oculus-for-business-launching-in-november/](https://www.oculus.com/blog/a-closer-look-at-the-new-oculus-for-business-launching-in-november/)

What do you think of this new offering? Share your thoughts in the comments below!

# **Introducing Mark as Read for important posts**

Important posts carry important information. To help you better understand whether someone‚Äôs passively consumed this information or actively acknowledged it, we‚Äôre introducing a Mark as Read action next month‚Äîwith our initial release beginning on October 2.

Mark as Read delivers a double delight by enabling users to de-clutter their News Feed while providing admins with actionable reporting on read rates. 

**HOW DOES IT WORK?**

Important posts can be managed by system admins, content moderators and custom admin roles with the ‚ÄòMark posts as important‚Äô permission. Once a post is marked as important by an admin, it will be shown at the top of News Feed for all group members for the amount of time selected by the admin or until the user clicks Mark as Read.

Within the Important Posts section of the Admin Panel, admins will be able to see aggregate stats of: Seen by, Marked as Read, Comments and Reactions. And they‚Äôll be able to download a file containing the following data for everyone who received the important post: Name, Email, Seen by and Marked as Read.

**WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE?**

For more information, please consult our [Help Center](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/252991161966313), reach out to Support or contact your Workplace team.

# [FIXED] Admin panel reporting showing inaccurate results for number of posts/reactions/comments

Some Workplace customers are currently experiencing issues with inaccurate reporting being shown in the Admin Panel for number of Posts/Reactions/Comments. 

Our engineering team is actively investigating the issue and hope to resolve it as quickly as possible. 

If you are experiencing this issue, please raise a support ticket so that the team is able to fully investigate.

[https://www.facebook.com/workplace/status](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/status)

[**What's New in WP?: 10am-11am US-Pacific**](https://register.gotowebinar.com/rt/2443299955583102220)

**Wednesday 9/25**

**Thursday 9/26:**

[**Workplace Admin Fundamentals: 10am-11:30am US-Pacific**](https://register.gotowebinar.com/rt/1541113277690146562)

Come learn the most important parts of the admin panel, along with information about the technical projects required to get Workplace up and running- with Group structure and change management sprinkled in!

# Content reporting improvements

We‚Äôve improved our content reporting by adding the ability to report chats to admins on Workplace.You can now report any content on Workplace, whether a chat, post or comment. This feature will begin rolling out today and will be available to everyone in the coming days.
## How does it work?

You will now have the ability to report one on one and group chats on Workplace in addition to posts and comments. In a group chat, you will be asked to report a specific member of the chat. When a chat report is submitted, it will be sent to the admin team (System Admins & Content Moderators) of the person who is being reported. The last set of messages and all associated media like photos and videos will also be reported to provide admins with important context so they can make an informed decision. *Reporting chats is ONLY supported on web, but will be available on mobile apps shortly.*
## Where can I find out more?

You can learn more about reporting chats or taking action on reported content on our [Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/980242522134735).

# Manage your busy day with saved messages & reminders

With so much to do in a day, we can‚Äôt get to everything right away. We‚Äôve launched saved messages and reminders to help you to stay organized and come back to work on your schedule. You can now save chat messages just like you can save posts. You can find and organize all saved messages and posts in the Saved section on Workplace.

If you want to remind yourself to come back to a chat message at another time, you can click ‚ÄúRemind Me‚Äù on any chat message. At the time you select, you will be reminded about this message within the chat thread. We hope this makes your busy days a bit more manageable!
## HOW DOES IT WORK?

It is quick and easy to save a chat or set a reminder. To save a message on web, hover over the message then click the bookmark icon. On mobile, hold down on a message then select "Save Message". To set a reminder on web, click **...** and then select **Remind Me. **Choose the time you want to be reminded and Workplace will send a reminder in the chat thread that only you can see. Reminders are not yet available on our mobile chat apps.
## WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE?

You can find out more about saved messages and reminders in our [Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/) or reach out to Support or your Workplace team.

# Extending the timeline for moving to Workplace.com

We announced previously that all Workplace communities were expected to move to the new Workplace domain prior to October 1. However, due to extended maintenance on the site, the timeline is now **extended to** **November 4, 2019**. On November 4 at 2pm BST, we will move your community to the new Workplace domain on your behalf.

For **communities with disabled ‚ÄúWorkplace URL‚Äù setting, it will be enabled on September 30, 2019,** and you will be able to carry out your move between September 30 and November 4, 2019. The ‚ÄúWorkplace URL‚Äù setting allows you to move your Workplace community to the new Workplace domain. You‚Äôll be able to find this at the top of this section: Admin Panel > Settings > Company Settings.

*If you are on Workplace Standard, your community was automatically moved to workplace.com on or before July 1st.*

We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience this may cause, and we appreciate your patience. If you have any questions, please feel free to reach out to your Workplace Team or Workplace Support, and we will be very happy to assist you.

*In this new live, virtual training, the Workplace team will walk you through creative uses of our new features from surveys to resources and other features you may have missed. And, you'll also be able to ask questions of, and give feedback to, our product team!  So come ready to interact with the people who built the features!*

**When:** Starting next week ([**Sept 16th**](https://register.gotowebinar.com/rt/2443299955583102220)) through mid-October in North America, EMEA, and APAC times!

**Where: **Your computer

[Register Here!](https://register.gotowebinar.com/rt/2443299955583102220)

# Customer Education Classes Week of 9/3

***Register for all of our classes here:[ fb.me/crc/training***](http://fb.me/crc/training)

**Wednesday 9/4:**

[**How to Launch Workplace: [**](https://register.gotowebinar.com/rt/4229335648736683532)10am-11am US-Pacific](https://register.gotowebinar.com/rt/4229335648736683532)

*Come learn best practices for deploying Workplace- from Executive Engagement to Group Structure, to Communication Strategies, and more!*

**Thursday 9/5:**

[**Workplace Admin Fundamentals:[**](https://register.gotowebinar.com/rt/1541113277690146562) 10am-11:30am US-Pacific](https://register.gotowebinar.com/rt/1541113277690146562)

*Come learn the most important parts of the admin panel, along with information about the technical projects required to get Workplace up and running- with Group structure and change management sprinkled in!*

**Monday 9/9:**

[**Strategic Communication:[**](https://register.gotowebinar.com/rt/5400220973261814285) 10am-11am US-Pacific](https://register.gotowebinar.com/rt/5400220973261814285)

*Come learn best practices for managing your organization's Strategic Communications through Workplace!  Inspired by the brain of Workplace's Communications Guru Abby G!*

# **Improve survey-response rates with a custom invite**

We‚Äôre adding a new field to our survey-creation flow: Invite Message. This will enable admins to provide survey participants with additional context via a custom message that appears before the Take Survey call-to-action. 

Our initial release will begin on September 3, with the ability to add a custom survey-invite message coming to all customers this month. Alongside this change, we will be deprecating the Description field (which was only visible to admins) while retaining historical description data.

**HOW DOES IT WORK?**

The [Surveys](https://fb.workplace.com/groups/WorkplaceVIPs/permalink/1629706877161916/) section of the Admin Panel is accessible to system admins, content moderators and custom admin roles with the ‚ÄòManage surveys‚Äô permission.

When creating a new survey, you‚Äôll see the Invite Message field on the Details page of the survey-creation flow. Add an optional invite message to tell people what the survey is about and why their responses are helpful.

Then view a preview of the invite message at the bottom of the page‚Äîor via the Preview Survey option on the Distribution page.

Note: If you don‚Äôt include an Invite Message, a default message will be sent.

**WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE?**

For more information, please consult our [Help Center](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/362546247797409), reach out to Support or contact your Workplace team.

# Connect everyone with the Frontline Add-on

Frontline employees are crucial for businesses, serving customers or manufacturing products. But **only 14%** of them feel connected to their company as they don‚Äôt have access to the right technology to make this happen. We are here to change that with Frontline Access - and more functionality in the Frontline Add-on - in the coming months.

Frontline access helps easily connect frontline employees, regardless of whether they are hourly, contingent or temporary.
* **Enable login with access codes **for frontline workers** **who don‚Äôt have a work email address
* **Easily manage your frontline staff's access **with Frontline Membership
* **Set custom terms **according to your company policies to help frontline workers manage their access outside working hours
* **Add people to default groups **based on their Frontline Membership

## How does it work?

You will first need to provision your frontline employees in the People page, as you would today. For people who do not have an email address, you can use [Access Codes](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/546217199128952?helpref=search&sr=4&query=access+code) to create Workplace accounts. 

Once you've created accounts for your frontline employees, visit the ‚ÄúFrontline‚Äù tab on your Admin Panel*:
* In the **Settings **page, you can write custom terms for your frontline workers which can be shown at a recurring frequency when they visit Workplace. You can also control other access settings.
* In the **Membership **page, you can add people to the Frontline people set manually or in bulk to manage who belongs to the Frontline group
* You‚Äôll can filter and download People activity data for your frontline set as well as security logs for when terms were accepted/declined.

**You can request the Frontline Add-on by speaking to your Workplace team so you can securely invite your frontline employees to Workplace. Please review the definition of a frontline employee [here](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/news-updates/new-plans-faqs).*

## Where can I find out more?

We will be holding webinars to showcase the functionality and answer your questions in the ‚ÄúWhat's New in Workplace?‚Äù series. Please sign up [**HERE**](https://register.gotowebinar.com/rt/2443299955583102220).

To learn more about why connecting deskless employees is so important and how Workplace can help, please visit our [Customer Resource Center](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/news-updates/frontline). You can also read more about our new pricing plans in our [Help Center](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/322175708660316).

And if you‚Äôd like to read more about the value of connecting everyone, including your frontline employees, please read our [Deskless not Voiceless summary and full report](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/blog/deskless-not-voiceless).

# Read the People Manager Guide to Workplace!

If you‚Äôre a people manager you know that communication is key to managing relationships with direct reports. Our [People Manager Guide](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/getting-started/people-manager-guide) will walk you through using Workplace to centralize communication with your team and work better, together.
## [Read it today!](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/getting-started/people-manager-guide)

The People Manager Guide covers:
* Working together in groups
* Hosting meetings
* Collaborating on documents and files
* Recognizing employees
* Communicating one-on-one with your direct reports
* Gathering feedback in cross-functional groups

[Download our one-pager summary of the guide](https://brandfolder.com/s/pwar3c-48tdds-d974r8) and share it with other people managers in your Workplace community!

And [join our How to Work in Workplace live training](https://l.workplace.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fregister.gotowebinar.com%2Frt%2F9064853643255384323&h=AT3beWxGjAAhmrbnFzPIpIWb3KYeHRf_HQIVYtDN6LG1Y47FJySIO4aFRg2tUDhablojkemjQUqiMELoixmAgxZfzCYraL1sKO8kYGK_BOQphGt7saNnOk-sTjgQDu-UqZCISIuJJe6LRrh7p4ESySD1u8jhx1rmdG0xOZh9n6f4A2FimJHYfeRySg4tKwzxWx4) for more guidance and support from the Workplace team.

[
](https://fb.workplace.com/photo.php?fbid=153154952548602&set=gm.2985672474803193&type=3&eid=ARAh4gqr-qUNYa3i0_30jTVPfUX79mWDcR5N5w9Kg-IhPeTKXHN25-INUgNpzeBOF3ujSsHOgl-30xo-&ifg=1)

# New File Viewer & Annotations üìÅüìù

Files are central to the way work is conducted today and we share them constantly both to spread information and gather feedback. Because files are so important in our daily work lives, we want to make sure working with them is quick and easy on Workplace. So we‚Äôve completely redesigned our file viewer experience, providing a high-fidelity preview and the ability to annotate straight from a Workplace post.

**This is now available for all your most common files!**
1. *Image types: *bmp, jpeg, png
1. *File types:* doc, docx, odt, odp, pdf, ppt, pptx, txt, csv, xlsx, xls
## üßê HOW DOES IT WORK?

When you attach any of the above files to a post, Workplace will automatically render the new viewer. Click on the viewer to see a rich preview with easy navigation. To add an annotation, simply click on ‚ÄúPlace a new comment‚Äù then click anywhere on the preview to place the annotation. The annotation will be indicated with a letter on the preview and in the comments thread of the post for easy discovery. Annotations can only be added on the web, but they can be seen on Workplace mobile apps as comments.
## üîç WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE?

You can learn more about working with files on Workplace in our [Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/800397456742178?helpref=hc_global_nav) or reach out to Workplace Support or your account team for further questions.

# **DELAYED**: Update to Groups with Chat

**UPDATE: Emails were sent on Tuesday October 1st and groups will migrate on Tuesday, October 15th.**

*There is an upcoming change to group types. Action is optional. *A few months ago, we redesigned Teams & Projects groups to include automatically synced chat.   

We made some changes to Teams & Projects group to allow for this:
* The group can have up to 250 members.
* The group and chat will have the same synced members and name.
* There are no group moderators only group admins.
* Teams & Projects groups do not allow for automated group membership like ‚ÄúAdd Teams to Groups‚Äù in order to ensure the group stays under 250 members.

For consistency, we now want to ensure that existing Teams & Projects groups meet these criteria. 

    

**What will happen to my existing Teams & Projects groups with chats? ** 

 If you have Teams & Projects groups with chat that meet the criteria above already, there will be no change. The majority of teams & projects groups are not affected. We are migrating all other existing Teams & Projects groups to Discussion groups and linked chats will be unlinked. *Unlinked chats will still exist they will just not be attached to the group. Nobody will lose access to any groups or chats as part of this change.*

**How will I know which groups are impacted?**  

On Tuesday, September 3rd, any group admins of Teams & Projects groups that do not meet the criteria above will:
1. Receive an email with a list of all impacted groups.
1. See a persistent notice on the top of every impacted group allowing you to **Manage Settings **to keep the linked chat.

**Action is optional and not required. **If no action is taken, beginning Tuesday October 15th these Teams & Projects groups will migrate to a Discussion group and chat will be unlinked but still available. You can relink the chat at any time.

# And... we've moved!

Thank you for your partnership throughout our move to a new Workplace experience. It was an intense few months since April 30 when we announced a new web design for Workplace. 

As we've fully transitioned to the new experience, we will **remove The New Workplace page from the Admin Panel on Monday, September 16. **Please make sure you download any useful documents and remember you can access most of these through our [Customer Resource Center](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/news-updates/new-workplace-experience).

Having everyone on the new experience allows us to focus on your feedback and we're committed to improving the new interface for everyone. Performance and white space are at the top of the list.

If you're curious about the rationale and journey around this move, [Engadget has published an article](https://www.engadget.com/2019/08/07/facebook-workplace-redesign-interview/) earlier this month on it. We hope you enjoy this behind-the-scenes peak and we look forward to sharing many more Workplace developments with you.

Thank you!

# **Getting granular with mark as important permissions**

Based on customer feedback, we are splitting out the ‚ÄòMark posts as important‚Äô permission so that it can be added to custom admin roles. We‚Äôre in this midst of launching this granular permission and it will be available to all customers by the end of the quarter.

Alongside this change, we‚Äôre relocating the reporting for important posts‚Äîwhich previously resided within the content tab of the Reporting section within the Admin Panel. This will now this will live as a new standalone section of the Admin Panel called Important Posts.

**HOW DOES IT WORK?**

System admins will be able to assign the ‚ÄòMark posts as important‚Äô permission to custom admin roles by navigating to the Administrators section of the Admin Panel and clicking on the Roles tab at the top of the page. From there, they can either create a new role with this permission or add it to an existing custom admin role.

**WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE?**

For more information, please consult our Help Center article on [how to create a custom admin role](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/396188054275905), direct users with this new permission to our Help Center article on [how to mark a post as important](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/314019095855858) or reach out to Support.

# **Official groups are coming soon**

Do the employees of your organization struggle to identify which groups have official company news and information? If so, you‚Äôll be happy to hear that we‚Äôre giving customers the ability to mark existing groups as official this quarter‚Äîwith our initial release beginning on August 20.

Marking groups as official provides a visual cue that's easy to spot when users are searching through many groups, especially when they have similar names. This helps employees to find company-approved* *information, whether that‚Äôs the latest company news, internal policies or business updates.

**HOW DOES IT WORK?**

System admins, content moderators and custom admin roles containing the ‚ÄòManage groups‚Äô permission will be able to mark (or unmark) a group as official.

An official-group icon will appear alongside the official group‚Äôs name in multiple locations, including the group-page header, search results and News Feed. And all users will be able to see groups that have been marked as official.

**WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE?**

For more information, please consult our [Help Center](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/2625539014340158), reach out to Support or contact your Workplace team.

# **Boost employee engagement through recognition**

Employee recognition is a crucial component of employee engagement but it's difficult to achieve at scale‚Äîand consistently. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre launching Badges to all customers this quarter, with our initial release beginning on August 19.

Badges provides a way to recognize employees for their roles and achievements, directly on their profile pages. Automatically-awarded badges provide a consistent, scalable way of recognizing employees while admin-awarded badges provide a flexible means of reinforcing company values.

**HOW DOES IT WORK?**

Badges can be managed by system admins, content moderators, account managers and any admin with a custom role containing the ‚ÄòManage badges‚Äô permission.

To see the full set of Badges available to your organization, go to the Admin Panel and click Badges from the menu. In this overview, you‚Äôll see a description for each badge along with the criteria and method for how badges are awarded.

**WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE?**

For more information, please consult our [Help Center](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/2341113332771139), reach out to Support or contact your Workplace team.

# **Making Q&A easier within posts**

Within the comments of a post, we're adding an icon next to the name of the post's author. This will help readers easily spot updates and responses from the author of the post.

We‚Äôll begin rolling this feature out to customers on August 12. And all customers will have access by the end of this quarter.
## HOW DOES IT WORK?

The author icon is a passive feature for all users. If you comment on your own post, you‚Äôll see the icon beside your name‚Äîwhether the post is on someone‚Äôs timeline, a group or even a multi-company group.

And when you scroll over the icon, you‚Äôll see tool-tip text indicating that ‚Äò[Person] created this post.‚Äô

# **Create multiple groups from the Admin Panel**

We‚Äôre releasing a new feature that will allow Workplace Admins to create multiple groups at once by uploading a spreadsheet or email list. This feature will become gradually available over the coming days and weeks starting today.
## How does it work?

Workplace Admins will be able to upload a spreadsheet or email list from the Groups tab in the Admin Panel in order to create multiple Workplace groups at once, which will make it easier to set up and manage your Workplace account. To use this feature, visit the Groups tab in the Admin Panel, click on ‚ÄúCreate Multiple Groups‚Äù and select an option from the drop-down menu. Before the groups are created, you‚Äôll be asked to confirm the groups to be created and the settings for each one. The Workplace Admin that creates the groups will become the admin of those groups by default, and can subsequently assign group admins and moderators.
## Where can I find out more?

Please visit the [Workplace Help Centre](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/) for more information about group creation on Workplace.

# One week to go! Everyone is moving to the new Workplace experience on August 5

*"Yes, we know, all Workplace users will automatically enter the [new Workplace experience](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/blog/introducing-the-new-workplace-experience/) on August 5".*

You probably think this news is *so April 2019 *and are ready to move on. Forgive us, we wanted to take one last chance to remind you of the logistics of the move.

## **What happens on August 5?**

Employees who have not chosen the new Workplace experience, will automatically be on-boarded into the new design. **The automatic move will happen on August 5, at 6AM PT / 2PM BST / 9PM SGT / 10PM JST / 11PM AEST.**  They will go through the [on-boarding flow](https://brandfolder.com/s/psdqdr-eg9rls-fyimlr?fbclid=IwAR0_XYT2w6xGHpbBtsRw3iv3DAqCsIkCGT0APAS5TZCBqCaZMXJbbD6ezbA) if they haven't done so before (for example, an employee who had already tried the new experience and had switched back to the Classic design would not see the on-boarding flow again).

To aid you in this move, we have two sets of in-product reminders:
* **System Admins only: **You will receive an email later this week reminding you of the move. If you‚Äôre reading this post, chances are you are aware. The email will help us reach System Admins through a different channel one last time before the move.
* **End users: **Anyone in the Classic experience has started seeing a banner on top of News Feed to remind them to move (unless an Admin has turned it off through ‚ÄúThe New Workplace‚Äù section in the Admin panel).

If you have any other questions or want more detail on what has changed, **go to our [Customer Resource Center](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/news-updates/new-workplace-experience), [Help Center, ](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/332823210704895)Workplace Support or your Workplace team.**

# You can now enable a News Feed banner to remind people to switch over to the new Workplace experience

With three weeks to go, you can now turn on a reminder on News Feed for those who have not yet switched to the new experience. More background in [this post](https://work.workplace.com/groups/WorkplaceVIPs/permalink/1629477870518150/).
## How does it work?

Simply go to the Admin Panel, and under "The new Workplace", you will find options to turn on (or disable) the News Feed reminder for people who haven't switched.

**Note: **This reminder will be automatically activated on July 22 for people who have not yet moved to the new experience if you take no action.
## Where can I find out more?

# Workplace domain move taking place on October 1st
 
On October 1st, we will move your communities to the workplace.com domain from facebook.com on your behalf. You can make this move yourself before this point to implement accompanying changes at your own pace. 
As of March 25, 2019, a setting has been added to the Preferences section of the Admin Panel, allowing system admins to move all Workplace users to the workplace.com domain.

**How does my community move to workplace.com?**
For Workplace Premium customers, you can find a setting in the ‚ÄúPreferences‚Äù section of the Admin Panel allowing system admins to move all Workplace users to the Workplace domain. This option was made available to you on March 25th. *If you are on Workplace Standard, your community was automatically moved to workplace.com on or before July 1st.*

**How should my community prepare for the move?**
People should not notice any difference when moved to workplace.com except that the url to access Workplace will change from company.facebook.com to company.workplace.com. We will continue to redirect from facebook.com to workplace.com for the foreseeable future. 
However, below are the recommended changes for when we no longer support the facebook.com domain.
- If your community has custom training documents or many published links with Facebook domain, we strongly recommend updating these to the Workplace domain.

**Where can I learn more?**
We have put together resources to help your organization prepare for the move to the Workplace domain. Please take a look at the links below. If you have any questions that are not answered below, feel free to reach out to your Workplace team or Workplace Support for assistance.
- [Customer Resource Center: Preparing for the move to the Workplace domain](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/news-updates/prepare-your-community)
- [Workplace Domain Change Q&A](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/1519603854842191)

# **Set self-forming teams up for success**

With collaboration on the rise and cross-functional teams becoming the norm, a lot of work happens outside of org chart-defined structures. And as an organization grows, it becomes increasingly difficult to figure out who‚Äôs working on what.

So we‚Äôve created Work Teams to help people and organizations discover where work is getting done. By joining a work team, users can showcase what they‚Äôre working on, who they‚Äôre collaborating with and where discussions are happening.

On July 9, we will begin rolling Work Teams out to an initial wave of customers. And all customers will have access to the feature by the end of summer.
## HOW DOES IT WORK?

Each work team has a dedicated page that includes a description, list of members and associated groups.

Use the Work Teams Directory (in the Explore tab of the Home page) to find and join existing work teams or create a new one.

Note: Any work team that you‚Äôre a member of will be visible on your Profile page.
## WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE?

For more information, please consult our [Help Center article](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/324899035109638), reach out to Support or contact your Workplace team.

# **Enrich your profile with skills**

We‚Äôre empowering users to promote their expertise by adding skills to their profile! As of today, anyone can add skills to their Workplace profile and endorse the skills of others. 
 
Skills are also searchable in the People Directory, which means finding the right fit for your project team and connecting to a colleague with shared interests has never been easier.
 
**HOW DOES IT WORK?**
We‚Äôve created three Help Center articles to help you learn how to [add skills](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/331034354188594), [endorse skills](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/334540457180777) and [search for people by skill](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/254965238748239).
 
**WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE?**
For more information, reach out to Support or contact your Workplace team.

# **Centralize your organization‚Äôs most important resources**

During the month of July, we‚Äôre launching Resources to all customers. It‚Äôs a new admin-managed page under the Explore tab, where organizations can curate an official set of key resources‚Äîon a single page, with a static location.
 
With no code required, your Resources page can be setup within minutes. And consistent navigation makes it easy for users to find and access the resources they need.
 
**HOW DOES IT WORK?**
System admins and content moderators are able to setup and edit an organization‚Äôs Resources page.
 
From the Workplace Home tab, go to Resources under Explore. From there, create categories and add links as resources. Then publish. (Note: Only published categories will be visible to non-admins.)
 
**WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE?**
For more information, please consult our [Help Center article](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/384762435719952), reach out to Support or contact your Workplace team.

# **Getting the pulse of your organization has never been easier**

An important part of driving employee engagement is understanding the thoughts and concerns of people across your organization. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre launching Surveys to all customers during the month of July.
 
With Surveys, Workplace admins are able to send up to 5 questions to anyone in their community via Workplace Chat. And once a survey has at least 4 responses, anonymized results are just a click away in the Admin Panel.
 
**HOW DOES IT WORK?**
Surveys can be created by system admins, content moderators or admins with a custom role allowing survey creation.
 
To create a survey, go to the Admin Panel and click Survey from the menu. From there, you‚Äôll have a status overview of all surveys along with the option to create a new survey.
 
**WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE?**
For more information, please consult our [Help Center article](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/362546247797409), reach out to Support or contact your Workplace team.

# Topic suggestions are live starting today!

Last week, we released a new feature which allows you to [tag various topics on a post](https://work.workplace.com/groups/WorkplaceVIPs/permalink/1616804028452201/). Starting today, whenever Topics are enabled (and group members can create new topics) in Open and Closed groups, you will also start seeing suggestions for topics to tag.

Topic suggestions are based on the group's top topics and the content of the post. For more information, please consult our [Help Center entry](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/2339897226088488), reach out to Support or contact your Workplace team.

# Search files and content links globally and in groups.

Content is at the heart of collaboration and the ability to share and discover the right content is an important part of that. Today, we‚Äôre introducing the ability to search for files and content links in group search and global search based on keywords in file titles.
## HOW DOES IT WORK?

People can search for the file globally (on top of left hand panel of the new Workplace experience), as well as in the groups to see the file search results.
## WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE?

You can take a look at the [Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/472460356212240?helpref=search&sr=4&query=search) or reach out to your Workplace team.

# Tracking your organization's move to the new Workplace experience

Here it is, the most anticipated release this summer! We know you need visibility over how your company is adopting the new Workplace experience. Starting today, you can see how many people in your organization have moved. This signal can help you decide whether to schedule your move imminently, increase the level of internal comms, let employees enjoy the full open access period (until August 5th), or something else.

## How does it work?

Simply go to the Admin Panel, under ‚ÄúThe new Workplace‚Äù tab, you‚Äôll be able to see how many people in your organization have moved to the new experience when you scroll to the ‚ÄúTimeline‚Äù section. You will be able to see a status bar, indicating the proportion of the company who is on the new experience* (at the precise time you check) and the total number of people this represents. This should help you gauge the level of adoption and additional change management needed in the organization.
 
Please note that, in the interest in moving fast and providing some signal for the move, we have kept this signal light. While we are not including breakdowns of which region/department/etc. in the organization, we believe this information already will help you plan the next move for your organization.
 
**The data includes all active accounts, including people who have not yet claimed their Workplace account.*

## Where can I find out more?

If you have any questions, please reach out to Workplace Support or contact your Workplace team.

# New Technical Resources section now live on Customer Resource Center (CRC)

Yesterday saw us launch our new Technical Resources section on the CRC, as a central point for **technical teams to configure and start using Workplace.**

[https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/tech/](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/tech/)

We have created much-asked for new guides and articles around topics like Security Admin controls and Account Lifecycle.
## What's next?

But this is just the first step. We will be adding new content to this section in the coming weeks as well as publishing translated versions of all the guides.
## Can't find what you're looking for?

We encourage you to take a look around the new section and would love to hear from you if there is anything else that would be useful. Just let us know in the comments below üëáüëáüëá

Hello everyone.  I am new as the Workplace Admin.  Can someone please tell me if there is a way that the initial invite message can be changed.  If so, where do I go to view the invite message as well as make the change?

# Create multiple groups from your email distribution lists

Groups is the core part of the Workplace experience. You can now easily create Groups in bulk from your email distribution lists stored in Microsoft Azure and G Suite. Additionally, an auto-sync group membership is enabled between the IDP and Workplace which means that you can automatically add users part of the original email distribution lists to those Groups as soon as the admin provisions them.
## How does it work?

Click on the Admin Panel, Groups section, and Import Email Groups button to get started.
## When is it launching?

The ability to create groups in bulk from your email distribution lists in Microsoft Azure and G Suite will be available starting June 25 to all Workplace Premium and Standard users.
## Where can I find out more?

We are here to help! Take a look at our [Help Center ](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/2214616132136570)or reach out to your Workplace team.

Hi everyone!

We are new to Workplace and would love to her how you are approaching your default group structure and posting guidelines. 

Do you have or know of helpful resources/visuals used to support teams in knowing what to post and where? ‚ò∫Ô∏è
Any movement (pun intended) on being able to move posts from one group to another? Have needed this several times...

# Find what you need faster, with improved search filters

Search helps you discover content and go back to information you‚Äôve already been exposed to. On **Wednesday June 26**, we will begin rolling out new search filters which give you more control over what you find. We are making search filters more granular, so you can search by date ranges, posts you‚Äôve seen, type of group where the information lives, and much more.

## How does it work?

Simply go to the Search bar on Workplace and enter your search keywords. Once you press enter (or go to ‚ÄúSee all results for...‚Äù), you‚Äôll see all the new filters.

## Where can I find out more?

Don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out to Workplace Support or to your Workplace team if you have any questions.

# Organize your posts and discover content with Topics!

Imagine being able to label all ‚Äúon-boarding‚Äù materials for new joiners in your team or quickly finding every post related to the ‚ÄúPulse‚Äù survey results in a group. On **Wednesday June 26**, we will begin rolling out topic tagging within groups. With topics, you can browse posts more efficiently, quickly discover useful content and organize your group‚Äôs discussion more easily.

## How does it work?

When writing a post in a group, select up to five topics to describe the post. You can either choose existing topics or create new ones. Then, consult the group‚Äôs topics on the right-hand column in the group. Click on each topic to find the relevant content for you.

Group admins are able to:
* Turn topics on/off within the group and select whether new topics can be created (from the Groups Settings page)
* Pin topics to be shown at the top of the Topics section of the group (on the right-hand column)
* Edit or delete topics added to posts in the group

## Where can I find out more?

For more information, please consult our [Help Center entry](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/2339897226088488), reach out to Support or contact your Workplace team.

message:
# The Open Access period continues - and you can now plan your move to the new Workplace experience!

On June 5, we opened access to every Workplace user to the new Workplace experience. We‚Äôve since seen a lot of activity and feedback from admins and users and continue to iterate based on this feedback.

We‚Äôd like to share an update on some of your top requests, which we've worked on since our last post. We are still working [on other items highlighted in the previous announcement](https://work.workplace.com/groups/WorkplaceVIPs/permalink/1602634519869152/) (yes, including white space) but wanted to give you an update on those which are top of mind at the moment due to their immediate impact on your move.
* **Group cover photos:** We shipped a solution so you can see some of the group cover photo by default when visiting a group. This ensures the photos are still prominent but not overpowering. We‚Äôll continue to iterate on this. We've also added [Photoshop guidance](https://brandfolder.com/s/pt1owb-4cbgqg-fa0duv?fbclid=IwAR3_f4cbWmBsmi_xnrXu7uaox4rCvZYt8AQSSJD3P-t96crdvszDg_ezUWQ) in our Customer Resource Center and Admin Panel to help you align your cover photos more easily.
* **Contrast on the navigation bar**: We have heard your feedback and will continue to experiment with the contrast on the navigation bar on the left. Please note the end product might have a slightly different color on the bar from what you have today.
* **Schedule your launch: **Today, we‚Äôre starting to roll out a scheduler for your launch. By tomorrow, admins will be able to see a date selector in the Admin Panel (under ‚ÄúThe new Workplace"). You'll be able to reschedule your move, if you'd like your organization to transition to the new experience before August 5. Please note that, to simplify the experience, we are only giving one time as a default for the change. For example, if an Admin picks July 6, everyone in the organization will be moved to the new experience at the very beginning of July 6 (based on the admin's time zone). A few other things to note:
   * You will be responsible for communicating to your organization that the change is happening. On the day of the move, everyone will simply see the on-boarding screens at the time of the move.
   * You will only be able to modify this time up to 24 hours before the change is due to happen
   * After the move, people will no longer be able to switch between the two experiences
* **Tracking your organization's move: **We are working on providing analytics for how the move in your organization is going. This is our priority at the moment and we hope to have an update for you on this topic in the next week or so.

If you encounter any challenges or would like to share feedback, please contact our Support team for quick assistance.

Thank you for your on-going feedback and partnership in this exciting new stage!

# NEW: "Connected Leadership, powered by Brunswick" research

Today, our Workplace partner - Brunswick Group - published its inaugural Connected Leadership research which measures the demand for leadership communications through proprietary research and provides insight into how leaders are engaging using a one-of-a-kind index that maps where S&P 500 and FTSE 350 CEOs are active online. 
## KEY FINDINGS:
* Nearly half (48%) of S&P 500 and FTSE 350 CEOs now have a social media presence
* Yet only one in four have posted within the past year
* 2 to 1 employees would prefer to work for a CEO that uses digital and social media as part of their work
* 93% of employees consider ‚Äúleadership that communicates directly and transparently with employees‚Äù to be important in deciding to stay at their company
* People are 3 times more engaged with Connected Leaders on Instagram than Facebook and Twitter
## HOW CAN YOU USE THIS RESEARCH?

Research like this always strengthens the argument for why Executive visibility and accessibility is so important both internally and externally. We will also be hosting a couple of webinars in July, so that you can delve further unto the findings. Stay tuned for dates!
## CONGRATULATIONS!

And finally a massive congratulations to our four Workplace customers who feature in the Top 100 Connected Leadership Index üëèüëè
* #1 - Doug Mcmillon at Walmart
* #10 - Ed Bastian at Delta 
* #17 - Kevin Johnson at Starbucks
* #54 - Francis Desouza at Illumina 
# [Download the full report here](https://www.brunswickgroup.com/connectedleadership/)

# The new Workplace experience

Hi all! Earlier today, we had reports of some people not being able to access the new experience.

I can confirm everyone should be able to check it out. Thank you for your patience! 

--

**Update:**

We've received feedback around some people not seeing the prompt to try out the new experience. We understand you've put a log of effort into preparing your organization for the move so appreciate the frustration.

As mentioned in our communications, as of June 5, users are able to access the new experience by going to Quick Help on the top right of the Classic screen (can be found through ‚Äú?‚Äù > scrolling to the bottom of the menu). They have also started being prompted to try out the new experience within their News Feed.

We appreciate that this information might have been confusing as not everyone in your community gets a prompt on their News Feed at the same time. We use a streamlined system for announcements on Workplace to avoid over-saturation of information. In many cases, the new experience will be the most important announcement we highlight, but not in all cases.

We understand people in your community might be asking you why they haven't seen the prompt yet and we invite you to share this information with them. There will also be users who will have seen the prompt already (which we imagine are not reaching out to you since they expected this to be the case).

We appreciate your feedback and apologize for the inconvenience caused by this confusion.

# Granular control of Workplace notifications
## You asked... we listened!

Notifications are important for engagement on Workplace and each user has different preferences of what to be notified about, where and when. Now, you can manage all your Workplace notifications per Group, tags, Workplace Chat with granular controls in one place. We simplified the user interface that will help people understand how they can change the notifications they receive e.g. email or push notifications as well as for what conversations e.g. Workplace Groups posts, tags etc.

## How does it work?

Users will be able to access these settings by going into their user settings > Notifications. There are seven categories of Notifications that you can set up separately, changing Onsite, Push and Email preferences. The Groups activity category is even more functional: there you can find the list of all groups you are member in and tailor your settings for each group.

## WheN does this launch?

This is already available for everyone on Workplace.

## Where can I found out more?

Check out the [Blog post](https://www.workplace.com/workplace/blog/new-notification-controls) and [Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/1597364750505216?helpref=search&sr=4&query=notifications) for answers to all your product questions. If you have any questions that are not answered below, feel free to reach out to your Workplace team or Workplace Support for assistance.

# The Open Access period for the new Workplace experience starts Wednesday, June 5!
> **Disclaimer: **Long post ahead! We cover a reminder on key dates, how we're addressing your main feedback and new resources (including translations & more webinars) for you to share with your org

On April 30, we announced a [new web design for Workplace](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/new-experience) to make it easier for people to connect, collaborate and get work done. Until now, only Workplace Premium admins and Workplace Standard users have had access to this new design. 

**Starting Wednesday June 5 at 4AM (Pacific time), 12PM (UTC/UK), 1PM (Central European Time), 7PM (Singapore), 8PM (Japan), all Workplace users will have access to the new Workplace experience*. **As a reminder, on August 5, everyone will automatically enter into the new experience and will be unable to switch between the two interfaces.

**Note: Users will be able to access the new experience on June 5 by going to Quick Help on the top right of the Classic screen (can be found through ‚Äú?‚Äù > scrolling to the bottom of the menu). Starting June 5, they will start to be prompted to try out the new experience within their News Feed.*
 
## Taking your feedback on board

We are extremely grateful for your positive reaction and the feedback you've given us during this Admin Preview period.
> Love the new design
> I really like the new notifications settings, I've spent a lot of time explaining how customizing notifications from both mobile and desktop now seems really easier and clearer.
> I love the ability to minimize the side menus! 
> Gotta say, I'm not sure I was in love with it at first sight but after getting to play with it today, I'm warming up to it fast. It definitely feels like there's less clutter overall in my face.

We have been listening to the feedback you've shared: through this group, through our Support team, your Workplace team, and other channels. We'd like to give you an update of what we've heard and how we're addressing some of the main asks we've heard.
> Will there be any guidelines on what format we should use for the cover pics?
> It feels like there is a lot of empty space
> I want to see my company logo at any time

A few themes have emerged about what you'd love to see in the new interface. Here's how we're incorporating popular topics:
* **Group cover photos:** We heard two pieces of feedback, 1) the cover photos felt too large and 2) existing cover photos were no longer the right size. First, we tested a pre-collapsed group cover photo which many of you didn't love. So we're reverting back to the large sizing this week and will continue to iterate so this does not take up precious space. Second, because the new design provides edge-to-edge cover photos, the dimensions are different. We've put together a Sketch file and PNG (in our resources below) to help you align your cover photos more easily!
* **White space: **The new layout provides a cleaner and fresher look, but we appreciate that the look might be *too clean *especially when viewed on large screens. We have made some adjustments but this area will take a bit longer for us to tackle, as we want to get it right. Please bear with us as we make improvements.
* **Company logo: **Having a more prominent organization logo was appreciated in the Classic design. We are exploring design options to make sure you feel like Workplace is *your space*. 
* **‚ÄúSaved posts‚Äù, ‚ÄúEvents‚Äù and more: **To match the clean look of the new design, tools like Org Chart, Saved posts and others are located in the Home page. To make sure everyone can find them, we're making the ‚ÄúSee More‚Äù button in the ‚ÄúExplore‚Äù section much more prominent this week. We'll continue to iterate on this based on your feedback.
* **Bot discovery: **You've developed many bots for your organization to use. We've brought ‚ÄúBots‚Äù into the Home page, under people. You can now surface all the bots you've developed in a few clicks.
* **Contrast on the navigation bar**: We've heard feedback that an all white navigational bar makes it difficult to distinguish the navigation from the content ‚Äî especially when the sidebar is collapsed. We're experimenting with a variety of visual treatments to increase the contrast.
* **Schedule your launch: **We know it's important to you to have control over when your company fully transitions to the new experience. We're building a tool in the admin panel which would allow you to pick the launch date at which point everyone within your company will be opted-into the new experience without the option to opt out. 
* **Tracking your organization's move: **We know you care about numbers! Over the coming week, we'll add some measurement so you know what proportion of your organization has moved to the new experience.

We will continue to improve the new experience: this is only the beginning! For now, we wanted to let you know how we're addressing your main feedback so you can share with your community as the Open Access period starts.
 
## Resources to on-board your organization

We'd like to make sure you have access to useful resources for your organization's on-boarding. *(Please use en_US or en_GB for now, as we finalize page translations.)*
* See the [Admin educational materials](https://work.facebook.com/work/admin/) or the [community resources](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/new-experience) to prepare your organization for the new Workplace experience
   * *We are adding more live webinars in case you want to share with your organization too (feedback on these has been overwhelmingly positive)*
   * *We are also providing the Admin Guide and Leadership two-pagers in Spanish, Portuguese and French*
   * *We are including guidance for group cover photos* *(soon to include Photoshop)* 
* Check out the [Workplace Quick Start Guide for non-admins](https://brandfolder.com/s/ps7z8y-adyels-5hlkro)
* Take a look at the [on-boarding experience for non-admins](https://brandfolder.com/s/ps6p5z-g2t6w0-dxnwv) (video)
* Review our [Help Center FAQ](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/332823210704895) or take a [look at what's changed](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/new-experience) on the Customer Resource Center

**Thank you for your continued partnership.** We will continue to listen to your feedback and innovate together on Workplace.

# [**IABC World Conference 2019 **](http://www.iabc.com/)

IABC (International Association of Business Communicators) World Summit is one of the key annual events for comms practitioners.  The 2018 event attracted over 1300 comms professionals from 36 countries.

# The New Customer Resource Center is Live! fb.me/crc
## Happy Friday everyone!

The [Customer Resource Center](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources) has a new look and loads of new content to help you get more out of Workplace!

New additions include:
* [Getting Started guides](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/getting-started): to walk you through launching Workplace or using Workplace as a new user or admin. 
* [Ways to Work in Workplace](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/ways-to-work): Learn how to empower your existing workflows by bringing them into Workplace. We have content on using Workplace for Employee Comms and Building Culture and will be adding even more soon!
* [Videos](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/videos): Learning videos you can download and share with your Workplace community.
* [Trainings and Webinars](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/training): Register to learn directly from Workplace experts.
* [Communities](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/communities): Learn about more MCGs and gain new insights from other organizations on Workplace.
* [Events](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/events/transform): Find out about Workplace events in cities near you.

This is only the beginning for the CRC. The Workplace Customer Education team is busy creating even more content and there will be regular content drops and updates going forward. Explore it today! fb.me/crc

[And for more information on the CRC update check out our blog!](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/blog/new-customer-resource-center/)

This multi company group is a place for Workplace company admins to connect with other Admins on Workplace.

This is your community so while the Workplace team is here to facilitate conversations, we want this to be your place to connect with one another, ask questions, share events, best practices and Workplace success stories.
story: Abby Guthkelch updated the description of the group Workplace Admins Community.

message:
# Welcome to the Workplace Admins Group

The Workplace team is excited to connect you with other Admins on Workplace.
## BUILDING MEANINGFUL CONNECTIONS

This is your community so while the Workplace team is here to facilitate conversations, we want this to be your place to connect with one another, ask questions, share events, best practices and Workplace success stories.

**KEY RESOURCES**
* [`Customer Resource Center](https://www.fb.me/crc):` Our resource hub that provides you access to turnkey resources and materials
* [`Workplace Training and Webinars:](https://www.fb.me/WorkplaceLearn) `Join the Workplace team as we educate you on ways you can work in Workplace
* [`Workplace Getting Started](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/getting-started): `New user and admin guides; as well as launch materials, including logos and customisable assets
* [`Workplace video library:`](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/videos) Learning videos you can download and share with your Workplace community.

# Automatic Group Membership Restoration for Reactivated Accounts

Groups are a key channel for people collaborate and communicate on Workplace. User management is important to ensure only the right people have access to those groups. Sometimes, accounts are deactivated by mistake and people are removed from their groups, even when promptly reactivated. Starting this week, group membership will be restored when an account is reactivated within 14 days of deactivation. 

## **How does it work?**

Workplace now stores group membership and admin permissions for accounts deactivated up to 14 days prior. If a user is reactivated within 14 days of deactivation, their group membership(s) will be automatically restored, except for deleted groups. For multi-company groups, Workplace will automatically send join requests. If users were group admins, their admin controls will also be restored.

To help admins have a clearer view on recently deleted accounts and the actions they may take, a new ‚ÄúRecently deleted‚Äù section in the Members section in a group has been added. This allows admins to view all accounts deleted in the last 14 days and decide if they'd like to reactivate or permanently remove these accounts from a group.  

## **Where can I find out more?**

For more information, please visit our [Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/388939947962173?helpref=search&sr=1&query=deactivate) or contact your Workplace team.

# Take time to recharge with scheduled Do Not Disturb

We've added the ability to schedule Do Not Disturb helping you to strike a better work life balance. Workplace helps you to feel more connected than ever while working from anywhere, but that doesn't mean you should always be connected. Do Not Disturb signals to others when you're not available and mutes incoming chats, video and voice calls when you're busy or away. And now you can create a recurring do not disturb schedule after work and on your days off to make sure you're taking time to disconnect and recharge. 

## HOW DOES IT WORK?

To set a do not disturb schedule, click on your profile image in the lower left hand corner of Workplace and click Do Not Disturb then Do Not Disturb Schedule. If you are using the old Workplace design, go to Workplace Chat and click the gear icon then Do Not Disturb. You can choose the full days that you want Do Not Disturb enabled and the schedule you want enabled for every other day of the week. In addition to your schedule, you can always enable do not disturb when you want some time to focus. 

## When is it launching?

This feature is launching on May 23rd and will be gradually be available to all companies in the coming weeks.

## WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE?

Check out the [Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/2151769891708621) for more detail or reach out to Workplace Support if you have any other questions or feedback.

# Attribute mapping with Azure AD and GSuite

We're launching a new native IDP integration setup flow with Azure and GSuite, which will allow you to map profile attributes from Azure AD or GSuite to Workplace. This means that you can now more easily manage Workplace users with Azure AD and GSuite without having to leave Workplace.
## How does it work?

Once you connect Azure AD or GSuite to your Workplace community, we will automatically keep accounts in sync so that if people join or leave, Workplace will be instantly updated.
## Where can I find out more?

You can find more information about this feature in the [Help Centre article](https://www.workplace.com/help/work/2037569539804116).

# Introducing the Workplace Status Page

With Workplace, we aim to provide a powerful and reliable platform to connect with your colleagues and get work done. Though we strive to ensure Workplace is always available when you need it, sometimes things aren't working as expected and we want to make it as easy as possible for you to stay up to date as we work to resolve them. 

The new [Workplace Status page](https://www.workplace.com/workplace/status) will do just that. Our public status page will provide frequent updates on any widespread issues affecting our product. 
## **How does it work?**

If there is a product issue, our Enterprise Operations team will create an entry on the status page and provide updates until the issue is resolved. The status page will indicate the part of the product that is affected, details on what is not working and when the issue began. Check it out now at [workplace.com/workplace/status](https://www.workplace.com/workplace/status).

If you have questions, you can learn more at our [Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/429033581256438) or reach out to Workplace Support.

# File Collaboration Made Easier - Enjoy more flexibility in sharing files how and when you want to.

Content is at the heart of collaboration and the ability to share and discover the right content is an important part of that. 

Today, we are introducing a few exciting new features that make sharing and discovering files easier, more flexible and more efficient. These features include:
* Attaching multiple files in a post from desktop and/or cloud providers e.g. Dropbox, Box, Sharepoint, OneDrive and Google Drive.
* Adding files to comments
* Native Microsoft Sharepoint and OneDrive, and Google Drive file pickers.
* Linking folders to a group.
* Improved Files tab on the [new Workplace experience](https://www.workplace.com/workplace/blog/introducing-the-new-workplace-experience/) announced at F8 last week.

## How does it work?
* **Greater flexibility on file sharing**: Sharing multiple files from various sources with your colleagues is often necessary to get work done. Now with improved file sharing, you'll be able to attach up to 6 files in a post, which can be from your desktop and/or from your integrated cloud providers. These files can be a mix of file types as well.
* **Share files right where the conversation happens: **conversations and workflows get disrupted when files need to be sent or found separately from where the discussions happen. You can now attach files to comments, and link folder to a group for easy references.
* **More intuitive file sharing experience: **New native Google/Microsoft integration file pickers provide an experience similar to native applications, making locating and attaching files faster and easier.
* **Easy discovery of shared files in groups: **Thousands of files are shared in groups every day, and we don't always remember in which post to locate a file. The newly improved Files tab allows you to quickly browse and locate all files shared in the group, all in one place.
* **Keep your information safe:** Connecting your Workplace instance to a cloud storage provider and sharing files on Workplace respects the permissions set in your cloud storage provider so that only the right people have access to the information.

## Where can I find out more?

We have put together resources to help your organization prepare for file collaboration. Please take a look at the links below. If you have any questions that are not answered below, feel free to reach out to your Workplace team or Workplace Support for assistance.
* [Blog post](https://www.workplace.com/workplace/blog/collaborating-on-files-just-got-even-better)
* [Adding multiple files to a post](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/771868409863951?helpref=search&sr=2&query=multiple+f)
* [Linking folders from a cloud storage service to a group on Workplace](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/224249971489848?helpref=search&sr=2&query=folder)
* [Adding files to comments](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/346695569489064?helpref=uf_permalink)

# Making it easier to find what you need on Chat

Chat is central to the way we communicate and work today, but it can quickly become a noisy space. Workplace Chat helps you focus on what's important with the new unread line & shared content tab. These features will be available to everyone over the next couple weeks.
## **HOW DOES IT WORK?**

The new shared content tab lets you easily rediscover files, photos and videos shared within a chat conversation in one central place. Just go to the menu of any chat you are a part to find shared content.When you open a chat thread you are now brought to the last message you read in the conversation. A divider line will also be shown indicating the number of unread messages you have. These improvements are the first of several upcoming Workplace Chat enhancements!
## **WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE?**

If you have questions or feedback, please [reach out to Workplace Support](https://futurework.facebook.com/work/admin/?section=direct_support&ref=contextual) or your Workplace team.

# Introducing a new Workplace experience

Today, we're announcing a new web design for Workplace to make it easier for people to connect, collaborate and get work done. The new Workplace design **retains its familiar user experience** and makes it **easier for people to connect and collaborate**. 
## **Learning resources **
* [Join our webinar](https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/rt/6212274080229790221) on the new Workplace experience
* Read more about these changes in our [blog post](https://www.workplace.com/workplace/blog/introducing-the-new-workplace-experience)
* See the [Admin educational materials](https://futurework.facebook.com/work/admin/) or the [user resources](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/new-experience) to prepare your organization for the new Workplace experience
## **How does it work?**

The new Workplace experience will be available to you when logging into Workplace on a desktop computer, according to the availability timeline outlined below. We've also included a preview video below.Those who are already using this new Workplace are really loving it. The main benefits of the new Workplace experience are that you can:
* **Reliably get the information you need: **The new navigation makes it easy to switch between Workplace Groups, Notifications and Chat. The new notifications view helps you stay on top of your notifications by displaying them as an inbox and enables you to filter them based on your preferences. You also have more granular controls over your notifications. Ultimately, it's now much faster to check and act on your notifications.
* **Get work done with fewer distractions: **Groups are where people get work done. So now they are much more prominent and make it easy to keep track of the groups you've joined, to re-order your shortcuts, and to navigate to the groups that are most important to you. You can also collapse both the navigation and the right-hand column to focus on the content you care about. And because it's faster, you'll spend less time waiting for a page to load.
* **Easily find and connect with people: **The home page leverages the machine learning elements of the [work graph](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/workplace/reference/graph-api/) to focus on the people and groups closest to you. You can find what you need in the Home tab and if you're working on a Teams & Project group, you can switch between the ‚ÄúPosts‚Äù and the ‚ÄúChat‚Äù tabs easily to make sure everyone's on the same page. You can also use the redesigned files tab to organize your work on Workplace. This means fewer clicks to find someone, to start a chat, or to connect your groups and chats.
## **When is this launching?**

*This timeline applies to Workplace Premium. For Workplace Standard, check out our [Help Center FAQ](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/332823210704895). *
* **April 30: **Admins in existing Workplace communities will have access to the new design. As an admin, you'll be able to switch between the existing and new designs to become familiar with them. 
   * We know sharing updates with your users is important. We have put together a **quick introductory video** to our new design, a **guide highlighting the changes** we have made, **messaging you can share** to explain what this means for everyone in your organization and a **leadership one-pager** highlighting the key benefits of this change. You can find these educational resources in your [Admin Panel](https://futurework.facebook.com/work/admin/), under ‚ÄúThe new Workplace experience‚Äù.
* **June 5: **Users will gain access to the new Workplace experience. They will be prompted to check it out and, upon joining, see a quick animation highlighting the changes. They will able to switch between the existing and new designs for a few weeks. 
* **Week of August 5: **All users will automatically enter into the new Workplace design. They will no longer be able to switch between the two interfaces. By August 9th, all users will have moved to the new design.

**Please note: **Admins will have the ability to switch 100% of their organization to the new design at any point between June 5 and August 9. This will be available on the Admin Panel, alongside the educational resources.
## **Where can I find out more?**

Attend our upcoming [webinar](https://l.workplace.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fregister.gotowebinar.com%2Frt%2F6212274080229790221&h=AT3VkHpABbNZ9c8w-AOo_I_S3k8Oga6RPykJO7Es6gNb9VipHs0GFhxrKdz0jHKespvqLiQfakCnpVOdxZXvODhfbc9O2OAFQ6rar_JR7-y650X72xuo15WbVQaDvcgoORjKYKctxG5ExZ0rE1bgBRapUHPskxWn_KpX4g) to learn how the new Workplace experience can change the way your organization works. You can also review our [Help Center FAQ](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/332823210704895) or take a [look at what's changed](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/new-experience) on the Customer Resource Center.

# Add descriptions to your group chats

You can now add descriptions to your group chat threads making it easy for group chat members to understand the purpose of your chat and get up to speed quickly.

Use chat descriptions to help make your chat threads more purposeful and useful. Share key links, answers to common questions or just a brief overview of what the thread is for. Chat descriptions can be added to any chat with 3 or more people on the web, desktop app, iOS and Android apps. The ability to add chat descriptions is rolling out to everyone over the next few days.
