# Move your community to workplace.com today

Premium communities can now move to the workplace.com domain from facebook.com. 
## **How does my community move to workplace.com ?**

For Workplace Premium customers, a setting is now added to the ‚ÄúPreferences‚Äù section of the Admin Panel allowing system admins to enable the setting to move all Workplace users to the workplace.com domain when ready. You can make the decision to move to workplace.com at your own pace. We will begin requiring all customers to move over in about 6 months. *If you are on Workplace Standard, your community will be automatically moved to workplace.com on May 8th.* 
## **How should my community prepare for the move?**

People should not notice any difference when moved to workplace.com except that the url to access Workplace will change from company.facebook.com to company.workplace.com. We will continue to redirect from facebook.com to workplace.com for the foreseeable future.  However, below are the changes we recommend in preparation for when we no longer support the facebook.com domain.
* From a non-technical perspective, if your community has custom training documents or many published links with facebook domain, we recommend updating these. We will continue redirecting for now so this does not need to be done immediately. Once you move to workplace.com, everyone should update their mobile apps to the most recent version. 
* From a tech perspective, SSO and API configurations do not need to be updated and can remain as-is for the time being, however if you would like to change these URLs over please read the Q&A below. 
## **Where can I learn more?**

We have put together resources to help your organization prepare for the move to the Workplace domain. Please take a look at the links below. If you have any questions that are not answered below, feel free to reach out to your Workplace team or Workplace Support for assistance.
* [Customer Resource Center: Preparing for the move to the Workplace domain](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/deepen/prepare-community-workplace-domain)
* [Workplace Domain Change Q&A](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/1519603854842191)

# Managing data access for integrations you've enabled on Workplace

Workplace Premium communities are in control of their data and can see which third parties have access to it too. The Integrations page on the Admin Panel makes it easy to track the level of access for integrations enabled on Workplace. To make sure that integrations only have access to the necessary permissions to function and deliver value, we are launching regular pruning of permissions for custom integrations through the Admin Panel, **starting Monday, March 25**.
 
## How does it work?

For a custom integration access token, data access permissions that have not been used in the last 30 days will be revoked and instance admins notified on Workplace. This means System Admins will see signalling in product (within the Integrations Permissions page, in the Admin Panel) when the permissions for a custom integration have been changed as a result of this process.
 
## Where can I fInd out more?

We are here to help! Take a look at our [Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/557801544591282) or reach out to your Workplace team.

# Move to workplace.com beginning March 25th

As we shared a few months ago, we will be moving Workplace by Facebook to workplace.com from facebook.com. Workplace has rapidly grown into a prominent collaboration platform used by companies around the globe. One of the top requests from our customers is to make it more clear that Workplace accounts are completely separate from Facebook accounts. In moving to workplace.com, we not only clarify that we are a separate product, but also identify as a unique platform of the Facebook family like Instagram, Oculus and WhatsApp. 

On March 25, 2019, we will allow any premium customer to move to workplace.com. 

**How does my community move to workplace.com ?**

If you are an admin of a premium community, on March 25th, a setting will be added to the ‚ÄúPreferences‚Äù section of the Admin Panel allowing system admins to enable the setting to move all Workplace users to the workplace.com domain when ready. You can make the decision to move to workplace.com at your own pace. We will begin requiring all customers to move over in about 6 months.

If you are in a standard community, your community will be moved over to workplace.com on May 8th.

**How should my community prepare for the move?**

People should not notice any difference when moved to workplace.com except that the url to access Workplace will change from company.facebook.com to company.workplace.com. We will continue to redirect from facebook.com to workplace.com for the foreseeable future. 

However, below are the changes we recommend in preparation for when we no longer support the facebook.com domain.
* From a non-technical perspective, if your community has custom training documents or many published links with facebook domain, we recommend updating these. We will continue redirecting for now so this does not need to be done immediately. Once you move to workplace.com, everyone should update their mobile apps.
* From a tech perspective, SSO configuration and API configurations do not need to be updated and can remain as-is for the time being, however there are options if you wish to change these URLs over. Please see the Q&A link below.

**Where can I learn more?**

We have put together resources to help your organization prepare for the move to the Workplace domain. Please take a look at the links below. If you have any questions that are not answered, feel free to reach out to your Workplace team or Workplace Support for assistance.
* [Customer Resource Center: Preparing for the move](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/deepen/prepare-community-workplace-domain)
* [Workplace Domain Change Q&A](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/1519603854842191)

# Workplace service is fully restored

Following yesterday's partial Workplace outage issues, Workplace is now back up and running. 

Beginning on March 13, 2019 at approximately 16:00 GMT, Workplace and other Facebook apps and services began experiencing access issues. People had trouble accessing or reliably using Workplace globally. During this time, some users may not have been able to successfully post, comment or react. Our engineering teams immediately began working to mitigate this. They identified that people were unable to access our apps and services due to a server configuration change that triggered a cascading series of issues. These issues are now resolved.

We would like to clarify a few common questions we received. Firstly, we can confirm that there was no external attack on our system. Secondly, Workplace is set up and runs differently than Facebook but shares some common infrastructure with the Facebook family of apps - multiple Facebook services suffered from partial outages due to a configuration issue across this common infrastructure. 

The reliability of our product is incredibly important to us and we sincerely apologize for the disruption this caused your business. Please don't hesitate to reach out to your Workplace team or Workplace Support if you have any questions.

# Workplace access issues fixed & service recovering

Our engineers have now identified and implemented a fix for the issues we experienced yesterday (March 13th). Access to Workplace and other Facebook apps and services is now being restored, but our systems are still recovering. We will share an update when Workplace is fully back up and running for everyone.

# Workplace Access Issues

People are currently having trouble accessing Workplace and other Facebook apps. This issue has been ongoing and we‚Äôre focused on resolving it as soon as possible.

There has also been some inaccurate media speculation that this is a DDoS attack; we can confirm that this is not the case. 

Thank you for your patience. We will share an update once we have more information.

[Stay updated in the **Workplace by Facebook Product Announcements** group here](https://fb.me/g/1UuNFlkLQ/4YJtNJlk)

Introducing our new System Admin Fundamentals live, virtual class!

Sign up for our 90 minute live, virtual "System Admin Fundamentals" to learn the ins and outs of the Admin Panel and key Workplace decisions only System Admins can make that impact your whole organization. You'll also learn how critical technical considerations can impact engagement on Workplace. 

Our first sessions begin in March!  [Register here](http://content.fb.com/eH1WSB01000VP90NeMsDU07) before sessions fill up!

# Customizable Admin Roles 

We are excited to share that we have rebuilt Workplace admin roles and permissions to be more flexible, clear and easy to use. The *Administrators* tab in the Admin Panel has been completely redesigned. This was a top request from many of our Workplace system administrators.

**How does it work?**

System admins will now see two sections in the *Administrators* tab: Admins and Roles. 

On the Admins tab, system admins can view all admins and add, remove or edit any admin's access. 

On the Roles tab, system admins can combine different admin permissions to create custom roles. 

The four admin roles in product today will remain as preset roles. There will be no change to your existing admins' roles.

**When is this launching?**

The new Administrators tab will begin launching today and **will be available gradually to all Workplace communities within the coming weeks**. Remember, this feature is only accessible by System Administrators.

**Where can I find out more?**

We are here to help! To learn more you can check out our [Help Center](https://fb.intern.facebook.com/help/work/357197298207498) or reach out to Support.

story: Julien Codorniou changed the name of the group "Workplace VIPs FYI" to "Workplace Admins FYI (MCG)".

message: This multi company group is a place for Workplace company admins to be in the know of all the latest product releases and stay in touch with the Workplace teams at Facebook and other admins from companies who also deployed Workplace.
story: Julien Codorniou updated the description of the group Workplace Admins Community.

message:
# Upload multiple files from your cloud storage provider

File sharing is an important part of collaboration. With an improved Google Drive* integration, and others like Box, Dropbox and Quip, users in communities with these integrations can easily share multiple documents as part of a post. Navigate through folders until you find the right files (up to six) and keep the documents and conversation in one place, on Workplace. 
 

**Improved SharePoint and OneDrive content integrations coming soon.*
 
## How does it work?

Click on the post composer within a Workplace Group and select your organisation's content integration*, like Google Drive. A new window will open up and show your folders and sub-folders so you can pick the right files (up to six files). You can also share multiple cloud provider file URL links into a post as attachments. The familiar interface will be intuitive and easy to use.
 

**Please note that a user will only be able to see integrations which have been enabled by a System Admin. If you already had the integration(s) enabled, no action by the System Admin is needed to show the new Google Drive file picker. *
 
## When is it launching?

The ability to upload a multiple files from Cloud providers will be available starting February 12 to all Workplace Premium and Standard users.
 
## Where can I find out more?

We are here to help! Take a look at our [Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/166279977397367/) or reach out to your Workplace team.

# [**Join us for our latest Workplace by HR Webinar - "How to Scale Recruiting with Workplace by Facebook"**](https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/rt/2710712174535086082)

[**Featuring SPECIAL GUEST: Nikita Bhappu, *Director of Public Relations and Social Media, Valet Living - February 28th, 10:00 AM EST***](https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/rt/2710712174535086082)

Recruiting is everybody's job. Workplace helps you recruit faster, become more transparent, share best practices, and cut down the time it takes to move from sourcing to offer. We believe every single person in your organization is a recruiter and Workplace helps operationalize it at scale.  

Please join me in our ***February Webinar Series***, to learn some simple, pragmatic and actionable steps to help you:
* Crowdsource top talent through recruiters and employee referrals 
* Significantly reduce recruiting cycle time by connecting everyone 
* Improve quality of hire by closing the feedback loop with recruiters and hiring managers
* Measure, monitor and share your recruiting analytics 
# Please [**REGISTER **](https://l.workplace.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fattendee.gotowebinar.com%2Frt%2F2710712174535086082&h=AT3ZUzv8gaMBVTjURfADSNKNe6BSANOmIXleu_CTA0Xvx5cdIGbYvSbttaXVG6k_QlXfjND4vpzYM1R3fG_1zTjmFfDVeNbUAW_w-j1REQsobqI8QyUyem5SCNnOOBPsbKC33GT71YFpeyGcHTQHADXcCj4j65iCrKSDHzH6KQ)for any one of the webinar sessions being offered all through February. 

For a preview of what you'll learn in this series, we encourage you to join the [**Workplace for HR Customer Community**](https://fb.me/g/2ALGfF4PY/258GOOLd).

# Safety Check for Workplace

The power of [Safety Check](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/features/safety-check) is now available on Workplace, bringing work communities together in times of crisis.

Safety Check is a new way for organizations to send notifications to employees and take action on their responses in real-time. 

Though we hope you never have to use Safety Check, you now have the power to connect with employees across the world in case an emergency arises. Safety Check is now available to all premium Workplace customers.

Since Workplace is already the place people go to stay informed, many customers like T-ROC and AstraZeneca have seen great value in integrating it into employee safety programs. [We've put together a guide](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources/deepen/employee-safety) to up-leveling your employee safety program with Workplace - which includes best practices for implementing Safety Check.

**How do I get started?**

To enable Safety Check, a system admin must go to the **Admin Panel** and navigate to the **Safety Check **section.

The admin will be able to enable Safety Check and add Safety Operators to assist.

**Where can I find out more about Safety Check?**

Take a look at our [blog post](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/blog/employee-safety/) to learn more about how [Safety Check for Workplace](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/features/safety-check) can change the way your organization handles crises. Or get your product questions answered in our [Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/2256383427974038?helpref=uf_permalink).

# Go Live in an Event

Live video is one of the most powerful and engaging ways of interacting on Workplace. Before today, Live video was only available within a group or on timeline. Today, we're introducing the ability to stream Live into an event so you can reach a specific audience, maximizing attendee experience and minimizing disruption for other group members. 
## How does it work?

Simply go into a Workplace event. On the post composer, you'll see a new option ‚ÄúLive Video‚Äù. Click on it and select the source for your live. Click ‚ÄúGo Live‚Äù and you're all set!

*Similar to when you stream into a group, you can [connect Workplace to various sources](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/1768107193412135?helpref=uf_permalink) to enhance your viewers' experience.*
## When is it launching?

The ability to go Live in Events is available to all Workplace Premium and Standard users starting today.
## Where can I find out more?

We are here to help! Take a look at our [Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/374466826682701) or reach out to your Workplace team.

## **WORKPLACE STRATEGY SERIES**
# [**Using Workplace as a People Manager**](https://brandfolder.com/s/pmf8vu-56wvyw-b3vodm)

The people on Workplace are the heart and soul of the tool. Without a connected community, Workplace just plain doesn't work. People managers are in a unique position to influence others on Workplace by leading by example. 

In our latest Workplace strategy video, you'll learn best practices on how you can use Workplace as a people manager. 
## **WHO CAN BENEFIT FROM THIS VIDEO?**

Everyone! While the video is geared towards people managers, anyone can benefit from these best practices. 
## **HOW SHOULD I USE THIS VIDEO?**

Post it in your Company FYI group (or equivalent group) to educate your community on how they can use Workplace as a people manager. These are super simple best practices anyone can implement today. 
# [**Download the video here**](https://brandfolder.com/s/pmf8vu-56wvyw-b3vodm)
## **ARE THERE OTHER VIDEOS?**

Yes! You can see the full collection of our [strategy series videos here](https://brandfolder.com/s/pmf8bs-5vwfgg-1n8kob). The Workplace team will also share tips and best practices over the next few weeks on ways you can use these videos.

[Download all videos here](https://l.workplace.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fbrandfolder.com%2Fs%2Fpmf8bs-5vwfgg-1n8kob&h=AT3rQcqkibKjLDW6pjVgRJHtnobT_7Ok1Ww19C-qKgYsJoNXzYMCYKamoAts9mZaZg05pvA0s_Z16_H04mFIOy1Bvn9ZoEV3Y1RvTN-zHZ4AKSohdp0bFy1eFdrAxCprVGoPL7pjdH8uvKIsX6sRTPzBvkmtot-t2hcprQcQRg)
## **HOW CAN I STAY UP TO DATE ON NEW LEARNING ASSETS MADE BY THE WORKPLACE TEAM?**
1. First step is being a member of this group. So good job!
1. [Second is signing up to receive our education emails here](https://l.workplace.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fgo.fb.com%2Fworkplace-updates-signup.html&h=AT0OqbXFeAx8nvrcNjh_1AhabYie3YEHPpa-Qb6YoacNrWJYolrvmGRpzkxSZU9pGDQLttWJMVcoqtNwvWQvyA3VqKOYHZC0iskeklKySjf3NS7i2iafuEmgyRxQXjDXPeQZ3Ib5rVV2jbZXsSnfthYcpWH0xscJCr7Y7vXZ2g).

# Improvements to Reporting Content on Workplace

Reporting content is an important way for Workplace communities to moderate together and build a safe and engaging place to work. 

We have added new features to make this process better. People can now report comments in addition to posts. We have also updated the reasons for reporting a post and now allow you to provide your own reason if preferred. This will help Workplace admins make a more informed decision on how to respond.

**How does it work?**

To report a post or comment on Workplace, go to the ‚Äú...‚Äù menu and select *Report post* or *Report this comment*. If you select ‚ÄúI don't think this should be on Workplace‚Äù you will have the option to hide all posts from that person or report the post or comment to the Workplace admin team. Now when you decide to report to your admin, you will be able to choose from a list of options or provide a custom reason.

**Where can I find out more?**

We are here to help! Take a look at our [Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/351883618534615?helpref=uf_permalink) or reach out to your Workplace team.

# Vodafone deployed Workplace to their 130,000 employees

Cannot be more excited to share this news with you today. Vodafone, one of the largest telecommunications groups in the world, launched Workplace to their 130,000 employees few months ago. 

At Flow, our first Workplace global event, we had the opportunity to ask to Ronald Schellekens, CHRO, his thoughts about the platform. 
> *Workplace by Facebook makes a large company look very small because you can suddenly connect with likeminded people across the world. That‚Äôs cool. *

We are extremely proud to serve Vodafone's 130,000 employees. [More information about Vodafone story here.](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/blog/vodafone-workplace/)

Feel free to share the news :)

# Mark as Important

When you need to share important news with your company, it can be a challenge to get information to the people that need to know quickly. And ensuring that information is seen is even tougher. Workplace is changing how organizations communicate and now we are making it easier to identify the news that matters most. *All premium companies now have the ability to mark posts as important.*

**How does it work?**

Mark as important allow organizations to ensure their most important news is top of News Feed and top of mind for their employees. Any system admin or content moderator can mark a post as important.  

Track the impact of your important posts with powerful dashboards measuring reach, comments and reactions.

**Where can I find out more?**

Our [blog post](https://l.workplace.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fworkplaceblog.fb.com%2Fproduct-news%2Fmark-as-important&h=AT2VRuoviUeJH9PgOnbA2vsfB6X8XSY_cKehQ34qnkDU2WH8zZPmPNrp_lR6gWm574mHsY46mlBT0WcxI5OOVP0t7VSS0sIJXngK6Fx3pXfvj4632uqvDSZDgPuzueJVYXEPHsUvghQpVXCp6eLq4A) walks you through the details. Or get your product questions answered in our [Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/252991161966313).

# **Nestl√© chooses Workplace to deliver digital transformation for 210k employees**

Today we are pleased to announce that Nestle, the largest food company in the world is going all in on Workplace by Facebook. A couple of months ago Nestle deployed Workplace to 220,000 employees around the world.

As Filippo Catalino, Nestle Global CIO, said ¬´Using Workplace we are able to give our employees across the globe a platform to build connections ¬ª.

Thank you Nestle team for the partnership - especially Filippo, Pete and Ana for making it possible. We are extremely proud to serve you and your community.

# Attach a file to a comment
## You asked... we listened! 

Context switching can be disruptive and inefficient when you're working on a project or task. Now, with Files in Comments, you can seamlessly start and maintain a group discussion in one place. Start a conversation by posting into a Workplace group or timeline, and then keep it there as people share responses, including files.
## How does it work?

Simply click on ‚ÄúAttach a File‚Äù within the comments section of a Workplace post, and select the file you want to attach. You can include one attachment, up to 100MB in size.
## When is it launching?

The ability to upload a file within comments is now available to all Workplace Premium and Standard users.
## Where can I find out more?

We are here to help! Take a look at our [Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/346695569489064) or reach out to your Workplace team.

Workplace by Facebook was **not** impacted by the Facebook Photo API bug, announced on December 14th. For the latest information from Facebook on that issue, please read [this post](https://developers.facebook.com/blog/post/2018/12/14/notifying-our-developer-ecosystem-about-a-photo-api-bug/). Thank you!

# Updating the Workplace Chat Apps

On December 17, we will begin to roll out some exciting improvements to the Workplace Chat apps. We're going to update the layout to match the [new Messenger navigation](https://newsroom.fb.com/news/2018/10/say-hello-to-the-new-messenger-introducing-messenger-4/) launched in October, and integrate additional features to help you customize your conversations. These changes are coming for all devices and platforms.
## **HOW DOES IT WORK?**

The new Workplace Chat will maintain the same familiar interface as Messenger, including a simpler layout with tabs focused on Chats and People. It will also be possible to customize the color of chat threads.
## **WHERE CAN I FiND OUT MORE?**

We will phase in these changes over a number of weeks starting December 17, so we'll update this post with help resources once the changes begin to roll out.

# Save and organize useful Workplace posts

With so much information to consume every day at work, it's impossible to remember it all. We added collections to our saved posts tool to help you save and organize the important stuff. You can create collections based on projects or teams you're working on, subjects you're interested in or even just posts you want to save and view later. 

**How does it work?**

You can save any posts you see on Workplace to view later, like the links or videos your coworkers post and upcoming events. To do so, go to the post menu and click *Save Post*. Once you save a post, you can add it to a new or existing collection. 

To create a collection, go to **Saved** under the Explore menu and click *+ New Collection*. Name the collection and begin adding relevant posts to it. 

Within the **Saved** tab, you can view your saved posts, organize saved posts into collections and adjust your settings to determine the reminders you'll receive about saved posts. 

**When does this launch?**

The update to Saved will begin rolling out today and will be available for everyone on Workplace in one week.

**Where can I found out more?**

Check out the [Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/2138517396167335?helpref=uf_permalink) for answers to all your product questions.

## **NEW WORKPLACE WEBINAR**
# [**How to Build a Culture of Recognition Using Workplace by Facebook**](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fregister.gotowebinar.com%2Frt%2F351463685119620353%3Fsource%3DMCG&h=AT1L0msVXZObLcnVqXokcZNowqkX_RE0gb727eyKHL5XaxFNyPBM-5WDx-A3kxntRlK1wJlMwuI4uu1gN6OSQOEiGXVh1ehETxJap91jTMcVZDslpZueV-fCJk9UVLXo_jIFJ33vwg)

Employee Recognition is the #1 reason most people leave their job with 65% of people sharing they received no recognition for good work last year.   

Join Sameer Chowdhri, Global Lead Workplace for HR, to learn simple, pragmatic and actionable steps on how to use Workplace to recognize employees and create a culture of recognition across your organization.  
# [**Register Here**](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fregister.gotowebinar.com%2Frt%2F351463685119620353%3Fsource%3DMCG&h=AT1L0msVXZObLcnVqXokcZNowqkX_RE0gb727eyKHL5XaxFNyPBM-5WDx-A3kxntRlK1wJlMwuI4uu1gN6OSQOEiGXVh1ehETxJap91jTMcVZDslpZueV-fCJk9UVLXo_jIFJ33vwg)
## **IN THIS SESSION, SAMEER WILL SHARE:  **
* How recognition positively increases employee experience, relationships and culture resulting in higher retention and productivity 
* A  step by step approach on 'How to create recognition groups' and build recognition communities 
* How you can automate and scale this experience for frontline employees using AI through Workplace 
* Examples of Workplace customers who have done this successfully with measurable impact  
## **YOU WILL WALK WAY WITH:  **
* A simple, pragmatic step by step approach to how you can design a great 'Recognition' program for your organization 
* Ways to drive appreciation and recognition, not just from top down but from peer to peer with your frontline employees 
* An HR practitioners guide to get senior leaders to recognize and engage with employees directly, building the culture of recognition  

For a preview of what you'll learn in this webinar, we encourage you to [**join the Workplace for HR Customer Community here**](https://fb.me/g/2ALGfF4PY/258GOOLd).    

We'll see you soon!   

The Workplace Team

# Discover the right integrations for your community

Workplace offers integrations with some of the most popular tools to get work done. But with so many tools being used in companies today, it's tough to know what different teams and employees use. To make this easier, we will now let people request integrations with tools they already use and share this information with system admins.
## **How does it work?**

People can request integrations in two ways. You can go to the *Integrations* tab found in the left hand menu of Workplace to explore available integrations and request useful ones. Our integrations with tools like Dropbox and Jira provide rich previews of the content you share. Now if a link from one of these content tools is posted, Workplace will let you know an integration is available to request.  

These requests are surfaced in the Admin Panel under *Integrations*. System admins can choose whether to install these integrations or not. 

These changes should make discovering and using integrations easier and help you get work done faster.  
## **When is this launching?**

The ability to request integrations will begin to roll out on Monday, November 26th and will be available to everyone in the coming weeks.   
## **Where can I found out more?**

We are here to help! Take a look at our [Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/264807134180350?helpref=uf_permalink) or reach out to your Workplace team.

# [Resolved] Intermittent Issues Accessing Workplace 

Yesterday‚Äôs intermittent problems, caused by a server configuration issue, have since been resolved. We are back to 100% for everyone and we are deeply sorry for any inconvenience.

# Intermittent Issues Accessing Workplace

We're aware that some customers are having intermittent issues using Workplace. Our engineers are actively investigating the issue as a top priority. We will share any updates with you as soon as we can. Thanks for your patience!

# Update to Workplace Android App Icons

We're going to update the Android app icons for Workplace and Workplace Chat so they are aligned with our brand style. This means that the Workplace app icons may change appearance for users on Android devices. 

**What's changing?** The app icons will change to our new Workplace brand, and the Workplace Chat app icon will transition to a light grey background.

**Where can I found out more?** For more information, please visit our [Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work).

# [**Workplace for HR brings you our new Webinar: ‚ÄúHow to use Workplace to onboard employees" **](https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/rt/3621741118971158017)

Join [Sameer Chowdhri](https://fb.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100009991631000&fref=gs&__tn__=%2CdK-R-R-R-R&eid=ARAOHaovw4Vmqx_95FJ3AIjz-Bx7IyqQitLqqqxauKjH_9ejlZf-CvPXjXJHEfahbbkjWtKcCRK64fic&dti=1955237771180007&hc_location=group), Workplace for HR, to learn practical steps on how to use Workplace to onboard employees across your organization. This is a great opportunity to not only learn how to pre-onboard your new hires and create a compelling day 1 onboarding experience, but also how you can help existing Individual Contributors and Managers onboard and ramp up in new roles.
# [**REGISTER HERE**](https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/rt/3621741118971158017)

**We have 7 sessions across various time zones throughout November 2018, so choose the best time for you!**
## **IN THIS SESSION, SAMEER WILL SHARE:**
* **Impact of onboarding** to an employee's productivity and building commitment to their role and company
* **Demo a step by step approach** on 'How to create onboarding groups' and build onboarding communities
* How you can **automate this experience** through Workplace
* **Examples of Workplace customers **who have done this successfully with measurable impact
## **YOU WILL WALK AWAY WITH:**
* **A simple, pragmatic step by step approach **to deliver a great 'Employee Onboarding' experience on Workplace
* How to **engage your employees** even before they join, through communities
* How to deliver a **great 'Day 1' **employee onboarding experience
* How to create a **self learning environment **for employees new to the company, role and management

For a preview of what you'll learn in this series, we encourage you to join the [**Workplace for HR Customer Community here](https://fb.me/g/2ALGfF4PY/258GOOLd).  ** 

We'll see you soon! 

The Workplace Team

# **Announcing our [Customer Resource Center (CRC)](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources)!**

The Workplace Team is very excited to announce the launch of our [Customer Resource Center](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources)! This new site is the evolution of our former Transformation Center and will be your new source of all Workplace best practices and learning materials. 
 
# [**Visit the site here**](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/resources)
## What can you expect to see in the future as we build new content?
* **Additional content formats** - content will come in numerous forms so you can expect to see more short form videos, images, live training, and text education materials 
* **Webinars and Events page** -  A listing of our live webinars and events along with recorded webinars we've hosted in the past
* **Deepen Guides** - Best practices to deepen adoption
   * **Functional guides** - HR, Communications, etc.
   * **Role based guides** - Executive, people manager, etc. 
* **Integration Guides** - Best practices to setup and use our integrations - [see our current assets here](https://brandfolder.com/workplace-education-kit/integrate)
* **Learning Courses** - live training with a Workplace expert and on-demand courses to take on your own time
## Stay up to date on future resources we add to the CRC
* Be sure you [**opt-in to our customer emails here**](https://go.fb.com/workplace-updates-signup.html) to stay up to date on Workplace education materials. New resources will be promoted in the monthly Workplace Newsletter sent via email and shared in this group. 

We are always looking to make your experience with Workplace and the Workplace team a valuable one. We look forward to your feedback on the Customer Resource Center!

# **Workplace will move from facebook.com to workplace.com **

**Workplace by Facebook will be moving from the facebook.com domain to workplace.com in 2019.**

Since our launch two years ago, Workplace has rapidly grown into a prominent collaboration platform used by companies around the globe. One of the top requests from our customers is to make it more clear that Workplace accounts are completely separate from Facebook accounts. In moving to workplace.com, we not only clarify that we are a separate product, but also identify as a unique platform of the Facebook family like Instagram, Oculus and WhatsApp.   

**When will this happen?** 

If you manage Workplace for your organization, you do not need to take any immediate action. We will not be moving customers to workplace.com until early to mid 2019. This is an early notice so that you are aware of this upcoming change.  

**Will every Workplace community be required to move over? ** 

Every customer will be required to move to workplace.com, but we will work with customers to make this transition as smooth as possible. We will be communicating in much more detail about this process in the coming weeks.   

**Where can I find out more?** 

Admins can contact Workplace Support or your Workplace team with any questions.

## **WEBINAR RECORDING**
# [**Walmart Webinar**](https://youtu.be/dOCnS4W4OTQ)

In case you missed the live session, you can now watch the recording of our recent webinar with Walmart's Senior Director of Digital Strategy and Brand Engagement, [Dan Kneeshaw](https://www.linkedin.com/in/dkneeshaw/), in conversation with [Shilpi Narang](https://www.linkedin.com/in/shilpinarang/) from the Workplace team.
# [Watch the webinar](https://youtu.be/dOCnS4W4OTQ)

Dan shares practical insight on the **Business Drivers** for Walmart and how Workplace has **transformed communication and collaboration **at the company. Highlights include how Walmart uses Workplace to:
* Facilitate easy communication and collaboration across a globally distributed workforce
* Eliminate language barriers
* Drive store sales by sharing merchandising ideas
* Work smarter using Workplace Groups and Live Video
* Amplify associate recognition programs
* Boost employee engagement, improve transparency and help Walmart play as one team

Once you've listened to the webinar, let us know your feedback!

# Group management made easy with People Sets

Groups are at the center of every Workplace community. They are where important news is shared, projects are managed and communication happens. Groups are especially powerful when the right people are brought together to have the right conversations. So we built people sets to make it simple to build custom segments of people and assign them to groups.
## **HOW DOES IT WORK?**

People Sets are dynamic lists of people in your Workplace community. You can create synchronized people sets based on profile fields or manual people sets by adding people one by one or through CSV. You can then filter and bulk edit people profiles based on sets or manage group membership through people sets. 

For example, if you were part of a hospital network, you could create a set that includes all the doctors in your New York City hospital based on the ‚Äòjob title‚Äô and ‚Äòlocation‚Äô fields in their profiles. You could then assign that people set to groups. This way, whenever a new doctor joins the New York City hospital they will automatically be added to these groups. 

With people sets you can manage and organize all your groups fast, without leaving the Admin Panel.
## **WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE? **üîé

Check out the [Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/655096804836309?helpref=uf_permalink) for answers to all your product questions.

# Manage your Workplace security health 

At Workplace, we take security seriously. That means providing you with transparent reporting in addition to holding ourselves to high security standards like being ISO27001, SOC2, SOC3 and GDPR compliant. Today, we launched our new Security Center for system administrators to help you quickly check the security health of your Workplace community. 
## **How does it work?**

We took the detailed logs of user actions that we have already been providing like files that might have malware, password resets and more and put them into an easily digestible report. Our Security Center shares your security health and makes it simple to take action on this data. Login settings including SSO setup have also moved to the Security tab. Admins can find these reports today in the Admin Panel Security tab.
## **Still have questions?**

We are here to help! Take a look at our [Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/239939156659809/?helpref=hc_fnav&bc%5B0%5D=Workplace&bc%5B1%5D=Admin) or reach out to your Workplace team.

# Product News from Flow by Workplace

Today we hosted our first Workplace leadership conference, Flow! During the keynote, we shared our biggest upcoming product launches. üéâ
# Safety Check

The power of [Safety Check](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/features/safety-check) is coming to Workplace, bringing work communities together in times of crisis. Safety Check is a new way for company leadership to send notifications to employees in a crisis and take action on their responses in real-time.

Safety Check will be available by early 2019 to all our Workplace Premium customers, but you can register for early access to the feature [today](https://go.fb.com/safety-check.html). 
**Where can I find out more?**
Take a look at our [blog post](https://workplaceblog.fb.com/product-news/safety-check) or [product page](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/features/safety-check) to learn more about how [Safety Check for Workplace](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/features/safety-check) can change the way your organization handles crises. Or get your product questions answered in our [Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/241625393186690).
# Workplace Chat Updates

Real-time communication is a powerful tool to connect teams and move work forward quickly. However, the volume of information shared can also make people feel overwhelmed. 

We've built a number of new Workplace Chat features that help people manage real-time conversations so they feel empowered to focus on what matters most:
* **Do Not Disturb** lets others know when you're not available, so you can mute incoming chats, video and voice calls when you're busy or away.
* **Pinned threads** and **replies** make it easy to find, highlight and respond to chat messages.
* **Multi-company chat** simplifies how people from different organizations can communicate in real-time through chat, video and voice calls, so they don't have to switch between several apps to work together. 

**Where can I find out more?**
Learn more about these handy features through our [blog post](https://workplaceblog.fb.com/product-news/workplace-chat-updates) or [product page](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/features/workplace-chat). Or get your product questions answered on [multi-company chat](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/254734331656422/?helpref=hc_fnav&bc%5B0%5D=Workplace&bc%5B1%5D=Features&bc%5B2%5D=Groups), [replies](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/682468881954082), [pinned threads](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/682468881954082) and [Do Not Disturb](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/880591925360314/?helpref=hc_fnav&bc%5B0%5D=Workplace&bc%5B1%5D=Features) in our Help Center.
# Mark as Important

When you need to share important news with your organization, it can be a challenge to get information to the people that need to know quickly. And ensuring people have seen that information is even tougher. 

Mark as important on Workplace ensures your most important news is top of News Feed and top of mind for your employees. Plus we offer powerful reporting on these posts to track engagement. 

Mark as important will be launching in the coming weeks. If you are interested in early access, contact your Workplace team.
**Where can I find out more?**
Our [blog post](https://workplaceblog.fb.com/product-news/mark-as-important) walks you through the details. Or get your product questions answered in our [Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/252991161966313).

# New Engagement Reports in the Admin Panel 

Workplace is most powerful when everyone in your organization takes part. We want to make it simple for our admins to build and nurture an active Workplace community. We have added new reports that make it easier to understand Workplace engagement over time and dig deeper to find pockets of high and low use.
## **üë©‚Äçüíº How does it work?**

This is an Admin Panel feature available to admins only. We have added two new reports to the People Reporting tab that you can use to monitor the growth and activity of your Workplace community. The first graph shows launched accounts, in-use accounts and active people over the last 6 months and allows you to filter to a specific groups of people. The second report allows you to look at a table of usage data, spot low usage and take action quickly. For example, you can filter to take a look at how adoption is going on the Marketing team and even breakdown usage to see the difference between web and mobile.Our work is just getting started to build better analytics for your community. Over time, we plan to extend this deeper reporting to other reports in the Admin Panel. 
## **üîé Where can I found out more?**

You can learn more about how our reporting works [here](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/807043472738394?helpref=uf_permalink) or contact Workplace support with questions.

# Trello and Workplace are Better Together

Today, we announced that Atlassian and Workplace are deepening our partnership with a Trello integration.

https://workplaceblog.fb.com/product-news/trello/

You can install the Workplace integration [here](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/integration?app_id=278413929384940) and the Trello PowerUp [here](https://trello.com/power-ups/5b75353332cf158d6c3ddb35/workplace-by-facebook)

The Workplace integration with Trello brings Trello boards and cards into the relevant Workplace Groups, making it really easy to keep track of your discussions right where the work is happening.
## SO, WHAT DOES IT DO?
* Share and discuss Trello projects from within Workplace to get answers to your questions, remind people to complete tasks, and move work forward
* Share Trello Boards and Cards directly from Trello to your team in a Workplace Group 
   * In addition, it will now show you a preview of the Workplace post inside Trello. 
   * You‚Äôll also be able to see the link to the Workplace post so that it‚Äôs easy to navigate to the discussion in Workplace
## WHY DID WE PARTNER WITH ATLASSIAN ON THIS INTEGRATION?

Because both Atlassian and Workplace share the vision that people will always want to use multiple tools to get work done. And these tools should work seamlessly together, no matter which platform you‚Äôre using. 

**We call this strategy Better Together.**

We believe Workplace is the best-in-class communication and collaboration tool. We believe that Trello is the best-in-class visual way for teams to manage projects. And we‚Äôre really excited to enable this integration between the two platforms.

#BetterTogether #BestofBreed

# Workplace + Zoom integration resources and user community

Zoom and Workplace have collaborated to make the two products work together. People in your Workplace community can now:
* Stream Zoom meetings into Workplace groups for live viewing or rewatching later
* Elevate Workplace chat conversations to Zoom conference calls through the Zoom bot

Today we wanted to share three resources with you:
1. **Tutorials:** [Streaming](https://www.gend.co/blog/integrating-zoom-with-workplace-by-facebook), and Chat [Bot](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Lp5UQPTQGbE&feature=youtu.be)
1. **Technical Support resources:** [Streaming](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005460286-Live-Stream-Meetings-on-Workplace-by-Facebook) and Chat [Bot](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005390806-Workplace-Zoom-Bot) (note Zoom Bot in Groups is not live yet)
1. **Use case guide: **How** **Learning & Development teams can use these integrations in their daily job - additional line of business use cases will be posted soon

These resources are just the beginning. 

To help you get the most out of both products, we have created a Workplace Zoom integration community group so you and your company's Zoom admin can share additional tips and tricks with other admins, ask questions, and give us feedback.

**Join the community [here](https://fb.me/g/1syk3agWw/B5O0HSNM) and if you have any questions or concerns, please  let us know. ** 

Workplace Integration Team

# Connecting everyone just got easier

**Join the conversation on Workplace with or without an email.**

From the corporate office to the shop floor, Workplace is built to give everyone in your organization a voice, not just people with a company email address. Today we are making it even easier to connect coworkers. Admins can now create accounts for any employee, with our without an email address. Say goodbye to flyers in break rooms and trickle down communication, a connected workplace is now within reach.
## How does it work?

Workplace accounts can now be created by providing an employee ID instead of an email address. Once these accounts are created, Workplace will generate unique access codes to distribute to any employees without email so that they can access Workplace and create a custom username and password... no email required.
 Just enable the feature from Admin Panel Preferences and unlock Workplace for your entire company. 
## Whether you are ready to get started or have a question...

We are here to help! Take a look at our [Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/546217199128952?helpref=uf_permalink) or reach out to [Workplace Support](https://work.facebook.com/help/work/contact/1055205077836390/?ref=contextual).

# **Add set values on profile fields**

We've been working hard to make [Workplace profiles](https://fb.facebook.com/groups/329644324122247/permalink/505494486537229/) the go-to place to find and connect with colleagues. We've listened to your feedback and now allow admins to set a list of values for people to choose from when updating their profiles. We hope this feature helps to make profile data more reliable!
## **HOW DOES IT WORK?**

When managing profile fields on the Edit Profile Template tab of your Admin Panel you will be able to set a custom list of values for the following profile fields. 
1. Location
1. Department
1. Division
1. Organization

Once you add set values, people must select from the dropdown list you set when making updates to their profile. 
## **STILL HAVE QUESTIONS? **

We are here to help! Take a look at our [Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/1173159049384822/?helpref=hc_fnav&bc%5B0%5D=Workplace&bc%5B1%5D=Admin) or reach out to [Workplace Support](https://work.facebook.com/help/work/contact/1055205077836390/?ref=contextual).

# Early Access for System Admins: Powerful New People Directory Features 

Workplace Profiles are the place to go to connect with and learn more about your colleagues. We've added a bunch of new features to make Workplace the central directory for your organization. System Admins will see these new additions first. Features will launch to *all* users in one week. 

If you were part of our early-access group, these features are already launched to your community.
## üèÅ** Customize and manage profiles**

Every organization is unique, from the structure to the people. This is why we are now providing Workplace system admins control over Workplace People Profiles so they reflect information your community cares about.

From [*Edit Profile Template*](https://work.facebook.com/work/admin/?section=profile_settings) in the Admin Panel you can control which fields should be visible or hidden from Workplace and who can edit profile fields (only admins, users or an identity provider). Plus admins can now edit a user's profile directly from their profile page.
üèÜ **Admin Pro Tip: **If you are a system administrator, you can customize your profile template today before all new profile fields are shown to your users next week.
## üë©‚Äç‚öïÔ∏èüë®‚Äçüè´üë©‚Äç‚öñÔ∏èüë©‚Äçüîßüë®‚Äçüíº** More personalized profiles **

We want to make people profiles the place to go to learn more about a coworker. Not just their name and seat, but their work and interests, too. So today you'll see: 
1. **Multiple Phone Number & Extension** support so anyone is just a phone call away.
1. **Division & Organization **fields on profile so your business can provide more detail about a person's roles and responsibilities.
1. Add a **Biography** to your Workplace profile to share a little more about yourself with your colleagues. 
1. Add the **Languages **you speak to share your knowledge with your team.
## üéÇ** Celebrate your colleagues**

Based on popular demand, work anniversaries & birthdays can now be celebrated on Workplace! If Start Date or Birthday are included on a people profile, Workplace will provide reminders to recognize your teammates' work anniversaries and birthdays. Cue the celebratory GIFs and stickers! 
 (Don't worry, adding a birthday is completely optional for each user and these fields can always be disabled by you as an admin in the *Edit Profile Template* tab of your Admin Panel.)
## üîç **Find coworkers faster with People Directory **

We will be launching People Directory in the coming days. System Admins will get access one week early. The powerful new search functionality lets you search for people based on a combination of profile field filters so you can find that superstar project team or perhaps a coffee buddy from a different team.
üèÜ **Admin Pro Tip: **This is a great time to consider a clean-up of profile data across your organization if it is not up to date.

**Questions?** Take a [look at our Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/185378598751635). Or if you can't find your answer, reach out to your Workplace team or [contact Support](https://work.facebook.com/help/work/contact/1055205077836390/?ref=contextual).

# Introducing synced chat with Team & Project groups

Coworkers on Workplace often use a mix of chat and Teams & Projects groups to collaborate and work together. However, until now Teams & Projects groups were separate from chat, meaning groups on Workplace had to recreate their groups on chat.   

Today we're launching a test for a feature that will automatically create a chat group for existing Teams & Projects groups. We believe the ability to chat real-time within these groups will make it even easier for teams to work together, by providing a simple way for coworkers to stay in touch throughout the day.   

This feature has been available to new Teams & Projects groups since May, and today we're expanding the experiment to existing Teams & Projects groups. Group admins can disable this feature at any time directly from the group settings.  

## **HOW DOES IT WORK?**

For Teams & Projects groups, a group chat will be automatically created and synced with the corresponding group. Membership is synced, which means that if a member leaves the group, they will leave the chat, but if a member leaves the chat they won't leave the group. Group admins can disable this feature at any time directly from the group settings.  

A linked chat is created automatically when a new Teams & Projects group is created, and existing Teams & Projects groups will begin having access to this test feature today.

# 4 effective ways to share work updates with employees

Regular work updates are vital, especially in large organizations or if people work remotely. Here are a few effective ways to keep people informed.

# How teachers are using Workplace to make education smarter

It can be difficult for educators to stay in touch with colleagues across the hall and across the sector. In our new video, we explore how using Workplace is enabling teachers to build communities and share ideas.

# How to get the best out of contractors and consultants

Working with contractors and consultants can be tricky. Especially when you need them up to speed fast to get the job done. But modern communication and collaboration tools are helping to speed up and improve the process.

# 4 ways to manage the stages of employee engagement

The way your staff feel about your organization doesn't stay static - they'll move through different stages of connection during their time with you. We look at how employee engagement works and why using collaboration tools can help keep people on board.

# 4 ways non-profits can set better goals

Goal setting for commercial organizations tends to be straightforward ‚Äì make a larger profit. But non-profits can have different goals. How can you make sure your non-profit workforce is working towards the same targets?

# How to launch Workplace well, and other tips from a tech deployment expert

Introducing new technology and unfamiliar processes can ruffle feathers within any company. As OrangeTrail founding partner Jaap Linsen has learned, [‚Ä¶]

# Building meaningful communities with Workplace for Good

Over the last 18 months, we've seen thousands of nonprofits and educational institutions transform how they work using Workplace. Now we're matching their commitment to doing good with our own. That's why we're launching Workplace for Good.

# Introducing the ability to see user membership for multi-company groups

Groups are the core way people collaborate on Workplace, and multi-company groups allow people in your company to collaborate with people at other companies who also use Workplace. However, until now instance admins didn't have an easy way of knowing which of their users were members of particular multi-company groups. 
 

Today, we're rolling out a new feature that will give admins visibility into user membership for multi-company groups. Admins will be able to see which employees are in a given multi-company group directly from the ‚ÄúGroups‚Äù tab in the admin panel.
 
## How does it work?

To access this feature, click on the ‚ÄúGroups‚Äù tab of the admin panel, select the ‚ÄúMore options‚Äù button on a multi-company group, and click on the ‚ÄúManage Members‚Äù option. This will display a list of your users who are members of the group.

# Introducing Draft Posts 

Today we're making it possible to save a group post as a draft so you can edit and post it at a later time. 

To save a post as a draft, click the arrow next to the 'Post' button and select 'Save as Draft'. To find a draft post, go to the group, choose 'Discussion', and drafts will be listed at the top. 

Draft posts will be rolled out 100% of people on Workplace over the next 24 hours. Draft posts are only available on Workplace on the web.

# Ways to stay organized at work: the downside of multi-tasking

The ability to juggle lots of tasks is usually seen in a positive light. But is working on simultaneous projects always a good thing? Or are there better ways of working? We look at what multi-tasking really means and how you can help people manage a varied workload.

# Introducing the ability to download a copy of your Workplace data 

General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) came into effect on 25th May 2018. We know how important this is to our customers, and we've been working hard at Workplace to enable organisations to more easily meet their GDPR requirements with regards to their employees. 

Tomorrow we're making it possible for people in organisations to download a copy of their Workplace data such as profile information, posts or chat messages. This feature is already available to Standard users. However for Premium instances, the default option is OFF and implementation is controlled by the Admin. It is also audited in the security logs. 

## How does it work?

To enable this feature for your organisation, click on Preferences in the left navigation bar of the Admin Panel. Here you can control and check the box marked Personal Information Download. Once this feature is enabled for the organisation, users click on General Account Settings to download a copy of their Workplace data. Per our terms and conditions, users will not be able to delete their data through this tool.

# 3 tips for encouraging innovation in the workplace

Innovation is the key to business success. Companies that want to thrive need to know how to source more cutting-edge ideas from more places in the organization. Here are three ways.

# How Ennismore uses Workplace to connect global teams and get more done

Workplace Leaders: We meet Sharan Pasricha - Founder and CEO of Ennismore - to see how using Workplace is helping connect the entire organization.

# Meet the Singapore hospital using automation to reimagine healthcare processes

With over 16 specialist centres and 45 health departments, Tan Tock Seng Hospital (TTSH) is one of Singapore‚Äôs largest multi-disciplinary [‚Ä¶]

# How to choose the right way to reach out at work

Effective communication isn‚Äôt just what you say ‚Äì it‚Äôs how you say it and who you‚Äôre saying it to. We look at getting your communication methods right for your people and your workplace culture.

# Deploy Workplace Chat Easily with the New Microsoft Installer Package

Workplace Chat connects people so they can get more work done together. Today we're delighted to announce our brand new Microsoft Installer Package for the Workplace Chat desktop app. IT teams can now install and manage Workplace Chat using Group Policy/Microsoft System Center. This will make it easy for IT teams to deploy Workplace Chat on multiple machines across your organization.  

Workplace admins can download the Workplace Chat MSI package by going to the new Workplace Apps tab in the Admin Panel. 
## Workplace Chat is better than ever

Workplace Chat doesn't just get people talking. It's messaging, voice and HD video chat with unlimited file sharing via mobile or desktop. It's where teams and organizations go to get work done. 

We've been busy over the last few months making the Workplace Chat desktop app a go-to tool for productive teamwork. Improved 1:1 screen sharing for instant collaboration. Upgraded HD video quality for even better connections. A brand new spell checker for greater clarity. 

To help people connect, you can now see job titles in Workplace Chat, and take fast action using keyboard shortcuts. We've added Workplace group notifications so your team won't miss project updates. A shared links section to help you find useful project information quickly.

For more information go to the [Workplace blog.](https://workplaceblog.fb.com/product-news/workplace-chat-msi/)

# Introducing the ability to view, filter and export Security Logs  

We like to make things as easy as we can for our admin community. We have been logging security-related events in Workplace for some time now. So far, these were only available through webhooks and a downloadable CSV file.
 

Today, we're making it possible for admins to monitor security events and analyze sensitive activity in Workplace by viewing and filtering the security logs on screen, as well as downloading those logs in a CSV file. 
 
## How do I use it? 

Click on Security Logs in the left navigation bar of the Admin Panel. Here you can view the log filters (date, event, location, name) and logs on the screen, or download the latest log. Use the logs to monitor and analyze all login, password, admin, file, and integration activity from the past 30 days. It will be updated daily, and will reflect the filters the admin chooses.

# Workplace News from F8 2018

Facebook's annual developer conference, F8, kicked off today! Workplace announced an ecosystem of powerful new integrations with industry-leading SaaS products like Jira by Atlassian, SurveyMonkey, Microsoft SharePoint, and ADP to name a few.

We launched an [Integrations Directory](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/integrations) making it simple to find and enable integrations with tools your team relies on. Plus system admins now have access to [permissions and analytics](https://work.facebook.com/work/admin/?section=integrations_data) to manage any integrations installed on their community. Select integrations are also available for our Standard customers. 
## learn More

Take a look at our [blog post](https://workplaceblog.fb.com/news/workplace-integrations/ ‚Äé) to learn about all Workplace announcements out of F8. You can see for yourself how Workplace and the other apps you use at work are better together. Enable the integrations we shared above and many more by checking out our [Integrations Directory](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/integrations) today.

## New Workplace Webinar
# [**What's New At Workplace, May 2018**](https://register.gotowebinar.com/rt/4014460279841841409)

We are excited to invite you to our latest webinar "What's New at Workplace, May 2018" where we will walk through our latest product news scheduled to be announced on May 1st!

[**Register here!**](https://register.gotowebinar.com/rt/4014460279841841409)

We are hosting multiple sessions so sign up for the best day and time for you.  No worries if you cannot attend as we will send the recording to all registrants.

We look forward to talking with you soon!

# Workplace and GDPR

As you know we‚Äôve been working to prepare for the forthcoming GDPR changes next month. You‚Äôll already have seen this [blog post](https://workplaceblog.fb.com/news/workplace-and-gdpr/).

So, I wanted to make you aware that tomorrow we will be updating the Workplace agreement with an addendum to reflect these changes. 

All system admins will be notified by email and in product, so I wanted to share the addendum, **which will form part of your Workplace Enterprise Agreement with effect from 25 May**, with you directly. 

There is no action required from you or a system admin. Please see attached the addendum for your reference.

Thanks again for your partnership, 

**The Workplace Team**

# Linked Groups are Back

We heard from many of you that linked groups were a very useful feature. So we made some important changes and we are launching them today! 

Group admins can now recommend a list of related (or just generally awesome) groups to members, making it easier for people to discover new groups that are relevant to their workday. 

Creating and linking groups is especially useful to build subgroups that allow for more focused conversation. For example, your Global News group can link to all announcements groups for your offices around the world so any employee can easily get up to speed on the new CFO at headquarters and then jump to a post about an upcoming office happy hour. Or your product development team can link new feature feedback groups together so that valuable comments and questions end up in the right place. 

Linked Groups will help your entire organization find new and relevant information more quickly. And more importantly, building connections between groups helps you to build a more connected workplace!
## HOW DO LINKED GROUPS WORK?

Linked groups are found in the **About** tab of a group. If you are a group admin, you  can get started by selecting ‚ÄúLink Existing Group‚Äù from the group menu.
## MORE QUESTIONS?

You can find more information on our [Workplace Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/407569872939779?helpref=uf_permalink) or if you are an admin, you can contact Workplace Support.

# Rolling Back the Test of the Group Chat Icon View in Workplace Chat

At Facebook, we often talk about "moving fast" and "the journey is 1% finished." When we get good feature ideas, whether from you as feedback or through the teams here at Workplace, we try to iterate quickly. You'll see us partially roll out a new feature to understand how useful the feature is. Sometimes, the feature doesn't have the impact we all hoped for, so we fail fast and learn from the results before moving on. This is how we've outpaced other products out there when it comes to innovation.
## What is being rolled back today?

Customers have asked us to make group chats on Workplace Chat easier to find. To do this, we ran a test to see if a list of group chat icons in a dedicated space in Workplace Chat would solve the problem. The test ran to 50% of people on Workplace.

The test results show that the feature had low usage. So we've decided to roll the feature back and use the learnings develop a new solution. The roll back will begin today.

Once this feature is rolled back, to find a group chat, type the name of the group in the Workplace Chat search bar.

# Add Images to Polls

Creating a poll in a Workplace group is a simple way to get input on a decision.

People tell us they use Workplace polls to choose agenda topics for a meeting, decide on event dates and select project priorities.
## ADD IMAGES TO POLLS

Now images can be added to polls too. You can upload an image to each poll option. This makes it easy for people to vote on visuals or helps to make your text options easier to understand.

To create a poll, go to the post composer in a group and select the poll option. When entering the poll choices, click the image upload box to choose an image.

*The roll out of images in polls will happen today and will go straight to 100% of people on Workplace. *

# Useful New Additions to the Admin Panel 

We have been busy building a better Admin Panel that lets administrators more easily manage their Workplace. Learn more about the new additions launching to all Premium communities this week. 

**Mass Update Workplace Profiles **

People change and so do their profiles. Perhaps you need to update manager information due to a team reorganization or update location information because of an office move. It is now simple to make bulk changes to people profile data through CSV directly from your Admin Panel. 
## **HOW DOES IT WORK?**

This is an Admin Only feature. Navigate to the People section of the Admin Panel. Choose ‚ÄúEdit All Records‚Äù to see step-by-step instructions on updating profile data for multiple people at once. Simply upload the updated CSV file and changes will be reflected on people profiles. *This feature is now available in your Admin Panel. *

**NOTE**: If you have an identity provider updating profiles via the SCIM API, it will override the changes you make  in your CSV. 
## **WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE?**

Get your questions answered in our [Help Center](https://work.facebook.com/help/work/1519058828410452?helpref=uf_permalink).   

**A Fresh Look for the Groups & People Page**

We redesigned the Groups and People tab in the Admin Panel for better navigation and reporting. The Groups Page has a new look and feel and allows admins to search for group names by keyword. *This update is available today.*

The People page now has powerful new search functionality. Admin can search for people based on a combination of profile field filters and export the results. These exports are helpful for more than just reporting. You can use this export to bulk add members to groups based on fields like department or location! *The new People page will be rolling out over the next week.*

## New Workplace Webinar!
# [**USING WORKPLACE TO BUILD A COLLABORATIVE CULTURE**](https://register.gotowebinar.com/rt/376287353544196099)

Hello VIPs,

I am excited to invite you to the latest Workplace webinar we are hosting throughout the month of April, ["Using Workplace to Build a Collaborative Culture"](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fattendee.gotowebinar.com%2Frt%2F376287353544196099&h=ATOh53w4wpPHJ0BUUbCBbctBqNEljKfNt1bMZRD0iIDIHQwANPNUzNcE7WwO7b3JU009dm2WvRBboczkBxW3kr_kTF2nfLC6Ms6YzSW3Y7o4di2nELGlzbgKsn9dPw). 

In this webinar you will learn how you can use Workplace to stay connected with your teams through simple tips and tricks with Groups, Work Chat and having a mobile first mindset. You'll also learn best practices around working with people outside your organization while still using Workplace. We'll highlight some of our favorite customer stories along the way, to make sure you take away tangible learnings!

And you can continue building strong relationships with your team by sharing [this registration link](https://register.gotowebinar.com/rt/376287353544196099) and inviting them to join as well.  Collaboration doesn't happen alone!

We look forward to talking with you soon!!!

## GDPR  and what it means for Workplace

GDPR is coming on 25th May 2018. And we've been working hard at Workplace to get ready for the changes. We know how important this is to you all so we've put together this [blog post](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fworkplaceblog.fb.com%2Fnews%2Fworkplace-and-gdpr%2F&h=ATNpfkJSkDZWk_a0T4DFRQ4Ujzg_T9p9dSSQXPf4G8uTpNtcRyJUlBkAumJjGgmYInGVBjfHk8iYZ-OTV3x_eg2oViD8UiNEwkGMf1C_A0kwN-cichhYOr03X6dArFYDRuh5-MPPN7d17kvDQIj9-nIq) to answer some of the questions you may have. The post looks at:
* What is GDPR
* Workplace and GDPR compliance
* Safeguards and Contractual Commitments
* Data Security
* Data transfers
* Useful resources
* FAQs

Workplace is serious about security. You can find out more information via [Security on Workplace](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/workplace/security) and in the [Trust Center](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/security/).

Thank you.

Hello dear *Workplace VIPs*, 

 As you have probably seen, Facebook has been in the news this week. 

I wanted to reach out and reassure you that **protecting people‚Äôs information is at the heart of everything we do**, across both Facebook and Workplace.   

As you already all know**, Workplace is set up separately to consumer Facebook. **

As a Premium customer of Workplace, **you are the controller of your data and are in full control of who can access it**. You can read more about Workplace‚Äôs security credentials on [our blog](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/security?source=topbar). 

You can also find more detail on Cambridge Analytica on [Facebook‚Äôs blog](https://newsroom.fb.com/news/2018/03/hard-questions-cambridge-analytica/). 

**If you have any questions about Workplace or if I can help clarify anything, please let me know. **

I‚Äôm happy to have a chat anytime ‚Äì we value your partnership and look forward to continuing to work together.

Thank you, 

Julien, on behalf of the entire Workplace team.

# New Admin Privileges for Workplace Chat Groups

Workplace Chat is more than just a quick conversation. It‚Äôs expressive instant messaging, voice, and HD video calls from mobile or desktop. It‚Äôs unlimited file and screen sharing on the go. It‚Äôs how teams get work done.
## NEW ADMIN PRIVILEGES

So we‚Äôre thrilled to launch new admin privileges for Workplace Chat group conversations to make the experience even better. This update gives people more options to control who can join group chats.

Workplace Chat group admins will now have the option to turn approvals on or off for any additions to the group. And it applies when group members add new people directly to a chat, or when people receive a link to join a group conversation.

You can toggle approvals for any size of group chat including the large conversations that may benefit from greater membership controls.
## JOINABLE LINKS

We‚Äôre also making it easier to add new people to group chats with joinable links. Anyone in a group chat can create a custom invite link and share it with someone they‚Äôd like to join the conversation.

If admins turn the approvals off, people can tap the link to add themselves to a group automatically. Or they‚Äôll join the conversation once the admin approves the request.

[Find out more about admin privileges on the Workplace blog. ](https://workplaceblog.fb.com/product-news/workplacechat-adminprivileges/)

## FAQS: 

**Who is given admin privileges in a new group chat:**

The creator of a group chat will be given admin privileges. They can then promote other members to admins. 

**Who is given admin privileges in an existing group chats:**

Everyone will become an admin in chat groups that were created before these features launched.

**What actions can an admin do? **
* Remove members
* Set member approval toggle on/off (off by default)
* Approve new members (when toggle is on)
* Admins can promote any other member to admin
* Any admin can demote any other admin to member

**What happens when an admin leaves?** 
* If an admin leaves, and there are other admins, the other admins are admins
* If an admin leaves, and they are the only admin, we will ask them to promote another admin
* If the admin leaves without doing this, the most tenured group member(s) will become admin

**How do joinable links work?**
* Each person may create their own invite link and distribute it
* If approvals are off (default), people who click the link will be taken to an interstitial, and then join the group
* If approvals are on, people who click the link will be taken to an interstitial, and then request to join the group. They will have to be approved by the admin, at which point they will be automatically added.
* Any user can revoke their own link and create a new one.

# Workplace Chat MSI Is Now Available for Testing - Beta-

Workplace Chat gives you the freedom to connect with your coworkers anytime, anywhere. Today we're excited to invite our VIP customers** **to test the new MSI installer for the Workplace Chat desktop app, so everyone across your organization can achieve more together. 

This MSI will make it easier to deploy Workplace Chat to all your users. 
## **How do I get the MSI package? **

Download it from: [https://www.beta.facebook.com/work/chat/download/msi](https://www.beta.facebook.com/work/chat/download/msi) 
Workplace Chat can be deployed as a user (not a machine) using the group policy tool. 
 
## **How will people in my organization know what's happening? **

Once Workplace Chat is deployed, the app will run on start up.
 

We recommend using your internal comms channels to make sure people understand what the Workplace Chat desktop app is and how they can use it. 
 
## **How do I send feedback? **

Any feedback, big or small, will be extremely useful for us. Please post your feedback in [this multi-company group](https://fb.me/g/2g2MxtqNs/lhKKzrp8). The group is open to both Workplace admins and users to join. 
 
## **How long will the test run?**

The length of the test will depend on what feedback we receive. Once we are happy the MSI process is running smoothly we will make the MSI package available to all organizations on Workplace. 
 

At Facebook, we've been using Workplace Chat for months, and the feedback has been incredible. People are telling us it's changing how they use chat on Workplace, as native notifications and app badging helps people stay connected to their team and coworkers. We're excited to see how Workplace Chat helps transform how you and your teams communicate.
 

Thank you very much for helping us shape the future of work and happy testing!

# Introducing a new Use-Case Library to help you find and share inspiration on new ways to drive your business with Workplace!

We're delighted to bring to you stories of how companies like yours globally have used Workplace not just to communicate and collaborate but also transform their business.

Filter and Search by your favorite topics. We're sure you'll get inspired to replicate some of these use cases at your organization.

Please bookmark:  https://workplaceusecases.com/

You can also share your inspiring stories with others globally by [submitting your story](https://workplaceusecases.com/submit-your-story/) to this library.

Please let us know your feedback!

# Manage your Community from Anywhere

We want people to be able to get work done from anywhere, with everyone at their organization. At Workplace, building mobile-first is part of our ethos - so it's important for us to build Workplace tools for admins in the same way. This is why we are excited to announce the Admin Panel is coming to our mobile apps. 
## **HOW DOES IT WORK?**

We have added some of the most popular admin features to our mobile apps. If you are a Workplace admin, go to the Admin Panel on your app to: 
1. Review and take action on any reported content. Push notifications will be sent to you whenever content is reported.
1. See community activity and send reminders to people to drive engagement.
1. Add people to your community.
1. Manage administrators and make changes to admin levels for any administrator. 
## **WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE?**

Check out our [blog post](https://workplaceblog.fb.com/product-news/mobileadminpanel/) or get your questions answered in our [Help Center](https://fb.facebook.com/help/work/781832268694267?helpref=uf_permalink). 

**The mobile Admin Panel is available to some communities today and will roll out to all communities over the coming weeks.**

# Live Session about The Future of Work with PwC, Box and A1 Telekom Austria 

Workplace by Facebook will be LIVE tomorrow from Mobile World Congress in Barcelona! 

Join us at 09.00am CET on our [Workplace Facebook page](https://www.facebook.com/workplacebyfacebook/) as we chat with Box, PwC, A1 Telekom Austria, and Quartz about how technology continues to shape the future of work. 

[#MWC18](https://www.facebook.com/hashtag/mwc18?source=feed_text) #workplacebreakfast #workplacebyfacebook
