**Not sure how to engage your front line staff on Workplace? Here's an idea!**

We like to think about them as the photographers, cinematographers, and documentary producers for your company. With mobile devices, their ability to capture photos and videos about the customer and employee experience can build an entirely new knowledge repository for your business. Check it out!

 #engagement #frontline #mobile #knowledge

# Schedule Recurring Events

Many events and meetings we attend at work are repeated regularly, whether a weekly meeting with your team or a quarterly earnings review with your entire organization. We have now made it simple to create these recurring events on Workplace.
## **HOW DOES IT WORK?**

When you create an event, you will be given the option to customize your event frequency to occur once, daily, weekly, or choose custom dates and times for it to repeat. Invitees can then RSVP to all or choose individual events to attend. You can schedule recurring events on the web only, but attendees can see them on any device.

Congratulations team Campbell for sharing your incredible journey and leadership in driving innovation and cultural change! Kristin Ennis Ôøºbeautifully told their story! 

Learn how they‚Äôre connecting Marketing with their audience, helping Field Sales be more agile and driving a more connected employee experience.

#startingtheyearonagreatnote

## **UPDATE: GETTING THE EMAIL NOTIFICATIONS BALANCE RIGHT**

We continue to believe that email notifications are an important way to help you move your day-to-day work to Workplace. We also know that we need to ensure that you get high-quality emails at the right time.   So we've been working hard since our last [post](https://fb.facebook.com/groups/868270109972267/permalink/1159267294205879/) to get the balance right on notifications. We'd like to share what we've been up to.  
* In December, we rolled out a long-term test: a set of machine-learning filters that work out which emails you're most likely to ignore. The filters then prevent these emails from being sent to you. We've been watching the effect - we're seeing a meaningful reduction in the volume of notifications and fewer unsubscribes across all organizations
* Our Strategic Partner Managers and Customer Support Specialists ‚Äî the folks who ensure your success ‚Äî have new guidance to help you manage the volume. We can help users turn off notifications for specific types of email. And we offer advice to admins about handling large announcement groups (a common source of overload). For example, making sure you moderate default Announcements groups so that only approved posts generate notifications.
* We have an email task force which will focus on shipping ongoing improvements over the coming months. These engineers work in test environments simulating real-world examples where inboxes become overloaded with email notifications. This may seem like a small thing, but it really helps guide decisions on what to tackle next. The one who feels the pain solves the problem!

We'll continue to regularly update you on our progress.  Thanks!  

The Workplace Team

# Making it Easier to Learn About Coworkers in Groups
## BACKGROUND

Groups in Workplace are a great way to work together with teams, join conversations and hear about company news that matters to you. Groups come in all sizes, from small working groups to announcement groups for entire organizations. 
## INTRODUCING GROUP MEMBER PROFILES

Often in large groups people don't know other members. So, to make it easier to learn about coworkers, a new feature called group member profiles is launching today. 

Now you can click on a coworker's name in a group to see things you share in common and a feed of their activity in the group.  

**Happy New Year! **

# Security Logs and New Design: Making Workplace Easier for Admins

We like to make things as easy as we can for our admin community. In addition to now supporting mixed authentication (see post [here](https://fb.facebook.com/groups/868270109972267/permalink/1177940495671892/)), we're making it easier for you to monitor security events and analyze sensitive activity in Workplace. 

We've also taken a look at the dashboard and made some improvements to the design. This makes adding people to Workplace, sending invites, and creating groups a better experience. 
## INTRODUCING EXPORTABLE SECURITY LOGS & DASHBOARD REDESIGN

**Exportable security logs:** 

We've been logging security-related events in Workplace for some time. Historically, it's not been as easy as we'd like for you to monitor and analyze sensitive activity. So we're now giving admins the ability to export and download these logs as CSV files. The CSV file is a rolling log which updates every day and contains security data for the past 30 days.
## HOW DO I USE IT? 

Click on Security Logs in the left navigation bar of the Admin Dashboard. Here you can download the latest log. Use the CSV file to monitor and analyze all login, password, admin, file, and integration activity from the past 30 days.

**A better dashboard experience: **

You'll find your security logs on a new tab in your company dashboard. And to make it even easier, we've upgraded the look-and-feel of the dashboard‚Äôs main menu. This includes clearer sub-tabs for setting up Workplace they way you want it. You can now find the options to add people, send invites, and create groups right where you'd expect to see it.
## HOW DO I USE IT? 

Click on the subtabs ‚Äòadd people‚Äô, ‚Äòcreate groups‚Äô, and ‚Äòsend invitations‚Äô in the left navigation bar to access this functionality.

# Connect Everyone With New Mixed Authentication

Many of our customers have employees who don't have a company-issued email address or the ability to use Single Sign-On (SSO). We see this in industries with high numbers of frontline workers such as retail, manufacturing, agriculture and more.

It's too risky to grant these employees access using their personal email addresses, and it hasn't been an option to add these people to your SSO systems. This means that it can be difficult to give all your employees access to Workplace.
## INTRODUCING MIXED AUTHENTICATION

To make sure that you can connect everyone wherever they work, we're excited to announce the launch of Mixed Authentication.

Mixed authentication allows your community admins to choose how to authenticate Workplace users by either a username/password or Single Sign-On (SSO).
## HOW DO I USE IT?

Admins can click on 'Authentication' in the left navigation bar. They select the preferred authentication method for all your users (SSO, Password, or both) and hit save. You can add multiple users via a CSV file. In this case, add a new column: 'Login Method' and set 'SSO' or 'Password'.

# Introducing a New Notifications Hub
## BACKGROUND

Groups in Workplace are a great way to work together with teams on various projects, join in with multiple conversations, and find the important company news that matters to you and your organization.

Workplace gets better the more people use it. And as people join and engage with more groups and become part of more conversations, they can sometimes find they receive increasing notifications about things happening in the company. 
## INTRODUCING A NOTIFICATION HUB

That's why we're rolling out a notification hub in beta. It's a brand new place to view, react and respond to all your notifications.
## HOW DO I USE IT?

Click on Notifications in the left navigation bar on News Feed. Here you'll view all your notifications in one place. You can now filter, read, and react or respond to all of your notifications from central space.

With the holiday break around the corner, we think using the notification hub is another way Workplace can help make catching up with work in January easier.  

**Happy Holidays! **

# Now you can search comments to find the information you need
You can already use Workplace to search for coworkers, posts, groups, and events. And now we're making it easier to find ideas and opinions. From today, you can now search people's comments to help find what you're looking for.Posts in groups are often just the start of a conversation. It's in the comment thread under the post where teams share new ideas and people make decisions. By including comments in search results, you'll now be able to more quickly find what you're looking for.

## HOW DOES IT WORK?
To search comments for information, type a search term in the search bar at the top of any Workplace page or in the search box in a group. To see the results from comments, make sure the ‚Äúcomment‚Äù filter is selected.
"Workplace + Sharepoint : Better together", a great post by our friend Regan Collins, from Azuronaut (MS gold partner and Workplace Certified partner too).

# Getting the email notifications balance right

Some of you have given us feedback on the high volume of email notifications you receive. Automated messages such as claim your account, trending posts, and group highlights, for example. We've listened! And we'd like to share the steps we're taking to make our email notifications more relevant. And how we're planning to get the frequency of our messages right.
* We've taken a look at the biggest factors that lead to email overload like the activity notifications triggered by large announcements in groups. As a result, our Strategic Partner Managers are sharing these insights as part of onboarding and training activities
* We're experimenting with tactics to reduce the overall number of emails we send to specific people. This includes sending no more than one email a week to people who haven't yet opened their Workplace accounts
* We will soon be introducing a filter which uses machine-learning to predict the most relevant notifications and the best time to send them. Our tests show that this decreases the overall volume of messages we send and makes the messages you do receive more relevant and interesting
* We're also working hard to make the unsubscribe experience easier and looking at ways to improve the whole email cycle

We believe that email notifications are an important way to help you move your day-to-day work to Workplace. But we know that we need to send relevant messages and not add to the overall email burden. We'll continue to work hard to get this balance right. 

We'll share more on how we're getting on over the coming weeks.

Thanks

Christine (Product Marketing Lead) & The Workplace Team

# Group Video Chat will Start to Rolling Out Today

A few weeks ago we [announced](https://workplaceblog.fb.com/news/workplace-one-year-later/) that group video chat would be coming soon to Workplace. Starting today, group video chat will begin rolling out to everyone. We expect 100% of people on Workplace to have group video chat within 2 weeks. 

Group video chat is available in the Workplace Chat apps on the desktop and on mobile, and on Chrome on the web. To start a call, create a chat group, then click the video button to start a video chat with your team. Up to 50 people can join a group video chat at one time. 
 

We'll be sharing this news broadly on the Workplace blog later this week.

Our friend Simon Cross gave a great keynote at the Web Summit yesterday about the future of work, in a mobile-first and millennials-friendly world...He also added a few things about Workplace by Facebook too. 

Nothing new for this group of course, but please let us know what you think.

We started publishing articles on Quartz.com, to discuss the "future of work". 

The topic below (giving everyone a voice and working out loud) should certainly resonate to you. 

Please let us know what you think !

# Workplace is Now One Year Old! 

It's been an exciting 12 months - now more than 30,000 organizations are using Workplace worldwide. They've used Workplace to create over 1,000,000 groups to help teams work together. 

Read about some of the highlights from the year and our new Workplace updates in our [latest blog posts.](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fworkplaceblog.fb.com%2F&h=ATPYDioS7vdt1ejEzAIF1JUPK6gdOKEEs7FPHhv02guWCl7ucA0JeVIi_g-y9PnpQmx7Qj2p-bU6MXNMsDLyM6Zqt4kuoGJRc6nV5-F7EDGXf20y9rv3kBs05RDzW6cwJh74nczXVs3JuouhhCoXXJ-fx0qPpydym-thSHNBgsLXwbsVVdoNJtXxDqYWAlfs9guxNZCzrZzpEWRsaAPSwf1WdgxhXTwJCbMddAVilSxSCYMmVOik1wJZ2ISGUkDCc44kfs3zHdRrb9X9qxPI2yLTYL9MYx1AuzzB5yp8gQ8SpRaEDr1Yy-34fJdOfQ)
## INTRODUCING WORKPLACE CHAT

We've learned this year how many customers rely on real-time communication to get important work done. Messaging has always been a key component of the Workplace experience. But we wanted to make it even easier for people to work together in real time, both on the go and at their desks.

So today, we're launching the Workplace Chat desktop app. Now, anyone can download the app for Workplace Chat on PC, Mac, Android or iOS. (MSI will be coming soon).

[Download the Workplace Chat Desktop App](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/chat)

Workplace Chat has always had mobile and browser components, and now we‚Äôre adding a desktop app. With the desktop app, people can access the same great features of the mobile app directly from their desktop. Workplace Chat includes video chat with a coworker, screen sharing, and file sharing. It also includes features like message reactions, @mentions, and gifs that keep the conversation fun but focused.
## GROUP VIDEO CHAT IS COMING SOON TO WORKPLACE CHAT

And in the coming weeks, we'll update Workplace Chat to include support for group video chat on desktop and on mobile. People will soon be able to click a button and instantly start a video call for their team.
## NEW LOOK AND FEEL

Building on the launch of the Workplace name and logo last year, we're giving all our apps across all platforms a new, fresh, consistent look and feel. These design updates are based on feedback from customers and make it easier to connect and navigate on Workplace.

Admins of Workplace communities will see the new Workplace design first. It will then roll out to all Workplace users in the coming weeks. 

Read more about the new design [here. ](https://workplaceblog.fb.com/product-news/new-design/)

# **Workplace Goes Live with Hootsuite **

Yesterday we launched the first in a LIVE series called "Workplace goes Live with" I want to thank **Kirsty Traill** VP of Customer at Hootsuite for sharing so MANY amazing use cases of Workplace at Hootsuite.

Hootsuite is the leading social media management platform, created by Ryan Holmes in 2008. They have been an early Workplace customer and are leading the transformation and Future of Work in a way that aligns to the company mission and values.

**About the Series**

# Early Access - Making it Easier to Connect and Navigate on Workplace

As a valued member of the Workplace VIP group, we're giving you early access to try a Workplace design refresh before anyone else. We plan to announce the design refresh broadly later this month, **so please don't share information about this update publicly yet. **

We'll also be giving all admins early access to these changes in the coming weeks so they can prepare for questions they may get from their community before the roll-out starts. We will start rolling out the update to everyone on Workplace a few days after the announcement. 
## Here is what's new:  

Everyone person sees content on Workplace that is unique to them and their work - from files to polls to GIFs. With lots of different content from different groups, Workplace can sometimes become a difficult place to navigate. To make Workplace easier to use, over the coming weeks we'll be making some design changes across Workplace on the web and on phones.
 

**Better conversations**
We're always working to help people on Workplace have productive conversations that get work done. To make comment threads easier to follow and join, we've updated the comment style so you can more easily see which comments are direct replies to other people. 

Using chat for questions or group discussions can be a simple way to get work done quickly. As part of this update, we'll be changing the name of the Work Chat apps to Workplace Chat to make it easier to find in the app stores.
 

**Better readability**
 We're making updates to refresh the look and feel of Workplace, including: 
* Updated icons and Like, Comment and Share buttons that are larger and easier to tap. 
* Circular profile pictures to show who's posting or commenting
* Larger link previews to make them easier to read
* Increased color contrast to that typography is more legible
* Smoother interactions to make Workplace more intuitive
* New illustrations in places like group headers 

**Easier navigation **
We wanted to make it easier to find the people and information you need on Workplace. To do this, we're updating the group bookmarks layout, so the groups you use most are easy to find. When you hover over someone's name to get more information, now you'll be able to see if they're online and where they sit in your org chart. And to make the Workplace apps easier to find on your phone, we will update the app icons color to the Workplace grey.

# Book Launch -*The Social Organization* 

Dear VIPs, we can't say no to a good book in the Workplace team, especially when its topic is employee engagement, innovation and the future of the workplace.

For this reason, Robert Porter and the Workplace team will receive [Jon Ingham](http://www.joningham.com/) in our London office for the official book launch of [*The Social Organization](https://www.amazon.co.uk/Social-Organization-Connections-Relationships-Performance/dp/0749480114). *

**Where: **Facebook London, 10 Brock Street, NW1 3FG, London 

**When: **Wednesday, October 18th at 3:30pm
## **ABOUT JON INGHAM & THE EVENT**

Jon Ingham is a UK based consultant who focuses on applying insight and innovation to people management and organization design and development. In his latest book, he suggests evidence from the social brain, physical and online social networks demonstrate the importance of social connection. 

Businesses wanting to use this insight should design their organizations around connections as well as individuals e.g. by incorporating communities (for deep relationships) and networks (for looser but broader connection) as well as functions and project teams within their structures.

Workplace by Facebook is excited to host Jon Ingham for an afternoon to discussing the themes surrounding Jon Ingham's latest book, *The Social Organization*.
## **HOW TO REGISTER**

[**Register here**](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fthesocialorganization.splashthat.com%2F&h=ATPg_4emGOOgTL72Wt9Ukjn7uDjhsYtoJ2jJ4ENKQumRhuKL_fWcWAiuvU6A0IDmF3zxAKXC2Pp6IP65lMUb8wWKq4BmdNBAJzCPc7rIlj2UoVyZe_przYN-obWgWrR4VobTJI_5Gx4bSFKFjuQOVK9ftMZ43VFtzCCF6Z3d9OHKN4egcdQsiqU2BFgpeeVeg9lbrauUnJvXi1rxRHDBsc1-IsQSH56MOoe-j24a4QPA4lwAezYQdrv5JcAqr6yqd7Tlv8r7qn8mzSqeWtweTm4Qb24CiTl-g82B7bSQJE2F3ZJ4LNc-pQ25PCyr)

**Access code: **PIONEER

LAUNCHING OCULUS FOR BUSINESS 

Dear Workplace VIP's, some interesting news from the Facebook Family:

**Today at Oculus Connect 4, a new program entitled "Oculus for Business" has launched.  **

This program is designed for businesses that wish to explore VR in their own business environments by offering Rift bundles, a commercial VR license and additional special sensors. Moreover, bulk ordering and dedicated customer service, both of which were previously unavailable, have been added to the program.

Oculus for Business helps companies that wish to invest in Oculus hardware do so quickly and affordably and with the appropriate licenses.

## **Workplace CHAT  (Beta) is now available for Windows as well as Mac**

A [few weeks ago we announced](https://fb.facebook.com/groups/868270109972267/permalink/1094335010699108/) Workplace Chat (Beta) - a desktop app for Workplace that brings native chat notifications, voice and video calling to the desktop.

We started with Mac and said Windows is coming soon - that time is now!You can now download Workplace Chat for Windows as well as Mac:

We've made many improvements and fixed several bugs in the last few weeks - particularly around Single Sign On - but there are likely more issues we need to work through.If you have feedback, please head over to the [Workplace Chat (Beta) Customer Feedback*Not part of your company*](https://fb.facebook.com/groups/467223736945872/?ref=gs&fref=gs&dti=868270109972267&hc_location=group) group: [https://fb.me/g/28FJNQNnL/Dn435x2V](https://fb.me/g/28FJNQNnL/Dn435x2V)If you're interested in deploying Workplace Chat across your entire organization, please let us know in the comments below and we'll reach out to determine how we might work with you to enable this.

## Why Walmart chose Workplace by Facebook and what it means for the future of work

The workplace continues to evolve and so do we. Today is a particularly exciting day with some big news from us at Workplace:
## [**WALMART ](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fworkplaceblog.fb.com%2Fnews%2Fwalmart-and-workplace%2F&h=ATMkvlyc-prJ3_vqcbWkkfFR9SU20SYL39QIV7hIdiffXPG_QFmXSYlTrzF8cYIXHTh5JXv_Lo9RMzH5MYqASvPMl42WcuZ_fSbGxaOW0qFLO08QkLOzO8Vibz-5vpVkMDqd8TDoT4fkv-hxGtmxfsEJlcmuS7dVUxCGOInT6BoXiZD1RzSgNeongslNXQCCeMnZ0SBEnaksqWrlZzsevxxFu2Z-fcWyEc7NKocUCRYdT96uGx-KI-gntx0bljjP4Sg79R792NYu7axgwjjo-ewErO8Cv1fwornk5mrBaeKGX1d-xknasA)JOINS OVER 14,000 ORGANIZATIONS USING WORKPLACE**

We built Workplace by Facebook to give everyone a place to work together. A space for any organization to collaborate more effectively in a mobile-first world. A platform that helps people to get more done. And we're delighted we can now include Walmart on the list of more than 14,000 organizations like** Starbucks, Spotify, booking.com, Danone, Deliveroo, and Virgin Atlantic **that already using Workplace to help transform the way they work.
> *‚ÄúWe believe the right technology can empower our people. Walmart‚Äôs vision of the future is centered around people ‚Äì by serving the communities people live in and the people who work at Walmart. Workplace shares this mission, and together we're building the next generation workforce.‚Äù*

-- *Clay Johnson, Chief Information Officer and Executive Vice President at Walmart*
## **WHY WALMART CHOSE WORKPLACE**

In our latest blog post, we explore the reasons why the world's largest private employer chose Workplace. It covers:
* How technology helps Walmart empower its people
* How Walmart associates use Workplace to move faster, solve problems and connect with each other
* Their plan to use Workplace to build the next-generation workforce with next-generation talent

Walmart will be using our platform to drive an on-going digital evolution and connect their front-line associates to its corporate culture, all while ensuring information is quickly and efficiently disseminated throughout their global network. Read the[ full background on our blog](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fworkplaceblog.fb.com%2Fnews%2Fwalmart-and-workplace%2F&h=ATPvfKepT_xLiPSCQFTEThuGJpaCaeP6MuAWHoKlVPrSgbO2GG6r9TK_TI0C8ruq7g53Hb9Ohij3cMxcGeZbZMbriV1d_Ff1nC2r-7WE1tdk2vmqMR7vWL9FW-eNyM_XxBkKmoREN0smjzRaE_qRUU7r4ZK7ggnWQtQFL2ph_WU5CYgfXNlyypnv1Jcxl7wC4tCyRLXlwxPVawvJyXxF1Z7p1Of7WOUaUWSq0OPk9dqyJfwGvguUnH_FHt1XgXJstZ8XnLAO6uVTlbPfXhMGvyS5z7KS28eSMdN-NDSyjwuYHco)
## **WHAT'S NEW IN WORKPLACE**

We're inspired by the new ways our partners and customers use Workplace. Here are some of the top updates we've made since our launch, thanks to everyone's feedback:
* Multi-company groups to connect you to the companies you work with
* Live video to broadcast to your entire organization
* Bots that speed up your processes
* Integration. Link seamlessly with Office 365, G Suite, Salesforce, Quip, Box, Dropbox and more
* Org Chart reduces complexity in your organization

Find out more about the latest Workplace features in [our new overview video](https://www.facebook.com/workplacebyfacebook/videos/1433377353377613/).
Our Workplace team is ready & excited to support you with any and all of the above.

# Build more powerful groups with new **Group Insights**

Groups are the core way people collaborate on Workplace. We want to make sure each one is valuable and engaging. Until now, group admins didn't always know who used their groups, which makes building a community tough. 

We heard your feedback, which is why we are excited to announce **Group Insights,** a way for group admins to instantly monitor engagement.

Group Insights offers three interactive dashboards. Each report is also downloadable so admins can take a deeper look. 
1. **Growth Details:** Track membership growth and group membership requests.
1. **Engagement Details:** Measure posts, comments and reactions in a given period of time and see the most popular days and times that members engage. Also review the group's top posts.
1. **Member Details: **See your top contributors.

These insights are meant to be actionable. Use this data to easily identify and connect with top contributors or schedule important executive posts for peak days and times. Since reporting is available for up to 60 days, you'll be able to track the impact of your actions and find out what works.

To get started, click More > **Group Insights** from your group navigation bar.

Want to learn more? Check out our [blog post](https://workplaceblog.fb.com/product-news/group-insights/). 

Have questions? Find our[ FAQ here](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/185242482019292?helpref=uf_permalink).

# Admins Can Now Choose Who to Provision With Selective Sync

Connecting everyone is at the heart of Workplace. Individuals and project teams. Multi-company groups and entire organizations. And today we've made connecting people to the platform even easier. With selective sync, you'll now have greater admin control when inviting and provisioning people to Workplace.
## WHAT'S NEW?

Selective sync updates the G Suite and Azure AD integration to give you more control over who you import into Workplace. 
* Choose to import everyone from your organization. 
* Import specific groups from G Suite or Azure. 
* Or select user groups by management structure. 
## HOW WILL IT HELP ME?

Admins importing users from G Suite or Azure AD will find it easier to provision with selective sync. You'll have more control over who has access to Workplace to help with your staged roll-outs. And it means admins can choose not to automatically provision printers, meeting rooms and other nonpersonnel resources in G Suite and Azure AD in Workplace.
## HOW DO ADMINS USE SELECTIVE SYNC?
* Click on Dashboard in the top right of your profile
* Select Add People to the left of the Company Dashboard
* Select Connect G Suite or Connect Microsoft Azure AD and follow the instructions to select the group or manager you want 

Selective Sync is rolling out over the coming week, so admins will see it soon.

Now generally available to all customers

**What does Workplace say about your culture ? **

**Keeping the 'Frontline Workers' connected with Workplace by Facebook - Event in London, 27th of Sept.**

 

Join us for an event at Facebook Headquarters in London on 27th September to hear from other companies on how they have enabled their workforce and the results so far! Hear from an expert panel and learn how chatbots can be an integral part of this communication strategy.

 

[Register here](https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/keeping-the-frontline-worker-connected-with-workplace-by-facebook-tickets-36762567830?fref=gc&dti=874186822739531)

 

Feel free to  forward this invite to any other companies that you think could benefit from hearing about how Workplace helps connecting frontline workers.

# Take Corporate Action: Hurricane Irma

In the wake of Hurricane Harvey, organizations have ensured the safety of their teams through the deployment of emergency action plans.

These types of plans are multi-dimensional and can be complex to develop. However, they can be integral in securing the safety of employees facing an impending crises. 

Workplace users can leverage a feature of the platform to ultimately strengthen their emergency action plan: Safety Officer.

[**Safety Officer](http://blog.servicerocket.com/adoption/accounting-for-your-people-in-a-crisis-using-workplace-by-facebook) **is an integration available on Workplace, created by its partner Service Rocket. Much like Safety Check on Facebook, Safety Officer gives organizations the ability to receive incident alerts, send incident notifications and account for people during and after an emergency event. 

With [Hurricane Irma](https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__l.facebook.com_l.php-3Fu-3Dhttp-253A-252F-252Fwww.nhc.noaa.gov-252Fgraphics-5Fat1.shtml-253Fcone-26h-3DATM5E-2DoUmc4BrtfANbXgMhOMYcg0-5FslS1cMG6JETqrYIv9rklNddcAJQE-5FiNtrvs68vUo98bIvewkWXvRu39A1FcBtkK-2D-5FTCbzhyvDBdK3uFfr1i8Df5kxJRE7drvYeUwauJT-5FB-2D4tqeG36YbrYl9-5FWYCG67E7Jy3NAAfjjZblbmqw&d=DwMFaQ&c=gtIjdLs6LnStUpy9cTOW9w&r=EZsDvsEfKT9Jdpx3fjb9RBewHauDUSwRXcYXQ7XmCpM&m=npVnJJmcRaGkE1tSAmVRec5pR6NZqfXFktdQYGQc0II&s=fM9ivGJIqBvj2c9AYJQ-8Gx29Jfmz4RBFV7-CQetiak&e) hitting Puerto Rico this morning and potentially Florida over the weekend, we want to raise awareness of this invaluable tool. 

Our thoughts and prayers are with those facing these overwhelming natural disasters.

# Helping corporate emergency action during Hurricane Irma

During Hurricane Harvey in the US, we saw organizations help ensure the safety of their employees by activating their corporate emergency action plan. 

A corporate emergency action plan is complex and multi-dimensional. However, technology can play a small part. With Hurricane [Irma](http://www.nhc.noaa.gov/graphics_at1.shtml?cone) expected to hit Puerto Rico today and potentially Florida over the weekend, we wanted to share this information more broadly.

Safety Officer is an integration available on Workplace, created by Service Rocket. Safety officer on Workplace is like Safety Check on Facebook.

During hurricane Harvey we saw Safety Officer give organizations the ability to receive incident alerts, send incident notifications and account for their employees during and after an emergency event.  More details [here](https://work.prod.facebook.com/notes/workplace-vips-fyi/safety-officer-for-workplace/1119021918230417/)

Our thoughts and prayers are with those who face these natural disasters. Please do not hesitate to reach out to the Service Rocket team if you have any questions about Safety Officer. The Service Rocket team is on standby.

# IMPORTANT SAVE THE DATES

# Workplace Transform Events 

Dear Chief Workplace Officers,

We have published the event registration pages for our **annual Workplace Transform Events ** so that you may start confirming your RSVP and take a look at the tentative schedule.

Please go to the page that is in your country or that you can make it to and let us know who you will be coming with!

## Event Registration Pages (password: pioneer)
- [Workplace Transform Norway](https://workplacetransformnorway.splashthat.com) - Sep 14
- [Workplace Transform France](https://workplacetransformparis.splashthat.com) - Oct 10
- [Workplace Transform Netherlands](https://workplacetransformnetherlands.splashthat.com) - Oct 12
- [Workplace Transform Italy](https://workplacetransformitaly.splashthat.com) - Nov 14
- [Workplace Transform NYC]
(https://workplacetransformnyc2017.splashthat.com) - Sept 27th

## We look forward to seeing you there!
*Note: there is a maximum of 2 people per company +1 CWO friend.*

# [Engagement Awards Entry Open](https://uk.ee-awards.com/)

Dear Chief Workplace Officers, The entry for the annual Engagement Awards is now open until October 6th with the ceremony taking place in January 2018.
* The Employee Engagement Awards in association with People Insight provide a platform to recognise excellence in engagement that inspires action and drives the industry and the employee experience forward.
* The Employee Engagement Awards winners will be announced at a black tie Awards Gala Dinner at Wembley Stadium on **January 25, 2018**. The evening will include a Champagne Reception, three-course dinner with wine, the Awards presentation and live band entertainment.
* The Employee Engagement Awards are your chance to come together as a community to network, learn and celebrate with each other. This high-profile event offers you the perfect place to meet hundreds of industry leaders and discuss how the last 12 months have affected you.

**Our Global Product Marketing Communications Lead, Nicola Brassington, has extensive experience with awards and has offered a proof-read consultation on your applications in order to review they are high quality.**
# Let me know if you are interested in this and hopefully we will see a few of you getting recognition for the amazing work you have done at bringing your organizations closer together!

# Workplace Integrations with Salesforce, SAP, Atlassian

Following the [April launch of our initial product integrations](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/blog/whats-new/f8-2017/?ref=blog) with Microsoft Office, G Suite, Box, Dropbox, Salesforce and Quip, we are working on extending and deepening product integrations for Workplace.

As part of this effort, we are exploring further product integrations with various enterprise software vendors.  For three of them, we have set up user groups to discuss integration ideas and concepts:

1. Salesforce & Quip
2. SAP (S/4, Successfactors, Concur & Ariba)
3. Atlassian (Jira, Trello, Confluence)

If you would like to join either of these groups, please comment on this post and I will add you.

Equally, feel free to comment with additional product integration suggestions, or [vote on an earlier poll on this topic](https://fb.facebook.com/groups/868270109972267/permalink/996637383802205/) in this VIP group, which we are still monitoring.

Thank you very much in advance for your thoughts. We appreciate you taking the time to make the Workplace product better!

# Workplace Chat (Beta) is now available for Windows as well as Mac

A [few weeks ago we announced](https://fb.facebook.com/groups/868270109972267/permalink/1094335010699108/) Workplace Chat (Beta) - a desktop app for Workplace that brings native chat notifications, voice and video calling to the desktop. 

We started with Mac and said Windows is coming soon - that time is now!

You can now download Workplace Chat for Windows as well as Mac:
* Windows: https://www.facebook.com/work/chat/download/win
* Mac: https://www.facebook.com/work/chat/download/mac

Please note that this is still beta software. We've made many improvements and fixed several bugs in the last few weeks - particularly around Single Sign On - but there are likely more issues we need to work through.

If you have feedback, please head over to the Workplace Chat (Beta) Customer Feedback group: https://fb.me/g/28FJNQNnL/Dn435x2V

If you're interested in deploying Workplace Chat across your entire organization, please let us know in the comments below and we'll reach out to determine how we might work with you to enable this.

With Workplace Chat now available for Mac and Windows - we're excited to see how it helps people connect better at work.
How to use Workplace by Facebook to collaborate with your clients, partners and customers, by Carrie Basham Young, from Talk Social To Me.

# Next Week the Invite People Settings Will Be Changing

Workplace community admins have told us that adding and inviting people to claim their Workplace account can be confusing. 

Today, there are two options:  

1) Add and invite people to claim their Workplace account in one step (default). 

2) Add accounts and then invite people to claim their Workplace account at a later date.  

Using option 2, means community admins can setup their Workplace community, setup users, setup groups and plan their launch before hitting the ‚Äúinvite all‚Äù button. 

However the option to do this is currently difficult to find in the Company Dashboard Preferences. 
## WHAT IS CHANGING? 

To make this setting easier to find and use, we're changing the setting so when an account is added via bulk import the admin will be asked to select: ‚ÄúInvite Now‚Äù or ‚ÄúInvite When I'm Ready‚Äù. 

There will no longer be the below setting in the Preferences section of the Company Dashboard: 

*When should people receive their invitation to join Workplace?*
* *As soon as you've created their account (Recommended after launch)*
* *When you choose to invite them*
## WHEN IS THIS CHANGING? 

On Tuesday 15th August we are planning to roll this change out to 20% of Workplace Communities. On Thursday 17th August, this will be rolled out to 100% of communities who are **not** **mid-launch.**
## FAQS: 

**What does this mean for my community if I am mid-launch?**

This change will not affect your Workplace community if you have already used the current setting to import users but not yet launched. If your community is mid launch, the setting will remain unchanged and you can launch when you are ready. Next time you bulk import people into Workplace, you will be asked if you want to invite these people now or when you are ready. 

**What if I want to do a staged roll out and invite my company in phases?**

If you select **Invite later**, the ability to send invitations will be enabled under **Setup** in your Company Dashboard. You can choose to invite everyone in one go or in phases. 

**How does this work if I am adding people using G Suite or Azure AD?**

When you setup your identity provider for the first time, you'll be asked whether you want to send invites now or later. 

If you choose ‚ÄúInvite now‚Äù we will immediately add and invite your users to Workplace and any any new users that are synced with the provider will automatically be invited to Workplace.

If you choose ‚ÄúInvite later‚Äù, we will add your users but will not send out any invitations until you're ready. Any users that we sync from your identify provider in the meantime will also not be invited. Once you are ready to launch and have invited everyone, any new users will automatically be invited to Workplace.

This only applies to G Suite and Azure AD. For all other IDP's, the default is always to ‚Äúinvite later‚Äù.   

**To learn more about to adding and inviting people, [click here.](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/1179878008737489?helpref=hc_fnav)**

# Ensuring the Security of Workplace Accounts

A core part of the Workplace mission is to provide a secure community for everyone who uses Workplace. Maintaining the security of information on Workplace is at the very heart of what we do.
## **AT RISK ACCOUNT CREDENTIALS**

Today we're adding a new security feature which helps ensure the security of Workplace account credentials.

Workplace will show the admins of a community if an account is suspected of being a security risk. An account will be marked ‚ÄúAt Risk‚Äù if the password has been used for a non-Facebook/Workplace service that has suffered a data breach. 

If a Workplace account is at risk, an attacker may be able to access the Workplace community. Therefore, we recommend admins force the affected users to reset their passwords or disable their accounts.
## **HOW DOES IT WORK?**

To see which accounts may be at risk:

1. Click **Dashboard** at the top right of your home page

2. Click **People** to the left of your Dashboard

Accounts that Workplace suspects are at risk will be highlighted in red and labeled **Account At Risk**. 

To disable the user or force them to reset their password, click the settings cog icon next to the at risk account and select **Deactivate User** or **Force Password Reset.**

This feature is not enabled for organizations using single sign on (SSO). 

To find out more about Workplace security [click here.](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/security/?source=topbar)

# Invite People to Multi-Company Groups Who Are Not Using Workplace

We built Workplace to help people come together and discover new, better ways of working. We've heard from organizations like Starbucks and YES BANK how Workplace is connecting teams so people can share ideas, learn from each other and collaborate on projects. 

Fast communication, collaboration and connectivity are transforming the world of work. Information needs to flow quickly and securely **between** organizations just as it does within them. Building strong relationships with suppliers, agencies, partners, contractors and buyers builds value and success. 
## WHAT ARE MULTI-COMPANY GROUPS? 

To enable multiple organizations to work together, we built multi-company groups. They work in the same way as other Workplace groups, but in multi-company groups you can invite people from other organizations to join the group too. 

We've now made multi-company groups even easier to use. You can now invite someone from another organisation to work with you in a multi-company group just by entering their work email address or sharing an invite link ‚Äî they don't even need to have a Workplace account. 
## HOW ARE MULTI-COMPANY GROUPS USED? 

**Teamwork**

Multi-company groups simplify teamwork across organizations. 

For example, design agencies use multi-company groups with their clients. In the group when they share draft images and videos of creative ideas, the client approves them with just a Like. 

**Announcements**

Announcements to partners, buyers and customers can be shared quickly and easily with multi-company groups. 

In the Workplace team we've built a multi-company group called Workplace Product Announcements to share our latest product updates. [Anyone can join here! ](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Ffb.me%2Fg%2F1AMi5mhL8%2F0JR6yrKi&h=ATMboUzBWSN6nRVU7T2lC4YxGC9NDTN3VjzYR69oBDWmggRQxzRaGHBQ72zlXFspntUKcXMJTTM6aq5Vc4NBo0ol3zyNWCvlLCD44l1P9ou-j8yhjpcJ9443qFe4Zcm0zTEwhKaaaTq8BYl-VhZagdTBYsrXIBO_yylsReWEWbm3LmoabOq19b6e0s4Y9vWxsAEmppXXttxEEKOZ71WI3qK8Ux-ERXqaGGB0k6b5epSFMtwDa8bp9ol14IqOUKvMPZvYqmqedN-cZeoPaoUXBhO5cWDlrahZiUhC6fMDew0)

**Communities**

Multi-company groups are also a great way to build professional communities. 

Creating a group called ‚ÄúLondon HR Managers‚Äù would provide a secure space to share best practices, plan events and even broadcast Live video from meet ups. 
## HOW ARE MULTI-COMPANY GROUPS CREATED? 

To create a multi-company group, click Groups from the left hand navigation bar, next to News Feed. In the groups view, click Create Group, then select Multi-Company from the list of options. 

To invite people from other organizations to the group, enter their work email address to send an invitation. If you invite someone and they don't already have a Workplace account, they will receive an email invitation, complete a short sign up process and open Workplace to see the multi-company group they were invited to join. 

It is currently not possible to create multi-company groups with people using publicly available email addresses such @gmail.com or @outlook.com. 
## WHERE CAN I LEARN MORE? 

To read the multi-company groups FAQs [click here.](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/254734331656422/?helpref=hc_fnav) 

In the FAQs you can learn more about privacy controls and who controls the data shared in multi-company groups.

# **Congratulations to our June 2017 Inspiring Workplaces!**

*Whoop, we're hugely excited to announce our next round of recipients of our **Inspiring Workplace** recognition! * 

These organizations have been nominated by Customer Success Managers and are chosen from across the globe based on their outstanding Workplace engagement and business results. 

**To our Inspiring Workplaces: CONGRATS** - You are an inspiring organization that embraces transparency, sharing and collaboration, offering your employees a better way to work and connect. You and your teams are the reason we developed Workplace so please continue to share your stories with the group. *We are very excited to announce the recipients of Workplace's Digital Visionary recognition for June 2017! It is always very humbling to see how our customers are using Workplace to transform their companies.*

**June 2017 - DIGITAL VISIONARIES**

Congratulations to all of you! - you've been a true champion of change. We will send you the badge separately and you are welcome to display it proudly. Thank you for your hard work and dedication!

# Important update about Workplace Premium billing

Thank you for being on the Workplace journey with us during the free trial period for Workplace Premium. On October 1st, 2017, we will start charging organizations who have used Workplace Premium for 90 days or more (the first invoice to be issued on November 1st). If you are still within your free trial period, billing will commence on the first calendar day once your free trial is complete.

Workplace Premium remains free for non-profits and staff of educational institutions. If you believe your organization qualifies as a non-profit or is used by staff in educational institution, please contact Workplace Support at the earliest opportunity.
 
## What do you need to do? 
 
Workplace Premium System Admins will soon start receiving notifications to set up their community account for billing.
 **There is no action required today but soon your System Admin will need to verify your organization‚Äôs payment details. This will need to be completed by October 1st, 2017.**
 
## How Much Does Workplace Premium Cost? 
 
Workplace uses progressive pricing. 
- The first 1,000 monthly active users are charged at $3 per user, per month.
- The next 9,000 monthly active users are charged at $2 per user, per month.
- Monthly active users over 10,000 in a community will be charged at $1 per user, per month. This is exclusive of applicable taxes. The billing currency is USD.
- For example:
   - If you had 1,200 monthly active users during the month, your bill would be calculated as follows: (1,000 x $3) + (200 x $2) = USD $3,400.
   - If you had 15,000 monthly active users your bill would be calculated as follows: (1,000 x $3) + (9,000 x $2) + (5,000 x $1) = USD $26,000.

## What Are The Benefits of Workplace Premium?
 
There are two versions of Workplace: Workplace Premium and Workplace Standard. Workplace Standard is free and includes communication and productivity features. Workplace Premium includes all the features in Workplace Standard, plus enterprise controls to connect entire organizations:
 - User Management & SSO
 - Analytics
 - Integrations with 3rd Party Providers
 - 1:1 Support
 
To find about more about the differences between Workplace Premium and Workplace Standard click [here](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/pricing/?source=topbar)
 
For Workplace pricing FAQs click [here]( https://fb.facebook.com/help/work/1813697888953906/?helpref=hc_fnav)
 
If you need additional help, please contact your Workplace 1:1 admin support.  
 
# Thanks!

# Announcing Workplace Chat (Beta) - A Desktop App for Workplace

Workplace is changing how people communicate and collaborate at work, with Workplace for the web and Workplace for iOS and Android. 

However, one of the top Workplace feature requests is for a chat desktop app. **So we've built one, and now it's ready for beta testing on Mac!**

Workplace Chat has: 
* Native desktop notifications for chat messages
* App badging for chat notifications
* Workplace group notifications
* Voice and video calling
## **HOW DO I TEST IT? **

Workplace Chat for Mac is now available for beta testing. Workplace Chat for Windows is coming very soon, and we'll update you as soon as it's ready. 

[You can download Workplace Chat for Mac here.](https://www.facebook.com/work/chat/download/mac)

To share your feedback with us, [join the Workplace Chat (Beta) Customer Feedback group.](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Ffb.me%2Fg%2F28FJNQNnL%2FDn435x2V&h=ATMKIDEbK3STB_kTcsPCvd7QZRWDAjwqfBP3yGYEsx03lCt4uNOyzdPHnlEe__KpL9vq9csKe2xEXoLmWJdwm5Rl_HB89x8e2mFEXD-HPDQQvs31K1h11kL4WUgu03HRAcNpTKAbEyMHutSh5xfPGceQFqT_-34PP1Wgg8NdkjmiVGw) 

Please bear in mind Workplace Chat is a beta product. We are continuing to add features and improve stability, but there may be bugs, and we can't yet commit to long term support or availability of this app.
## **WHO CAN TEST IT? **

We're inviting Workplace Partners and VIP customers to beta test Workplace Chat before anyone else. During the beta phase, we won't be promoting this app widely. But if you want other people in your organization to try Workplace Chat for Mac, feel free to forward them the link. 

We're actively looking for companies that are keen to help us test Workplace Chat at scale. If you're interested in deploying Workplace Chat to everyone in your organization, please comment below and we'll get back to you about being involved in an additional trial. 

At Facebook, we've been using Workplace Chat for a few months, and the feedback has been incredible. People are telling us it's changing how they use chat on Workplace, as native notifications and app badging helps people stay connected to their team and coworkers. 

We're excited to see how Workplace Chat transforms how you and your teams communicate.

Happy testing! 

## **FAQS**

**Which operating systems are supported?** 

Windows 7 and above. macOS 10.9 (Mavericks) and above. Earlier versions of macOS and Windows are not supported. The Windows version will be available in the coming weeks.

**Where can I give feedback or ask for help?** 

Please join the Workplace Chat (Beta) Customer Feedback group by following [this link.](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Ffb.me%2Fg%2F28FJNQNnL%2FDn435x2V&h=ATMKIDEbK3STB_kTcsPCvd7QZRWDAjwqfBP3yGYEsx03lCt4uNOyzdPHnlEe__KpL9vq9csKe2xEXoLmWJdwm5Rl_HB89x8e2mFEXD-HPDQQvs31K1h11kL4WUgu03HRAcNpTKAbEyMHutSh5xfPGceQFqT_-34PP1Wgg8NdkjmiVGw)

**How often will Workplace Chat be updated?** 

While we don't have a regular timeline for new releases, we'll update the app from time to time to make bug fixes, performance improvements and feature enhancements. When an update is available, you'll see a green banner. Clicking on this banner will install the latest version of the app. 

**What information is sent to Workplace when I'm using this app?** 

People using Workplace Chat, agree to our Privacy Policy and Terms of Service. We collect basic information about use of the app in order to provide the service and improve people's experiences. This includes when people start and stop using the app, use the features within the app, and the person who's currently logged in.  

**Does Workplace Desktop require administrative privileges to install?** 

Anyone can install Workplace Desktop unless it has been explicitly blocked by their system administrator.

**Is Workplace Chat available in the Mac App Store or Windows Store?** 

During the beta testing phase, Workplace Chat is only available from the download links listed above.

message:
# Schedule Posts to Publish on a Specific Day and Time

Posting in a group is a great way to share information and start discussions. Sometimes though, a post has to be published at a time when it is not convenient to write it. 

To help, we've built post scheduling. Post scheduling means people can compose a post when it is convenient, and schedule it to publish at a specific date and time. 
## **HOW IS IT USED?**

At Facebook, we've been using post scheduling to manage company-wide announcements and publish sequences of posts to share timely on-boarding information with new employees. 
## **HOW DOES IT WORK?**

Starting today, everyone on Workplace can choose to schedule a post. To schedule a post, write a post in a group and click the clock icon next to the ‚ÄúPost‚Äù button to choose the date and time when it will be published.To find out more about scheduling posts [click here](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/110451072942718). 

To stay up to date with product announcements,[ join this group.](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Ffb.me%2Fg%2F1AMi5mhL8%2F0JR6yrKi&h=ATOIACmO9TBJ70mkEsMLLfphuTYkdBsCl9O-GMT8Ip7iYhBR1m5puuwYTvSY38Nx1arNIEQyMry-Pfd64SWA-fE9nW53W0DnMV7wrIdknUQhexE1wvwQHr8s3xNIY5aP3cr_9Mr3BmDFpS0urqBgT-5XiTcwtvfrT464LO6eg_XTkOc)

## Join us for a [webinar](http://learn.converse.ai/workplacewebinar) with Tony Lucas, CEO of Converse.ai, one of our bot platform partners

Increasingly, bots for Workplace are a focus for internal business strategies, increasing employee engagement and integrating multiple business processes and workflows. 

**What to expect**: In this webinar, Tony Lucas, CEO of Converse.AI will discuss:
- How do you identify your first bot use case
- What type of strategy fits your objectives
- The different ways to measure success
- How to approach your bot roll out plan
- What are the typical problems with a bot roll out and how to avoid them. 

**When**: Wednesday, July 19th at 11am GMT

**Register [here](http://learn.converse.ai/workplacewebinar).** We will also share the recording of the session for those who aren't able to attend live.

# Inspiration: Club Med

I've been supporting Club Med get the most out of Workplace for a few months now. Lately the team has managed to get great results thanks to an inspiring campaign run company-wide. 

So when Olivier shared with me the video part of this campaign, I immediately felt like sharing it with all of you. It's so great to see Workplace empower the culture in such an iconic company.

Have you used a similar video in your Workplace launch/engagement plan? Feel free to share it in the comments!

story: Lara Harrison uploaded a file in the group: Workplace Admins Community.

message:
# Testing a New Notifications Hub

Groups in Workplace are a great way to stay up to date on projects, participate in discussions and hear new announcements. However, the more groups and conversations someone is a part of, the more notifications there are to manage. To make managing notifications easier, we're testing a new Notification Hub. 

## Who will get it?
50% of people on Workplace will get the new Notification Hub. By testing the feature we're hoping to learn if it's valuable and how we can improve it before Notification Hub launches to everyone. By testing features in this way we can learn how people use them in the real world which helps us build great experiences. If you'd like to learn more about Facebook's approach to testing and feature roll-outs you can find out more [here](https://work.facebook.com/groups/329644324122247/permalink/334717583614921/). 

To see if you have Notification Hub, go to the left hand navigation bar next to your News Feed and look for the tab labelled ‚ÄúNotification Hub‚Äù or click on ‚ÄúSee All‚Äù at the bottom of the notification jewel.

## What does it do? 
With Notification Hub you can see, preview and respond to your notifications all on one page. Notification Hub can also filter your notifications by unread, tags and replies and multi-company groups. 

## How do I give feedback? 
Give it a try and let us know what you think by clicking on the Help Center icon, then Send Feedback on the top right of the navigation bar.

## FAQs that can be shared with users
**What is Notification Hub?**
Notification Hub is one place where you can see and manage all your Workplace notifications. In the center of the page you can see a list of your notifications. Clicking on a notification shows a preview of what you are being notified about. 

For example, if someone has commented on your post, when you click on the notification in Notification Hub it will show your post and the feed of comments, as it would appear in the group. You can then respond to the comment straight from the preview in Notification Hub. 

Notification Hub can also filter notifications by: Unread, tags and replies and multi-company groups. 

**How do I access Notification Hub?**
Notification Hub can be accessed from the left hand navigation bar next to News Feed. Or by clicking on the notification icon in the top bar navigation, and selecting See All at the bottom. 

**Why do some coworkers have it and others don't?**
Only 50% of people on Workplace currently have the new Notification Hub. This is because the Workplace team are learning if it's valuable and how it can be improved before Notification Hub launches to everyone. If the test goes well, Notification Hub will roll out to everyone on Workplace.

**How should I use Notification Hub?**
Notification Hub can be used in addition or as an alternative to the current notification drop down on the top navigation bar. Notification Hub is most useful when managing a large number of notifications. 

**What types of notifications can be filtered?**
Notification Hub can filter notifications by: All, unread, tags and replies and multi-company groups. 

**What do the settings at the bottom of Notification Hub mean?**
There are two settings at the bottom of the Notification Hub page: Hide Reactions and Open Links in a New Page. 

Hide Reactions lets you hide reaction notifications. This setting is useful if you just want to see more important notifications where, for example, you have been mentioned or content has been shared in a group. 

Open Links in a New Page means when a notification is clicked it will open in a new page rather than showing an interactive preview on the right hand side of the notification list.

"*Workplace is the first thing I look at in the morning*" says the CEO of XPO Logistics, Inc., 90 000 employees, fastest growing company on the Fortune 500 list.

A  great interview, from a very inspiring leader. (see the workplace part, at 1m35).

# Try the New Org Chart 

In the the coming days we're launching Org Chart in Workplace to help people find coworkers and teams in their organization. 

We're giving members of the VIP group early access to try Org Chart first today. Soon you'll be able to find a link to it in the navigation column to the left of your News Feed and on people's profiles.
## About ORG CHART

We often hear from large organizations that finding the right people to work with can be challenging. So, we're launching Org Chart, which visualizes your organization and helps you quickly find people and teams. 
## **VISUALIZE YOUR ORGANIZATION**

Your Org Chart shows an interactive view of everyone in your organization and how they fit together. By clicking on people, you can navigate through departments. 
## **SEARCH FOR COWORKERS**

You can also search for coworkers in Org Chart by entering a job title, department, location or name, for example: ‚ÄúKelly sales London‚Äù. Once you've found the person you're looking for in Org Chart, you'll see their contact information, so you can: 
* Send a Work Chat message
* Follow them on Workplace
* Send an email
## **ORG CHART & DANONE**

Danone, a world-leading food company and Workplace customer, have been testing Org Chart for the past few weeks. Here's what Danone CIO, Jean-Michel Egu, had to say about the Org Chart in Workplace: 
> *"The Org Chart feature is another good reason to connect to Workplace. It is a fast and intuitive feature. It helps our employees to know better who is who and to build connections"*
## **WHEN WILL IT BE ROLLED OUT to all Workplace communities?**

Org Chart will begin rolling out to all Workplace communities from tomorrow. We expect Org Chart to be available to 100% of Workplace communities by the end of next week.  
## FAQs: 

**How do I see my Org Chart?**
There are links to your Org Chart in two places in Workplace. In your News Feed there's a link to view your Org Chart in the left-hand navigation column. And you'll also find a link to Org Chart in profiles. 

**How do I update or change my organization's Org Chart information?** Admins can edit employees information in the Company Dashboard or using the SCIM API. If profile editing is enabled, employees will be able to edit their own manager information or specify who they manage to build a more accurate Org Chart.

**How do I navigate the Org Chart?**
Click on people's cards to see whom they report to and who reports to them. 

**What do the numbers mean next to names?**
The numbers in grey circles show how many people report to that person. 

**Is Org Chart available on mobile?**
Org Chart will be coming soon to Workplace mobile apps on iOS and Android.

**Is Org Chart available on Standard?**
Org Chart is only available on Workplace Premium
**The 5 key responsibilities of Workplace community managers (and how to handle them), by Ren√©e van Holsteijn from T-Mobile NL. **

**Kore.ai free, secure Workplace Bots for Workplace VIPs. **

Happy to share that Kore.ai ,one of our bot platform partners, launched a Workplace Bot-store for customers. 

You will find 4 free, pre-built chatbots (*Thanks Bot, Survey Bot/mood-o-meter, Feed Poster Bot, Weather Bot*) that your Workplace Admin can immediately make available for individuals and groups throughout your company! 

**These 4 bots are hosted and run on Kore.ai cloud bot platform which is SOC2 compliant. **

Just point your Workplace Admin to [https://workplace.kore.ai](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fworkplace.kore.ai%2F&h=ATMI69l0D7QyCxlij00rWrd4QsSagStfaDjopxvCWTQz-Pglc6L_by_m3JkgbZ1V7QrlaMEXsWCpsf46kcFf5fKc_wTqXukQQLRKpPza2_xQIEVl4tDqXDNF505W8qjHiH0t_YomEbPkvHqi3xjtXcEJ97qjHXh4dC_nLTu4Nx8vyg) for instructions on how to set up these bots for your company. In case of questions, feel free to reach out to Robin Kearon at Kore.

The 4 bots are:
* **Thanks Bot: **Chatbot that likes and comments on a post where an employee is appreciated in Facebook Workplace
* **Survey Bot: **Chatbot that triggers a survey on Work Chat for a specific employee, and tracks the employee‚Äôs mood on Workplace. Every employee can have access to create their own survey using the bot. 
* **Feed Poster Bot:** chatbot that automates the process of posting new articles into a Workplace group when new content appears on a given RSS feed.
* **Weather Bot:** provides local and long range weather forecasts, tropical weather conditions and severe weather alerts for locations worldwide.

Over the coming months, Kore.ai will continue to introduce other chatbots to Workplace. Just point your Workplace Admin to [https://workplace.kore.ai ](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fworkplace.kore.ai%2F&h=ATMI69l0D7QyCxlij00rWrd4QsSagStfaDjopxvCWTQz-Pglc6L_by_m3JkgbZ1V7QrlaMEXsWCpsf46kcFf5fKc_wTqXukQQLRKpPza2_xQIEVl4tDqXDNF505W8qjHiH0t_YomEbPkvHqi3xjtXcEJ97qjHXh4dC_nLTu4Nx8vyg)for instructions on how to set up these bots for your company.

# ** Introducing Clevy for Workplace**

Last week at Viva Technology, I had the opportunity to meet with Clevy team. **Clevy is a platform for easily creating and managing Q&A chatbots for Workplace**. You can create fully autonomous Q&A bots on any topic by simply importing a flat excel file containing questions and answers and connecting it to workplace without any code.

I have been so impressed I have asked them to send me a demo so I can share it with all our Workplace VIPs. 

This kind of solution can have a massive impact on employees productivity but also cost savings (# of tickets created). 

With **Clevy**, you can basically answer the most frequent questions of your employees on many topics:
* HR policies: How many vacation days do I have? What's the insurance policy? How do I submit travel and expenses?
* IT Helpdesk level 1: How do I reset my password? How do I start a video conference? My phone doesn't work anymore, what do I do?
* Change management: questions about the organization, or the takeover of another company

Good news Clevy understands French and English. I have asked the team and they told me other languages are coming very soon!

You can learn more about Clevy on their website: [https://www.clevy.io/en](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.clevy.io%2Fen&h=ATPxLKp-aoEwHQYq8v3KF6GdSPyabde-nehc8qYCUwNIKFn2SefpUCCBqwHbIoZIJfbSWfkP6bss71CgzCbm6-VSoVPyPnqlxERUyw2IUMFzEPbSW7bC1z9elBTJup0kK1bvDkVsc2XBvILR2hf0Lyg)

What do you think?

Our friend Adam Clyne, CEO of COOLR, is organizing an event, at Facebook London, to discuss how to build "**a next-gen workplace for the next-generation of talents**", on the 6th of July.

**Adam was formerly COO of The LAD Bible, and before that, he was in charge of innovation at Weber Shandwick.**

**Feel free to sign-up, and see you there !**

Technology is disrupting everything - there's a war for the best talent and by 2020 millennials will make up over half of the workforce. The next generation of talent expect a next generation workplace.

How will your company keep up?

Join us for an exclusive event and inspirational conversation that explores the new working world - and how to be ready for it.

# 30 Use Cases for Bots on Workplace

If you didn‚Äôt catch the webinar **‚ÄúEntering the Conversational Era: The Why, What and How of Bringing Dialog to Your Digital Strategy with Chatbots,‚Äù **you can access the on-demand version [here.](https://kore.ai/webinar-dialog-digital-strategy-chatbots/)

Coming out of that live session, our chatbot development platform partner Kore.ai also gave attendees an e-book with 30 real chatbot use cases for Workplace across functions like HR, IT help desk, sales and beyond. 

Here‚Äôs a [**link**](https://kore.ai/top-30-use-cases-workplace-facebook/) to the eBook for those exploring AI-powered chatbots. It's a good read, and I personally found it very useful to learn about some of the problems that people are solving with chat bots.

Several people have asked for a video file they can share with colleagues not in this group.  Here it is attached.

message:
# Livestream metrics

We're seeing more live streaming and people are asking about metrics. There are some basic views, but I wondered if anyone had any thoughts on what metrics can be captured for live stream. Also, are there plans to roll out the video performance metrics we see on Facebook to Workplace?

I had an opportunity to meet Tram Nguyen today, coincidentally at a Workplace event that our partner GoPomelo hosted in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam.  Tram very much inspired me with her passion and excitement, which I wanted to share in our Workplace VIP community:

Christina's, where Tram runs HR, is a young travel and tour operator.  With 120 core team and 60 affiliated staff, Tram and team's mission is to change people's perspective on Vietnam: from being seen as a war-torn ex-communist country to one of amazingly friendly people with a modern economy. 

Tram tells me that Workplace is essential for Christina's to interact closely among their team, to maintain their superb customer service and quality.  Christina's is using Facebook for all their customer interactions, and aims for a response time of just a few minutes or less.  Which of course requires the team to be very connected and responsive internally with one-another, through Workplace.  Tram says people at Christina's couldn't live without Workplace anymore. 

I found it very inspiring to experience that while physical infrastructure and other material developments in emerging markets take some time to develop, people have taken to digital products and platforms in a cutting edge way to start & grow their business and deliver superb customer experience.  

It's seeing Workplace change people's life that make me go to work every morning, pumped.  It was so wonderful meeting you, Tram.  Thank you for sharing your story!

# Happy 30th anniversary to GIFs!

Facebook is [celebrating](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fnewsroom.fb.com%2Fnews%2F2017%2F06%2Fcelebrating-30-years-of-the-gif%2F&h=ATNiX991nYaX3y0gMGrPzE0Uah_iCmuVU3CuihVHayMCwXZTKF44jEs_zBPGuQ6gJDSnpKIj2gajA7At9vZbY0mjVH4-_6nkbLJbQEl542zb5aun-Jt_1xdrYGxSijgD9ZYBgd1dwbA9nwAx1-Y1tTTB7kJbugheOgoJREpNtt05&enc=AZP0t-KT-0Yjc1v1-PpmJDslyG4qqXqMWWoc_IgLjwsqB-fBmmeghUCCeZIFPTMhdMfzaqR0XgXIfUK7wz6FwJD6lFcvm4tYpLopvNGTPYCTchmIt5i62w-dIGIPwRfkpV6iz-_ToBLLmw7TRiuFjwkMULPIMZvZeqNR3tvVc2qnANqBZoE9Jq6Thh8UqzXVFnU&s=1) the 30th anniversary of the GIF. So we're joining the party and bringing GIFs in comments to Workplace.

The choice is yours so have fun! :)

# Launching today: a better way for admins to view claim rates and take action

With enhanced reports available in the Company Dashboard, company admins can see who has claimed or not, and filter that information by manager or department. You can also sort the results to suit your needs. 

With a few clicks, an email can be sent to remind these people to claim. You can use the default template or customize your message to be more relevant to that group. For example, if you filter the claim rates by manager, you can include references that are relevant to that team to make it more personal.  

We're starting the rollout today so you may not see the update right away.

message: Hi All , We at UST Global are delighted to announce that we have successfully integrated our Corporate Chatbot with Workchat . Dia has a weekly traffic of 35000 transactions . Implementation of Dia has reduced our helpdesk and support request traffic by 30%  and with the integration with Workchat we expect these numbers to go even Higher . The ROI from Having a corporate chatbot is evident from the very first day . Dia currently  has various functionalities like Unlimited Context search, HRMS Integration , Finance Integration and ServiceNow Integration etc. No more questions like how much perdiem will I get , What all approvals are pending , How do I install Adobe Reader and Millions more  . Soon we will be adding Facial recognition, NLP ,Learning , Rewards and recognition ,Exit interviews,Optical Character Recognition , Machine Learning and Voice Integration into Dia .  The Only Bottleneck we have is inability to imagine use cases quick enough. UST Global has been dedicated to its primary goal of going digital and This Endeavor is a huge leap in making UST Global a fully digital company . Any other companies interested in joining us for the ride , staying ahead of the curve and implementing this for their company feel free to get in touch with me  anish.nair1@ust-global.com . Let‚Äôs collaborate and take this to a level unheard and ever thought of.
Our first Bot at XPO has steadily been getting smarter as we train him, and we are almost ready to send him out into the world!  Launch date 6/21.

Feel free to reach out if you are interested in this and more integrations with office applications, the more you tell us of your needs the more we can help to deliver them to you.

anyone? Thanks

Hi everyone, for those that don't know Converse AI, we are one of the launch partners for bots on Workplace.

Converse is a bot platform that allows companies to easily build Workflow bots without writing code.

We've been working very closely with the Workplace team to deliver some of the use cases that you have been requesting, and wanted to let you know about one we've just launched, the Survey Bot

You can now easily deploy a Survey Bot into Workplace (like the Moodometer), easily design and modify the questions you want to ask in our graphical UI.

You can then broadcast it to the entire Workplace, or a subset of Group and/or Department as needed.

The data is stored and can then be retrieved and outputted as Pie Charts or in other ways as needed.

Check the video out for a demonstration and feel free to get in touch if you would like to learn more.

Today we had a town-hall in Oslo with our new CEO - which was also broadcasted live on Workplace to the nearly 4000 employees not on site. At the most we had 250 watching live (probably more as colleagues gathered in meeting rooms and watched together). We even had a live Q&A session. Worked like a charm.

**https://help.transformyourworkplace.com/hc/en-us**

This new public resource center is meant to help all our customers launch Workplace with turn-key and professional materials/resources.
## For example all the video we produce to help new users adopt can easily be found in the [Education Center](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fbrandfolder.com%2Fworkplace-transformation&h=ATODw3Ui_rbx2GcqJK4yRpi2Pmm2vd5TmGVOKXWPcP713jGD1zknIpXIIejoy88NQAOV0AUkUABHaXgI-VW2b3xwS_N618_ejk36TAjjUOUioG_6IWv2l2S1N-EhQcCxEds41VpWQw9dRKPkfqdBC33RklZ30fLg9zs1b0fdcnKwvAFOXfNPL4oMPih2WIAXrZR6OLccpfBbOIcEtmuL8gcn1ZhOyUu6LPv6N5n72gi51_gU150mqsVhz6kdiqDDk78O2gLWxHfUdUb0rl888T-INLPqRpx1OU7a5on8KzYKOGgwMHNqJDmqyEsd)

**Additionally, you will be able to find our newly created [Launch Kit](https://brandfolder.com/workplace-launch-kit/?guest_pw=416cf74dd3eae0298cba559875fe180419d688262623e0988f065b17427936c0) which contains champion badges, posters, etc to power up your communication!**
## **BENEFITS**
* Launching a community is not a one and done experience. It's about iteration and this resource center will provide you with latest most up to date best practice materials and educational resources.
* No longer will you have to wait to connect with someone from the Workplace team to get access to key resources. 

**We are always looking to make your experience with Workplace and the Workplace team a valuable one. We look forward to your feedback on what you love about the resource center and any comments/suggestions/questions you may have!**

# Launching Today: Post to a Coworker's Timeline 

Timeline is the home for content a person shares on Workplace. On a coworker's timeline you can see things like posts they've made and their photos and videos. 

From today, you can post directly to a coworker's timeline. Posting to a coworker's timeline is useful when the content is directed just to them, but you would like other people in your organisation to see it. 

You could post to a coworker's timeline to thank someone, ask a question or celebrate an achievement. For example, at Facebook we congratulate people on their work anniversaries.

# **HR bots**

Hi there - i was just wondering if anyone was using Workplace bots for HR related activity?

We are looking to implement an instant peer to peer colleague recognition process and have been looking in to the option of using Workplace as a foundation for this.   Ideally we would like there to be a suite of tools e.g. high five, thumbs up, smiley face, which could be selected with an editable template for a colleague to post and share with their colleagues.  Does anything exist in this format, or has anyone had any experience in creating a reward and recognition process on Workplace? 

Thanks

Lucy

Happy Friday from Silicon Valley! Thanks again to Rebeca for the intro:

[https://work.facebook.com/groups/868270109972267/permalink/1055056624626947/](https://work.facebook.com/groups/868270109972267/permalink/1055056624626947/).

I wanted to share some of my background and experience so we can get to know one another better. I've been building and managing communities for several years now and there is still SO much more to learn! I consider myself a student of the game ‚Äî I enjoy learning with and from dynamic community members such as yourselves.

When it comes to Workplace, I'm a customer as well. I experience the same joys and frustrations y'all experience. I remember feeling ecstatic when Live Reactions came to comments. And triumph when I helped lead the charge to implement more info in the Graph API for a customer.

A feature I'm personally waiting on? Multiple files in one post!

In my past roles, I've empowered product champions to help build the next great feature and worked with change agents to disrupt the status quo in their organizations, and build shared value together. I want to take what I've learned to help better serve y'all.

That being said, I strongly feel that there is community in all things we do: 
* A group text amongst friends
* Organizing a volunteer event at work
* Local church or school events

We ALL have community experience. Community happens to be my profession (and also my passion), but that doesn't mean I'm the only one with community experience. I can seriously talk about community 24/7, I'm THAT invested in it.

message:
**Workplace and how to (not) highlight important content**

One of the things we as Comms sometimes struggle with is to get across important messages in Workplace. There is so much going on and I dare to say that there are quite a few people in our organisation who feel overwhelmed by all the info in Workplace. I know this is a learning journey, that there are vip users and pinned posts etc. but: 

What would really help reduce these effects and close the gap to a traditional intranet are *teasers that can be pinned to the right hand sidebar*. 

This way important company topics can be positioned more prominently or static/important content gets more visibility over time. So instead of cluttering up the screen with group or follow suggestions (that seem not very relevant to me) or other redundant information that can be found on various other places, it would make more sense to make this space customizable for moderators. This could make an Intranet next to Workplace completely redundant for a lot of companies. 

What are you experiences with this? Curious for your feedback!

Hi VIPs! Over at Talk Social to Me, we've just shared a list of proven tactics (that we have used over the years) that you can use to reverse a sudden, unexpected decline in your community engagement:

http://www.talksocialtome.com/blog/2017/5/16/employee-community-engagement-decline

We've included everything from C-level campaigns down to small activities that ANYONE can organize on a moment's notice. Take a look and let us know what you think. #engagement #decline #adoption

This bot currently addresses the need to remind people to close their groups when creating and saves the admins a lot of chasing around.

Plus we've given him the name and identity of Marvin the Paranoid Robot from Hitchhikers Guide just for kicks. After all, your bots need a personality, right!
