message:
# Boosting Custom Integrations
## **Quick Summary**

Based on your [feedback](https://fb.facebook.com/groups/868270109972267/permalink/1038521656280444/), we would like to support you with fast-track engineering help to realise your custom integration ideas!
## **Background**

Last week, we asked you how you were using [Custom Integrations](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/workplace/integrations/custom-integrations). Thank you to everyone who responded!

Summarising the responses, it's clear that: 
* Building Custom Integrations requires technical resources
* Securing technical resources requires an understanding of ROI

With the [new features we announced at F8](https://developers.facebook.com/blog/post/2017/04/18/Workplace-F8-Integrations-Bots-Live-API/), we believe Custom Integrations will bring measurable ROI to how our customers use Workplace.

To get you started building valuable custom integrations within your organization, we launched the [Workplace Platform Samples repository](https://github.com/fbsamples/workplace-platform-samples), a collection of sample code for example Workplace bots, based on bots we use internally at Facebook. 

These samples are available for you to deploy and customise for your specific needs, as a starter-for-ten on Workplace bot development.

However, there were a few great ideas in this group, not covered by our sample apps repo, including IT ticket filing bot, deployment bot for group assignment, a jargon bot, HR help bot etc. 

**To help you bring some of these bots to reality, we're kicking off a Custom Integrations Fast-Track program.**
## **What's Available**

This program will provide the following to participating customers:
* Proactive support from Workplace Partner Engineering to scope and deploy your integration
* Up to 4 weeks of collaborative development services, depending on the scope of integration
* Facebook ad credits for the most compelling custom integrations built via the program
* Great new use cases for Workplace in your company and recognition as one of the Workplace thought leaders!
## What's Expected

Interested in participating? Excited about getting more out of Custom Integrations? Great! Here's what's expected of you:
* Identify **at least one use case** for Workplace bots or integrations with other SaaS apps that have public APIs.
* Assign business & IT owners to work with us for 4 weeks starting **May 22**. Expect to invest approx 5 hours each week.
* Assign an IT team to collaboratively develop the integration with us.
* Secure organizational buy-in to go live with the custom integration on **Tuesday June 20**.
* Communicate the new integration to all users in your Workplace instance.
* Partner with us for measuring impact by **Wednesday July 5**.
* Agree to Facebook publishing a case study featuring your integration.
## How to Apply

Please fill out this survey and submit your proposal before **Friday 19th May:**

**https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/3BQSC9L**

In your proposal, please share what integration you would like to build and answer a few questions that will help us understand if your organization is a good fit for the program. 

We are looking for Workplace customers that are highly motivated and have good ideas about bots that solve business problems!
## Next Steps

**We will select 6 Workplace customers for this scholarship** ‚Äî 2 each for Americas, EMEA and APAC by 5/17 to co-create these integrations. We're excited to hear your proposals! 

For any questions, please do not hesitate to ping us here.

# Closed Multi-Company Groups Launching Today

Multi-company groups in Workplace are a great way to collaborate with people from other organizations.

To make multi-company groups discoverable and easier to join, today we're launching an option to create closed multi-company groups.
## **DISCOVERABLE: **

Closed multi-company groups are discoverable inside any community that has one or more members in the group. As with other closed groups, only members of the group will be able to see the content.
## **INVITE BY LINK: **

In closed multi-company groups, as well as inviting people by entering their email address, members can invite anyone with a Workplace account to join the group by creating and sharing a link from within the group.

To find out more about multi-company groups and how to create them [click here](https://www.facebook.com/help/work/254734331656422/?helpref=hc_fnav)

# Timing your posts for max reach

Has enyone done any measurements on the impact of timing? Rebeca Tristan - will we have access to traffic data through the analytics dashboard - like we have on Facebook - to see when our users are most active? We have traffic broken down on month/week/day, but I'd love to go even more granular. We have seen that there is a difference in the number of views on content depending on when  it is posted, but I'd love to have actual data - not just my own hunch. A hunch that tells me that posting around the start of the working day gives better traction than later in the day. My guess is that people log on in the morning, get a coffee and scroll through Workplace. (about 90%  of our users are using the webversion, only about 10% have access via mobile). Has anyone got any real stats?

We're looking for an app or solution that would let us display a news feed (either full company or from a particular group - or maybe even all posts with a specific hashtag) on a large-screen display. # **OAuth for Workplace?**

Hi everyone,

We've had many requests from our users on using Workplace as an authentication protocol (similar to OAuth for regular Facebook) for their own internal apps and processes, as they consist of employees of different agencies with a number of disparate HR systems (behind the intranet), and Workplace appears to be the easiest way to authenticate legitimate users of 3rd party apps/platforms since it's the only real platform that everybody is commonly on.

Anyone else find that this would be extremely useful?

# Reactions in Comments

Now in Workplace, express how you feel about a comment with reactions. 

Reactions in comments have rolled out in Workplace this week. To use them, hover or hold down the comment Like button to see the reaction options, then tap Like, Love, Haha, Wow, Sad or Angry.

I got a popup notification when I went to like a comment just now that reactions for comments are available! Is this something that's in limited release? If it's available for all our employees, I'd like to broadcast availability in our company's "Workplace Tips" group :-)

Hi everyone. I'm going through my training materials and am realizing most of my information focuses on *how* to post in the Workplace platform and not necessarily *what* to post. Does anyone have any best practices or sample materials they'd be willing to share? One of the challenges we face is properly explaining what to post in addition to recognition, events and company updates.

Dear VIPs, as you know, we launched our Bots platform (for Groups and Work Chat) at F8, and I wanted to share a really cool example with you.

At Facebook, we run an employee sentiment every 6 months. It's a form, that employees have to fill on a web-page. Not mobile at all, not really "*next-gen workplace*".

**However** we can now do the same thing, with a Work-Chat bot. 

It takes 2 seconds, on mobile/web, and admins/HR can now decide to run this sentiment survey, anytime, all the time (on a sample of the company), and see how the employee base feels in general or react to the company's news cycle.

This bot, called Mood-O-meter, asks 3 very simple questions (see the first video): 
* How happy are you here ? 
* How long do you want to stay in the company
* Are you tired/happy ?

It also comes with a great reporting dashboard, that admins can access directly via their chat bot (see the second video)

**Check out the video, and let us know if you need help to build bots like this one. Our [bots partners](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/partners/?source=topbar) and [service partners ](https://www.facebook.com/workplace/partners/?source=topbar)can also help you to do this. **

*Credits to Connor Treacy for building the demo bot here. *

# **Launching to frontline employees...**

We are hoping to launch to our frontline employees in the next couple of months.

I would love to hear from those of you have launched to your frontline - *in particular those employees who don't have a company email address* - about what worked well to get their attention and get them on board.

Many thanks

# Custom Fields for Workplace!

*ServiceRocket Makes Custom Fields Available*

You can now extend Workplace user profiles with custom fields, and:
* Store user information like individual skills, team names, local timezone, work anniversary date, office region, seat information, t-shirt size, and more.
* View and edit custom field value via Org Chart for Workplace.
* Allow custom bots to read and update custom field value.
* Use its API to automate, load custom field values, and integrate Workplace & your systems together. Store external IDs like JIRA username and employee ID for API mashups.

*Only text fields are supported currently; more field types coming soon.*

Subscribe now via [ServiceRocket's Add-on Manager for Workplace. ](https://workplace.servicerocket.io/)

**UPDATE**: For People using Windows and Powerpoint and Experiencing a white screen when trying to share powerpoint this is due to hardware acceleration issues with OBS and Powerpoint. To Solve, within Powerpoint Go to File > Options > Advanced - Click the boxes next to disable hardware acceleration in powerpoint and slides

Does anyone have advice for sharing company news in multiple languages on Workplace? We are looking to use Workplace to publish company news in English and French. I have tried using the "Write post in another language" feature (currently not working properly, but I have a case open) and while it seems to work well it does not allow any rich formating within the original English post or any additional language added to the post. 

The inline translation feature is also great, but due to regulatory reasons we need to make sure our French posts are professionaly translated. 

I have considered the possibility of creating two separate groups, one for English news and one for French news, but it seems like this may add clutter, and it wouldn't benefit those who speak both languages. 

Any suggestions?

# Workplace Transforms Retail Organizations

Dear Workplace VIPs. 

Yesterday at F8, we announced a lot of new features for Workplace. You'll find here the video of our session, with Joanna Tong and Simon Cross. 

**What we shared with the press yesterday: **

* 14K companies on Workplace, new customers, across all geographies, Fortune 500 companies and small businesses.
* Native Integrations with Office 365, Salesforce, G-suite, Box, Dropbox, Quip. 
* Integrations with the major e-discovery and compliance vendors. 
* Workplace live APIs + Integration with BlueJeans Network
* A bots platform, for groups and Work Chat. [Don't miss the second video](https://developers.facebook.com/videos/f8-2017/building-custom-integrations-for-workplace-by-facebook/)  with Astha Agarwal and Connor Treacy , to understand how to build these bots. 

**All of this is already LIVE, you can activate these integrations today from the company dashboard.**

Please let us know what you think of these improvements. 

Thanks for your trust, your feedback, and for using Workplace.

# Breaking News: 
# Workplace announcements at [F8](https://www.fbf8.com/)

The Workplace team is out in force today at F8, our annual developer conference. Were announcing new integrations and partnerships for companies to:
* improve day-to-day workflows by integrating with cloud services providers, and the ability to create bots
* ensure regulatory compliance and manage activity in real-time
* enable richer communication using the Live video

**Read** more and see demo videos at our developers [blog](https://developers.facebook.com/blog/post/2017/04/18/Workplace-F8-Integrations-Bots-Live-API). 
**[Watch](https://developers.facebook.com/videos)** the keynotes and the two Workplace sessions ‚ÄúWhat's Next at Workplace by Facebook?‚Äù and ‚ÄúBuilding Custom Integrations for Workplace by Facebook‚Äù being presented at 2 and 3pm (Pacific Time) later today. 
**Learn** more about our new partners at [facebook.com/workplace/partners](http://facebook.com/workplace/partners)
## More details and Q&A:

**New Integrations:**
* Connect Workplace to Microsoft, Box, G Suite, Salesforce and Quip.
* Sharing: Share files and documents from cloud services through a simple file picker in the Workplace composer.
* Previewing:  Files, documents and links render inline with a rich preview so you can comment on each page.
* Organizing: the updated files tab now lists all files shared into your group from all the integrations you've enabled, and organizes them by most recently updated.

**Build Custom Workflows with Bots:**
* Extending Custom Integrations to let Workplace customers build bots that connect to the tools and services people use every day.
* Bots in groups - the ability to @mention a bot in a group and have it respond. Bots can also post into groups as a way of notifying the group.
* Bots in Work Chat based on the Messenger Platform. One key difference is that bots can message you when an immediate notification is needed.
* Bot platform partners make it easy to build bots for your Workplace: Avaamo, Converse, PullString, Kore.ai, The Bot Platform

**Compliance and Security Integrations:**
* Integrations with industry-leading  compliance and security cloud providers: CS Disco, Netskope, Skyhigh, Smarsh
* Webhooks allow companies to build Custom Integrations that manage activity on Workplace in real-time.

**Workplace Live API:**
* Stream to Workplace from professional-grade video gear.
* Broad hardware and software encoder support.
* Live Production Partners help Workplace customers get the expertise they need to ensure flawless Live broadcasts.
* Live stream BlueJeans meetings into Workplace.

**Q&A**

**Q. How do I enable these new integrations with Office 365, Box, G Suite, Quip and Salesforce.**
* If you're a Workplace admin, to to the ‚ÄúIntegrations‚Äù section in your Company Dashboard
* Once you've enabled the integrations in the Company Dashboard, people will see the integrations in the composer, and will start to see rich previews when they share files and links from these services.

**Q. What can our developers build on Workplace?**
* Custom Integrations allow you to manage users, group membership, and content posted to Workplace.
* Now, you can also build bots in groups and chat that make it easy for people to interact with other tools and services directly from within Workplace.

**Q. Is there a Workplace app store?**
* Not at the moment - Workplace customers can build their own Custom Integrations to integrate their Workplace with the tools and services they use in their company.

**Q. Where can I find the technical documentation?**
* You can find all the documentation for Custom Integrations, security and compliance integrations, and our Live API at [https://developers.facebook.com/docs/workplace/](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/workplace/)

Hi all, 

Maybe some of you have the same challenge, and have solved this with an integration or an workaround - it would be interesting to hear if and how you have resolved this:

In Moelven we have a lot of employees that have their first digital identity with an new email account and an Workplace account that has been rolled out last fall. This creates fantastic opportunities to cooperate between different subsidiaries and production locations with people previously "unreachable". 

The Moelven IT Support Help-desk has a phone number and an email address that our users can reach tech support at, and after the Workplace rollout - you can also reach the IT Support at a dedicated group that everyone are default members of. 

This group is working as intended - and many postings in  the group are solved by non-technical co-workers that educate and gives advice to others even before our techies are able to respond. Especially superusers solves many issues, and questions that are just remotely technology related - gets solved this way. 

Nevertheless - it is an challenge that our IT personell are using 1 system for prioritizing and queuing incoming requests for phones and email, while posts in the IT Support Group are on the side. Hence - there are no common queuing - and emails might get resolved faster than postings or vice versa. 
## Are there any of you that has the same challenge?

I have seen that for public facebook there is several support ticketing systems that integrate with facebook pages so that postings on a wall creates an ticket in the ticketing system (like emails) and responds to these tickets generates responses on the post in facebook automatically. For instance Zendesk has this solution/option - described here: 

https://support.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/203661556-Setting-up-your-Facebook-channel 

The perfect scenario is actually to have the same solution to connect a ticketing system (i.e. Zendesk) to a Workplace Group to Orchestrate and prioritize postings through the ticketing system.

Any ideas or solutions out there?

Thanks, and best regards,

Would you be able to share with us all kinds of scenarios and uses you have done *integrations* with in Workplace? If possible please also tell what tools for the integration you have used and what provider is the source and/or recipient of information. Any practical details and ideas would also be greatly appreciated.

# Giving everyone the power to collaborate and get more done

**Beta test - a new Standard plan for Workplace**

Getting work done happens in different ways, and teams come in all sizes. We've started a limited test of a free, Standard plan for Workplace that is ideal for organizations that don't need administrative features, or for small teams that want to quickly come together in a shared space to collaborate on a project. 

The Standard plan for Workplace is free and allows anyone to create a Workplace community and invite coworkers to join them, as long as they have the same work email domain.

In the existing, Premium plan the community is launched and managed by admins. The admins have access to a company dashboard, analytics, and various integrations and administrative features like single sign-on. 

It's important to highlight that the product is not changing. Our brand remains Workplace by Facebook.

Non-profits and staff of educational institutions can use the Premium plan for free. The good news is that the free trial period for all of our existing customers using the original, Premium plan has been extended to September 30, 2017.

This is a close beta test so you won't have access to the product just yet. You can still learn about the different plans at workplace.fb.com/faq and view the list of features at workplace.fb.com/pricing.

# Login Approvals

Protecting Workplace accounts is our top priority, and today we're launching login approvals to keep your account more secure. 

Login approvals is a two-factor authentication system that Workplace users can choose to enable for extra protection. 

When enabled, login approvals prompt you to enter a code either sent to you by SMS or provided by a code generating app whenever you log into Workplace from a new or unrecognized device. Once you have entered this security code, you‚Äôll have the option to save the device to your account so that you don‚Äôt see this prompt on future logins.

To enable login approvals for your account, go to Workplace settings, click Security and select Login Approvals.

**FAQs**

**What is login approvals?**

* Login approvals is a two-factor authentication system that Workplace users can choose to enable for added security. When enabled, login approvals require you to enter a code sent to you by SMS or a code generator whenever you log into Workplace from a new or unrecognized computer. Once you have entered this security code, you‚Äôll have the option to save the device to your account so that you don‚Äôt see this challenge on future logins.

**How do I enable login approvals for my Workplace account?**
1. Log into your Workplace account
2. Go to account Settings ‚Üí Security ‚Üí Login Approvals
3. In the Text Message (SMS) section, click on ‚ÄúAdd phone number‚Äù link to add a phone number. You'll be asked to enter a phone number, and then to confirm that you own this number by entering a confirmation code sent via SMS.
4. Once you've set up the ways to get security codes, click on the ‚ÄúEnable‚Äù link to enable Login Approvals for your work account.

**Once I have login approvals set up, how do I use it?**

*Login from a new (unrecognised) device*
1. Start by entering your email and password as usual.
2. You'll be asked to enter a security code. The code will be sent via SMS, but you can also use a one-time code generated by a code generating app if you have previously set it up.
3. If the code is correct, we assume that the authentication was successful.
4. Before letting you in, we'll ask you if you want to save this device. If you save it, you won't be asked for a security codes when logging in from this device in future.

*Login from a known (recognised) device*
 1. Start by entering your email and password as usual.
 2. For known devices, you don't need to approve your login ‚Äì we'll let you in if your password is correct.

**Can I turn off login approvals?**

* Login approvals can be disabled in settings. 

**I'm an admin, can I enable login approvals for my organisation?**

* Login approvals are enabled by individual users who want added Workplace account security. An admin cannot enable login approvals for their entire company. 

**I'm an admin, can I see who has enabled login approvals?**
* There is a new Login Approvals Enabled column on the CSV that you can export from the Company Dashboard "People" tab. 

**What happens if a login attempt is made from an unrecognized device?**

1. Start by entering your email and password as usual.
2. You'll be asked to enter a security code. The code will be sent via SMS, but you can also use a one-time code generated by a code generating app if you have previously set it up.
3. If the code is correct, we assume that the authentication was successful.
4. Before letting you in, we'll ask you if you want to save this device. If you save it, you won't be asked for a security codes when logging in from this device in future.

**How do I change or delete my phone number?**
* You can disable a phone number in login approval settings and add a new one. 

**What happens if I forget my phone?**
* If you ever lose or forget your phone and have login approvals turned on, you will still have the option to log in, provided you are accessing your account from a saved device. Having these recognized machines associated with your account prevents lockout and ensures that you can regain access to your profile.

**Are login approvals available for all users?**

* Login approvals are available for all users to use, except those from companies with a SSO account or who have their Workplace account linked to a personal Facebook account. 

**Do login approvals work with U2F devices?**

* Login approvals work only via SMS from your mobile phone or using code generators.

# Reactions and Mentions in Work Chat

Today we're introducing reactions and mentions in Work Chat!  

Use reactions to quickly express how you feel and use mentions to notify someone that a conversation needs their attention.

*Reactions and mentions will be available starting today in Work Chat for web and for iPhone. They are coming soon to Work Chat for Android.*

After some sleuthing to find out how one of our users managed to create a group with a custom URL (http://company.facebook.com/groups/yournamehere instead of http://company.facebook.com/groups/12345667890), I'm curious if anybody else has leveraged this capability, or if there's any training or best practices around its use?

In case this is news to you (as it was to me!) if you go into the group settings menu there's a button for Web Address. This lets you change the address from its default (or whatever you previously set); just take note of the disclaimer that groups with more than 5k members cannot have a name change. Had we been aware of this prior to our launch, we likely would have used custom addresses for our default groups.

# Invite Coworkers to Workplace From Your Phonebook

We're making it easier for people to invite coworkers to collaborate on Workplace. 

Starting today, the Workplace Android and iOS apps will connect with your phone's address book, so you can invite your coworker contacts to Workplace with one tap. 

**Notes: **
* You can invite a coworker to Workplace when you have their work email address saved in their contact card. 
* If an administrator has disabled coworker invites, this feature won't be available to the community.
* On Android, when the Workplace app updates, users will be asked permission for Workplace to access contacts. 
* We're rolling this feature out over the next few days, so not everyone will have access to it immediately.

## Video learnings & role of HR
Hi everyone, I am a part of international HR team & our goal is to use more and more multi-media learning options in order to have a better reach among employees across all countries. Today we kicked off with 1st of short video learnings, where we introduce tips&tricks on how to improve visualization on flipchart when you lead a workshop, seminar etc. 
**I would love to hear from others, especially HR/PR colleagues: do you have any good practices to share? How do you bring learning&development (non-clasroom) opportunities on workplace closer to all employees?**

**What is the timeline for opening up Workplace to 3rd party developers?  Who will the development partners be, and what sort of integrations are likely?**  I know this is a big questions, and information may be confidential now, but no harm in asking, right?  In my conversations with representatives of other large companies who have adopted Workplace, it is obvious that the we all want to see more integration with enterprise systems as well as creative extensions from startup companies.  Sharing this information as early as possible is very helpful so we can get these capabilities on our roadmaps - we are at risk of missing the boat if the same capability is built out on another platform first because we didn't know it was coming.

# **WATCH VIDEO** - Reaching the Hard to Reach Employees (Webinar)
## Why did you launch Workplace by Facebook? 

Was it to connect some of your company or your entire organization? If the latter, then this webinar might be of interest to you. 

Do you have hard to reach employees - those without emails or without desks, working remotely or often in the field with customers, etc.? If so, I invite you to watch this 45-minute webinar where we discuss:
 
## A. Three Pillars of Connectivity For The Hard to Reach Employees:

1. **People Managers** - How managers need to lead in-person onboarding and drive the habit of communicating inside a team group and 1:1 groups.
2. **Process-Driven Groups** - Examples of groups like "shift swap," "bright ideas," "facilities," "product training," etc. to help inspire disconnected workers to connect. 
3. **Location-Based Communication** - Discuss how the use of traditional media at work, in the filed, at home or on mobile can be leveraged to reach employees who are disconnected in order to help them get digitally connected to your Workplace. 

## B. Guest Speaker
* **Nicolas Guiochet, Chief of Staff and Communication at Renault Retail Group** - Discover some of the tactics Renault Retail Group have taken to reach many of their disconnected, extremely hard to reach, mechanics.

You may download the [PDF of the presentation here.](https://www.dropbox.com/s/a90ty91fh6dkfjr/Workplace%20Webinar_Reaching%20the%20Hard%20to%20Reach%20Employees.pdf?dl=0)

# **The challenge of complementing Microsoft Office 365 technologies with Facebook Workplace [see 3 diagrams also]**
## *Background:*

We‚Äôve been working in the enterprise digital workplace area for a few years now.  We replaced an entire Lotus Notes landscape (3000+ databases) with Google technologies (GSuite, AppsEngine, Cloud, AppsScript) and are now migrating these (4500) users, (1.8+M) files and (30+) applications to the Microsoft Office 365 environment.  This initiative is the result of merging 3 companies together and consolidating onto one platform.  

Effectively managing the change has been the magic ingredient for our previous endeavours.  We embedded (volunteer - early adopter) business change champions across every site and function.  We provided a very clear vision, consistent key messages and simple ways of working across the business which were exemplified through best-practice use-cases.  We have now started the new Microsoft 365 journey using the same methodologies (which is virtually identical to the Facebook recommended transformation approach).

## Challenges you VIPs may be able to advise on:

As we continue with the Microsoft Office 365 migration:
* How can we adopt Facebook Workplace within the same roadmap so that it becomes a complementary, value adding tool that ingrains a simple and collaborative way of working for all of our end users?
* How do we eliminate technology overlaps so that end users don‚Äôt become confused as to which tool to use for what purpose to address their specific business use-case?  
* What does the visionary future architecture look like?  Will it be evolutionary or revolutionary?  What timescales will this happen over?  How will it align with the Facebook roadmap?

* What is the business case for the removal of these overlapping technologies?  Have any of you managed to reduce costs (licence costs, support costs, implementation costs, cost avoidance through retiring old platforms e.g. intranets) as a result of deploying Facebook Workplace? 
* How do we effectively manage this overall change and make sure to maximise the business benefits in the shortest possible time?

Thanks for reading this!  I welcome any feedback and am happy to have 1:1 discussion with anyone who is interested.

Regards,

Barry

# Settings Page Update

We've updated the Settings page to make it simple and easy to use. 
## Accounts and Profiles: 

In the Accounts and Profiles section you can now see and manage the email domains whitelisted for your company. 

Also in the Accounts and Profiles section, you can now choose to send Workplace invitations to specific people or as soon as new accounts are created.
## Help Community and Secret Groups: 

To simplify the settings, for **new** organisations to Workplace, employee access to the Help Community and employee creation of secret groups will now be switched on by default. 

For **existing** customers, your previous preferences in these two areas will remain unchanged. 

If you would like to change your preferences, here is what to do:
* Change from on to off: Contact Support [here. ](https://work.facebook.com/help/work/contact/support)
* Change from off to on: You can turn access on using your settings page.
Anyone have a group image crop guide? That shows how group header images crop on various mobile devices?

**How to kill the Intranet? ;-)**

*Although every feedback is appreciated this question is especially for bigger organisations with large intranets. *

As a group with subsidiaries we have 18k employees in 8 countries, different brands and 9 separated, local intranets - you get the idea:) One of the reasons why we chose Workplace was to overcome these barriers and to grow together. 

After several months with Workplace we begin to 'think radical' and plan to switch off at least some of our intranet(s). What I would love to know from you (especially if you have already made this step) is how you made this transition happen, if you could move everything successfully to Workplace or if you still needed additional tools such as Wikis, Sharepoint or your old CMS.  

In our case I see mainly two issues: 
* The intranet has traditionally been a central hub, where one could find news as well as all the necessary tools, templates, guidelines etc. While i see no problem in moving company news entirely to WP, I cannot say so with regards to all (static) info pages and tools that we also have in our intranet.
* In our company Workplace is not mandatory, meaning that we have departments/teams where not everyone uses it. This makes a complete shift to Workplace even more difficult. 

What are your thoughts on this? Did you reduce your intranet  and move the static content to a simple Wiki or a Sharepoint site or did you entirely kill it?

Looking forward to your feedback!

We have 20,000 accounts we are synching into Workplace, and its taking a long time (up to a week) for new accounts to appear in Workplace, after they are added to the Workplace security group in AD. Hey everyone, I'm Mike and I write the interface content for Workplace. That includes things like:
* **Product guidance** (those little pop-up cards and blue boxes which introduce new features)
* **Dialog instructions** (seen when you make a new group, or invite people to Workplace)
* **Emails** (especially initial invitations, and messages offering hints and tips)
* **Terminology** (what we call everything from 'Multi-Company Groups' to 'Invitations' to 'Champions')

Getting Workplace to sound right and make sense for all kinds of organisations is a real challenge. But if we do it well, I hope you won't notice the content at all, and instead just get on with making the most valuable content - yours.

Now and then I'll show up in this group to ask what you call things in your business. Everyone uses different terms for 'people working under a manager', 'senior executives', '1-to-1 meetings' and so on. With your help, we'll keep making Workplace better.

If you've any general questions or feedback about what you've read on Workplace, feel free to say hello!
What is the most popular group in your company (open group) ?

message:
# Optimizing your Live Sessions for Important Events!

We know that **live** is one of the most leveraged features on Workplace and that your CEOs are loving the two-way connection to employees in real-time.

## Some of you asked what the best practices for the best streaming experience are?

Below you will see a diagram of the optimal configuration to have high impact live events based on what has worked the best for our customers for a seamless broadcast.

## Why should you use this method for high impact events?

- Wifi is not always reliable; even if the wifi access point is dedicated for only the broadcaster, the presence of other wifi-enabled devices can degrade the connection -- **recommend hard-wired Ethernet**
- Our app may not prioritize wifi over the cellular antenna in certain cases -- **recommend airplane mode**
- Using battery power is risky because the battery will drain faster than normal when doing a Live broadcast -- **recommend using hard power**

# Don't forget to share with us the impact of your Executive Live Sessions!

## Happy Live Streaming!

# New Resources for C-Suite on Facebook, Instagram, Workplace

More than two hundred CEOs use Facebook or Instagram to reach customers and a public audience.  Many more are using Workplace by Facebook to communicate and collaborate with their employees. ** Craig Mullaney,** who leads our work with executives, has shared several resources to help this group.
* Join our inaugural Leadership Communications Summit 23-24 February at Facebook headquarters featuring workshops, networking opportunities, and keynotes from social CEOs, experts, and practitioners like you.  [http://conferences.ragan.com/facebook/](http://conferences.ragan.com/facebook/)
* Learn best practices and download the comprehensive guide for Facebook Business Influencers here [https://www.facebook.com/facebookmedia/businessinfluencers](https://www.facebook.com/facebookmedia/businessinfluencers)
* To received updates and announcements relevant to business leaders on Facebook, sign up here [https://www.facebook.com/help/contact/1822022171349955](https://www.facebook.com/help/contact/1822022171349955)
* To have your executive‚Äôs public Facebook presence verified or to join its Influencers program, please contact your Workplace point of contact who can fasttrack your application.  The influencers team provides enhanced support to a limited group of high-profile business leaders.
* Other business leaders recommend this equipment for producing Facebook content:
   * [Ricoh Theta S](https://theta360.com/uk/about/theta/s.html) ‚Äì 360 camera.  Facebook 360 tips [here](https://facebook360.fb.com/).

# Moving fast at Facebook

Dear VIPs,

Since our October launch, we've been doubling down on making Workplace even better for our customers. You may have noticed we've been iterating more often and I wanted to share how Facebook approaches product development in general.

At Facebook, we often talk about "moving fast" and "the journey is 1% finished." When we get good feature ideas, whether from you as feedback or through the teams here at Workplace, we try to iterate quickly. You'll see us partially roll out a new feature to understand how useful the feature is. Sometimes, the feature doesn't have the impact we all hoped for, so we fail fast and learn from the results before moving on.  This is how we've outpaced other products out there when it comes to innovation.

As VIPs, we'll give you early access to features that we're testing so that your feedback can help shape our future. We'll always announce it here in this group, but it's worth noting that there will be times when you have access to a feature before some of your coworkers, and that there will be times when some coworkers have a feature and some don't.

A great example is how we're rolling out rich formatting in posts. Lara posted yesterday that 50% of people have the feature, while you've had early access for two weeks. If we're happy with the latest iteration, we'll roll it out to everyone. 
https://work.facebook.com/groups/868270109972267/permalink/967924573340153/

Thanks for being on the journey with us and experiencing a little bit of our culture along the way!

# Format Text in Posts 

Starting this week we're beginning to roll out text formatting options for posts (as announced by Ian here: https://work.facebook.com/groups/868270109972267/permalink/959117914220819/). As VIPs you all had early access to this feature, and now we're rolling it out to 50% of people on Workplace. So some of your coworkers may start to see it too. 

The formatting options include: 
* Headings
* Bullet points
* Numbers
* Quote marks 
* Code formatting

The new formatting options will help highlight important content and make your posts easier to read. 

When writing a post, the formatting menu will appear on the left-hand side. 

To format your text, simply click the format menu icon, choose a format option (such a H1 for a heading), and begin typing. 

If your coworkers don't see the feature yet, they should see it in the coming weeks.

Hi All, I'm a software engineer on Workplace. 

We've built a new **rich text composer** which has been opened to all members of this group for testing. It provides a Notes-like editing experience within the composer. This should be great for people who don't know Markdown.

You can use it to create formatted posts like you would Markdown. You can also ignore it and carry on with plain or Markdown posts like you do today.

It's Friday, the weather is cold, but the sun is shining. I'm reading through our company Workplace timeline while eating some real Dutch drop (candy) and suddenly it struck me.....
Workplace is the ideal tool for creating persona's of your employees. I created 5 persona's:

1. **The "happy sharing collaborating" type**
This is the social open minded type of colleague. Always willing to help, to motivate, to connect, to make people feel comfortable...you know people like Ren√©e van Holsteijn 
2. **The "liker" type**
This is the type that only likes basically everything, even his/her own posts. Sometimes they even press the Like button just a few seconds after something is posted
3. **The "sender" type**
The typical guy/woman that is used in sending a lot of information without actually caring if it's worthwhile reading. Never reacts if his/her posts generate comments. Completely convinced that his/her post is contributing and valued big time.
4. **The "Yes, but..." type**
The doubter, the more process oriented guy/girl that hates experimenting, afraid of chaos and only starts doing things if he/she is convinced that it will work 
5. **The "I say nothing unless" type**
The most dangerous specie. You really don't know they are there, but suddenly they attack. After the attack they withdraw in their hole.  

Do you recognize this??  
Do I miss specific persona's?

Happy Friday dear Workplacers :-)

These and your ideas will generate participation and positive energy to start 2017 on a right note.

message:
# New Group Type for Buying and Selling
Today we're introducing Buy and Sell groups, a convenient way to discover, buy and sell items with people in your company.

Employees can post photos, a description, price and location of an item they'd like to sell. Once a buyer is found, the item can be marked as sold.

System Administrators, Content Moderators and Account Managers can create Buy and Sell groups for their organisation. To get started, go to 'Groups', click 'Create Group", choose 'Buy and Sell' and continue through the setup.

So, here's a scenario.

Here in Australia (and I'm guessing all across the world), people often change jobs. But with the expansion of Workplace into many companies and government organisations, your presence on Workplace could change.

Right now, I exist within one instance. But eventually, I may end up in a different instance. Presumably with a brand new account.

Where this gets interesting is MCGs like this one.

If my time at Company A finishes, and I then start at Company B, I assume my account (and presence here) with Company A is suspended. And then my new account with Company B is created. If I then get added back into this group, I have an old presence, and a new presence, but continue to be the same person.

So, now here's a question.

Would it be possible to migrate accounts between organisations in order to maintain a singular presence in MCGs? You simply become deactivated in one instance, then activated in another instance, but your participation in MCGs remains seamless? 

Would love to hear FB thoughts on this.

Cheers :like:

# Introducing Documents in Groups #
From today you can create rich documents and share them just with a group. You can write drafts, add a cover image and add images in-line with text. To create a document, go to a group, click ‚ÄòMore‚Äô, then select ‚ÄòCreate Doc‚Äô.

Another question about the technical side of Workplace Live videos! My CEO wants to do a cosy group interview on sofas with 4 senior execs and live staff Q&A, to replace the usual end of year wrap CEO video message. 

I can't for the life of me figure out a solution that will enable good sound quality for this. Ideally I'd like a pass-around cordless mic that feeds the iPad we will use to film. However I can't find a cordless one that works. I don't want to buy a full set of cordless lapel mics with mixer as we are not technical enough to manage a sound desk. Passing around a mic will control the speakers from interrupting or talking over each other. 
I know there is a beta programme to run this through a laptop but I'm not convinced that would necessarily make it any easier? 
Any experience doing a live video with more than one speaker and/or using a hand-held cordless microphone (brand? Model? Etc) 
Thanks so much!!

Hi Folks from FB . Recently we organized a major event within the company , and it was decided to send all notifications and updates of the event using Workplace , especially by using the posts and events functionalities . On doing so the common feedback we received were , 
1. can I have some way to sync the Workplace and Outlook calendar without exporting each of the events separately. Having to go through two calendars to decide if I am available is a little tedious
2.Would it be possible to add a timed reminder for the events . I accepted event invites a couple of days or weeks back and then it just skipped my mind . 
3. If events are like calendar invites , then once a person accepts or declines an invite , they should vanish from your news feed and should be only showing up on my upcoming events . Right now for this event, invites for 15 separate events were send out to all the folks and now their news feed seems to be cluttered with just invites .
4. I have a basic calendar showing up on the PC version of Workplace  but would be nice to have a detailed calendar on the mobile app too . Right now i see the upcoming events and its a long list with dates mentioned on the side . such a long list might give me panic attacks .

Are any of these features being looked into for future releases .

Bonjour, what would you think about doing @mention to reference Workplace groups in posts ?
To me, it would be very useful to click directly on the mention and to be redirected to the group (same as it is when clicking on a user name).
Is there a way to do so ? Thanks.

This is a question, or rather a suggestion ot the good folks at Facebook. It would be useful to be able to post stuff on Workplace without using my personal profile - like corporate news etc. Could we get a solution, much like Pages on Facebook, where departments for instance could have their own pages and post as the department? Since I work in communications, it falls on my plate to communicate both positive and negative news as part of my job - but these are not my own opinions, but rather what the organization or management wants communicated. Thus far we have set up "impersonal accounts" - i.e. "Group Communications" that has posted. this work-around requires me to log out and in as a different user, and won't work when we go for single sign-on.   Is there another way to solve this?

I might just have lost this, but is there a way to embed the Workplace newsflow, in the same way we can embed a facebook-page? I think this would be a good way to show content at least in a transition-period, as we go from our old intranet to Workplace
Hi all - this might be a silly question, but if we want to make certain fields mandatory on Workplace (profile picture and surname) can we enforce this somehow? Thanks

# ADMIN ANNOUNCEMENT
# Custom Integrations and Access Token Deprecation

## Create your own apps for Workplace
Custom Integrations will allow you to create your own apps for Workplace. Custom Integrations also introduce a secure app permission model allowing you to control which services can read content, post to groups, manage groups, or manage accounts in Workplace.
For more information please see documentation [here](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/workplace/custom-integrations).

## Access Token Deprecation
With the launch of Custom Integrations we will be deprecating the existing static access token system on January 13, 2017. **For companies that are using an Identity Provider, the Account Management (SCIM) API, or the Graph API, you will need to do the following before January 13, 2017:**

**Create a Custom Integration app and assign it the proper permissions:**
- **Read Content** - if you are using Graph API to export content from Workplace.
- **Manage Groups** - if you are using Graph API to manage group membership.
- **Manage Accounts** - if you use an Identity Provider, the Workplace Active Directory Sync Component, or custom SCIM integration to manage accounts in Workplace.

Replace all references of the static access token with the new Custom Integration app's access token. 

**Questions?** Contact Workplace Support using the regular 1:1 support channel.

cc: Connor

# ADMIN ANNOUNCEMENT
# Update to our Acceptable Use Policy
We have updated our Acceptable Use Policy to clarify that you must not share access tokens with any third party not expressly approved by Facebook. If you want to work with a partner that is not part of our [Partner Program](https://workplace.fb.com/partners/), please contact us first via [support](https://work.facebook.com/help/work/contact/support).

Please review the updated Acceptable Use Policy [here](https://www.facebook.com/legal/FB_Work_AUP).

message:
== Default groups and posting permissions ==
Dear all, I‚Äôd love to hear from you what sort of default groups you use in your Workplace instance and how ‚Äústrictly‚Äù you moderate them. 
 
We‚Äôve officially launched Workplace around one week ago and with more and more people joining we start to see a few issues around ‚Äúnoise‚Äù and content quality in the larger groups. What we‚Äôve seen so far is that a lot of people want to post in the large company-wide groups since they offer a larger audience. Consequently in some groups, we have to reject quite a bit of low quality (self-promotional) posts, otherwise we would risk to distract people with too much irrelevant content.

We currently have four default groups where all employees are automatically added:  
1) Company announcements (everyone can contribute, admins need to approve posts)
2) Questions & Answers (no posting restrictions)
3) Workplace Tips/Support (no posting restrictions)
4) Social Topics (no posting restrictions)
... and around 900 other groups where we start loosing the overview;-)

>> What sort of default groups do you think are necessary and who should be allowed to post in them?
>> How strict are you towards self-promotional posts (pictures with happy people tend to get a lot of likes but too many of them can negatively impact relevance in my opinion)
Looking forward to your inputs!

Hi VIP's! I have a best-practices question on group privacy and nomenclature:

When we launched Workplace, we encouraged all teams to use "Closed" groups so that employees could find as many relevant groups as possible. Now that most employees have found their relevant groups, we'd like to make the platform less confusing while also improving cross-team collaboration. So, as an example, our current structure looks like this:

Sales Team Members = 'Closed' team-members only group
Sales Team = 'Open' discussion group for x-functional collaboration

We're considering making the 'Sales Team Members' groups Private in order to reduce the appearance of "duplicate" groups. I have also seen a few other companies using 'Sales Team Chat' (Open) as a collaboration group.

How are you organizing your company's groups and privacy to best encourage collaboration?

Hi all.
We're using Workplace for a few months now and we love it.
Ultimately by the end of December we need to decide if we will stick to Workplace or not. That decision is more difficult than expected. Although our users like the solution very much, our IT and especially our security team are less enthusiastic. 
Two main reasons:

**Data security**
Although we're Dutch, we're part of a big German Mothership. One of the results is a very strict policy on data safety. Having data stored in the US is ringing alarm bells.

**Facebook reputation**
It's no surprise that especially security/data privacy people are having doubts regarding Facebook. In our situation Workplace suffers from that.

How can we convince security to accept Workplace as a secure solution? How did you do it?

Your feedback is appreciated. Thanks!

UPDATE: Now Live for everyone!!!

=== Multi-company Groups Launch ===
Dear VIPs,

We are excited to announce that multi-company groups will start rolling out to all companies in the next few days. Everyone in your community will be able to collaborate with other company's employees via Workplace using multi-company groups. System admins will be able to modify controls for multi-company groups in the Company Dashboard Settings.

For more information about multi-company groups please visit our help center at https://www.facebook.com/help/work/166241107040475/

Thank you all for your feedback and for helping us build this amazing feature.

== Windows Desktop App (Notifier) ==

Dear VIPs,

Many of you have told us that your employees miss notifications on desktop - this can be addressed by adding notifications on many Mac browsers (e.g Chrome). However, on Windows Desktop - there was no good way to make sure you don't miss a notification.

We are thrilled to announce that we are rolling out the test of our first Windows Desktop App (Workplace Desktop Notifier) - you can download this here: https://www.facebook.com/work/notifier/download

----------------------------------------------------------------------
== FAQ ==
1. What type of notifications will I receive / Can I customise which notifications they receive?
- The Notifier displays the same notifications as you'd see on the Workplace website or in the Workplace mobile apps. If people want to customise their notification settings they can do so here: https://work.facebook.com/settings?tab=notifications
2. What platforms are supported?
- Notifier works on Windows 7 and above. We don't have immediate plans to support Mac.
3. Does the Notifier support SSO?
- Yes!
4. Does the Notifier support notifications for chat/messaging?
- Not yet :)
----------------------------------------------------------------------

Thanks to our early VIPs that tested this feature and we look forward to hearing your feedback as you try it out!

== Want to go Live on Workplace? Consider these tips ==

With great opportunity to go Live on Workplace, comes great responsibility. Below you'll find resources and tips for going Live that are sure to make you look buttoned up and "oh so" professional. 

Check out this recent article from USA Today‚Äôs tech expert, Kim Komando on "Facebook Live: How to broadcast like a pro" http://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/columnist/komando/2016/10/17/facebook-live-how-broadcast-like-pro/92024018/

Also, don't miss these ‚Äú30 Practical Tips for Producing Great Facebook Live Videos‚Äù from ProBlogger - http://www.problogger.net/tips-facebook-live-video/. You‚Äôll find handy gear suggestions from item 18 onward. 

Finally, download our very own Live Guide here: https://www.dropbox.com/s/y0r6a2lusfg7cm3/Workplace_GoLive.pdf?dl=0

And if you don't get around to reading these, at minimum remember to always have a purpose, engaging content, an energetic disposition, good lighting, stable ground (tripod), clear sound (external mic), non-distracting surrounding and a reliable wifi connection.

== Introducing Formatted Posts ==

We're delighted to introduce the ability to add basic formatting to your posts on Workplace. You can make text bold, use italics, embed links, quotes and code, and use bulleted and numbered lists. 

Formatted posts should help you structure your posts when sharing content like meeting notes or weekly reports, and more effectively highlight important parts of your posts.

How do Formatted Posts work?

1. We'll be rolling our Formatted Posts to all organizations in the coming days, starting tomorrow.

2. When it's enabled for you, you'll see a "Format text with Markdown" button ("</>") at the bottom of the groups composer and a "Format post" button in the new composer many of you have at the top of News Feed. Click these to enable formatting on your post.

3. Format your post using the simple but powerful Markdown syntax - we've included a helpful reference.

4. You can preview how your post will look before you publish it.

5. You'll need to have the latest version of Workplace for iOS and Android to view formatted posts on mobile. 

6. It's currently only possible to craft formatted posts on the web.

While today you need to use Markdown syntax to format your posts, we're looking at making it even easier to add formatting in the future.

Formatted Posts aren't designed to replace every kind of document - they don't support inline images, tables or other more advanced layouts - but we hope they'll help you and your coworkers communicate your ideas more effectively on Workplace.

== Create your own Multi-Company Groups! ==

As part of out package of announcements on October 10th, we also announced Multi-Company Groups to the world -- something you VIPs have known about for a while ;-). We've been hard at work and we're delighted to announce that we're ready for the next phase of the rollout: letting you create your own multi-company groups!

If you'd like us to enable the ability to create multi-company groups at your company:

1. Ask your Workplace system administrator to open a support ticket of type "I have a request" and state that they'd like us to enable the ability to create multi-company groups
2. Our support team will process the request
3. Once the request is processed, our support team will respond to the support ticket to let the instance admin know MCG creation is now enabled.
4. Go forth and create multi-company groups with your suppliers/clients/agencies/partners!

## FAQ

Q: Who will be able to create multi-company groups?
A: Once we've enabled MCG creation, anyone at your organisation will be able to create multi-company groups

Q: Who can be invited to a multi-company group?
A: As before, at the moment, only people already using Workplace can be invited to a multi-company group. If you want to use MCGs to work with a company that's not yet using Workplace, please reach our to your Customer Success Manager, and we'll work to try and onboard them onto Workplace.

Q: Where can I see the multi-company groups in my organisation?
A: All the multi-company groups that one or more of your employees is a member or admin of are listed in the Groups section of your Company Dashboard.

Q: When will the ability to create multi-company groups be rolled out to every company?
A: We're continuing to make multi-company groups better, including giving administrators additional controls around multi-company groups. We'll let you know when we plan to make MCG creation available to everyone.

There's many more FAQs in the Help Center: https://www.facebook.com/help/work/166241107040475.

If you you have further questions, please ask them in the comments below.

This week you will see a new way of managing admins in the Company Dashboard. Apart from the new design, you can also invite new employees to join Workplace and assign them as admins at the same time. Here's a preview.

Over a year ago, GWI showed that internet users had a healthy interest in Facebook Workplace. And with today seeing the official launch of the service, their chart explores the demographics of its most likely users ‚Äì those who fall into the ‚ÄúWork Networkers‚Äù audience from their new social media segmentation.

Of course, LinkedIn‚Äôs solid foundations in the work-related networking space present a formidable challenge for Facebook Workplace. Outside of China, over a third of all internet users visit LinkedIn each month, and this rises dramatically among Work Networkers to more than 6 in 10. LinkedIn has also seen impressive year-on-year growth since 2012.

Even so, Facebook does have reach on its side. Over 8 in 10 outside of China visit Facebook each month, meaning that many of those it hopes might use the new service will already be familiar with the site‚Äôs user interface and functionality.

In today‚Äôs multi-networking world, however, it‚Äôs unlikely that most users will choose one or the other. That‚Äôs especially true given that the prime demographics for work-related networking ‚Äì 25-44s and men ‚Äì are also among the most prolific multi-networkers. So, Facebook Workplace is most likely to become another service that people use, rather than a replacement for an existing one.

==  Workplace Rebrand ==

Dear VIPs,

Today we are thrilled to announce the launch of Workplace by Facebook! 

We have re-branded to mark the beginning of our official product launch and in great part due to your feedback on the name and perception.

We want to thank you for being part of the journey! Without you, none of this would be possible as Workplace is the result of your feedback and continued support.

== What happens next? ==

1. All our apps will update with the new logos automatically

2.  We will be sharing an update of the logos for your communication materials.

3. You will be able to request Multi-company groups to work with other Workplace partners by making a ticket through your 1:1 admin support (System Admins only). TIP: Add "MCG Creation" on the title of your ticket

4. We will be making more announcement through the week on further updates.

Thanks again to all of you!

== Important reminder about this group ==

We have been seeing a lot of Support posts recently so I wanted to share this reminder of what the VIP group is all about.

----------------------------------------------------------------------

WHAT IS THE PURPOSE OF THIS GROUP?
1. This group is for all our close partners' leads and admins on Facebook at Work to share best practices and learnings from each other.
2. We know you all care about the success of Facebook at Work within your company and each of you has come up with amazing, creative ideas that could benefit others.
3. We, Facebook, want to inform our VIPs of features coming up, early access to testing and a close relationship to our leadership teams.

---------------------------------------------------------------------

WHY IS THIS NOT SUPPORT?
1. We have a dedicated expert team in charge of answering your questions through the 1:1 support channel. This team is not part of this group.
2. Support questions posted here are not tracked anywhere; meaning that if this is a bug or request, there will be no task and ownership created on the back end to get actioned.
3. The Support Team uses the questions and requests received as guides on what Help Content to create. If they do not receive the questions, they will not know what content would help you.
4. We want to provide you with an excellent Support Service. If the service is not being used, we will not know what needs to be improved or how we can better serve you.

----------------------------------------------------------------------
WHERE DO YOU GET SUPPORT?
Click on the "?" Icon on the top right corner on your menu bar. You have three options:
1. Access to the "Help Centre" for articles and how to guides
2. Access to the "Ask the Community" for help asked and shared amongst all Facebook at Work users 
3. Access to "Contact Facebook Support" for you to get 1:1 help from the dedicated Support Team (Admins only)

----------------------------------------------------------------------

Later today we'll be launching a new design for Facebook at Work to members of this group.

We want Facebook at Work to be the most useful place to spend your working day. With this updated design, we've made some small but purposeful changes to make Facebook at Work even better:

* A new color scheme that's both professional and clean.
* A simplified navigation bar that makes it easy to see which of your groups have new activity.
* A refreshed top-bar which makes it easy to get to notifications, messages and support.

We'll be rolling our new look out to everyone who uses Facebook at Work in the coming weeks, but we're releasing it to you - our VIPs - in advance to get your feedback, and so you're better able to answer any questions your employees have.

Question for companies with over 1000 employees:

Open, Closed, or Secret? When setting up groups for your teams (i.e. Marketing Team, Customer Support Team, Sales Team) what privacy setting are you using?

Currently we are finding that using the 'Secret' setting seems to work best because otherwise we have non-team-members requesting membership access to groups of which they are not a member of that team. On the other hand, using 'Closed' makes these team groups more discoverable when a team admin may not be very proactive about adding new employees. So what are you doing at your company?

You can access our new help options via the question mark at the top right  corner, where you can find the links to the Help Center, Help Community, Feedback, and if you're an admin, the ability to contact Facebook support through a contact form.

A few weeks ago i got a tip about Sparkle (http://getsparkle.io) in this group, Sprakle is a tool to present FaW groups on large displays etc.

After my first tests of the product we found some security concerns about the product and had a discussion with Sparkle around this.

Today i recieved an update and some of our concers was fixed

* Access tokens from FaW is now is now sterad with encryption in the database
* Closed/Secret groups is not listed anymore, only open groups
* More infomation where and how the data is stored at Sparkle
* It¬¥s now possible to mark a "Sparkle" as private. When a channel is now marked Private an access token is stored in the URL and in the embeded script so you can¬¥t guess the URL to a Sparkle anymore

I will test the product in more detail now in the following weeks and keep you updated with the progress.

Hey everyone - you might have noticed something new at the top of your News Feed - a new composer that makes it really easy to post into groups!

We've had a lot of feedback from people that they find it cumbersome to have to navigate into a group when they want to post something. Thanks to familiarity with Facebook, people are used to being able to post directly from the top of News Feed.

This new composer lets you do just that. It gives you quick access to your top groups, so you can quickly post from News Feed.

We've rolled out the new composer to everyone in this group - we'd love to hear your feedback, and please let us know if you find any bugs.

We plan to roll this out more widely in the next few weeks.

A small tip until Facebook releases a proper Windows 10 UWP App for FaW. This works in Windows 8 and 10.

4) Open the Start Menu and you have a FaW Tile! Click on it to run.
5) You can pin it to the taskbar.

== Desktop Notifier for Windows - Alpha Trial ==

Yesterday we gave you a glimpse into what's coming by adding you to this new, shiny, Multi-company Group.

How can we build on that? By letting you know about ANOTHER new product we're testing and would like your feedback on: the Desktop Notifier for Windows (Alpha).

Not everyone keeps their browser window all day which means people sometimes miss important notifications about activity on Facebook at Work - for example when you've been mentioned in a post.

The Desktop Notifier runs unobtrusively in the system tray and pops a toast notification when something happens on Facebook at Work.

## Alpha Trial

We're looking for alpha tester to help test this product and give us feedback on the design, installation and value of having native Windows notifications for Facebook at Work activity.

Limitations:

* Windows 7, 8 & 10 only (we don't have Mac or Linux support at this time)
* Username/password authentication only - The Notifier doesn't yet support companies that use SSO for authentication - we're working on that as fast as we can.

If you'd like to be part of the alpha trial, please *comment below* and I'll add you to ANOTHER multi-company group where you'll get access to the download and can give feedback.

This is great!

My inital thoughts:
* I would love to be able to DM someone from another company
* It would be great if the company name was visible near a persons name in these multi-company groups.  
* I would love to invite non-FAW people into these groups

I'm sure you guys are working on at least some of this. Excited to see more updates soon.
Thanks for adding me to the group!
Dan O'Leary, talk about breaking down silos! Love it!
This is really cool :)
I am excited to be on this forum. Endless possibilities of learning. Excellent forum.
Hi, great to e-meet you all guys and thanks Rebeca for this great idea! We are just about to launch and eager to hear/read from your experience!

Hey folks - Welcome to the new VIP Group!

With this new group, we're testing a new feature that we call "Multi-company Groups". These are secret groups where you can invite people from other companies to join. 

These should be useful for you to work with suppliers, agencies, partners - or as we're using them here - with your most important customers.

We're currently testing them with select companies, but plan to roll them out more widely in the coming months.

PLEASE NOTE: This feature is still confidential under NDA. Please don't discuss Multi-company Groups with anyone outside this group.

You'll note that there's a little icon next to my name that (for the non-Facebook folks in here) denotes that I'm not from your company. This will help you understand who you're communicating with.

Let us know if you have any feedback about Multi-company Groups, or questions about how they'll work.

Hi everyone
Lovely to meet you all and looking forward to connecting.
M

Hi Everyone,

Nice to connect with everyone. Do we have anyone from UAE or Middle East?
To get a better sense of our VIP audience, please share with each other what part of the Facebook at Work journey you currently are at?
story: Rebeca Tristan created a poll in Workplace Admins Community.

message: Hi everyone !
This is very exciting- looking forward to sharing and hearing the latest via the F@W platform!
Yay cool!
What a wonderful day!
Hello World!

== Welcome to your VIPs Multi-Company Group ==

As our closest partners on Facebook at Work and VIP community, we want to welcome you to our first large Multi-company group. This group is designed to replace the Personal Facebook version and give you direct access to our latest news, our team and our extended Facebook at Work family (you, our amazing customers).

== IMPORTANT ==
- This group is confidential and under NDA. This is the only way we can share and remain open about what we are working on and include you on early testing opportunities.

== What can you expect? ==
- Facebook will communicate new product announcements or exciting news!
- Facebook will have Facebook at Work team representatives from different areas to listen to you.
- We will no longer moderate this group in order for you to continue to share ideas, learnings or best practices in your business using Facebook at Work.

== What this group is NOT? ==
- This is not a support group and we will not manage support responses. 
- For support, please continue to log these requests through your Company Dashboard > Help > Submit Request. This is the dedicated expert team that can respond to your questions.

**–ó–∞—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∏—Ç—å –∞—Å—Ç—Ä–æ—Ü–∏—Ç—ã –ø—Ä–µ–≤—Ä–∞—â–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –≤ –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ–Ω—ã –ø—Ä—è–º–æ –≤ –º–æ–∑–≥–µ? –†–µ–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ!**

*–°–æ–≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–Ω–∞—è –∫–æ–Ω—Ü–µ–ø—Ü–∏—è –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ–≥–µ–Ω–µ–∑–∞ –≥–ª–∞—Å–∏—Ç, —á—Ç–æ –∞—Å—Ç—Ä–æ—Ü–∏—Ç—ã –∏ –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ–Ω—ã —Ä–∞–∑–≤–∏–≤–∞—é—Ç—Å—è –∏–∑ –æ–¥–∏–Ω–∞–∫–æ–≤—ã—Ö –∫–ª–µ—Ç–æ–∫-–ø—Ä–µ–¥—à–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–∏–∫–æ–≤. –ü–æ—ç—Ç–æ–º—É —Å –ø–æ—è–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ–º –∫–ª–µ—Ç–æ—á–Ω—ã—Ö —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏–π —Å—Ç–∞–ª–æ –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω—ã–º —Ä–µ–ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –∞—Å—Ç—Ä–æ—Ü–∏—Ç–æ–≤ –≤ –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ–Ω—ã, —á—Ç–æ –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –∏–º–µ—Ç—å —Ç–µ—Ä–∞–ø–µ–≤—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–µ –∑–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ –ø—Ä–∏ –Ω–∞—Ä—É—à–µ–Ω–∏–∏ —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–∏ –Ω–µ—Ä–≤–Ω–æ–π —Ç–∫–∞–Ω–∏. –ö–∏—Ç–∞–π—Å–∫–∏–µ —É—á–µ–Ω—ã–µ –Ω–∞—É—á–∏–ª–∏—Å—å –ø—Ä–µ–≤—Ä–∞—â–∞—Ç—å –∞—Å—Ç—Ä–æ—Ü–∏—Ç—ã –≤ –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ–Ω—ã in vivo, —Ç–æ –µ—Å—Ç—å –Ω–µ–ø–æ—Å—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –≤ –º–æ–∑–≥–µ. –î–ª—è —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ –æ–Ω–∏ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–ª–∏ –º–∞–ª—ã–µ –º–æ–ª–µ–∫—É–ª—ã, –∞ –∑–Ω–∞—á–∏—Ç, —Ç–∞–∫–∞—è —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏—è –ª–µ–≥–∫–æ –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω–∏–º–∞ –≤ –º–µ–¥–∏—Ü–∏–Ω–µ. –ü–æ–¥—Ä–æ–±–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ [–æ–ø—É–±–ª–∏–∫–æ–≤–∞–Ω—ã](https://www.nature.com/articles/s41421-021-00243-8?fbclid=IwAR3xTmJ2xyueXrtPNI0p8692jHWA6syXgTTiyeFn2VB7BlgThrUiJxSnYl0#Sec9)* *–≤ –∂—É—Ä–Ω–∞–ª–µ Cell Discovery.*

## –í–∏—Ä—Ç—É–∞–ª—å–Ω–∞—è —Ä–µ–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –≤ –æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–∏:

**–ö–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏—è Getac –æ–±—ä–µ–¥–∏–Ω—è–µ—Ç –≤–µ–¥—É—â–∏—Ö —ç–∫—Å–ø–µ—Ä—Ç–æ–≤ –ø—Ä–æ–º—ã—à–ª–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –æ–±—Å—É–¥–∏—Ç—å –±—É–¥—É—â–µ–µ —É–º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–≤–æ–¥—Å—Ç–≤–∞**

–ù–∞ –ø—Ä–æ—à–ª–æ–π –Ω–µ–¥–µ–ª–µ Epic Games –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∏–ª–∞ –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç Metahumans Creator –¥–ª—è —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏—è —Ü–∏—Ñ—Ä–æ–≤—ã—Ö –ª—é–¥–µ–π –≤ Unreal Engine. –¢–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å –≤—ã –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç–µ —É–≤–∏–¥–µ—Ç—å –ø–µ—Ä–≤—ã–π –ø–æ–¥–æ–±–Ω—ã–π –ø–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–∞–∂ –≤ –≤–∏—Ä—Ç—É–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–π —Ä–µ–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏.

–Æ—Ç—É–±-–±–ª–æ–≥–µ—Ä ETR VR –ø—Ä–æ–¥–µ–ª–∞–ª —Ñ–∞–Ω—Ç–∞—Å—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫—É—é —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã, –¥–æ–±–∞–≤–∏–≤ –ø–æ–¥–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∫—É VR –¥–ª—è –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–æ—Ç–∏–ø–∞ –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏ —á–µ–ª–æ–≤–µ–∫–∞ –æ—Ç Epic. –û–Ω –≤—ã–ª–æ–∂–∏–ª –≤ —Å–≤–æ–±–æ–¥–Ω—ã–π –¥–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø —Å–≤–æ—é —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫—É –¥–ª—è –±–µ—Å–ø–ª–∞—Ç–Ω–æ–≥–æ —Å–∫–∞—á–∏–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –∏ —Ç–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è [–ø–æ —ç—Ç–æ–π —Å—Å—ã–ª–∫–µ](https://mega.nz/file/A9MSRDJb#boJWXaz5i62ZTFi2o-Tf910XwD0wUT7_rEWEPV1RmL0). –û—Ç–º–µ—Ç–∏–º, —á—Ç–æ –¥–ª—è —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ –ø–æ–Ω–∞–¥–æ–±–∏—Ç—Å—è –≥–∞—Ä–Ω–∏—Ç—É—Ä–∞ –ü–ö VR. 

–ú–µ—Ç–∞–ª—é–¥–∏ ‚Äî —ç—Ç–æ –ø–æ–ª–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å—é —Å–º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–µ, –≤—ã—Å–æ–∫–æ—Ç–æ—á–Ω—ã–µ –≤–∏—Ä—Ç—É–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏ —á–µ–ª–æ–≤–µ–∫–∞, –ø—Ä–µ–¥–Ω–∞–∑–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –¥–ª—è —Ç–æ–≥–æ, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –¥–æ–±–∞–≤–∏—Ç—å –≤ –∏–≥—Ä—ã —Ä–µ–∞–ª–∏—Å—Ç–∏—á–Ω—ã—Ö –ª—é–¥–µ–π.
